description:
Tl;dr carrot cake is amazing!

The best carrot cake you will get anywhere. Also if you download their app you get free cupcakes and other free goodies from time to time. Amazing. We're addicted.
author: Alex I.

description:
My friend ordered the confetti cake with vanilla buttercream icing for a birthday party and it was a hit. The colors bring you back to childhood, the taste has the perfect balance of sweetness, and the presentations is trendy AF. 

Their shop has got lots of little treats if you don't want an entire cake. Cupcakes, mini cupcakes, cookies, cake slices, etc. This is the palce to go to for all of your upcoming celebrations.
author: Patty B.

description:
HOLY SUGAR RUSH  this is a birthday/celebration haven! I love love love Susie cakes (well maybe singular cake because you really only need to get one thing there and hint it has to do with  ). 

YAS carrot cake, here we go.

This is the yummiest carrot cake I have ever had in my entire 24 years of life. The moist cake with noticeable carrots, raisins, and walnuts is just the perfect concoction of goodness. Add on some cream cheese frosting and not only so we have a cake, we have a cake of glory. Cue the angles singing and doves flying. 

If you're strolling down chestnut looking for a sweet after that Blue Barn salad or Blackwood hot stone pot, pop on over to SusieCakes for a truly life changing sweet tooth experience. You will not regret it.
author: Kara N.

description: Thank you so much for making such a beautiful cake! See the two tier white unicorn cake with pink hair photos posted. The cake was the highlight of my sister's baby shower. The whole process of ordering was so easy, efficient, and fast. The staffs were great! They were able to make a two tiered cake with the colors I requested for a very affordable price. Overall, great service and yummy cake!
author: Ana C.

description:
Order: confetti cake with vanilla buttercream icing. The cake including the writings came out to be $48 (with tax) 

Taste: Amazing! Everyone loved it. The icing is not the basic whip cream icing. The buttercream icing definitely added the delicacy to the cake. It is pretty rich so we ate the whole cake in the span of two days and also by sharing it about 7-8 people. 

Didn't order it before hand. Just went in and they have the cake there. Super grateful to the staff for putting all the words on the cake since it was a surprised birthday cake for my mentor who is visiting from out of town!
author: Yuan Z.

description:
Not only pretty but truly delicious.

Beautiful cakes made with precision and whimsy, there's a taste to suit every palate from mocha chocolate to Meyer lemon buttercream.

They have cookies and full sized cakes, cupcakes and decorations. Prices are Marina-sized to cover the monstrous rents. That said, I was happy to pay the price for cupcakes of this quality. 

The taste of the buttercream nearly made me cry, thinking of my dear Grammy (the best baker in the whole wide world, RIP). 

The cupcakes were dense yet moist, the perfect balance. 

If you're a mom on a mission, everything from candles to party hats is here (noisemakers, I dunno- didn't you give birth to those?)

I really like this shop and they just opened another outpost in the Financial District in SOMA.

Let everyone eat cake!
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I'm always torn between SusieCakes and Sprinkles (Stanford Shopping Center).  I think I favor the icing at Sprinkles, but the actual cake of the cupcake at SusieCakes.  One day I should do a side by side comparison.  Until then, there's a lot I like about SusieCakes:

- Slices from whole cakes are available. Slices are extremely generous.  In fact, if you care at all about your health, you won't come close to consuming an entire slice.  It's really super good, super sweet and super deelish, but just don't do it.  Yes, they're that large! I like the cake with rainbow sprinkles, but they also make whole coconut cakes, carrot cakes, etc. You can't miss them, as they're displayed on top of the case, directly in front, tempting you during your entire stay.  Often, my original game plan was to purchase just one cupcake, but I would leave with a slice of cake instead, or sometimes with both a cupcake and a slice of cake. Now, that's bad!

- Mini cupcakes are available.  You definitely get more value by getting the standard cupcake, but the minis are there if you just want a little taste.  Only problem is that it keeps you wanting more and more.  If you have good self control, and are missing the addiction gene, it's a great option.

- Seasonal cakes will also appear, especially around the holidays.

- Friendly and efficient employees.

- Cute, but super small bakery with 4 seats available.

- Located on Chestnut Street, where you can easily spend some time shopping or just strolling with your cupcake in hand.
author: Lori N.

description:
Ohai Yelp, sorry I've been a bit neglectful lately. Fear not, though I've switched jobs, I still eat most (ok let's be honest, all) of my meals at my desk. On a Friday afternoon at my new job, I got to try this spot out for a coworker's farewell. If you like sweet things, this is your spot. While the frosting and cake were both way too sweet for my sweet(bitter)tooth, I could see someone who loves sweets enjoying this.

I had a slice of the vanilla celebration cake, which has retro blue icing with funfetti batter. The cake was one of the more memorable ones I've had in recent memory-- almost cake-poppy sort of texture, dense, moist, and a bit sticky. The cream cheese frosting was super sweet, but not sickeningly so. A tiny slice was more than enough given the density. The layers inside were expertly put together. The cake was huge, I mean like, yuuuge.

A 3.5/5 for me.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Hella sweet, but quite good. We did bday cakes for our company and cupcakes. 


I love how you can order by slice at the store, the bday cake was so good. Need milk though!
author: Shruti D.

description:
3.5 stars rounding down

$3.75 per cupcake

Red velvet - yum, my fave
Vanilla - it was ok, I'd say you can skip this
Lemon - it was ok, I'd say you can skip this too 
Snickerdoodle cookie - it was good but I can skip on this next time

I feel this shop is the type of shop you go in knowing what you want. My party and me were taking a while to decide and I felt the staff were hawking us to decide asap. Parties behind us didn't know what to get either or they were confused whether we were in line and the whole shop filled up with customers and became a bit overwhelming. 

I'll probably pop in to grab myself a cupcake if I'm ever in the area again
author: Yeanne L.

description: Yummy!! i ordered a carrot cake that was absolutely delicious and marble slice and snickerdoodle cookie. Everything was sooo good. I have to try everything there now
author: Yasmina F.

description:
Shoutout to this team!! They were so accommodating with our order. We were celebrating a 17th year anniversary for someone here at DDB SF and we accidentally ordered the cake for the wrong day. We ended up calling last minute to change our order date with the fear that they would charge double or not be able to make us the same cake. I was wrong!!

Susie's cakes was so accommodating and got the cake to us here on the correct date with no trouble. I highly recommend the strawberry icing with chocolate filling. The agency and I were we are so pleases with the service that you guys provided. I will be reaching out to you guys for all of our celebrations that are coming up!

DDBSF
author: Ale S.

description: I loved the choices my boyfriend and I picked. He had the strawberry shortcake slice. I hade the strawberry filled cupcake. The cake was very moist and the berries oh so sweet. Perfect combination. The frosting on the cupcake was awesome. Frosting is my favorite part of a cake or cup cake. The right amount of sweetness. Will definitely return to make more purchases
author: Tracy W.

description:
Such a fun place to get cakes and cupcakes and even peach pies. Their cookies aren't half bad either. 

The lady behind the counter who helped me was a tad bland, didn't seem to care to be there. But it was also 6pm, a hour before closing on a Saturday, I'm sure she was tired. Anyways, she tried to up sell me the cookies which are $2.50 each, for 2/$4 but it was chocolate chip only, and I was buying a chocolate chip and a snickerdoodle cookie. 

Their chocolate chip cookie I thought was pretty bitter from the chocolates. So dark chocolate lovers, this one is for you! The snickerdoodle cookie was good. But I could pass, for another location more convenient to me. 

The peach pie was good, but I wish the top customer was a bit sweeter.
author: Jess W.

description:
Susie Susie you're always on my mind...

I am falling in love with Susie's cakes. This is a tragedy especially for me that i'm on my last leg of pregnancy. HELP!

I first tried the 6 layer chocolate cake couple months ago when someone brought it as a gift. The chocolate cake was so rich I can't tell you enough about it...I just recently tried their confetti cake (at a friend's birthday party). Now, I love confetti cakes but Susie's was the best I've had. Rich and delicious. So yea, these cakes are really good and I got the craves as I type this review. 

Not sure about the prices but I think their regular cakes are about $40 which is worth it because these cakes are really huge and can feed a lot of people!

Can't wait to try their red velvet and their cupcakes :)
author: Heliana M.

description:
I have not eaten a piece of cake with frosting - in years. 

And it's not that I don't enjoy cake - because I do. It's actually because of my deep love of cake that I choose to abstain from it. Because once I have a slice of moist cake with sweet frosting - I'm hooked. I'll be craving the next slice of cake - the moment I eat the last bite of my first slice of cake.

Today - someone from our office had brought in a stunning Funfetti - Vanilla Celebration Cake from Susiecakes to commemorate another co-worker's birthday. It was one of the most delicious looking cakes - I've seen in awhile. Seven layers of moist nostalgic colorful sprinkle embedded vanilla cake goodness - painted in thick dollops of baby blue buttercream decadent icing. 

I walked by it twice, admiring it from afar in our work kitchen. It was only after the 4th person gushed about how good it was - that I decided that if you're going to do cake - make it a quality slice of SusieCakes Cake.

I grabbed a plate and a fork and I cut off a piece. It fell onto the plate with such cake elegance. One bite - and I was smitten. It was divine. The icing was everything you could ask for and the cake was bursting with fresh vanilla flavor.

It was so worth it - full of profound buttery and sugary goodness.

If you're looking for an incredible cake for a special occasion  - look no further than SusieCakes. Their funfetti cake is definitely one of the best slices of cake that I have had in years. Literally.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
TG for my team that LOVES to celebrate individual birthdays. The mecca of all birthday treats is SusieCakes. I've been blessed to be able to try almost all the flavors of cupcakes here, as well as the Chocolate layered cake, and the Vanilla Celebration Cake (my personal favorite - it's like funfetti but 100x better).

The cake is fluffy, the frosting is nicely whipped. I don't know how they do it each time! 

Online orders for pick up are no-frills. Delivery, unfortunately, is a lot more expensive. Glad they are opening up one in the plaza right next to where I work!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
Really disappointing.  I ordered a 20 to 30-person cake for a 100th birthday, and had made particular requests about the lettering and decoration.  The result looked the staff had put in the least required effort to get it out the door...what it said to me was "100...so what?"  The lettering looked like it had been done by an earnest but not particularly artistic seventh-grader, and the cake had very little edging (despite my requesting this). I had also wanted some kind of gold accent (e.g., flakes), and all they offered was goldish loose sugar -- which I was told wouldn't really show up.  

I was offered a fix of the edges that would take 15-20 minutes, which I didn't have.  But really, the problem was the original scoping.  

To make matters worse, the box was only secured with Scotch tape; as it had collapsible sides, this unfortunately meant that part of the box caved as I was carrying it -- and damaged the frosting.

This location clearly does a substantial volume of business -- and it just seems like they are moving items down an assembly line.  I don't know what a larger custom project looks like, but I would not recommend you trust them with any significant work without working out the details through a test drawing/image of some kind.
author: Germaine J.

description:
Possibly THE best cupcakes and cakes I've ever had.

The taste is delightful, fragrant, and light -- definitely something you need in your life regardless of whatever emotions you're feeling.

1. The red velvet cupcake: I could eat this everyday if I could. It has this wonderful balance of sweetness and tanginess, so you're not bombarded with too much sugar.
2. Topical coconut cake: OMG. There's no question that this is one of their most popular cakes.
3. The vanilla funfetti cake: Gorgeous colors. It makes you feel sophisticated ;) Also, the taste is incredible.
4. Chocolate cupcake: It was good, but not my favorite. It was a little too sweet for me.

Overall, I'm definitely coming back. I'm already craving it as I type this review.
author: Jenny H.

description:
I submitted an online inquiry on their website, but they get BUSY.  I would recommend following up or just calling - because you can miss your window.  

I ended up calling and was able to book my order.  I ordered 15 custom cupcakes and they were exactly what I wanted.  I asked for space/galaxy themed chocolate cupcakes for a baby shower and they came out PERFECTLY!  They were so cute and a huge hit, everyone was very impressed.  

I would definitely use them again. Highly recommend - left very happy.  They were beautiful and delicious.
author: Michelle S.

description: Great yummy cakes! I needed a cake last minute since the one I baked fell and they were able to decorate a cake for me in less than two hours and have it ready for pick up in no time!
author: wanda u.

description: We got the celebration cake for some coworkers and it was 1. Beautiful and 2. Delicious. The texture was closer to a cake pop than a standard cake. It was more moist and heavy rather than fluffy and light. I really enjoyed it but the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the frosting was too sweet. If the frosting was 20% less sweet, this would be a perfect 5 stars.
author: Aakanksha M.

description:
They have gluten free items...YES!!!!! I came here with a friend today since she was getting a cake for a friend's party. The staff were super friendly, accompanying, and helpful when it came to putting in a custom order in.

During this time, I was eyeing all the desserts! I wish they had a gluten free cake that I could order a piece from, but unfortunately they didn't. The carrot and red velvet cakes looked amazing though!

The gluten free items they did have were a peanut butter soft cookie, vanilla pudding, and a regular (and mini version) of a vanilla cupcake with chocolate cake.

I opted for the mini vanilla cupcake and it was delicious! I only wish I had ordered the regular version because I was still drooling over the crumbs of my cupcake after I finished my dessert.

Also, download the app for rewards!
author: Gita r.

description:
Love their cupcakes.   every month they have a special flavor.  They packed the cupcakes so good that they are beautiful even walking or taking public transportation.  

August 29, 2017.  Ordered the monthly pie of the month Strawberry and Rhubarb for my friend, Randy for his birthday.  Called to place my order.  Arrived and gave my name and they had my pie ready.  Great and friendly service.  My friend loved the crust and topping of his birthday gift!  Who wouldn't want a treat from this bakery.  got myself the peanut butter cookie  

January 17, 2018

My first purchase for 2018.  I saw Whittney who just joined the team last year .  It was great to see a familiar face!  We chatted a bit before I order my cupcakes.  Pie of the month is Cherry and chocolate cream.   Love  this store!  Thank you Andrew for hiring Whittney for your store.  She is great, professional and gives grea

February 22, 2018

Saw Whittney today  great service while purchasing cupcakes!!!  Great and awesome service!!!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I usually don't crave cake or cupcakes, but SusieCakes is literally the only bakery I truly like. My husband and I love their mini cupcakes, and they're my personal fave because they're delicious (the cake is moist, and the icing is just right), I don't feel forced to eat a big portion, and they're so cute!
It was only natural that we decided to go with SusieCakes for our wedding last month and it was perfect. We had a simple chocolate cake with chocolate icing in the middle of each later and white coconut icing on the outside. They were also able to put the symbol of my husband's and my alma mater on the outside of the top tier, which meant a lot to us since we both met in college. They are a traditional bakery; they don't use any fondant and don't do intricate designs but the quality and taste of their cakes are worth it!
author: Crissy L.

description:
I consider myself a major cake connoisseur, so I knew I had to pull out all the stops when it came to our wedding cake. SusieCakes absolutely rose to the occasion! Our friends could not stop gushing about how delicious and gorgeous it was (we provided our own the topper - we aren't garbage pigeon birds IRL, we promise, they're just an inside joke). We needed a cake for 100 people, and with our budget, the only way we could afford that elsewhere was if we got a tiny ceremonial cake and then a sheet cake for everyone else. I had resigned myself to not being able to afford a lovely, multi-tiered cake until we came across SusieCakes. SusieCakes' prices were so amazingly low compared to other local wedding cake makers that we could afford a four-tier of four different cake  flavors. You'd think that for a price that good the taste would be awful, but every single flavor and tier was so delicious, and SusieCakes offers so many different flavors we had trouble deciding what to go with. Luckily, Park Lee, the assistant celebration specialist with whom we coordinated everything, was so chill and so wonderful. He set up an amazing tasting for us, and was so thorough in making sure the cake's design turned out exactly how we envisioned it. 

It was such a long and unnecessary journey of dry, tasteless crumbly cake before we discovered SusieCakes. For you, it doesn't have to be! Wedding cake can be both delicious and affordable! 

(Full disclosure, I started crying while writing this review because I remembered how delicious our cake was and it made me sad that I can't eat it every day).
author: Vivian H.

description: We ordered the Luscious Lemon cake as our wedding cake and it was delicious! We met with Molly back in February at this location for our cake tasting and she was great. We emailed back and forth regarding the style of the cake and I found her to be very responsive and helpful. As we were getting married in Half Moon Bay, she arranged for our cake to be delivered from the San Carlos SusieCakes location. The cake was beautiful and a huge hit with our guests!
author: Alissa S.

description:
Molly's Cupcake in Chicago is still my favorite cupcake shop.  

SusieCakes could not even come close....they were too dense and not moist or fluffy at all.  My friend had gotten some for my birthday. I tried a variety of flavors like red velvet, pumpkin spice, vanilla, etc.  Supposedly they have a really good birthday cake flavor but I guess they ran out...

I was impressed that they fit happy birthday on a single cupcake!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
After finishing lunch nearby, we decided to indulge in something sweet.  Although we were somewhat stuffed, we each decided to get a slice of cake anyway.  

Funfetti - everyday is your birthday with this cake.  Its stacked, its dense, its not too sweet, and it's uber delicious.  I had to split this into a two day dessert but if you want to finish it all in one sitting, no judgement

I've been spoiled by the desserts here specifically the cupcakes and this was the first time trying the cake.  I appreciate the texture of these goodies as it is still soft the day of or next day.
author: Linda N.

description:
The executive director of my company bought a birthday cake for a few of us and this was to die for. She bought the 6-layer chocolate cake and it was just fantastic. This thing was huge, but rich and moist with every bite. I prefer small slices of cakes because the sweet frosting can get overwhelming and make me feel sick, but I couldn't help but eat this all. The frosting had a pleasant sweetness to it that didn't make me feel sick and the ratio of the frosting to bread was perfect. Every bite was just a delight.

The presentation of the cake was beautiful as well. It was perfectly layered, the frosting was spread evenly all around and pulling the slice of cake out and seeing the layers of frosting inside was just a sight to behold. This place is fantastic and I am definitely coming back for any cake cravings or cakes I need to purchase.
author: Steve H.

description:
After finishing lunch up at tacolicious and walking back to our hotel, we stumbled upon this cute bakery. Decided to give it a go after noticing a few people were holding their boxes. Immediately we were greeted with two smiling faces, one of which was Jake who took our order and rang us up. 
Got the banana pudding and a vanilla blue cupcake. My frosting on the cupcake was light and fluffy.  The banana pudding was dense which isnt the taste i wasnt expecting but it was not bad.
I wish it was more of a sitdown place instead of a to-go place but the space is small. Theres one table with four seats towards the registers.
author: Harv P.

description:
We LOVED our experinece at the Studio City location with our celebration specialist Debby Whalen!
We have been all over LA, cake tasting for our wedding. This was our last stop and they won us over. Debby made the experience so fun and easy. Hands down the best experience of any cake shop we have been to. We highly recommend ordering your wedding cake here and ask for Debby!
author: Angela J.

description:
Delicious cakes and cupcakes with frilly frosting, I was walking around the Marina District and wanted--no, needed--a treat. Found Susie Cakes and knew this was a good spot to indulge. The storefront was beckoning with all sorts of iced beauties, including a Barbie cake where she's standing upright and her skirt is a cake. 

There was a bit of a line, but it moved quickly. While the cakes by the slice, like a buttercream confetti flavor, looked good, I wanted something more portable.

There looked to be at least eight different flavors of cupcakes, please other treats like sugar cookies with a buttercream filling, whoopie pies (with chewy chocolate cookies instead of fluffy cake), snickerdoodles, seven layer bars, ginger snaps, and a gluten-free peanut butter sandwich cookie. There actually seemed to be a few gluten-free options for Cupcakes.

I opted for a classic chocolate cake with vanilla buttercream. It reminded me of Magnolia Bakery cupcake--moist and fluffy, classic buttercream frosting where you can really taste butter, sugar and vanilla. Susie Cakes has a distinction with its cupcakes that it tours as "frosting filled". There definitely is a hollowed our area in the cake where there's an extra piping of frosting, but it was pretty subtle and took a few bites to get to. It's probably impossible to add more frosting filling without breaking apart the rest of the cake when you bite into it. 

Enjoyed my cupcake and experience at Susie Cakes--would like to stop back again soon to try out their peanut butter flavor!
author: gail b.

description: SusieCakes did the cake for our wedding and they were sensational.  First, the tasting experience was awesome - we went to the Chestnut Street location and tasted with Park.  It was so helpful to not only try the flavors, but also to look at pictures of what can be done.  Since we couldn't decide on one, we picked 1 tiered caked (celebration cake) and 4 other flavored cakes.  They were all so good and Park recorded all of the specifics and ended up transitioning the details to Dani at the Marin location to place the order since it was closer to our venue.  Delivery was also very reasonable.  I would 100% recommend SusieCakes to anyone, and particularly for weddings!
author: Karen A.

description:
I was very disappointed with Susie's Cakes to say the least. While on vacation in San Francisco we decided to look up Bakeries like we do on EVERY Vacation. We love cakes and cookies and enjoy trying different Bakery's.
The Store front is beautiful and the staff are friendly.  
The product is not so good sad to say. 
I bought 
1 slice of Red Velvet taste like shorting 
1 slice of Tropical coconut good taste a bit dry 
1 vanilla/strawberry cupcake horrible very heavy and dry!
2 flourless peanut butter cookies-  unknown my son had not tried them as of yet. 
$24.00 down the drain.
author: Nancy S.

description: I was asking pricing over the phone and questions regarding the cakes themselves and the lady over the phone got very impatient and as soon as I said I would call back to place the order she hung up. Extremely rude..
author: Lovely V.

description:
I know everyone loves SusieCakes, but I still wanted to share that I, too, love SusieCakes.

First, all their treats are damn delicious, including the cookies (molasses, omg), mini-cheesecakes, etc. Don't neglect all the non-cake options!

Second, if you happen to be obsessed with frosting, they'll sell you an extra scoop of frosting on the side. 

Third, SusieCakes was the only bakery out of the 5-6 that I called that was willing to make me a gender reveal cake. Sure, I was not pleased with the color of the frosting that ended up being inside, but I can't fault them for that (the blame falls squarely on my husband's shoulders, obviously).

TBH, I usually don't even like cake. But SC's cakes are so freaking moist and tasty that they've made a cake aficionado even out of me. If that's not a glowing endorsement, I don't know what is.
author: Connie S.

description:
The hype is real.

I'll admit, I've spent the past 10 years going out of my way to avoid bakeries that pride themselves on cupcakes. I've been burned before (not literally) with sugary frostings, dry cake bases, and stale sprinkles. That being said, when it's your dad's birthday and he has a sweet tooth, you can't NOT hook it up with a cake.

So, off to SusieCakes we went. There was a short line out the door (it's a VERY small shop), but it went fairly fast. The first cake we wanted, the old-fashioned chocolate cake, had sold out (which our server guy noticed only AFTER writing 'Happy Birthday, Dad' on the styrofoam display cake), so we opted instead for the classic marble cake (vanilla and chocolate cake marbled together with chocolate chips, filled and frosted with vanilla and chocolate buttercreams).

When you have a dad who already loves cake, and a fiancé who religiously avoids dessert, and BOTH of them devoured their entire slice? You know you've found an amazing bakery.

I 100% will be back, the customer service was great, prices were fair, and cakes are exceptional.

Note: I would NOT do wedding cake tasting here, as you're essentially stuck in the corner of the store, with customers crowding around you while they wait for their order to be called. Not a very magical moment.
author: Claire S.

description: The cupcakes here are amazing. Despite the price, I would definitely come back again to try all the available and seasonal flavors. I bought 3 cupcakes: carrot cake, chocolate on chocolate, and red velvet. All were $3.75 each, and they were all very soft and moist on the inside. Worth!!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Small adorable bakery shop in the marina area. Moist and delicious cakes with lots of options to choose from! They also cater and make personalized cakes! 

Why I was here // My bf has been stressed out from work lately, so I wanted to give him a slice of cake to cheer him up. 

The location // Clean, small, and so cute! Love the design on their boxes and bags! The color really pops! 

The cake // I bought a slice of their red velvet cake which is 7.00 by the slice. 
Generally, the slice cakes are more moist than the cupcakes and the cake was definitely moist!  OMG it melted in my mouth and tasted absolutely decadent. Loved that the cream cheese frosting wasn't overly sweet at all. 

Overall, the cakes here are amazing and I would definitely come here again to try all of their other goodies!
author: Emily T.

description:
This place has some great cupcakes- their seasonal strawberry lemonade cupcake is a MUST try. 
Vanilla is a very moist cake and some really good frosting! 
It is a little pricey (around 3.75$ for one cupcake)
author: Shriya B.

description:
We got the red velvet, with cream cheese frosting, and a slice of the chocolate cake.

The quality of both were average. The store is small and there was a long line. Took about 5 minutes to get to the register.

Overall a nice cupcake place, a little over priced, $8 for a slice of cake.

I wouldn't go here again unless I was standing in front of it and was craving cake at that exact moment.
author: Isaias P.

description:
You honestly cannot go wrong with any Susie Cake's option. My go-to cake for all orders, but also great to pop in for a cupcake, a slice of cake, a lemon bar or a layered cookie treat. Personally, I cannot stop raving about their cake slices. Each one I try blows me away--the cake is always the perfect density and the frosting always compliments perfectly! My personal favorite is the coconut cake! Coming from the South, it's hard to beat a true Southern coconut cake, but Susie Cakes has has nailed it. 

The staff are always so cheerful, helpful and speedy. They also have some fun novelties in birthday candle options, cards and party favors! 

Love this place. And today I noticed s sign by the register that said there is a small charge added to every bill to help provide their FT employees with health benefits! Now, I love them even more!!! Party on, Susie Cakes!
author: Shelley V.

description:
I ordered a marble cake from this location to celebrate my sister's graduation from law school. Everyone enjoyed the cake and my sister was very happy.

Quality/Taste: the cake was delicious! It was perfectly moist and the buttercream had great consistency without being too sweet.

Design: whoever designed the cake did a great job. The cake was beautiful and everyone gasped upon seeing it. I bought the cake topper separately on Amazon.

Service: the customer service representative took her time to listen and was able to deliver on my expectations. I paid for delivery and they were professional and delivered by the projected time.

Pricing: The ingredients were good quality and the design was great so well worth the price.
author: Dani A.

description: What a disappointment!  Ordered 2 DOZEN mini cupcakes but only TWO mini cupcakes showed up!  How embarrassing!  NOT RECOMMENDED!!!!
author: Gil M.

description:
Susie Cakes 

I happened to stumble upon this shop while walking in San Francisco and it looked too cute not to go in! I'm like a child when it comes to dessert; I always order based on pretty colors and I ended up ordering the funfetti cake. It was super adorable and quite a big slice. The cake was moist but firm so it didn't get crumbled when you took a bite. It was such a fun and yummy cake at the same time that I didn't even try to be civilized while eating it. I just picked it up like a sandwich and started munching on it. I wanted to order one of each item from their menu because everything looked so delicious. So happy I went by this area!
author: Celeste M.

description: These were damn good. The cake was cushiony and not too sweet while the frosting was soft and creamy. All of the flavors sounded really good so it was very hard to choose! But I got red velvet, lemon, and chocolate. All of the cakes looked really good too so I will return to try them! They had red velvet, lemon, funfetti, carrot, marble, and that all I could remember. The staff was friendly and the interior was very cute. The bags are adorable as well! I would say perfect to take the kids for a sweet treat and spoil yourself as well!
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
Honestly one of THE best cupcake places in the city. 

I've tried cupcakes and cakes and it just tastes SOOOO good! 

My cousin had a birthday where she had a coconut cake from here and I usually don't like cake but WOW that was the best cake I've had. It was just soft and a lil nice touch with the coconut. I ate so many pieces. 

If you like coconut, try the coconut cupcake or cake. They have a lot of different ones, so you're bound to find something great.
author: Allyson L.

description:
Coffee lovers must check out anything with their mocha icing.  It's made from freshly brewed coffee.  Ahhh-MAZE-ing.  

The marble cake is equally delicious.  The cake is vanilla and chocolate (as expected based on the name) with just enough chocolate chips to turn make you see rainbows and unicorns on a crappy day.
author: Amy J.

description:
WOW!! Everything was amazing in a very unique not too sweet thick and dense kind of way. We tried the celebration cake, chocolate, red velvet and lemon. We ordered through Doordash, and specified to have the shop choose alternatives if our choices weren't available. 

It was very kind of them to upgrade the lemon cupcake we ordered with a full slice of lemon cake - I'm guessing they did this because they were out of lemon cupcakes. Thanks for that generosity!! Too bad there isn't one in Denver - I'd order way too often though if this place was local to my area. :)
author: Lisa V.

description:
SusieCakes

All I'm saying is that I've been celebrating my birthdays with SusieCakes since high school. I recently turned 21 on the 16th of July (shout out to mom for ordering the delicious cake)! She ordered it on the 15th and we did a curbside pickup on the 16th in addition to having a free slice of cake for its app members. Every year we've been asked where we bought our cakes and every year the answer's been SusieCakes on Chestnut. 

This year I received the Seasonal Red, White, and Blueberry cake. The texture of this 4 layered 9" monster was moist but not too moist. The strawberries and blueberries weren't too sweet nor sour, totally fresh. The cake almost tasted like cornbread with whipped creme. As usual the cake was a hit. Thanks SusieCakes!
author: Liza H.

description:
I happened upon an event in my neighborhood to promote a school. (Tarraval outer Sunset) 

I got a lemon one and a coconut cupcake. Amazing. What a special treat after girls night our at the local pub!
author: Amanda L.

description: Great bakery! I live for the months when the fresh strawberry cake is in season. Talk about the most moist cake in town!!
author: Sandy G.

description:
Love this place! I'm a crazy cake person, so my boyfriend and I had to check this place out for our anniversary. SusieCakes' cake is killer. I've never met a cake slice that I couldn't finish in a single sitting, but the celebration cake here did it. 

At first, I was hesitant to pay $7 for a single slice, but since I had to split it into thirds and eat it over the course of two days, it ended up being a great deal. The cake was super dense and moist, and the buttercream frosting was incredibly rich and tasty. Highly recommended! Just be very careful if you have any sensitivity to sugar, because there is a LOT of sugar even in a small amount of their cake + frosting.
author: H L.

description: I walked past this place and did a double take. Cupcakes? Cookies? Yes. I wanted a little dessert and stepped right in. There are so many beautiful cupcakes to choose from! I decided to get the flourless chocolate cupcake. This was so moist and dense! It was deep and rich chocolate...just how I like it! The frosting was maybe too sweet on its own but paired with the bitter tones of the chocolate, it went quite nicely. They have seasonal selections as well and I'd like to try those. Great cupcakes!
author: Natalie M.

description: My coworkers got me hooked on this place. A sweet tooth's paradise - I've had the crepe cake and marble cake and both were delicious (and beautiful).
author: Emily M.

description: Susie cakes are DELICIOUS! And they last! Was surprised with mini cupcakes on a Friday and still on Monday they taste just as good as they did the first day. They didn't dry out or lose flavor. And all the flavors were good: red velvet, chocolate, vanilla - all divine. Their special birthday cakes are beautiful, the funfetti is so good too!
author: Lily R.

description:
This is the real deal!

Though I am not, by any means, a picky eater, I will only thoroughly enjoy a piece of dat cake from only
SusieCakes.

We get SusieCakes cupcakes for birthdays in the office and the red velvet is killer. Half a dozen red velvet and the rest is potpourri, yet red velv seems to deplete the first of all flavors!

The parents came by recently and also went to Peet's in the Marina. My dad has a sweet tooth and walked into SC; they took home a slice of RV and a slice of carrot cake. Both were still so YUM in slice form.

The bakery itself doesn't have any seating. Parking is normal for SF - aka none at all (street + private garage).

They also have pies which I have noted to try for the future!
author: Nicole D.

description:
Tried this for the first time. I love cupcakes, especially Sprinkles and Magnolia's, so I'm always looking for the next one and I admit I do compare all other places to my favorite. 

This is more than just a cupcake shop; think 50s deserts...they have whoopie sandwiches, and variety of cupcakes and cakes. 

Their cupcakes are good but they are on the light side for the price. Other places are a little more dense but i guess one good thing is it's not as heavy and sweet. Buttercream is sweet and pretty good. I think the bread is not as moist or dense as other places which makes it easier to eat the full cupcake in one sitting. Usually I eat half of it's a sprinkles one since they're so dense and heavy but at Susie cakes it easy to have the whole thing. My go to flavors are vanilla or red velvet. 

Located right in marina where's a bunch of cute boutique like shops and restaurants.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Hands down the best red velvet I have ever had!! The cream cheese frosting is the right amount of sweetness, not too sweet, and not too much. They got the cupcake to frosting ratio down forsure. I also appreciated how they had cupcakes with "happy birthday" written on them already, since my visit was to get some cupcakes for a birthday, this made it quick and convenient.

They have so many goodies behind the glass, I wanted to try one of each item. Service was good too, helpful staff packed my stuff and got a free magnet on the way out! This is definitely gonna be my go-to spot for my cupcake cravings and birthday cakes! 

All in all, highly recommend if you're a dessert lover who doesn't like frosting that feels like it's going to give you cavities! I'd definitely recommend the red velvet!
author: Jamila W.

description:
Omg, you guys, this place is great. I was flying in from Oregon and needed to get a custom birthday cake for my friend who loves whales. In a few quick emails, I had sent the desired whale image, gave some specifics on color, cake options, etc, and WHAMMO the cake was ordered. It was ready to go when I showed up. The whale looked great.

When we finally had a chance to eat the cake (funfetti ftw. gets the party going), it was fantastic: great consistency, frosting was delicious, and the whale was still sassy.
author: Aryn G.

description:
I ordered my birthday cake from SusieCakes and it was so good! Tastes homemade and wonderful.

I am ordering another custom cake from them this month and I can't wait to try it. Their cake specialists are very helpful and have great customer service.
author: Asha S.

description: Went yesterday to get something to bring to friends Christmas party got a large pumpkin cheesecake it was delicious, and service was good  in despite the fact that it was a mad house  very small place and very busy and they were one of the very few in the neighborhood open yesterday..only complain they forgot to put my whipped cream that l asked for and when l got to friends place wasn't there..luckily my friends had a electric mixer and heavy whipping cream and whipped it up real quick,but just wished l had brought it with me as l requested only reason why l don't give 4-5 stars. ;however, cake was delicious..
author: Angiel S.

description:
Bottom line: Pricey for baked goods, but cake and cupcakes are usually delicious. Items are cute and good for photographing. Cookies are okay.

Context: I have visited many times over the past few years.  Had cake slices, cupcakes, mini cupcakes, and cookies.

Service: There are always many people behind the counter. They offer to help when you're ready. It is nice that they are being attentive, but sometimes I feel rushed. There are so many options to choose from! But I understand: it's a narrow space, and they have to keep things moving.

Consistency: I'm fairly confident that I'll be happy with items from here.  Usually delicious, though sometimes just okay.

Favorite item: Funfetti cake
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Where to start, where to start. 

Banana Pudding is a must! For a while in 2016 (during the egg shortage) they did not make most puddings. That's my go to treat. When ordering cakes or just stopping in for a cupcake you are greeted by friendly staff.

I've bought many many many birthday cakes (red velvet, celebration, lemon, marble). All delicious. Cupcakes are so cute and so are the cookies. If you have never been go grab a slice or cupcake and save the banana pudding for me!
author: Amanda M.

description:
Well, I've ordered about 10 cakes from this location in this past month. Lol... actually I've used them in the past but my boss's family just likes to celebrate every day of the month for their family birthdays. Anywho, for some reason, EVERY TIME I call, I'm always helped by Becca. I'm not complaining at all because she has been by far, amazing, but does anyone else work there?!? I've been so extremely happy with the service she provides and has done a great job with each order. To top it off, Susie Cakes is probably my favorite bakery thus far. They are simple, but there is something extraordinary about their buttercream. I went to pastry school, so you'd think I have high expectations. But no, I love it simple and delicious and that's just what they are. My favorite flavors are the strawberry, vanilla, and right now they have a seasonal strawberry rosè. O.O has my name all over it!! 

They do deliver, which is super convenient. ONE thing I do recommend is that they should change up their designs a bit! I loveeeeee the simplicity of their cakes, but sometimes I wish they got a little more creative. Maybe they like to keep it traditional?! Who knows, but they're definitely doing it right!
author: Felicia F.

description: I ordered a cake from SusieCakes for a friend's birthday. It was really easy to order over the phone and pick up the next day. The sales lady even took the time to help me pick out candles and decorations and was very patient despite the long line. They even recommend keeping your cake in a fridge depending when it'll be served to make sure you have the best quality for your guests- and I really loved that detail!
author: Mara Y.

description:
The place is cute, the cake is cute.
Being a red velvet lover I just got to try theirs. The red velvet is OK, didn't make me do my happy cake dance. (You know, when the cake is so good and you just have to flap your legs and arms because words are not enough?)
A tad too sweet for my taste.
Whoopie pie is also so so. Nothing special for the price. 
But I heard their carrot cake is good, I'll try one next time.
author: Jenny T.

description:
The store is small and cramped (so much traffic in and out everytime we've went) so although there is a small table in the corner I wouldn't try eating there. It's a nice street though so you could eat on a bench nearby if you were so inclined.

However, the food is great! I love that the icing is not too sweet and the cake itself was the perfect moisture/dryness ratio. However, my most recent trip is why I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5. For some reason the cupcakes were just off on our last trip. We tried a Banana Chocolate Chip Cupcake which on paper sounds amazing but was quite horrible - dry, icing way too sweet, crumbly -- we ended up throwing the remainder out. But every other trip has been fantastic. The Chocolate Cake is definitely our favorite -- that has been PERFECT everytime and I would have it again in a heartbeat. We tried the funfetti cake too which was good once we warmed it in the microwave but wasn't so perfect just eating it at room temp. The red velvet cupcakes were awesome as well. 

All in all, I would definitely recommend this place whether getting some treats for home or a party -- we got a custom birthday cake and they were able to accommodate same-day which was perfect.
author: Neechi M.

description: Nice variety of rich and tasty cakes. The slices and portions are very large. Cakes are moist, dense and a bit overpriced. Tip: don't get candles from here they charge over $8 for 1 packer! Also have a few extra minutes even for pick up of pre-orders as they always have a line!
author: Ruchi M.

description:
This comment and rating only applies to the San Francisco location.

The red velvet cake is the best, but giving two stars, because the San Francisco location charges their customers the Healthy SF (5%) tax PLUS sales tax on the Healthy SF tax; is that legal to charge sales tax on a tax?!  This is an employer tax, part of doing business in SF, and should be paid by the employer! The cakes are expensive ($38 for 6"; $55 for 9"), that should well cover the Healthy SF tax, don't be greedy!

Susie Cakes is part of a retail chain, you can do better by your employees and customers.
author: E F.

description: Place was really busy when we came and I imagine this location being especially hard to go to since it is near fisherman's wharf. We got two free cupcakes since we downloaded the app, which saved us $7.50. I got the lemon cupcake and Irish cupcake which was seasonal. Even though I could have left without buying anything, I couldn't not stop myself from buying a thing that basically looked like a nutter butter from heaven.
author: Richard L.

description:
So. Dang. Good! Their red velvet cupcakes melt in your mouth. 

Their chocolate cake is intoxicatingly rich - good luck trying to finish it. 

Big fan of their basic chocolate chip cookies 

Their portions are huge so be ready for a sugar showdown!
author: John A.

description: When someone has a birthday and wants a special cake, we order one from Susie's. And their single slices of the mile-high chocolate cake with a glass of cold milk have done us in many a time when craving a treat. Chocolate and red velvet  are by far our favorites, but for kids we order the vanilla with sprinkles...it's moist but just can't compete with the former two. We have ordered so many times here, my only wish would be if they could offer new and different ways to write/decorate/showcase the guest of honor's name and event. AND extra special stars for the owners coming out every now and then to greet the folks on Chestnut and offer them a free sample of their cakes.
author: A K.

description:
I lahk cake. Especially birthday cake. Mhmmmm. Cakkkkeee...

Susiecakes, termed as the perfect All American Bakery, offers a variety of flavorful sweets and amazing layered cakes. I always come here for the cupcakes especially their strawberry, but what they are best known for is their cakes! 

Warning, their cakes are super sweet especially because their frosting is thick and sugary--but really good! I highly suggest the 6 layer vanilla celebration or the red velvet. They don't do too much with decorations, but their cakes have a classic and sleek look! Just wish they had fresh fruit flavors but they are easy to work with and can do cakes with very short notice!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Warning! This place is NOT diet friendly. If you are on a diet and you're planning on getting cupcakes or cakes from here ...abort mission !!

The first time I've ever tasted Susie cakes was up north in Greenbrae right next to my old work in 2010. Ever since, I've had most of my birthday cakes from here, twice last year (lucky me!) 

I love Susie cakes because their cakes and cupcakes are baked to perfection. I love how moist their cakes are. I always get the vanilla celebration cake. It is definitely on the super sweet side but if you have a sweet tooth, you're good to go! If sugar was healthy I would eat a whole cake to myself. Everything is good and the staff is super friendly!
author: Brigitte M.

description:
Confetti cake for the win! Seriously delicious and so simply. It's truly a crowd pleasure. For a cake, it's $58. We got it for a couple of baby showers and birthdays and it's always a hit!

The carrot cake is also delectable! Light and moist with the perfect cream cheese frosting.

If you order a cake, they deliver within the city for $30.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Just a quick update that I have returned numerous times for friend's birthday celebrations and the cakes always turn out perfect (and tasty).
author: Kasey C.

description: The Carrot Cake from here is amazing! Even after a couple of days the cake was still moist and full of flavor. The cream cheese frosting was also a hit amongst my friends. The customer service was also great, Janette was very nice and happy to help! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for delicious comforting desserts.
author: Marc O.

description:
I came here for a wedding cake tasting with a friend. We had a blast! I felt a little on display since we did the tasting right in the main section of the store but that was OK - everyone was super nice who spoke to us. We were given milk which was a sweet and really appreciated gesture. 
We got to try a bunch of different cupcake/frosting combos in addition to cookies, whoopie pies, etc. I paid $20 for the tasting (which would be credited towards a future purchase) and got a very generous amount of treats for what I paid.
I took a star away because I needed more custom options then they could accomodate. I wanted lemon raspberry and they couldn't do it. I also wanted a small two tier cake and they could only make one with a strange ratio which wouldn't have looked how I wanted.

If you are planning a wedding I would definitely recommend trying this place out! Especially if you're doing a cupcake/dessert bar. I thought the pricing was very fair.
author: Emma B.

description:
Be aware, VERY sugary and sweet cakes. I try to make it up this way every now and then when I want sugar fix, so I avoid having to buy stupid store-bought cake like from Safeway or Lucky's lol. They really should expand their hours because closing at 7 or 8 is no bueno :( There weren't even extended hours for the summer. Wtf. 

The Celebration Cake is a favorite obviously, and I like that they use a teal frosting instead of just white. I've tried to Chocolate Marble, and Red Velvet too, which were equally good. Their cookies taste really good as well, I love the Chocolate Chip ones. They have a good balance of sweet and salt. Cake slices could be a little bigger for the price given.

Service is definitely lacking so I'm not sure why there are reviews raving about their service. On my last visit alone, the stupid girl who took my order was lifeless, immature, and seemed like she didn't know what she was doing. When she received my request, she then proceeded to instead take well over 5 or 6 whole minutes cleaning all the knives and other silverware and dishes on the counter instead of just cleaning one knife, serving me my order, then going back to her tasks. I was like wtf, you know you have a customer you're supposed to be helping, right??? If you weren't ready to help a customer you should have not called me up to place my order. I then pointed out that the brochure says one price but I was being rung up another, and she nonchalantly just shrugged it off, so I emailed in to complain and got reimbursed thankfully. Don't pay attention to the brochures, clearly they are wrong.

I visited the location in Lafayette one time, and received mediocre service as well from some lowly, undeserving, brute girl who really shouldn't be working a customer service job.
author: Marquis A.

description: Stopped here in 12/2017 as we were craving dessert, and it was within walking distance from our hotel. We shared a slice of the coconut cake. The portion was huge, but the cake and icing were overly sweet. The cake was moist, but the coconut flavor was overpowered by the sugar.
author: F S.

description:
My first 5 star review on Yelp. Pure perfection. All of the cakes that I have tried have been unbelievably moist even when coming in at the end of the day (right before closing). I NEVER like chocolate things (I know, I'm crazy) but I have LOVED double chocolate and the marble cake. Perfect proportions of sweet and great presentation. The store is inviting and clean and everything looks 5 stars. 

The peanut butter cookie sandwich was divine. 

I will admit it's rich and heavy but SO worth every calorie. Close to flawless for me. 

Looking forward to trying the Vanilla Berry cake next time that looked amazing. If you're ever wanting to treat yourself this is the place to go.
author: Samyutha R.

description: They did mini cupcakes for our wedding and it was awesome! The cupcakes were delicious and completely devoured by our guests! We love this place and cannot recommend it enough :)
author: Sarah U.

description: The smell of this place is divine! I tried a mini red-velvet cupcake with cream cheese frosting and I wish I got the regular size! It was wonderful and I'm still dreaming about it! I will definitely visit this place again as I didn't get the chance to try a cookies which looked amazing.
author: Brandan W.

description:
Rarely dip into the single-star ratings but this sincerely calls for it. 

Cake of the cupcake was dried out from top through to the bottom, so heavily on the top that you bite in with this weird hard to medium-hard consistency. Frosting was crusty on the surface as if the cupcakes had been drying for a few days in the open air. Bought ones with stock words written on them from the glass case, already prepped, not knowing there was an additional $1 charge on each, so getting to the register was a shock. A single vanilla cupcake will run $4.50 and with SF tax, you'll be paying $5 total for each cupcake, meaning a dozen will run you $60. I can get an entire phenomenal cake from Cafe Madeleine or Whole Cakes for less than that, and feed more people.

Disappointing. Incredibly. Under other circumstances, I'd give this joint another chance, but not at these price points.
author: Alison A.

description:
I've tried all of their cupcake flavors and a couple of their cakes. I prefer their cupcakes over their slices of cake. Their slices of cakes are just so large! I didn't particularly enjoy the icing on the lemon cake.

Their seasonal one is usually good, so I'd recommend trying that.
author: Mimi T.

description:
SusieCakes makes the best chocolate cake in San Francisco! My wife and I love it!

We've sampled their whoopie pies and other cakes and they are all good but they cannot compare to the chocolate cake. 

The slices are very large - one slice is enough for two people.
author: Luke F.

description: One word: HEAVEN!!!!!!! Saw some ladies with a SusieCakes bag and their marketing was so great I had to find them and try them. I googled their location and walked my happy self over to indulge! And boy am I glad I did!
author: Catrina S.

description: I love German chocolate cake and SusieCakes has the best in town. Last time I didn't get the size as I usually get,I called the store and they gave me another one. They really care about and want to please their returning customers. I am sold for them as far as delicious cakes is concern, especially German chocolate!
author: Bowman L.

description:
They bake legit cakes/cupcakes here. I've never been to their actual stores but i've had their cake/cupcake from work functions. I had their chocolate cake, strawberry cupcake, cookies.

Their chocolate cake was really decadent. The cake was really soft and moist and it does not crumble when you cut into it. The frosting/filling is also chocolate but its not too sweet so it goes really well with the semi-bitter chocolate cake. The bitter sweet chocolate cake makes it stand out from other/artificial cake/frosting. 

Strawberry cupcake was also really good! The vanilla cupcake is again soft and moist and what I really liked about the cupcake is that you could taste real strawberries in the frosting so you know they dont just add coloring and flavoring to the frosting. There are minute chunks of strawberries in the frosting too. Yum.

Their cookies are also amazing. Crunchy on the outside but its soft baked on the inside! 

I am actually pretty interested to go out to their actual store to try it out.
author: Valerie H.

description:
Susie Cakes was AWESOME!! I came across Susie Cakes while in a cab headed to Smitten Ice Cream, but what's ice cream without cake? My husband and I walked to Susie Cakes from Smitten. I'm totally glad I did. I only tried two items. They both were sooo goood. I got the Chocolate Cookie Whoopie Pie and the Green Velvet Mini. I love Red Velvet Cake so this was as close as possible. They had Red Velvet by the slice but I didn't want that much cake. The green Velvet Mini was very good and moist. You can tell they use oil in making this cupcake which helps keep the moisture. The frosting to me tasted more like a butter cream and I'm not a fan of butter cream. It was like a cream cheese butter cream. I like straight cream cheese frosting. I'm a big fan of Great American Cookie Company and the Chocolate Cookie tasted like the chocolate cookie from Great American Cookie Company. They have the best cookies and this cookie reminded me of them. This cookie was thick, moist and soft. They only thing is it could have used some chocolate chucks to give it some crunch. Other than that this cookie is the bomb. Very good. 

Like I said, I only tried 2 items but they were good and I loved them. Overall, a good bakery and a must try.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I ordered cupcakes for a series of meetings today. Huge hit. I can honestly say, these are hands down the best cupcakes, and it's not even close.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Susiecakes is my favorite cake shop! I've always received wonderful service and deliveries on time. When it came to my wedding, of course Susiecakes came to mind. The tasting is $20 (this location accommodates up to 4 persons) but the credit will be applied to your order if you decide to order with them. Park was our tasting advisor, and he was awesome sauce! He listened to our needs and provided recommendations. We seriously wanted to eat the whole store, everything was delicious. We had the opportunity to try different butter creams, cupcakes, cakes, and other sweet desserts. An ipad with photo samples also helped with selecting a design. A mock cake was also available to reference for size. Park promptly sent an email the next day to confirm our selections and delivery date. I can't wait until my wedding at the end of the month so I can turn all my friends and family to Susiecake addicts! 

We selected a 3 tier (red velvet, celebration cake, 6 layer chocolate covered with vanilla buttercream) and a full red velvet sheet cake with cream cheese frosting to accommodate ~200 guests with a delivery fee of $40. Although they do not offer marzipan style designs, your florist can easily add fresh flowers to accent the cake.
author: Eileen W.

description: Meh. I ordered cupcakes for my boyfriend's birthday delivered to his work as a surprise. They said they came in a pretty box wrapped in a red ribbon and I thought they'd be glorious fluffy looking beauties covered with pretty sprinkles and very festive. I paid $55 for a dozen cupcakes and  they looked like a third grader made them. I was very disappointed. I'm sure they were delicious but next time I'll have donuts delivered for a fraction of the cost
author: Sara B.

description: I bought cupcakes for my sister in laws engagement celebration and they were a hit! Everyone loved the cupcakes and she was so into them that she is considering Susie Cakes for her wedding cake.  The buttercream frosting is so good! Highly recommend.
author: Marite C.

description: Birthday cake here is sooo goood! Sweet and buttery and everyone is super friendly! I also enjoy the red believer cupcakes and get them too often. Delicious dessert spot when you are in the mood for a quick sweet treat!
author: Trevor S.

description:
ENVIRONMENT: Store is pretty small and can get crowded but it's pretty cute inside. 

FOOD: They sometimes offer samples if you want to try a certain cake. My favorite is their carrot cake and their birthday cake flavor. They are all very tasty but are all really rich and sweet. I tend to get one slice and share it with a couple of friends! It's enough for all 3 of us. They are pretty pricey as well if you want to get a small cake for someone birthday and they can write things on the cake for you.

STAFF: they are pretty friendly and nice to give any sample you ask for! So don't be shy and try as many as you want. Most are tasty!
author: Vicky C.

description: Most amazing cake I've ever had - our company was celebrating a TON of successful wins this week and we were so grateful that SusieCakes helped us out. Great flavor overall (funfetti cake) moist and we'll definitely be ordering again!! Frosting was also to die for!
author: Our Forks In The Road ..

description:
SusieCakes staff brought in pies (by surprise) for the workers at my place of employment.  What a delicious and thoughtful gift to get us through the holidays!  Everyone was raving about how good the pies were. (Though we almost didn't find out because they were almost too pretty to eat!) 

Almost. :P
author: Pernicious J.

description:
Delicious cupcakes. Friend of mine really wanted to go here so we decided to try it out. 
We went right before they closed, so the options were limited. Had a mocha cupcake and my friends had the flourless cupcake. Both were very very good! The flourless one, I had a hard time believing it was "flourless" as they say. 
The mocha cupcake is a must for whoever loves coffee.
Nice and friendly people who work here too :) definitely recommend making a stop here!
author: John G.

description: I have ordered here countless times. The cakes and cupcakes are delicious and the service is wonderful. They are very accommodating and worth the price. Great kids cakes!!
author: Luna K.

description: My daughter got me the cranberry orange cake for my birthday. Excellent flavor and very moist. The fall color sugar on top is a beautiful color, but it's a little sweet for me. Otherwise the orange frosting is delicious
author: Kelly J.

description: This location in particular is wonderful. I love the variety of both cakes and cupcakes, and the workers are nice. This is a place you can go to where their products will always be top quality and you will not be let down. This is my go-to bakery for a QUALITY cake!!! So delicious! They do get busy, but it's always service with a smile!
author: Jenny K.

description:
I was introduced to Susie's red velvet cake a couple of years ago and probably ate it once a month thereafter. So rich, so moist, so sweet, so dense & heavy. This cake is firing on all cylinders. After the first taste, I checked out the bakery myself a few times. It's a small space with just a couple of seats, so it is mainly a takeout spot. 
I love how their cakes are so simple, just rich layers of cake with luscious, creamy frosting. No useless fillers and frou-frou decorations. They have a homemade look to them. 
I even like the way they ice their cupcakes. Looks like it's done by hand with a mini spatula. It creates the nice ridges and waves.
I've tried the...

Susie's Famous Southern Red Velvet: 
Like I said, it's delicious. 4 layers of bright red cocoa cake with cream cheese frosting. I'm not a fan of the sprinkles though, but I've never liked sprinkles.

Old-Fashioned 6-Layer Chocolate Cake:
I counted & there are indeed 6 layers of moist chocolate on chocolate decadence.

Classic Marble Cake
Very good! 4 layers of cocoa & white cake with swirly frosting.

Pretty pricey! 
$6.25 a slice - good amount to share between a couple of people
$36 - 6 inches
$49 - 9 inches

Also tried the...
Sour Cream Cheesecake ($5.50 individual):
smooth & creamy, pretty heavy, not overly dense

One question, why is the Vanilla Celebration Cake blue? I've always been curious. It's a very pretty color, no doubt.

Just one thing that irked me...  one of the young ladies who rang me up repeatedly reiterated how to store the cake, and to leave it unrefrigerated several hours before serving to make sure the cake is served at room temperature. I told her not to worry because we'd be dig in to it in just a couple of hours. But she continued speaking to me as if I were a child. Alright, thanks, heard you the first time. It's a cake... I'm not handling a bomb, you know.

I think I'll try the lemon cake or the banana pudding next. Sounds like something I would like.
author: Joy W.

description:
Becca and her team at SusieCakes are AMAZING!!!!! I have not had customer service like this in a looooong time. 

I preordered a very large custom cake for a work event a week ahead of time. Through no fault of theirs, on the morning the cake was supposed to be delivered the DoorDash delivery driver went a-wall. Doordash claimed the cake had been dropped off, when in fact I was sitting there stressing as to why it hadn't shown up (45 min late) and my event had already started. I called Becca and she PERSONALLY got in her car that second and brought a couple cakes to our office to make sure we at least had something to be served. (She also got here within 10 minutes..... AMAZING.)

In my role at work I deal with vendors on a daily basis, and to not be met with a "Well thats not my problem" attitude is amazing. 

I will be calling SusieCakes for EVERY single one of my events from now on. They have a loyal customer in me.

(Their Red Velvet Cake is delicious btw)
author: Jefferson T.

description: Sweet baby Jesus! This is the best coconut pineapple cake I've had in my life! We bought a 6 inch cake ($36) for dinner, and it was more than enough to feed 7 people. It was heaven in my mouth. The cake is moist, and icing is perfectly sweet. The first thing I did this morning was head to the kitchen and finish up another slice. I can't wait to try the other flavors.
author: Ha D.

description:
For those who grew up in our fair city in the '60's and '70's, one word sums up my thoughts about Susie Cakes:  Blum's.
I don't get down to the Marina much these days.  In the past, it was mainly to catch a great movie at the Cinema 21, have deep dish pizza at the City's original Uno's on Lombard, or enjoy a post softball game meal at Barney's Burgers or a Mexican place on Chestnut.  On Christmas eve, my friend and I stopped here after an appointment at the neighboring Apple Store (wait, isn't this where the theater was?).  There was a small line around 3 pm as people scrambled to buy last minutes gifts or treats to celebrate the holiday.  
After entering the narrow walkway into the store, my eyes were fixated on the variety of sweets stored in their deliciously tempting display counter.  Not wanting to be bad for the holidays, I limited myself to three items as follows:

1. Tropical cake (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Bdt85fhl96b_e9-bVQF4Kg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - This looks deceivingly plain, but trust me when I say that there is no lack of flavors here.  From the pineapple pieces scattered in the cake to the coconut flakes on the outside, my taste buds were at full blast eating this.

2. Whoopie pie (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q&start=1&select=gPV5uygJHL8X47Sl_cBdgA) - Not normally a big fan of this, I enjoyed this generously sized rendition.  Just make sure you have that cup of tea or coffee to wash it down.

3. Snickerdoodle (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=mGyr7sZHZOL22_oOnjcHNA&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Solid version, though still hard to beat my favorite at a chain named Baker Street Cookies who served them hot, steamy, and soft.... sigh.

The counter staff were very cordial, patient, and efficient in preparing and boxing our orders.  After a short wait, we were ready to pay and out of the store.  There were several frazzled customers who seemed lost in trying to pick up their phone orders.  
I would definitely have that tropical cake again and hope to try their other offerings in the near future.  Just need to make sure there's no physician's checkup or blood tests looming.  
Don't want my sugar count to fly off the charts!
author: Mike C.

description:
This review is long overdue. BF and I ate nearby and wanted cupcakes for dessert. It was so hard to pick just one. We ended up getting two and sharing. Both of us still wanted more! 

The staff was friendly even when we took so long to decide. Can't wait to come back and have another cupcake from SusieCakes!

Parking in the area can be challenging however coming to SusieCakes will make you forget your parking dilemmas.

2016 Review #12
author: Stephanie G.

description:
SusieCakes is one of my biggest weaknesses whenever I'm strolling through Chestnut. I'm a huge sucker for homemade cakes. It's like an unofficial birthday celebration every time I treat myself to one of their goodies. 

SusieCakes is an all-American bakery serving home-style desserts baked from scratch. They don't use any mixes and preservatives. Because they don't use preservatives, they're best eaten the day of. I've stored my leftover cake in the fridge in tuber wear for a couple of days and the bread hardened.

Their icing is a little too thick and sweet for me and I wish their bread was moister. Their slices are huge and can be shared among 2-3 people. My favorites are their vanilla celebration and red velvet cakes. Giving an extra star for excellent customer service and short lines.

They also offer custom cakes and cupcakes and wedding tastings.
author: Helen C.

description:
I placed an online order for 2 cakes. 1 6inch marble cake and 1 9in vanilla susie blue cake. The marble cake was delicious five stars on that one. It was the vanilla celebration cake that was the problem. 

First the writing on the cake was completely off to what i had wrote on the online description box. Not a huge problem because the guy fixed it by writing what i asked for on a new cake. However, that new cake was the issue.

When it came time to cut that cake, that thing was frozen. It was so hard to cut through the cake. For a moment it felt like it was an ice cream cake. The texture was not buttery or smooth at all. My guess is that when i was issued a new cake it was meant for someone who was to eat it 3 days out. Very disappointing, because i had raved on how good that cake was. I previously had it at work for a colleague and you can tell the difference immediately. Sadly, i needed the cake and did not have the time to go back and complain.
author: Monica F.

description: I received a chocolate cake built up on one side with two inches of frosting- to make it look bigger? I was so embarrassed to serve this chocolate cake for my daughter's birthday dinner. Half of the guests had frosting with four bites of cake. I'm very disappointed and let down by my first experience here.
author: Susan B.

description: Got a marble cake for my dads birthday and it was delightful. The frosting wasn't too sweet, but the blend of the chocolate and vanilla cake and icing in the middle was a perfect combination of flavors offsetting each other, with hidden surprises of chocolate chips. They gave me great instructions to store the cake at room temperature and seran wrap it, to which it was actually more moist he next day!! Highly recommend and will take a lot of will power for me to not get something as I walk by every time now
author: Kaitna S.

description:
Delicious desserts and even sweeter employees!

I work for a business not too far away from this spot and the people working at this location and I absolutely love stopping by there. The staff are full of energy at all times and go out of their way for all of their customers!
Of course the brand name speaks for itself. I have been to so many locations and all are the same high quality that you would expect!

I highly recommend their cupcakes and cheesecake!
author: Liza P.

description:
Some good friends brought home a carrot cake from SC -- best carrot cake I've ever had. Went by today to get a slice of that heaven, plus a slice of the chocolate layer cake -- heaven-squared! Best chocolate cake I've ever had.

Enough said.

Cheers!
RS
author: Rich S.

description:
I take baked goods kind of seriously.

While I can't just whip up my favorite duck confit, or something like a soufflé by myself at home...I CAN bake a magnificent cake, or a severely mean batch of cookies, with minimal, if any, effort.  So in order for me to legitimize paying for them, they should be exceptional.

And I expect a top notch bakery, in a high end neighborhood, in a cosmopolitan city, to have exceptional fare.

So far, I've only ordered cake here.  But when that word is included in the title of your business, there should be zero risk with doing that, right?

The cakes are moist, but they're too rich, dense, & sweet.  Basically, you're done after 2 or 3 bites.  Which defeats the purpose of having a slice of cake, right?  I want a light, fluffy cake, w a creamy frosting, not a sugary one.  

Perhaps this extra sugar factor is why there are always a bunch of little kids in here w their parents; kids just love sugar.

Props for the chocolate frosting & the sizes of the cakes.  The chocolate frosting has that old school quality, both taste & texture wise.  I love that.  

I've tried the coconut & the marble.  Maybe the red velvet or the celebration cakes will win me over?

A slice will run you $6.50, but it is a hefty slice.

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Cute bakery with a wide selection of cakes. Stopped in after brunch with some girlfriends and we split a humongous slice between the three of us. Cakes are $6/slice but it's a great deal considering that it'll feed up to 4 people. I also love the open kitchen layout here that allows you to see cakes being made on the spot. Only downside is that seating is limited and there's only room for 3-4 people on the inside and outside.
author: Amy C.

description:
I'm giving this place an extra star for cuteness, but to be real, I wasn't feeling their cupcakes. Something was just off. Now don't get me wrong. This is the cutest place and they sell other baked goods, and it's possible maybe I just chose the wrong thing. I got the plain buttercream cupcakes but just found it a little too sweet and the cake way too dense, which is surprising, given the reviews of this place. And the icing was just strange to me. Maybe I need to go back and give it another shot, but I did get two types of cupcakes and felt the same about both. So to be fair, this is just about the cupcakes. And if I had a choice, this wouldn't be my go-to place for them. But, if you're looking for a super cute storefront with a variety of baked goods, or just in the mood for window shopping, then check this place out. 

Likes:
-cute store front
-great customer service
-variety of baked goods

Dislikes:
-cake part of cupcake is a bit too dense for my liking. 
-icing is a bit on the sweet side, and has a weird taste that I can't put my finger on
author: Tracy T.

description: After having a not so satisfying lunch at Glaze across the street, I'm glad we ran into this bakery. I ordered a slice of chocolate cake, 6 cupcakes and a chocolate chip cookie. The chocolate cake was delicious! My new favorite place to get it. My kids liked the cupcakes (6 different flavors) and a big chocolate chip cookie. I will definitely go back when I'm in the area.
author: Maria W.

description: My brother and his fiancé got a cake from here for their engagement party and I do not hesitate to say that it was the best cake I've ever had. Super rich, super buttery, full of flavor and seriously just amazing. It's been a month and I still think about that cake. They got the celebration flavor (aka funfetti). Amazing and I wish they delivered to New York
author: Natalie S.

description: The marble cake was delicious. They also write on the cake for a special occasion, $3.
author: Isabela R.

description: The red velvet cupcakes are bomb! Everytime I am in the area and have cravings for something sweet I make my stop here!
author: Christina G.

description:
It took me awhile to write this review :)
My manager always orders from here if we have a party or a goodbye feast to one of us. I hadn't had a whole cake myself, hence, this time, I went a bit overboard and bought two whole big cakes: Red Velvet and Vanilla. 
Red Velvet has always been my top favorite from this place. It was a first cake I fell in love with so there you have it.
Vanilla, uhm, both my sister and I ain't a fan. My 3 years old niece didn't like it either. I did at the end finish this whole cake by myself...and it wasn't so bad.
Definitely a place to go for cake (again) this time, Rv only.
author: Bao V.

description:
I sampled their flourless chocolate cupcake with cream cheese frosting and chocolate sprinkles!
I got the mini just in case it was too dry but it turned out to be the fudgiest little chocolate cupcake I've ever had. Nice surprise for me and I plan to buy a regular sized one next time I go back! I've heard great things about Susie Cakes and I hope they have some really creative holiday iced cookies coming up for me to try!
author: Laura Y.

description:
Cute store with friendly service and delicious cupcakes. There's a couple tables outside for sitting at.

We got the pumpkin cupcake with cream cheese frosting and coconut cupcake ($3.50 each). They were both so good and not overly sweet. I saw they also sell cake slices here for about $6 which looked amazing.
author: Linda X.
