description: Yummmmy! Chocolate cupcakes with vanilla frosting and the strawberry cupcakes are my favorite. Red velvet is pretty good too. I didn't really like their peanut butter cupcake i felt that it had a high dose of coffee in it which is weird, i didnt taste the peanut butter at all.
author: Sarah A.

description: Cookies and Cakes are great,but service is suspect.  2nd in line, and neither person behind the counter would even make eye contact to acknowledge our presence.
author: Ray R.

description:
My usual SusieCakes location is the store in Menlo Park, but before going home on the Peninsula after a hair appointment, I had a sudden urge to satisfy my sweet tooth. I headed to the Marina to get my SusieCakes fix.

This location is much smaller than it's big sister location in Menlo Park, but the baked goods are still thebomb.com.

My go tos are vanilla celebration cake, so I got a slice this time around. I also went home with two chocolate chip cookies, two snickerdoodle cookies, and a slice of red velvet cake. EEEK!

SusieCakes will always be my go to bakery--fresh, down home baking, and top notch finished products.

Expensive? Yep. A slice of cake will set you back $6.50. Steep, I know. However, it's worth for me. The cake slices are huge and just so, so delicious.

The staff was friendly and quick during this visit, too. I have nothing but good things to say!
author: Chandra D.

description: Best in the city !! Coconut cake!!! Great service. Very friendly staff. Highly recommend!!
author: Jessica J.

description: Susiecakes is your classic American bakery with wholesome ingredients. I tried the 'birthday cake' which is basically fancy confetti cake. $7 for a slice of cake seems like a lot but a fair price for quality and location. It's a big slice too! Why 3 stars for a-ok? It's not particularly unique enough for me to make a trip here and I found the cake a bit too sweet.
author: Tammy T.

description:
We got cupcakes from Susie Cakes to celebrate someone's last day at work. We got an assortment of cupcakes, but since I love strawberry, I decided to try the Strawberry cupcake.

I may anger a lot of Susie Cakes lovers, but I found it to be waaay too sweet. I basically took one bite and threw the rest away. It did have a nice strawberry flavor though. Too bad the sweetness overpowered the strawberry flavor. I know a lot of people like their celebration cake, but if it's as sweet as the strawberry one I had, it's not for me. I prefer lighter frostings and cakes.

If you're a huge fan of thick sugary icing, then you'll probably like Susie Cakes. But for me, the cupcakes were beautiful, but not very tasty.
author: Elena N.

description:
I've loved SusieCakes for a while... Especially the coconut cupcakes. My best friend goes nuts for these so I got two dozen mini coconut cupcakes for her birthday! I was really impressed with their customer service and ordering them was easy... I had them write HAPPY BDAY EMMY on the cupcakes. Unfortunately, when I went to pick them up, it looked like a third grader had written it :( Everybody's pictures of custom cakes on Yelp looked so good I was hoping for the same...

We were really bummed but at least they still tasted good.
author: Julia M.

description:
Do your research before trusting a guy when they rave about a dessert place. Chances are it's REALLLYYYYY amazing or it's not that great. Unfortunately, this place was just average to me. Susiecakes was brought up by one of my acquaintances who swore it was the best cupcakes ever. Being the cupcake enthusiast that I am, I had this place bookmarked and eyed for the longest time. Finally got to try this 2.5 weeks ago. 

Bought a box of 4 for $14. $3.50 each cupcake. 
Flavor of the month Strawberry Lemonade: Omg... it was SOOOOOO sour... I cringed. And I LOVE sour. But this was overwhelming and I forcefully downed it since I already paid $3.50 for it. 

Strawberry: It consisted of artificial pieces of strawberries in the cupcake itself . This one was alright. I can't put my finger on it, but I didn't really favor this one as much. 

Red Velvet: Kind of hard to mess up. The flavors were good, it wasn't too sweet, and the frosting complimented it well. Maybe some technical issues in baking since a lot of the cupcake were completely stuck to the baking cups. 

Vanilla: Probably my favorite one out of the four. Very basic, but it was the only one that seem to be made correctly. It wasn't too sweet and the frosting was nicely balanced in sweetness with the cake portion. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/susiecakes-san-francisco?select=_iYAvO7lUeQu7UKuYN6wDQ

Overall, a very average cupcake place. I really wanted to like the place a lot...but... flavors were not amazing to me unfortunately. BUTTTTTTT. I'll give it to them that the cupcakes look adorable.
author: Chena N.

description:
Due to poor planning, the bakery I normally get cakes from was closed  by the time I had time to grab a cake so I was left scrambling for a Father's day cake. We called a bunch of cake stores and majority of them were sold out of cakes already. 

Susiecakes still had some cakes left so we drove over to the Marina district to pick up one. We opted for the small 6" marble cake and it costed $36 with an additional $3 for writing...Most cake places provide free cake writing. The 9" was $49... Super expensive for a basic cake. 

When it was time to eat it, we were excited but upon consumption we were super disappointed. The marble cake was basically vanilla and chocolate cake swirled with bits of chocolate chips embedded and covered in a chocolate frosting. It was overly sweet and no one expect for my 10 year old brother liked it. You really REALLLYY reallly need to have a major sweet tooth to enjoy their cakes. My mouth/tooth cringes at the thought of how sweet it was. We ended up giving away half of the cake to a homeless man because we didn't want to waste it and that we should share instead of throwing it away in the trash. 

To each their own but in my opinion, even the Whole Foods cakes taste better than the cake we had here. 

2 stars because it saved our butts for our Father's day cake but would never come here for a cake ever again. I will stick to Schuberts.
author: Kelly L.

description:
I come here for ALL occasions that require desserts.lol They have such a wide variety of options you can't go wrong! 

I can go early in the morning or late afternoon and they still have plenty to choose from. 

The candle/card selection is absolutely adorable too.
author: Katerina Y.

description: A lot of hype surrounding SusieCakes and I'm not sure why. Their cakes are expensive, pumped with ridiculous amounts of sugar, and the service is sub-par. I bought a lemon cake for my mother's birthday and an employee asked me if I wanted to write something on it. Of course! I have to let my mom know that cake is specifically for her. The short employee charged me $3 without letting me know beforehand, which is ridiculous because the 6" cake was already $36. There are 100 other bakeries that I would rather go, goodbye SusieCakes!
author: Nicholas H.

description:
Every single bite of our wedding cake was devoured!

We opted for 3 cakes (tropical pineapple coconut, chocolate with peanut butter, and carrot cake), plus mini red velvet cupcakes.

I never even saw the cupcakes, they were gone so fast - and the rest followed shortly. Most guests had 2+ slices, they just kept going back for more. Yum!!
author: erica d.

description:
Up until yesterday, if you asked me what the best piece of cake that I've ever eaten was, I would tell you that it's my homemade chocolate cake with chocolate frosting. After having Susie Cakes marble cake last night at a graduation ceremony, I'm questioning everything I used to know to be true. How have I lived in the same city that this bakery operates in and never tried their cake? Honestly what have I really even been doing of worth in my life? 

A couple months ago somebody told me a story about her boyfriend having thrown out the leftovers of a Susie cake and she called him "a deranged hillside murderer" for having done that. They're not together anymore and I'm not saying that it's because he threw that cake out, but I'm also not saying that it's NOT because of that. 

I would eat a prison spread out of a sharps container if it contained that chocolate frosting.
author: Emma H.

description:
4.5 Stars

I had originally baked my own cupcakes for my sister's baby shower. However, when we were transferring our baby shower supplies from the car to her house, they all tumbled over and were ruined. :( 

There wasn't much time to bake a whole new batch, so we quickly ordered a dozen and half cupcakes from SusieCakes through Postmates. The cupcakes were delicious and arrived very quickly. However, they could use some quality control. We had at least three cupcakes that were missing sprinkles. Were they really in that big of a rush? -.5 star.
author: Gina P.

description: They took my cupcake order just one day ahead of time and everything turned out perfectly! The cupcakes tasted delicious and they even offer curbside pick up.
author: Kristen A.

description: I don't get it. Super super sweet. Don't even taste anything else than sugar. My 4 yr old loves it but adults...What gives?
author: caro S.

description:
Had the pineapple upside down cupcake SPECIAL today. Best cupcake ever from SusieCakes. This flavor should become a regular. 

I was looking forward to a slice of German Chocolate but was told they don't make it. Maybe it's seasonal? Carrot cake slice was a winner! 

The celebration vanilla cupcake was exceptionally dry today. The staff is always over the top polite. Kudos.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: Cake does not get any better than at Susie Cakes. If you like rich moist cake, Susie Cakes is just for you. I love the chocolate cake the most. Would recommend getting a piece of cake versus a cupcake because price wise a slice is $6 while a cupcake is about $3, the chocolate cake slice is huge and is definitely worth all of your money. For any occasion, Susie Cakes is always the right answer. Go follow @cass.eats on instagram for similar reviews and photos.
author: Cass.eats ..

description: Great Pies! Apple crumble was  we also bought their Surprise Balls for New Years and they were underwhelming.
author: Cam P.

description: These cupcakes and cakes are remarkable. It's a distinctive style that makes them coveted by those in the know. A dozen cupcakes for my birthday sent me over the moon. The dough in the cupcakes is just perfect. And the frosting is thick and sumptuous. Surely diabetes would be in my future had I not shared my bounty.
author: Alias A.

description: My son lives in San Francisco and I wanted him to have birthday cake. I was undecided whether to have a cake delivered to his place of employment or purchase several slices for him. I went with the slices. He LOVED the cake!!! Didn't give five stars because the girl who took the order was efficient but certainly unfriendly. The cake deserves five stars. Quality. Slices were: 6 layer chocolate, red velvet, and lemon. He said all were yummy but the 6 layer was best.
author: Diane R.

description: Fantastic cupcakes and plenty of options. I would recommend the chocolate chocolate cupcakes to any chocolate fans!
author: Brian G.

description:
If you like frosting, fun, bright colors, sprinkles, or happiness, you will like SusieCakes and their vanilla celebration cake. Even if you don't like any of those things, you will still like their vanilla celebration cake. It is THAT good.

Seriously, though. The cake looks amazing and tastes even better. Those decadent layers of cake and frosting are irresistible. If you're in the market for a cake, SusieCakes is the way to go.

#teambuttercream
author: Kelly R.

description: Grant expensive cupcakes bakeries here looks really good nice presentation pretty expensive
author: Meishi M.

description:
I was so excited to come here - had heard about it from several friends. I went at 7:30p on a Sunday, and got a slice of their signature celebration cake to take home. 
The service was great at the store - the line moved quickly and the staff was friendly. However, when I got home and tasted the cake, it was extremely dry. It wasn't just dry on the edges, the entire cake was inedible. I had a few friends over at the time I had it, and they all agreed that it was so dry and crumbly that it had to be thrown away. 
This place is expensive and I'm disappointed to have wasted $7 on it. Perhaps it's because I visited close to closing time, so their cakes had been sitting out all day - but still, that's no excuse to sacrifice on quality.
author: Corinne W.

description:
I've stopped by a couple of times when in the area as I have a pretty serious sweet tooth, and it's a cute little shop, albeit tiny. I've tried a number of their cupcakes and also the whoopie pie. I have to say, I'm not a huge fan of the cupcakes. The flavors are good, but the cake has always been on the dry side (maybe I got ones that weren't fresh?) and the frosting is just a little too sweet so that it makes you feel a little sick after eating the whole cupcake. That's saying a lot coming from me, as I generally have a very high sweets tolerance!

I did enjoy the whoopie pies, although rather than the traditional outer layer which are a little more cake-like in texture, they use two soft chocolate cookies instead, with a buttercream frosting in the middle. Also on the sweeter end, so you might not want to eat it all in one sitting as that thing is surprisingly filling!

Friendly service!
author: Vivian L.

description:
Susie Cakes is amazing!! On gloomy days, I know one of the things that can brighten my day is a slice of their COCONUT Tropical Cake. Not too sweet, it's soft, moist and those chucks of pineapples and coconuts make it the BEST CAKE EVER! I think I can eat the whole cake myself, it's that good.

Of course they also have other highlights at Susie's. I also love their cookies. Their peanut butter cookie sandwich is awesome as well as their huge snicker doodle cookie. They have pies too. Pie flavor varies, so when you visit, it's like a surprise. I got the cherry pie on pie day this year. I love cherries but this pie was too tart for me but the crust was good. 

I know their signature flavor is red velvet but I think its way too sweet for my taste. If you prefer something less sweet, I would recommend their Classic Marble Cake. I always bring this cake to parties because it's something everyone would like. They also have theme cookies, cupcakes and cakes for sports, holidays, events, etc. Their Christmas cakes are the best. SUPER pretty and festive. 

It's a cute little bakery located in the Marina and I love everything about it. Staff is always friendly with a smile. So glad it's not too far from where I live and not too close. Haha
author: Sandy B.

description:
Things to know about SusieCakes:

- Chocolate chip cookie: Good (hard to eat this after having had an amazing cookie in NYC, but I definitely enjoyed it)

- Red Velvet cupcake: Very good (who doesn't like Red Velvet?)

- Vanilla Celebration Cake: The ULTIMATE AMAZING. 

We had the Vanilla Celebration Cake for our engagement party awhile back, and being that I'm not a cake person, I was mediocre on the idea of having a cake for the party.  But, after having a slice of it, I went through the effort of researching how to properly save cake so that I could continue to enjoy my Celebration Cake even after the event was over. I can't get enough of it!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Best. Cakes. In SF.

The celebration specialist was on point.

The cakes we ordered were perfect. 

I love dropping buy for the slice of the day or any of their epic cupcakes.

Faves? Red velvet, strawberry, coconut.
author: Gabriela W.

description: I had a slice of cake that was to die for! They also had some interesting cupcake flavors that I wanted to try, but you can only be so fat before you die, right? I would definitely recommend this if you are into interesting flavors.
author: Isabel G.

description:
If you do not like sugar avert your eyes..

This is my second time coming to the SusieCakes bakeries, this is my first time at the San Francisco one. The customer service here was great. The bakers greeted us as soon as we walk through the door. They were also very patient as we took our sweet time figuring out what mouth watering delight to question our lives with. I really enjoyed the fact that they a unisex uniform, a brown bandana with a SusieCakes brown T-shirt. The baker that took my order was just hired and it was her first day. She appeared a bit nervous, I would be too if I had to handle these moist tastebud sensations. I ordered a peanut butter cupcake, 2 frosted cookie & 3 mini cupcakes (red velvet, chocolate, and vanilla). I would lie to you all and say that one was better than the others, but I know that when I go to SusieCakes I will never lose. Although, I was not as much of a fan of the red velvet cupcake. The cookies were a perfect blend of moist, soft and had a slight crunch to them. Come here and have you tastebuds love you forever!
author: Cherise N.

description: Bought a "gender reveal" cupcake from them and it was ready in 2 min and delicious. They totally had this thing under control and it was perfect.
author: Susan G.

description:
I love their vanilla celebration cake.  My son loves it too.  It's perfect for birthdays, baby showers or any type of great event.   I have been back here several times since my first review and I have to admit, I rated them too critically on my first visit. 

Their cakes are really good and tasty.  They have so many different goodies from cookies, whoopie pies to cheesecake and pudding.  If you need to satisfy your sweet tooth, this is a great place to indulge in all kinds of goodies.  I will definitely be back to by the celebration cake for my sons upcoming birthday because he is absolutely in love with this cake. Definitely recommend.
author: Christine P.

description: Cheesecake can compare to Zanzes or even better. Im just now eating my day old cupcake from there still tastes fresh and very good. Highly recommended.
author: Mei H.

description: Best cakes ever and amazing talented staff who will dream up whatever your heart desires.
author: Kevin L.

description:
WHOA. My sweet tooth has been lifted

Gave Susie Cakes a try because my sweet tooth was begging for some frosting. I love the decor and open windows in this compact bakery. I couldn't get my eyes off every single pastry that they had displayed and I just wanted to eat ALL OF THEM.

I had the mini chocolate cupcake, mini lemon cupcake and mini red velvet. The best is hands down, the red velvet. It was rich, moist and the cream cheese frosting was a blessing combination to the cake itself. But unfortunately I felt like the rest were TOO sweet for me. I also had the chance to try the sample cake that was on top of the counter - It dried out my tongue and the sweetness of the cream left my face squeezed to a pulp.

I'll stick to the red velvet from now on!
author: Linda K.

description: Good cupcakes, moist cake and flavorful icing. Nothing too sweet. HOWEVER, I had a cake from there the other day, I picked it up in the morning and it was served in the afternoon, so pretty fresh. The cake wasn't as moist as the cupcake and it had too much frosting to my taste. thick frosting layer on top and all around, plus thick frosting layers inside the cake, more frosting than cake is not my thing... 3 stars for the cupcake, 1 for the cake.
author: J. S.

description:
I always thought this place only did preorder of cakes and cupcake but i always wanted to try this place whenever i passed by it. Early today during my lunch break, i notice that this place wasnt busy so i decided to dropped in to see what this place is about. If i was busy, i wouldnt have walk in. I came in and asked one of the worker if they only do preorder...they mention they also see stuff over the counter which is good since i was able to try their products without preordering. 

They don't have many selection of regular cakes size, mini and regular size cupcakes, and cookies. I was looking toward the cupcakes when i first walk and took me a while to pick which flavor i want since all the cupcakes looks so good. 

Decided with the chocolate cupcake(regular size) since i didnt have much time to stay there long. Cost $3.25 for one cupcake which i thought it was pricy. But the chocolate flavor cupcake was yummmy!! This cupcake has a lot of chocolate. Chocolate frosting on of the chocolate cupcake itself plus chocolate filling inside. This is match made in heaven for those who are a chocolate lover. The bread part of the cupcake have an okay amount of chocolate flavor but when you bite together with frosting and filling, it adds that extra sweetness. Its a cool place if you want to grab a quick snack to bite. Or preorder it for better occasion. 
Friendly staff.
author: Julie N.

description:
For my 300th Yelp Review, it is my favorite place. Well when I am SF that is, right after a visit to the Golden Gate Bridge. 

I first wen to get some mini cupcakes which hare so cute and perfect for me because I can't pick just one cupcake, why would you only pick one? You're hurting all the other cupcakes feelings. :) I choose vanilla, chocolate and red velvet. Perfect bit size, so moist, flavorable, pretty and so addicting to eat as well. 

The second time I went, I opted to get the filled cupcakes: chocolate mint, vanilla pink, coconut and chocolate peanut butter. O-M-G, those were so good, I love how they are not so sweet but sweet enough to enjoy without second guessing your diet. Oh and don't forget they have a wide selection of cookies too, I tried the sweetheart sandwich, love the confetti sprinkles on top of the cookie sandwich, and heart shaped top cookie. My son and I enjoyed it very much. 

The third time, I got even more daring. My girlfriend was coming in that week so I ordered her a birthday cake. She loves red velvet but I couldn't not get the vanilla celebration cake. The blue frosting was what sold me on it, oh and the 6 layer vanilla cake with confetti. Yep I love anything with confetti :) 

Oh did I mention that was only a week span of my visits, hehe. The staff are very friendly as well and it's neat to look out the kitchen glass window as the are making custom cake orders. Once in a while if you're lucky they also have magnets for you.
author: Racquel K.

description:
Great chocolate chip cookie.  A solid 5 stars.  I'll definitely return for more and try the other cookies as well.

I'm not so sure about the cakes.  I've only tried a slice of the coconut cake which was very dense, not cake-like at all, and the frosting extremely sugary.  I love sweets but this cake could put you in a sugar coma.
author: Donna P.

description:
So I've been to the one in Newport, CA and it's amazing. After dinner we were walking around in SF and saw this so we had to go in. Not to mention earlier in the day I saw one in Sausalito so it was truly meant to me. 

I got for myself:

Red Velvet slice- this is a staple so you much get it. Moist, chocolate, frosting.... To die for. Heaven. RIP. 

Celebration Cake- this is a celebration in your mouth. You cannot get enough of this. I just wanted more and more and more. Try this with ice cream. 

Lemon Slice- this thing was super zesty and great frosting. The crystallize sugar was good too. 

Pumpkin Cheesecake- I am a sucker for pumpkin. I am also a sucker for cheesecake. So I am naturally a sucker for pumpkin cheesecake. This was soooooo delicious. I loved every bite. 

Pumpkin Bread Pudding- I have no words for this. Just none. Eat it. 

This place is far superior to all other cake places!
author: Tony C.

description:
During my search for the perfect bakery for my wedding, I knew that I wanted cupcakes and it came down to a difficult decision between two of my favorite bakeries. It was a no brainier that I ended up with SusieCakes. I have to commend them for being so accommodating and offering such an amazing tasting experience. We wanted cupcakes, a cake, and kept everything simple although SusieCakes was more than willing to customize and provide alternatives in terms of colors, designs, and add-ons. We went with a mixture of coconut and red velvet cupcakes and a strawberry cake topper. Our guests couldn't stop raving at how moist and delicious the cakes were. SusieCakes was our one and only cake tasting experience and we were sold after such great service that we didn't even bother to look elsewhere. 

My husband and I worked with Molly. She was such a sweetheart from the very beginning up to the stressful days of the wedding. Always responsive, timely, patient, and accommodating. We had our wedding at the De Young museum earlier this month and with the strict policies, time requirements, and drop off procedures, Molly and her delivery team put us at ease as well as provided what was required in a timely manner making the process seamless.

Thank you SusieCakes for making our wedding day awesome!

P.S. They even included instructions on how to store and keep your cake if you wish, so we are looking forward to seeing how our cake holds up within the year! :)
author: Tracy T.

description: I could not be happier with my recent experience with SusieCakes.  I was needing about 40 cupcakes for a gender reveal party. I dealt with Park the manager during this process.  He was completely sweet and wonderful when I wanted to change the frosting colors, when I wanted different sprinkles, when I wanted to change the way the frosting was piped, (I could go on and on with my crazy pregnancy cupcake demands) and he accommodated everything perfectly.  He always answered emails promptly, and I was pleasantly surprised when the cupcakes were gorgeous and PERFECT. Sorry Park, but I will always be coming to you with all my cake and cupcake needs.  I highly recommend him at SusieCakes!!! :) Elle
author: Eeao O.

description:
I've honestly never had a bad cupcake here, but my favorite item here is the vanilla celebration cake. It's pretty much a funfetti cake on steroids. If you're thinking about purchasing a slice, consider asking them to cut that slice in half and then you'll have two regular slices. One slice is humungous with the layers of moist vanilla cake and deliciously rich cream cheese frosting.

I've also ordered a whole cake for a friend's birthday before and while you may think the price is a bit steep, its a HEAVY cake and you'll get your slices worth out of those. 

Not a huge fan of their whoopie pies, but I don't think I love W-pies in general so there's that.
author: Stacey L.

description: Tasty carrot cake with perfect decoration... very happy! While a bit pricey, well worth it for the reaction and lasting memories.
author: Mike J.

description: Peanut butter and red velvet meh ... I've had better at other places - its a small place - no coffee - no parking other than street spots
author: Jody S.

description: Sometimes I dream about winning the lottery and sailing across the oceans, other times... I dream about the whoopie pies at SusieCakes. It's like they were sent from up above, to grace the mouths of hungry yelpers ahhhhh.
author: Steph W.

description:
Wedding Cake Review
$20 cake tasting, $40 delivery in SF
Just did the cake tasting. Tired multiple fillings, cupcakes, and their specialty cakes. Too sweet for my taste. Saw their wedding designs. I think they are a better fit for birthday cakes than wedding cakes. Cake is the centerpiece for weddings and the designs need work. Overall, not the place for me.
author: Jasmin T.

description:
Red velvet cupcakes and creme cheese frosting. Oh myyyyyyyy goodness!!!!

I'm not even a cupcake person but good grief it's hard not to love these!
author: Raji R.

description:
Walked into the place and it smelled like sour milk...not the most pleasant scent to be welcomed with in a cupcake shop, but I never tried SusieCakes and with an open mind, I was determined to get my cupcakes no matter how the store smelled. 

I ordered their red velvet mini cupcakes (they were out of the regular sized ones), flourless chocolate cupcake, mocha cupcake, and cheesecake. 

The red velvet cupcake was good- I especially enjoyed the cream cheese frosting and would recommend this (if I ever come again, I'd just get this). 

I would NOT recommend their cheesecake...and cheesecake is my favorite type of cake. I felt the cheesecake was not tangy enough, not smooth enough (tasted a bit too eggy) and just overly sweet. The cheesecake is topped with some sour cream and the sour cream makes it taste a bit more tangy, but the cheesecake part itself is not really tangy at all and that is really what makes it a disappointing/boring/not worth the calories cheesecake. 

I was not crazy about the flourless chocolate cupcake...but perhaps others would like it. It tastes like a dense brownie.

I thought the mocha cupcake taste ok, I liked the chocolate cake part of this one better than the flourless one, but still was underwhelming to me. 

My favorite cupcake place is still Sprinkles Cupcakes...but they don't have one in SF sadly!
author: Kathleen Y.

description:
Goodness gracious! I am so craving for a slice of Susie's red velvet cake right now.  A few weekends ago, my boyfriend brought me to his favorite cake place (yes, here).  Not that I don't trust his tastes in sweets because he knows his sweets, but I was a bit skeptical that this place have a great red velvet cake.  I mean... come on! It's a SOUTHERN cake and where I'm from (Texas), I've had my share of red velvet cakes! 

I didn't eat the cake right away.  I actually waited about 2 days because we have been eating non-stop for the entire weekend.  I had my first bite on the plane en route back to Texas.  Nom... it helped with the screaming kid and toddler around me.  The cake was super moist (even after being a day or two old) and the frosting was the right balance of cream cheese and lightness.  The slice was pretty generous too!  In fact, I ate half on the plane and the rest in my office for lunch the next day. 

I think I might have found my favorite red velvet cake place (and yes, I might be replacing Icebox out in Miami, Florida).  So if you're out in San Francisco and you're craving for some cake... then stop by over here!
author: Sandy H.

description: Fortunately for me, I am not near by, otherwise I would be in trouble....stopping by for way too many treats to fulfill my sweet tooth. Their cupcakes are delicious and I love the ample variety of sweets offered. I will make sure to make it a routine to stop by whenever I'm the city.
author: Alejandra R.

description:
I came here during a cupcake food tour and really thought that their signature frosting style with the divot in the middle was sweet and unique. It gives it a home-made look which some might dislike but I, personally, love.  

I like their retro 50s vibe and their open kitchen. The front window allows you to see into part of the kitchen which makes you feel safer about the product you're about to eat. I tried their red velvet which was their signature cupcake flavor (I heard). It's good but man are they sweet. I have such a hard time eating super sweet frosting. 

Mini cupcakes are about $20 for a dozen. That's a very flat and agreeable price I would say. They sell  more than just cupcakes but I have yet to try all of their products. They have cookies, pies, cakes, cheesecakes and whoopie pies.
author: Brenda L.

description:
I love cupcakes and have searched around the city for some of the best ones. 

First impressions: Cute small bakery, with a 1960s vibe that makes you feel like mom whipped these up.

Ordered: Vanilla with Pastel Frosting and Red Velvet. I love the vanilla cupcakes - even though it's a super basic flavor, they do it so well. The cake is moist and the frosting is the perfect buttercream (not too sweet, and just a little bit salty). The red velvet wasn't as strong (Sprinkle's is still my favorite red velvet!) 

In the past, have also tried the carrot cake and strawberry, but the vanilla is always one of my favorites!

Bonus points for giving great care instructions with each box!
author: Amanda C.

description: Just want to update my review to add a star. I've been back many times and referred my friends to order their cakes here and it's consistently good. Yes, it's a little generic and too sweet but it's meant to be a treat and you don't have to eat the entire thing! Also, I appreciate that they have 100 health rating when so many restaurants in SF don't care about this.
author: Emma M.

description:
Celebrate good times with the celebration cake sooo good!  I love the simply wonderful, classic flavors offered from Susie cakes.  It's like walking In to a 50's style bakery with a modern twist of fun.  The service is friendly and the treats are always fresh tasting and moist.  
Dessert bars are a hot trend and this team has perfected the art of the classic desserts without getting lost in the hype. 
I recently purchased a small fruit pie in addition to my standard slice of celebration cake and let me tell you, my taste buds were dancing.  If you are in the mood for a real treat or have an occasion to celebrate, look no further, Susie cakes is the perfect fit.
author: Karen L.

description:
SusieCakes does not use any mixes, artificial preservatives, high-fructose corn syrups or trans-fats in their products. They bake everything entirely from scratch. And man, it shows!

It's safe to say I am obsessed with these cupcakes. I don't know what they put in the frosting but it is the perfect balance of creamy, smooth, and not overly sweet. My favorite cupcake is the Mocha. It has just the right amount of chocolate and coffee. 

The best part is my work office is close by in the Presidio. SusieCakes is the perfect place for coworkers birthday cakes, bad days, or just the occasional sugar rush! Though I haven't tried the cakes myself, I have heard they are delicious and perfectly decorated!

Great bakery to check out in the Marina!
author: Nicole W.

description: Not very impressed. We were In town for the week and decided to get a cake for my sisters birthday. We found it on Yelp and it had high reviews so we were super excited, but the service was subpar. We ordered the marble cake and it had way too much frosting and way too sweet. It did have nice chunks of chocolate chips, but I've definitely had better cake from the Publix bakery for half the price. Maybe my expectation were too high? I'm not sure but definitely wouldn't be a place I would recommend.
author: Gabriela S.

description: Today was my first time buying a cake at susiecake's. It was super busy because it was mother's day weekend. This isn't my first time being a customer at susiecakes but I assume everything will go well as I thought. A guy with glasses helped me out. I told him I wanted mother's day cake and he replied,"mhm." I repeated again and said I want vanilla flavor. Then he said, "what kind?" I pointed to cakes that already had Happy Mother's Day piped onto the cakes. I assumed those were ready to go for anyone, since Susiecakes would be expecting high demand right? Nope. Those were for pre-orders. So I pointed that I wanted another cake that was blank and told him to pipe the letters on it. I understand how it is to provide customer service when it's super busy. But I felt a weird and snobby vibe from him like I didn't know what I was doing. I just wanted a cake.
author: Suki L.

description:
They did an amazing job on our wedding cake. Everything from the tasting with Molly to the ordering to the delivery went smoothly (they even coordinated delivery with our venue for us) and our guests raved about how good the cake tasted. 

I know you're supposed to freeze the top layer to eat on your first anniversary, but our cake leftovers lasted only a week after the wedding. Luckily, we know where to go to get more :)
author: Alison E.

description: First time here place was nice and clean real modern day bakery style. The lights in the store made all the cakes look extra good and makes your just wanna buy everything.  Only thing I wasn't feeling was the guy helping me he was moving super slow. Just seemed like he didn't even wanna work today. Cakes are very sweet so have some milk or water ready #Paypaboy
author: Donald A.

description:
We were excited to order a birthday cake from this location. We go in and ask to try small samples of a couple different flavors (as I have done previously before ordering a cake that costs over $40). 

The lady at the counter was not friendly and when we asked for a small sample she hesitantly said "ok" as she rolled her eyes then gave us the smallest "sample" I have ever received...ever. The crumb of cake barely fit on the tiny sample spoon. 

At this point we were both pretty pissed because clearly this lady did this in spite. Way to go counter lady. We walked out and I will maybe try a different location. But I did not want to give any money to these people or this company
 
Learn how to treat customers so they actually want to buy your products. You sell desserts, if you're not happy about that then you should consider a different line of work.
author: C K.

description:
I'm so happy that we wandered by this place! Everything we tried was so delicious! The staff was friendly and nice.
The Whoopi pies were heavenly, the beat I've ever had! 
The molasses ginger bread cookies were devine. The cakes were magic. My boy friend got a slice of coconut and loved it so much he went back the next day to replace his slice he devoured.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
Are you looking for a delicious cupcakes! Don't have to look anymore just go straight to this bakery they have the best one.  Today my friend brought a dozen cupcakes to us, and 12 different flavor, it's hard to decide with one you will eat at first, my favorite is the strawberry topping and red velvet. 
I strongly recommend this bakery!
author: Adilson F.

description:
I was walking around the area after lunch on a weekday looking for a dessert spot.  I was SO happy to learn and find a SusiesCakes in the area! I absolutely love their cupcakes...perhaps my favorite!

I wanted to try something new, which was difficult to decide.  Everything looked yummy! But then the special Cake-of-the-Month captured my eye!  I went for it:

CRANBERRY ORANGE CAKE SLICE - $5.50

This orange flavored cake have some cranberries in it with Plenty of yummy frosting that had sparkly sprinkles all over!  It was amazing; moist, sweet, and a LARGE slice! Completely reasonable price!

I knew I had to come back.  And you know what, I came back the very next day!  This time I tried:

WHOOPIE PIE - $5
I had this frosting sandwiched between 2 moist chocolate pastry. It's a huge pie! It definitely a tasty treat but I think if rather pay $0.50 more for a huge slice of cake! 

I love SusiesCakes.  I usually have their cupcakes but I'm glad I tried their other goodies! It's so moist with plenty of yummy frosting.  I can't wait to go back!!!
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
Would like to do my Best review for this great Place ! 
One day I was late to this place and we came for time later 5 min after store was closed already . 
I was very upset because in that day I wished to eat Carrot cake for dessert . 
I knocked to the door already closed store . One girl from the sale staff was opening door and explain that store was closed and cashier machine closed too . After she saw how I was very upset she told for somebody inside store something and they gave me Big Piece of Carrot Cake for Absolutely Free ! 
I tried to gave money for them but they refused , because casher was closed - they explain " it complementary for you " 
The carrot cake was very Delicious ! 
Personal from me : 
In that time  I was chocked  by so nice behavior of this Particular Business and great manner to keep  happy customers memory about this Susie cakes place ! 
Thank you so mach ! It past almost 3 months , but I still remember about so Great experience about this Business
author: Marina S.

description:
I'm obsessed with SusieCakes in probably a not okay way. They make the best cakes I've ever had, and now I order a slice every couple of weeks to satisfy my cravings! I started with their 6 layer chocolate cake, which is moist and has the most delicious frosting. Then, at a friend's insistence, got the 6 layer vanilla celebration. The most important thing I found (and that they'll tell you, too), is to let these cakes get to (at least) room temperature! Otherwise you're not doing their moistness justice.

I know that their red velvet is allegedly their best seller, but I just can't tear myself away from the chocolate and celebration cakes to give it a try, yet. I've also never gotten the hype over red velvet... But I have plans to try it soon. I've never really cared about cupcakes, and don't intend to start - with cakes like these, who needs 'em.

I basically never write reviews, but I can't get over SusieCakes. I'm their biggest fan. People are worried about how much I eat it. BUT I DON'T CARE. Thank you for existing SC. So much love for these cakes.
author: Abby H.

description:
We come here mostly for the carrot cake, as it's a bit different from other carrot cakes you may find. Note that if you don't like a really sweet cake, this is likely not the place for you.  We like the carrot cake the best but normally don't eat part of the frosting because it makes the bite overly sweet. 

Don't love that they have a separate charge to put some script in a cake, as the cakes are already a bit pricey.  However if they do charge they should ensure the person who does it does it well. I picked up a cake that was supposed to have "Happy Birthday" on it. I didn't look at it until we took out the cake later for dessert. I was so embarrassed to see how poorly the letters were done - it looked like something I, who has zero experience in this sort of decoration, could have done.  The letters were childish, uneven, and in all caps. They should not have let that cake be sold to us like that. They also added a few confetti type sprinkles on the top, but so sparingly that it looked like someone accidentally dropped some by mistake on the top of the cake (maybe they did?).

We have ordered a custom decorated cake from them, and the man who helped us was patient and helpful.
author: whatever I.

description:
I love chocolate chip cookies and Susie Cakes got one of the best chocolate chip cookies I have ever had. It is warm, chocolatey with the right amount of chewiness.
The service was awesome and helpful. Coming in very confused and indecisive, after a few exchanges I knew exactly what I wanted to order.
Will be coming back for the chocolate chip cookie!!!
author: Ariunaa B.

description:
This review is only for the celebration and lemon cake. I didn't have a chance to try the cupcakes but the slice of celebration cake was indeed a cause of celebration in it's own right. The cake wasn't too sweet and didn't taste like other birthday cakes I've had. The cake was nice and flakey and moist. 

I didn't care much for the lemon cake because it was more on the tart and tangy side.

Staff is very friendly and quick to answer any questions you may have and they even have post it notes on instructions to handle and care for your treats to save for later!

Parking is bit of a pain but well worth driving around the block a few times.
author: James H.

description:
Susie cakes made beautiful and yummy cupcakes for my baby shower. They were able to reference photos I sent to get the colors and style just right! 

Don't skip the chocolate...those were my favorite!
author: Laura M.

description:
Please try the carrot cake. So good. I'd give that 4 1/2 stars. I also had a delicious strawberry rhubarb pie. 

If you haven't tried this place and you have a sweet tooth you should. 

Only con - its expensive but everything in SF is expensive so get over it. 

I recommend to others :) would give 4 1/2 stars if I could.
author: Rachel G.

description: Damn, this place was delicious.  It's super cute, colorful and vibrant with a large selection of cakes, pies, cookies and cupcakes as well as bread pudding. EVERYTHING looks delicious which is how I ended up with a slice of coconut cake and a snicker doodle cookie ( about a $9 bill). The cake was better than the cookie and man was it moist and sweet. Perfect coconut flavor throughout. You can order larger sheet cakes or round cakes and have decoration and words added. They also have candles and other supplies and suvouneirs. Great location in a nice area. They were well staffed and everyone was polite and quick. They have a little sign at the register which says a small charge is added to each bill so that all employees can be offered health care which I think is a respectable effort (the charge can be removed upon request). Perfect for a non ice cream desert option! Yum.
author: Sabrena M.

description:
A little taste of LA, i was so happy to find Susie Cakes had a store in SF.
best cupcakes in the city, fun themes on holidays, special boxes for birthdays!

coconut frosting... droooooooooool...

nice service as well (wouldn't you be happy eating those cupcakes every day??)
author: I A.

description:
So. Good. 

We got the marble birthday cake for a co-worker and I didn't want to share it. There are chocolate chips in the cake and the frosting is divine. I would highly recommend this place for their cakes!
author: Akshaya V.

description: Tried the coconut and a mini vanilla cupcakes. Both were good. I also tried a bite of the chocolate cupcake with vanilla icing, which was also tasty. The mini cupcake was not as moist as the larger (which make sense) but it was still good!
author: Randi F.

description:
I still think these are the best cupcakes I've ever had. Sooo moist, not too big and the perfect dose of sweet. 

The cookies, cake and cheesecake are also wonderful. I crave their chocolate chip cookies- they're soft, chewy and fresh and big enough to share (or not). 

Location is smaller than their LA spots, but just as adorable. Staff is also ridiculously friendly here!
author: Kate K.

description:
I love desserts. As Marie Antoinette joked "Let them eat cake! The decor is old-school, almost like a soda fountain/bakery mix. The cakes look like they flew in from the '50s, and taste amazing. Tried the Celebration Cake ~ $5, wow, the cake is dense and delicious, the frosting is just fantastic and usually arranged in the correct proportions. A slice of cake is about  $5 isn't a bad deal at all since the slice is huge and can be shared between two people even three.

The peanut butter and jelly cupcake ~ $3 is insane, the cake is actually  light and fluffy and the frosting is awesome.  Of course the red velvet cupcake is my absolute favorite with the decadent frosting.  It will make you say oohhh, ahhh, yum! Not necessarily in that order.

Another treat I enjoyed was the chocolate whoopie pie with vanilla frosting a bit pricey at $5 but it is big enough to split in half.  The cookie was soft and cheewy, did not break apart when I bit into it.  Just the right amount of sweetness.   

Other must tries:
Coconut Cake and Coconut Cupcake
Carrot Cake 

This is where you want to go when you need to get your sugar fix! Your little piece of heaven at the Marina!
author: Maria M.

description: My favorite cupcakes and cake in all of SF! The icing is pure amazingness! I love the traditional birthday cake but also love the flourless chocolate! I gave up sugar recently but I will be having a slice of birthday cake here for my birthday!
author: Geri S.

description: The customer service here is so great that I would return over and over again. I bought couple cupcakes and slices of cake for my fathers birthday... The person assisting me was a sweetheart! I had a hard time choosing considering everything looks amazing! I'll definitely come back when I'm in the area and for any family members birthdays or other special occasions.
author: Jenna C.

description: My favorite cupcake spot. They always have the moistest, perfectly sweet cupcakes! Red velvet and the vanilla are my two favorites. I love how you can also get a slice of cake instead of a cupcake. The staff here are really friendly too! :)
author: Samantha G.

description: A slice of cake here is 5-6 bucks.. I'm not saying that in a bad way, you get your money's worth for sure. Personally I love the celebration cake here. All of the cake sliced are like 4 layers so the slice is huge for sure. You won't finish it in one serving unless you're on the road to diabetes. I'm fat and eat more than the average bear but trying to finish a slice is a tall task. Mainly from the richness in the taste. My bro got the coconut cake slice and didn't think much of it. First of all, he has a talent for ordering the worst thing on the menu so who cares what he thinks lol. The red velvet cake is the same here as everywhere else, pretty good. My other favorite cake besides celebration is the lemon. Oh man is it good and tart to the touch. Probably absorb the sugar from your skin pores it's so potent. But yea dude.. that shit is hella good bro. I recommend it to everybody and on my Snapchat all the fat people responded to my story when I posted a slice. I never showed the box or anything giving the location away and they were like "hell yea dude, susies is the best"
author: Tom R.

description: Amazing cakes!!!!! One of the best slices of cake I've ever had. I tried to vanilla birthday cake slice, but I am excited to go back and try more!
author: Mallory W.

description:
These cupcakes just scream southern for some reason. Maybe it's the thick, richness of the frosting that just reminds me of the southern mac 'n cheese, BBQ, corn bread, and all the other buttery, heavy goodness that is typical of the south. The buttercream frosting here is so thick and creamy that it reminds me of the texture of cream cheese frosting (even though it's buttercream). The cake is also quite moist, but also comes in a big package and feels very heavy. My style of cupcake tends to be medium-sized, but with lots of flavor.

They also don't put prices up here, and I'm not sure what they have to hide. Regular cupcakes are $3 each, and the special cupcakes of the day are $4.
author: Audrey L.

description:
My friends and I decided to end our eventful weekend by having something sweet. And OH MY CUCPAKES! The cupcakes at this little cute bakery are simply just AMAZING! The shop sells cupcakes along with cookies, whoopie pies, layered cakes, and pie. They all look very scrumptious! I ordered the flourless chocolate cupcake, which was perfectly moist and rich in chocolate. However, with the frosting the cupcake can be a little too heavy. My cousin, who doesn't believe in flourless anything, loved it too! The staff is friendly and will quickly take your order when you're ready.


Tip: The bakery is small so expect to take your goodies to-go. They do have a couple of small tables and a few chairs outside of their shop. 

Those who love seasonal flavors should really try the Apple Cider cupcake!
author: Chandni P.

description: I can't say enough about this place, and the service.  The Celebration cake is what started me, then the Coconut cake, then the German Chocolate, the Red Velvet and I could go on.  I've never been disappointed.  Some days I think someone got a little carried away with the sugar, I have to thin out the frosting.  I am so glad that I live between the Lafayette location  and the San Francisco location, so much temptation.
author: David A.

description: Cake. Eat it occasionally and choose the best there is.  I always offer to get the cake for  parties then I get to bring what I want. I always bring more than the recommended size. So if we are ten people I tell Susie cakes I need enough cake for twenty people. Carrot cake is the standard. It is filled with pralines!!! But if I am bringing more than two carrot  cakes I bring a lemon cake too.  I get the kids cupcakes so there are more cake available for the  adults. Worth the drive to the Marina.
author: Dani K.

description:
Came here to pick up some treats for my mom but got tempted and ended up ordering some things for myself!

I ordered a red velvet, vanilla and chocolate cupcake. Im typically not a red velvet fan but my god! The cake was delicious with the right amount of cream cheese frosting. I tried my first red velvet cupcake at karas(It was so bitter) and was so unpleased with the experience I refused to order red velvet again! Until I tried Susies! Vanilla and chocolate were just as tasty. Love love their frosting.

Packaging was eh, when i opened it they were all over the place but was able to still enjoy them.

Cant wait to come back & try more!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I liked this shop a lot! It's very small, cute and colorful.
Being from France, we do not have all these high, big cakes, full of icing! All these options were quite exciting to see!

I split a Coconut cake with my friend. It was very very sweet but good.
My friend also had the flourless mini chocolate cupcake - good stuff. We paid 8$ for the two items.

Located on the very pleasant Chestnut street, with tables outside to enjoy the sun, I definitely recommend this place when you feel like having a cheat day :-D
author: Leslie S.

description:
Cute shop, super-friendly and helpful employees, and great assortment to choose from. The case was beautiful!

We went about an hour before closing on a Tuesday. They were only out of two items, both specials. There were still many, many delicious-looking goodies to choose from. We ended up choosing five cupcakes: mint, mocha, lemon, coconut, and flourless (gluten-free) chocolate. I enjoyed the mocha flavor most. My husband liked the lemon.

As other reviewers have said, they can be a bit too sweet for some--I am one of those people, and though my husband didn't mind it as much, he also said less sweetness in the frosting would have been preferred. The cake is perfect. This is why I docked one star, but overall, this place is great and I still wholeheartedly recommend a try.

I only wish I had tried another type of dessert while we were there in place of one or two of the cupcakes. They had a banana cream pudding in a bed of vanilla wafers I'm still thinking about, as well as that confetti-candy dotted Celebration cake. Yummmm.

Prices were as expected for a gourmet bakery in an expensive city. I don't understand why people complain about this when it is comparable to other bakeries/ cupcakeries in the area (it's not fair to compare to a cheaper cake you can get at a grocery store or a similar store in a less-trendy part of town or in a suburb). How else are they going to pay their rent and employees?
author: Lesley C.

description:
This morning my supervisor came in with a giant bag from SusieCakes. I was like, ummm what's that all about. Even at 10AM I had to snag an Egg Nog cupcake. The frosting is softly whipped and is just the right amount of sweet. The rum flavor of the moist cupcake made me wonder why I don't eat more cupcakes. But then I remember that one cannot sit around all day eating cupcakes, though I did let myself indulge a little today.

Truth be told, I'm not really a dessert kind of gal. This time of year is hard because it forces me to eat the sweet treats given as gifts or left at my house after a party or lying around my office. I mean, if the sweets were replaced with chips or bread, I would gain 20lbs every holiday season. But I'll pack on the 5lbs from the sweets that fall into my lap, especially if they're from SusieCakes.
author: Crystal C.

description:
SusieCakes made our wedding cake. It was SO GOOD. So many guests complimented it.

We did a tasting at this location and that was SO FUN and gave us a raging sugar high. In the end it was soooo hard to pick because all the cakes were so tasty.

The cake was reasonably priced and fantastic. Would absolutely recommend!!!
author: Jeff F.

description:
I don't think I've ever had a cupcake as divine as the ones I've had at SusieCakes. My all-time favorite is the Coconut. The frosting is so creamy and sweet topped with coconut shavings. The cake itself is moist and flavorful complimenting the frosting perfectly. 

I literally dream about SusieCakes and pick one up anytime I have the opportunity. Life changing. If you've never had the pleasure of trying one, do it ASAP!
author: Emmy Q.

description: Yummy in my tummy. As a self-taught baker, it's always hard finding a bakery that makes a yummy cream cheese frosting and has the right cake / frosting ratio. SusieCakes it's just the place. My family was on vacation and stumble upon the bakery. We tried several flavors but the carrot cake was my favorite. Moist and delicious. The red velvet was just okay and needed a stronger chocolate taste. The chocolate and chocolate marble was also a huge hit among the family.
author: T. Renee D.

description: Cute little bakery shop! Saw it an we instantly craved dessert! My favorite cake is funfetti so when I saw they had a "celebration cake" I knew I had to have it! My hubby is a chocoholic an he saw his dream "Matilda movie chocolate cake" so he had to have it. The people were so friendly an the colors of everything was fun and inviting! The slices of the cake are totally worth the price! You get like your own personal cake. It travels well. I packed ours for our flight back to Houston! We are this cake for 3 days straight lol. The cream cheese frosting on the celebration cake was AMAZING. the only issue I had was my cake was a little dry.. Crumbly even. My hubbies chocolate cake was amazing in his words. Perfect Matilda cake ;p
author: Leslie E.

description:
I've literally made trips up to the marina specifically for this cupcake...

The shop is cute and colorful. And the cupcakes have more of a handmade look to them than sprinkles. They're also less massive, which I don't view as a bad thing. 

I always get the red velvet and the vanilla. The frosting on the regular sized cupcakes here extends into the middle of the cake. Yum. I've also found that the cake here stays pretty moist, even if I eat it a day later.
author: Quyen V.

description: Stopped in after grabbing dinner nearby. Kudos to the staff -- they are great (patient and helpful).  We ended up getting a snickerdoodle, a peanut butter cookie sandwich, and the vanilla pudding.  Everything was good; the cakes looked really delicious (although personally I am SO over red velvet).  The celebration cake looked beautiful.  Really like that you can get cake slices (vs. cupcakes only).
author: Donna G.

description: Awesome! I work down the street. We purchased a red velvet cake for a staff member last day. Amazing, I went in the night before thanksgiving . I bought a 6 in celebration cake .. Wow best choice in my life. I typically think the cake is just the vehicle for the frosting "I love frosting" this cake was equally good!
author: Jason P.

description:
Omg ...I travel the world for cupcakes
With that said ...
The best cupcakes
My God....if u need a cake, cupcake, cheesecake
This is the place, and the area is super cute
Full of shops and restaurant...
Awesome!!! I will come back for more
author: rhina D.

description: Went here while on the SF Cupcake Tasting Tour. Awesome area. Disappointed in their lack of selection though--nothing gastronomic or unique, but good quality.
author: Natasha K.

description:
Alright I've finally come around to SusieCakes. The red velvet and chocolate are traditional, but they do a great job on such typical flavors. The fluffy cake paired with the light fluffy frosting is awesome, beware certain flavors are more sugar potent than others (e.g. confetti cake).

My only issue is that the mini cupcakes are tiny and expensive (3 for $5), and you can get a hugeeee slice of cake for only $5. Unlike what you would expect, the cake and the cupcake taste quite different - the frosting between layers, and the cake itself is not as fluffy in cake form, so overall, I prefer the large chocolate and red velvet cupcakes because of price and taste over the cake slices and mini cupcakes.
author: Jess C.

description:
Thank you Susie, you made my day and my wife's night :)
Went to the shop to get a birthday cake. I chose the superb 5-layer vanilla celebration cake.
It was sweet and blue :) We could keep it refrigirated and enjoy it on the following day.
The staff was very friendly and attentive. They added a birthday message and drew daisies on the cake.
Just perfect!
author: Tony T.

description: Cake was on spot - creamy and moist. Had the berry vanilla slice. Main complaint was the person at the counter: refuses to give me a sample when the person ahead of me was given one (first time in the store so I wasn't sure what to get) and then took so long to package the person behind me got their order before I did. ....
author: Jennifer F.

description: SusieCakes was so yummy! I'm usually not a huge coconut person but their coconut cupcake was delicious. I also got the sweetheart cookie sandwich and it was fantastic! They have pies which look really good but I didn't order because I'm not sure if they're sold by the slice. I put five stars but it was more like 4.5; -.5 because the prices. I think my cousin ordered 2 cupcakes and it was around $10, which I feel like is too much buuut they are very very good!
author: Yarah L.

description: The cupcakes here are delicious!  I've had cupcakes for two parties catered from here (once, they matched my party's color palette precisely, after I sent them photos).  Yum!
author: Barnali D.

description:
The funfetti birthday cake with Tiffany Blue icing- one little slice of heaven. Super moist, not too too sweet, surprisingly. Perfect with a glass of milk and for sharing... Not all at once. Saved it overnight and still just as good the next morning (not in the fridge).

I want the whole cake for my next birthday.
author: Christina R.

description:
It's pretty good.  Preferred the slices of cake vs cupcakes.  Not quite as good as the cupcake place a few blocks down.  But all in all, pretty good.

Carrot cake is the way to go!
author: Christopher L.

description: This review is for a groom's cake I ordered for my wedding.  I ordered a cake in the shape of a Chicago Blackhawks hockey jersey and it was absolutely beautiful.  The detail was unbelievable!  The cake, funfetti with vanilla icing, was delicious.  I worked with Molly while I was placing my order and she was super friendly and made the process really easy.  I would absolutely recommend SusieCakes, especially if you're looking for a groom's cake!
author: Kaitlin V.

description: Very nice bakery. I love that you can buy slices of cakes and they have many to choose from. That way you could buy one slice every time you visit them. They have regular size cupcakes and mini cupcakes in all sorts of flavors. Their topping is pretty sweet. Cakes are moist and we left them out over night unrefrigerated and they still were moist the very next day. Glad we found this place!
author: Cheefong J.

description:
I mean I like this place but its pretty bland overall. The cupcakes don't look appealing, there isn't that much variety to choose from, and the taste of their cupcakes are just ok. I have lots to say but I'll just give a brief overview.

The vanilla cupcake was nice and big looking..even to the feel. The frosting was buttery great and had a nice taste to it but the cake itself was pretty dry. It wasn't moist and so the texture was a bit hard but ok. 

I loved their peanut butter cookie sandwiches with the frosting inside. It was sweet as hell, but it was definitely the best thing! It was chewy with a slight crisp to it while the inside was creamy. This was pretty unique and so I think this was the best thing.

I won't be coming back but at least I tried some of Susie's treats?!
author: Allister D.

description:
Susie cakes did it again! I had a cute pink buttercream frosting with red velvet inside and gold sprinkles for our wedding! (I had a small civil ceremony at SFO city hall) 

It was so good and delicious. I am a very big red velvet cake fan! The only thing is it's so hard to find parking! But it was so worth it! 

There customer service is great and will call you about your cake. It's nice to know they care about their customers. Will forever continue to keep coming here.
author: Charmaine P.

description: I've heard sooo many great things about this place but I was kinda disappointed... I had the Rose' Champagne cupcake (seasonal) honestly it just tasted like a Strawberry cupcake nothing special about it. I also had the lemon square which is super tingy & I absolutely loved it.
author: Naz M.

description: I've stopped here a couple times to get birthday cakes for work. Their stuff is always tasty, and they have a good selection on hand so you don't need to pre-order.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Gluttonously delicious!
My boss always orders a box of assorted flavored cupcakes when it's someone's bday in the office, which is really sweet of her...literally!

The one that really sticks out is the red velvet. It's so moist, dense but light at the same time. The frosting is what I think takes the cake (ha) it's sweet but not too sweet. If it starts becoming too much, I just scrape some of it off with a fork.

Other popular ones that my coworkers seemed to like were the chocolate mint, cocounut and of course the staple vanilla with vanilla or strawberry frosting.

Plus that they also deliver!
author: Georgina G.

description:
people must truly love this place ! we went here 4 times in one day for ALOT OF catering orders! this place is a must go to if you love places that everyone knows but isnt MCDONALDS! 
in mcdonalds defense they dont sell pastrys. but you get the refrence! its like a beautiful mom and pop shop but decorated very nicly and they must get tons of business because like i said. . . any one whos anyone knows about this place . so if you love pastrys. and you LOVE small awesome quaint shops. this is a spot you must stop at in the bay area BEFORE you leave!
author: Dash Duo D.

description: The cupcakes are amazingly moist & buttery! Got it from one of the pharmaceutical reps for our office and they were gone in seconds. You won't be disappointed
author: Mona Lisa L.

description:
A little over rated in terms of quality. I've tried many cupcake places and the #1 thing that makes or breaks it for me is selection, and if the cake it moist.

I tried all the mini flavored cupcakes. The only ones not dry and heavy was the white cupcake with a strawberry frosting and red velvet. The chocolate ones were very dry and tasted horrible. Don't think I'd come back though I think you can have better cupcakes from the box at home.
author: Anthony V.

description: after several years of devouring chocolate chip cookies, I keep stopping by because I know the management is dedicated to hiring customer- focused staff who take pride in service offered. the cookies are great, the staff is better.  Thanks Andrew, Valerie and Friends.
author: Allan B.

description:
my boyfriend and I were walking to our car after having lunch at Pacific Catch and we stumbled upon this little bakery! they had wide variety of cupcakes and whole cakes, & a few cookie selections as well.

we chose the seasonal special: banana chocolate chip & a red velvet cupcake. the banana chocolate chip was just that; you could smell the banana as soon as you unwrapped the liner. every bite was full of banana and chocolate chip. it was exactly what a flavored cupcake should be. the red velvet was just as great: very moist and beautiful red coloring. their cream cheese frosting was a little sweet though. my teeth were aching after awhile. lol 

we were defitently happy with finding this spot & we'll more than likely stop by again, next time I drag my man to Brandy Melville. lol
author: Allyssa P.

description:
I've been to a different SusieCakes location back in SoCal. The cupcakes were just as good here as they were down there.

My bf and I ordered:

Red Velvet Cupcake: The cake is bright red, soft, fluffy, and moist. The frosting has fantastic cream cheese flavor and it is not too sweet. I got the regular size cupcake but they also have a mini version of the red velvet if you just wanted a taste. 

Chocolate Chip Cookie: These cookies are very large but thin. The one we got was warm with mini chocolate chips in it. It was a soft, chewy cookie which is the type that I like. Very yummy.

Overall: Small shop, I'd just grab want I and go. I would definitely order the red velvet again, since it tasted delicious and it is one of my favorite cupcake flavors.
author: Ella C.

description: Stopped by this place due to the lengthy line coming from the door. The cakes were overly sweet - couldn't even finish half a slice of the marble cake due to the extreme sweetness and high butter content.
author: Frida A.

description: I am a serious cupcake junkie. I research cupcakes in every city that I have access to (home and frequent travel) and always buy and sample cupcakes in the highest rated places. I am always skeptical and I want real buttercream...don't try to fake me out with some gross frosting made from anything but butter, sugar, vanilla, and salt as the basic ingredients to start a true buttercream. I don't do faux buttercream. I just don't. It's disgusting....so, when I walked into Susiecakes, I inquired if they use real butter in their frosting and was proudly told that they use real ingredients and prepare everything from scratch. ok....still skeptical since I've heard that before...but these looked legit. I purchased two vanilla (one pink, one turquoise) and two coconut. I will attest that they are using real buttercream and the cupcakes were really good. Fresh, moist and just delicious. I've eaten cupcakes from coast to coast and all in between and these are exceptional!  Have I had better? Yes. Have I had worse? Omg, YES! These are probably my number two or three in the history of my cupcake obsession (which is extensive). Definitely worthy and definitely calls for more visits! They had lots of whole cakes that could be purchased by the slice too. Now, I like cake, but I have a special affinity for cupcakes and I didn't purchase individual slices. Cupcakes run about $3.50, which is true and fair for quality cupcakes and I feel that these are worth it.Customer service was very friendly and willing to answer questions. They seemed proud of their product too! I will definitely be back!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Love this place! Best cakes and cupcakes ever. It's a little bit pricey though. I signed up for their membership program and the only perk is if you buy often to redeem a discount on their whole cakes. Service is a bit slow even though there's like 4 or 5 people behind the counter. Parking is terrible! You spend more time find parking than deciding on what to buy. I come here like once or twice a month to get a few cupcakes for a really special occassion or a lemon bar. It's not a place you'd go if you're throwing a large kid's birthday party.
Favorit cake/cupcake flavors: peanut butter, mocha, vanilla celebration cake, tropical coconut, strawberry.
Definitely will go back and try their pies and cookies
author: Kathy D.

description:
Susie Cakes made wedding cake shopping fun and easy, and they delivered delicious (and affordable) cakes on our wedding day.

I arranged a tasting last fall at the Chestnut location (we live nearby). My fiance and I had a great time tasting all of the flavors, and they let us take the leftovers home.  We picked the carrot cake (Justin's favorite) and tropical coconut cake (my favorite), and because we were expecting about 100 guests, we elected to do a three layer cake and a sheet cake.  We ordered our cakes from the Marin store because it was closer to the our reception location. 

The wedding cake was delicious - it tasted just like the samples.I do have two recommendations:  #1 - These are very dense cakes so you probably don't need to order any extra.  We had a ton of cake leftover.   #2 - because it's buttercream frosting (and not fondant), they can't get too fancy with the cake decorating.  We decided to go with a simple design, and then ordered extra "cake flowers" from our florist (for around $40).  We used Farm Girl Flowers (love them!) but they don't send a florist to the reception site, so one of my friends put the cake flowers onto the cake.  It looked fantastic! 

One of the things that I like best about Susie Cakes is that they don't price gauge you just because your cake is for a wedding.  They charge the same prices for all of their special occasion cakes.  What a concept!!!!
author: Kelley H.

description:
RED VELVET!! I could eat a whole dozen to myself! They are so good.

They also offer gluten free flavors which was nice last time I picked up a couple dozen to take to a get together.

Very friendly and helpful staff!
author: L S.

description: Charmaine Rachel Hayley are some of the best employees that a company could ever have. They always greet you at the door with a great attitude. The food quality is phenomenal as well as the customer service as they help you pick out one of there many great items. I try to go to Susie Cakes as much as possible and I never regret it. Thank you ladies!
author: Zak B.

description: Fantastic bakery. We stopped here for a little dessert after lunch at neighboring Blue Barn. I had a wonderful slice of celebration cake. I suggest walking over to the Palace of Fine Arts on a pretty day and having your dessert there while enjoying the views or walk across the street and take in the Golden Gate Bridge.  Quite possibly the best cakes I've ever had.
author: Matt C.

description: Susiecakes is amazing! They are my go to for ordering cakes and cupcakes for the office! I love their pies, their fun and delicious sugar cookies, their yummy flavored cupcakes! And they are super professional and a great vendor to work with. After our event, they always call me a few weeks after to check that everything went smoothly.
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
"Hi! Welcome to SusieCakes!"

That was how I was greeted. Awesome. Super, tentative workers always make my day. Since it was my first time at Susiecakes, the chances of me not knowing what to order was high. And yup, that's what happened. I felt like I took F-O-R-E-V-E-R to decide on what I want. (Sorry!)

There were ~15 cupcake flavor choices to choose from -- most being pretty standard. Ex: vanilla, chocolate, red velvet, coconut, lemon, strawberry, and etc.

My friend and I ended up ordering 9 cupcakes: all of the flavors mentioned above + eggnog + chocolate mint. I wasn't a fan of the eggnog flavored cupcake (with spiked rum frosting) but then again, I'm not a big fan of eggnog in general. I did, however, enjoyed the chocolate mint and flourless chocolate cupcake! Most of the friends found the flourless chocolate cupcake to be TOO sweet but hey, if you have a huge sweet tooth like I do, I think you'll like it, too.

All of the cupcakes are $3.25/each unless I'm wrong and missed the memo somehow.
author: Annie S.

description: SusieCakes came highly recommended, and did not disappoint!   I ordered the tropical coconut 6" cake, and it was ready and as described first thing the next morning.  Prices seem reasonable - $40 for 6" cake, and it was moist and delicious!  Definitely a good option for last minute cakes!
author: Greg B.

description: I know it's just cake, but SusieCakes is truly the best cake in SF. Super moist, delicious frosting, all the best flavors, and incredible customer service. Thank goodness postmates will bring me delicious cake slices from the Marina to the Dogpatch, because my cravings are unrelenting.
author: Kim J.

description: Susie's cakes is a Gem of a bakery in the city! Its customer service is above and beyond. The Lady with whom served me was kind and generous to all my questions and needs for my daughters "Beauty and The Beast" Bell Disney Cake.The cake not only looked amazing it tasted even better. The workmenship and hard work and attention to detail that went into the cake could only be done at this bakery. I highly recommend Susie's cakes for any of your custom needs.
author: Rudy M.

description: I bought a cookie and 2 dozen mini cupcakes for my employee's birthday.  They were super yummy and delicious!  The cakes were soft, moist, light, and full of flavor.  When I popped in, it was super busy with a line out the door.  Make sure you plan your treats in advance so you don't just show up when you need it because you might find them sold out for the day.
author: Shaun W.

description: My friend brought me here while i was in San Fransisco. The shop was super cute and small. I decided to get a vanilla celebration mini cupcake. It was very good, the cake was moist and the frosting was sweet. It was your basic standard good cupcake. We sat outside because there is a small sitting area. Its in a nice location because theres a lot to see around the area. Overall, I quite enjoyed it but its nothing super special.
author: Grace C.

description: Bought the vanilla celebration cake for my mom's 50th birthday party without trying it first because there were so many rave rave rave reviews on yelp. It was such a cute cake and there are 6 or so pretty layers BUT it was extremely sweet!!! NO one in my family grabbed seconds and most of them left the frosting uneaten. The cake itself was stiff and not light and "cakey". I was completely embarrassed because this was my mom's life milestone and I botched it with this cake.
author: Sarah N.

description:
SusieCakes are delicious. However, if you're thinking about paying for a "design," just don't. I ordered a 9" custom layer cake ($49 base price) for a graduation party. I figured it would be nice to have them do some kind of design, since the website photos look so great. It was a law school graduation, so I suggested the scales of justice as the design. I gulped hard when I heard the total for my order: $95 (including tax)!!! The manager explained the breakdown: Although the actual cake is $49, it costs $3 for an inscription and another $38 for a custom design, plus taxes. I rationalized that this was a special event, and it would be worth it. When I picked up the cake, my heart sank. I'm fairly confident I could have done that design myself and saved the extra money. To be fair, they asked me if it looked ok when I picked it up, and I should have said something then, but I was in a rush, with my mother-in-law, and did not want to make a scene. I learned a valuable lesson that day, however, that I figured I would share with the yelp community.

***Update: The manager of this location reached out to discuss my experience. He listened to my concerns and explained that he wanted to make it right. I appreciate this level of customer service. Nevertheless, my next custom SusieCake will only have a $3 inscription.
author: Darcy S.

description: Susiecakes is my favorite cupcake shop in all of San Francisco. The interior is small, but very adorable. There is not much seating, so it is best to purchase to go. Their cupcakes are made from wholesome ingredients, are very fresh and moist, and are the perfect amount of sweet. Worth swinging by once in a while when you want to indulge in a sweet treat.
