Note that this is the Chestnut Street location in the Marina and can get busy Friday and Saturday evenings so sometimes it can take a while to find parking.
author: S A.

description:
It was my birthday and my coworker knew that I liked red velvet cake, so she went all out to SusieCakes to get me a red velvet cake! Woohoo :) :)

The cream cheese frosting was amazing. It wasnt too thick which makes you sick after eating a few mouthfuls. Instead, it was very light and creamy and complemented very well with the cake. In fact, the cake itself was also light and moist. 

I hate how some cakes make you feel like each mouthful is a sin. SusieCakes seem to be the complete opposite. Highly recommended!
author: Christina N.

description: Stopped for a slice of cake to enjoy at the park. Had the tropical and celebration cakes. Both were fantastic. The tropical was loaded with pineapple and coconut with a delightful frosting. We demolished this in less than 5 minutes with our group of 4. The celebration cake was an much upgraded fun fetti cake. My daughter absolutely loved this cake. Must stop for anyone looking for a sugar fix!
author: Jeanette A.

description:
Cupcakes are one of my best friends during times of stress or when I need to calm down one of my kids when I need some sane time. (Don't judge, lol). When a friend introduced this place to me, I fell in love with it from the first bite. I had a red velvet cupcake and a coconut cupcake. YUM!! I'm one of those red velvet lovers ever since I was introduced to Sprinkles red velvet cupcakes during my 8 years in LA. It was moist and not too sweet. The cupcakes are also dense. The coconut cupcake is my friend's favorite and it's one of those flavors where I haven't been completely blown away with at any bakery. But here, I really liked it because there was actually coconut pieces in the cake itself. I became a fan instantly. I had to knock off one star though because personally I think the frosting is too sweet. There is so much of it on the cupcake that I ended up scraping most of it off.

Few tips:
-price is comparable to other bakeries of its kind
-very clean and presentation is very organized
-parking is difficult obviously because this is chestnut street (the Marina), but there is a parking structure on Pierce and Chestnut, closer to Lombard; bring quarters ($2/hr during day, $3/hr at night) or you can pay by phone
author: Char D.

description: I've gotten two cakes here, one back in 2015 and then another one this past March and all I have to say is Yum, Yum, YUMM!!! Both times I ordered the confetti cake with the green frosting. It's the cake that they always have inside their shop (not a special order cake). Both times, the cake was soft, moist and just delicious. They did an excellent job with the frosting too! Not too overly sweet. They are on the pricey side, but I definitely think their gourmet cakes are worth it!!
author: Val G.

description:
Adorable little shop that makes quality cupcakes in classic flavors with very friendly staff. 

My favorite was the standard chocolate cake with vanilla frosting, however I found it too have a little TOO much frosting (if there is such a thing!). My daughter ate up her mini cupcake and enjoyed looking at all the decorated cakes. Cupcakes look a little more homespun than other boutique shops in the same price range. 

It's clean, quaint and well made. Definitely worth coming in and buying dessert! Customer service was on point.
author: Bianca U.

description: mMm Susie Cakes is such a tasty treat! Their cakes are extremely moist and not too sweet. Had the marble, red velvet, and vanilla celebration. I think Vanilla Celebration was my favorite though. I know where I'm ordering my birthday cake from next year!
author: Dara S.

description:
Awesome cakes! Flavorful, beautiful and high-quality. I've only ever had the chocolate layer cake. The cake is about 7 layers, alternating between cake and icing. I prefer icing to cake, but I'd say they were quite evenly distributed - definitely more positive than when it's too cakey. The icing is sweet but not too sweet, to where a lot of people leave it on their plates to the side. 

I've never tried cookies, cupcakes, pudding cakes, etc., but all look very tasty as well. My one qualm is the price - it's not cheap for a relatively small cake! But if you're looking for professional and convenient, it's a great go-to.
author: Jackie W.

description:
Julia Child once said, "A party without a cake is just a meeting." 

That Julia is a smart woman. So if you are having a party head to SusieCakes stat. Or if you're like me and have a sweet tooth (or I should say sweet JAW) do yourself a favor and indulge in a large slab of cake sold by the slice. 

This is my favorite cakery in the city. It's cakes are moist, decadent, and top notch in quality using fresh ingredients and no preservatives. They have several flavors baked regularly such as their super popular vanilla celebration cake complete with sprinkles and teal frosting, old fashioned chocolate, vanilla chocolate chip marble, tropical coconut, carrot, and red velvet. My two favorite are the tropical coconut (with one bite I swear you will be transported to Exotic Cake Island) and the marble cake (chocolate chips are always a good idea!)

They also offer a variety of other treats like cupcakes (just had the seasonal cupcake for July-blueberry pancake....so freakin goood), whoopie pies, regular mini pies, cookies, and an assortment of bars. Check out their website for custom orders/specialty party cakes. I'm far off from ever getting married but at least I know where I am ordering my cake from. I love you Susie. Keep on with the cake magic.
author: Miriam M.

description:
Funfetti Cake...Too Die For!

Ohmygah this place is delicious! I got a slice of the funfetti cake for my boyfriend's birthday and it was ammmmazing! The buttercream frosting is too die for. I can't even put into words how good one slice will do to you. Thank you Susie's Cake for making this happen! Also, another star for the customer service, I got the very first slice and the guy behind the counter let me know it was still fairly new so it's best to not eat it right away.

Yummy! will come back for more!
author: Julia K.

description: The carrot cake was light and fluffy, sweet but not overly sweet. The mini cupcakes were the perfect size and so yum - loved the red velvet and chocolate. Just go!
author: Jenna G.

description: Wow.  Have your cake and eat it too.  SusieCakes may not be in the "specialty" wedding cake business, but if you want people to enjoy their cake, this is the place to get it.  We ordered a two-tiered wedding cake.  The bride-to-be was not happy with the size (small), which we should have ironed out with SusieCakes in more detail.  We adorned it with flowers, and on the day of our small civil ceremony everyone loved the cake.  The cake and the icing were a hit.  Delicious.  Everyone was happy, including the bride.  What more can you ask for?
author: Ted R.

description:
My friend was raving about this place and so we drove all the way here, thankfully on a weekday to try their celebration cake.  Well of course we got other treats too.  

Some people like fluffy cake, some people like dense cake. The usual fluffy ones I feel like are boxed, dense cake I think are the legit ones.  Their celebration cake is dense but still managed to be moist.  They give you a huge piece of cake for the slice so you can either share or be a heffa.  It was good but the downside is I found it too sweet especially the icing.  Felt like eating just sugar alone.  I guess it's good so I don't have to finish it and share it with others.  Same thing with their cupcakes.  If it wasn't as sweet as it was, I'd probably like it more.
author: Claire J.

description: I bought these over priced cupcakes for a gift..Safeway bakery makes better cupcakes, Off day maybe, but all my fellow co workers said they were nothing special. Not worh the hassel to go there. Safeway much better, over priced and unwhelmed.
author: Bill W.

description:
This place makes some damn good cakes. Unfortunately that's not enough if you want to keep customers. Bakers are a dime a dozen in this town.... heh. Susie thinks she's all that and a bag of banana chips, but her chips are stale and the operation makes a pre-school look like a well run corporation. I came in here to buy a bunch of cupcakes at 2:38PM. They have a large selection. Cakes, cookies, cupcakes..... A sugar slut's dream. But here is where it got stupid and weird. I place my order. 3 dozen cupcakes. 4 of every flavor. pretty easy if you think on it for 2 seconds. But chaos reigns in this TINY, tiny, shop. There were 11 employees working and Me at the case..... Just me. Now I understand things can be hectic.... But it was just me.... And the craziness on the baking side of the business looked like 11 crack heads doing the tango. It took them a few minutes just to ask me for my order... Staff are carrying cakes around, bakers are yelling from the back, 3 people are managing phone and internet orders... 3 people? There is NO SYSTEM in PLACE.... NONE. Shit just happens by yelling and moving. Looks like the short order line at lunch in NYC diner. What the hell Susie? Straighten up your bakery. Aren't bakers suppose to be planning, mindful, and precise? Cooks are the messy creative types. We yell, we throw flaming pans across the room into the dish sink, we curse, we are avant guard. We are the Parisian waiters of the kitchen... "Phufft! I fart in your general direction!"   But Bakers..... You guys are suppose to be quiet professionals..... souffles ain't shit to you. You work by stopwatches and measure stuff by the micro-gram. Once that oven dings.... Heaven comes out the door. The Zen masters of the kitchen.

But.... Not.... You... Guys.
   11 .... Eleven employees. I waited.... I watched... 1 out of the 11. She grabbed some tongs... that she had to search for.... and slowly folded a box..... She.... put.... the.... box... down ....on... the... counter...20 feet ... away from the counter.... and .... transported.... the... cupcakes.... one...at... a... time.... to... the... box.... 36 times.... what... the.... fuck... lady.... It took her 1 minute per cup cake because she had to dodge and cover the cupcake from the other employees squeezing in and out of the counter area......  I was in there for 34 minutes. I was out the door at 3:16. I waited +half-hour to give you guys $123 for 36 cupcakes..... Seriously. I was the first one in the door, and by the time I left the line had grown to the sidewalk. How do 11 employees make such a mess of running things? Did one of you other employees ever think of helping her load the other 2 boxes? No.... You each grabbed a customer and then went off trying to do everything yourself like a bunch of amateurs. First year cooking students have more sense. Team-work makes the dream work. But alas..... you guys will probably keep running around and stick to punishing yourselves like a bunch of flour covered sadists. Where as I will go to Safeway and pile cheap ass cupcakes into my cart, save $100 and retain 34 minutes of my life. I'm not a dessert guy..... And birthday kids don't care where their sugar came from or how much I spent on them. Have fun Susie. You deserve the neighborhood you live in. As slow and self absorbed as your operations and offerings. Ciao, flour power wackos. I hope you fold when the next protein fad hits your part of town.
author: Mark B.

description:
My teeth are still jangling from all the sugar!

Why are there no prices on products?
Why is the cake so poorly mixed and heavy?
Why so much sugar?

Good customer service, cute place, but the products are so sweet that it is almost impossible to taste any flavors other than the mind and palate numbingness of sugar.
author: William M.

description:
I just ate some mini cupcakes from SusieCakes and it was SO GOOD!
Highly recommended for any occasions. Especially Red Velvet :)
author: Natsu Y.

description:
Came by yesterday for a little treat.  I got a cookie sandwich-type thing with peanut butter cookies and peanut butter frosting inside -- the word nutty was in the name, but I can't remember the first part.  Very delicious, but very sweet -- I almost couldn't finish it!  My friend got a piece of carrot cake, which was HUGE.  He said it was super moist and delicious, which it must have been, because he inhaled the whole thing without offering me a bite.
A bit expensive ($10.25 for the 2 items), but okay for a once in a while treat.
author: Calee S.

description:
SusieCakes has a very classic cupcake selection, with favorites like vanilla, lemon, and red velvet. Even the bakery matches the menu with its cute and old-fashioned look. I picked out a vanilla cupcake with pastel vanilla frosting. Their frosting isn't too sweet, nor is there too much of it piled on the cupcake (my pet peeves with store bought cupcakes). Sadly, I didn't like the cupcake itself. It was dense, crumbly, and overall disappointing. 

I also tried the chocolate chip cookie. It wasn't too sweet & there was good ratio of chocolate chips per bite. I'm a fan of moist and chunky chocolate chip cookies, but this cookie was more chewy and thin. 

SusieCakes has more than just cakes and cupcakes--they have mini cupcakes, pies, pudding, cakes, cookies, and more.  If I come back again, I'd like to try their cakes or whoopie pies, but I'll probably skip out on the cupcakes!
author: Vanessa C.

description: After having a mediocre meal on Union Street, my friends and I popped by Susie Cakes. I took my friend's advice and ordered a slice of cake rather than a cupcake. She says the cupcakes are dry but the cakes are amazing! Don't know about the cupcakes here but the slice of cake I got sure as hell was delicious and moist! I ordered the caramel apple cider cake ... I think that's what it was called. The icing was so rich and creamy and a bit sweet. I ordered a cup of English breakfast tea and that offset the sweetness. You can get milk here too to enjoy with your cake. My friend got the celebration cake which was a fun mint green. It was delicious but only enjoyable in a few bites per sitting. It's very sweet. There's limited outdoor seating here. We got lucky and snatched both tables for the 6 of us + my puppy.
author: Michelle T.

description: SusieCakes made our wedding cake and dessert bar. We received so many compliments regarding how delicious the cookies were! I will definitely be ordering cakes from them in the future.
author: Kaitlin L.

description: Picked up Strawberry Lemonade Cupcakes today - WOW!  They were amazing.  Have purchased their cookies in the past and taken them to a party where everyone kept asking me for the recipe and I faithfully said "Susie Cakes" but these cupcakes were unbelievable.
author: Sue B.

description:
I've had SusieCakes make two custom cake orders.  One for my bf's birthday, and one for my cousin's graduation.

I worked primarily with Molly.  I emailed them with some vague idea about what type of cake I was thinking about and the theme.  She worked with me to come up with a great idea, and when I picked the cake up each time, I was floored!  

I love that they do not use fondant as I feel fondant doesn't taste great at all.  Yet, the designs are gorgeous, so you know that the cake decorators are truly artists.  

The delicious flavor is not sacrificed for the artistry, either.  My bf's cake was red velvet, and even non-red velvet fans loved it.  We went with a simple vanilla cake for the graduation cake, and though I was concerned it may taste/look too simple, it was fabulous.

I am looking forward to working with Molly and SusieCakes again and again!
author: Ghizal A.

description:
You know a cake place has to have great cakes if the basic flavors are on point.. tried the classic chocolate and red velvet during a Cupcake Tour and they were sooo yummy!! I do wish the red velvet tasted more like cocoa instead of that light red & light cocoa flavor a lot of Cali places do to butcher a real southern red velvet cake.. With the way they did cakes here, I would think their red velvet would be a real true red velvet, ya know? It was still good tho :)

Frostings aren't overly sweet and the cake was light enough, dense enough but rich enough and flavorful enough - I'm not even a fan of chocolate cake and it made me want to try all the others in the display case! Winner winner...

One star off for location, best to walk here! :) as with most SF good eats, lol..
author: Rachael D.

description:
OMG I love the cakes!

I did a cake tasting last week and it was such a great experience. I found the perfect two-teired cake for my daughter's first birthday party.

I can't wait to see the results!

1. one two-tier cake with decorations and writing
2. a dozen cupcakes with decorations
3. a smash cake with decorations and writing

total = $275
author: Mel P.

description:
Received a half dozen of these as a little celebration gift!

I tried red velvet, chocolate, and vanilla celebration! Super tasty icing, fluffy cake, and the perfect amount of moisture. My personal favorite was red velvet - the cream cheese icing was a good complement to the velvet batter. 

Can't speak on the service or anything, but I can say these were really tasty!
author: Davinci L.

description: My supervisor brought these into work for my co-workers mini baby shower. There was a variety of Lemon, Red Velvet, Flowerless Chocolate, & Chocolate. I had the Chocolate and it was amazing! I'm not really in SF all that much, but if I ever get the chance I'd definitely go there to grab so moist cupcakes!
author: Dianna C.

description:
I've been lucky to be pregnant at the same time as one of my best girl friends. We both live in East Bay and one weekend that I happened to be in SF, she also craved cake. She really wanted to try SusieCakes so I told her we could pick some up and bring it by.

The staff must have thought I was crazy for the amount I ordered for myself but what do you expect for two pregnant women?! I got a slice of celebration, marble, carrot and tropical each. And a whoopie pie and a cupcake... haha. 

I enjoyed the cakes more than the cupcake, so moist! Just so everyone knows, these are generously huge slices. Four people sharing four slices is probably overkill. But it makes for lots of yummy leftovers, but remember to eat the cake at room temperature if you've had it in the fridge.
author: Sarah A.

description:
OMG, THE RED VELVET CAKE AND THE FROSTING HERE IS AMAZING! 

I've never actually been to this store in person, but my friends bought me my birthday cake from this place, and I was in cake heaven. Also, the ladies who work there apparently didn't bat an eyelash when my dude friends requested them to write "Happy Birthday! XOXO, Ryan Gosling" on my cake. Loved it!
author: Catherine C.

description:
Not as good as the one in San Carlos. Unfortunately the cookie was no longer crisp.
- lemon bar too sweet
- brownie was too airy
author: E T.

description:
I've eaten cakes from here so many times that it's tough to decide where to begin.  How's this:

I have a huge sweet tooth, and I decided to swear off all desserts for an extended, though defined, period of time.  Fortunately, I was able to realize this sacrifice.   

So, where did I choose to "break my fast" of all places?  Yerr DANG right:  Susie Cakes!  (With a slice of Vanilla Celebration!)

Vanilla Celebration is truly a celebration of amazing cake, frosting, and perfectly distributed bits of small candy.  I love it.  That said, choosing between this, Red Velvet, Chocolate, and the various other varieties that Susie Cakes has in its arsenal would result in an infinite loop in my nucleus accumbens, which where we, homo sapiens, sense pleasure. 

The desserts here are nothing short of addictive.  Susie, you should tell me if you're lacing your product with something!

Susie Cakes is on the pricier side, but well worth it in my view.  They sell fancy "tall" birthday candles as last minute impulse purchases.  While convenient, I've kicked myself for doing this despite having the very same candles at home.

My next birthday can't come soon enough.
author: Sebastian N.

description:
Great cakes, cupcakes. Large cookies. Large cake slices. Everything we tasted was A1 superb!  The customer service was top notch they really deserve four and half stars, because they really deliver. 
I can't give them five stars because the sign outside offered puddings and they didn't have puddings. And as for pie, you had to buy the whole pie and didn't offer pie slices.  It seemed odd that by 11:30 am on a Sunday they were out of 5" pies (little pies). 

But, really great cake!
author: Rebekah B.

description:
After traveling most of the day from DC and then going out with colleagues for a little sightseeing and lunch and dinner, a stop at SusieCakes perked me up right away.

First, we were greeted by a gentleman and then the staff, without being pushy, were very kind and eager to take our orders. We each ordered slices of cake. 

I believe they were each about $6.25 + tax and well worth it. The slices were huge, and I very thoroughly enjoyed my carrot cake. There are some other awesome looking (and I'm sure tasting) flavors such as vanilla celebration cake, chocolate banana, red velvet and more.

Besides cakes, they have cupcakes, whoopie pies, and cookies. Drinks are for sale as well as party decorations although the selection is not nearly as expansive as other places. 

I also spied a complimentary magnet in the shape of a cake cutter which I took as a souvenir for the trip.

Eating here at the small table for four, I noticed a steady stream of customers in the 15 minutes we were eating. Pretty awesome and happy place to get your sugar fix and be warmly greeted!
author: Veronique L.

description:
So, my go-to cupcake spot (TTTC) is closed on Mondays. I was walking down Chestnut and came across this place and I'm glad I walked in. 

It took me awhile to choose what I wanted because aside from cupcakes, there were whoopie pies, cookies, and cake amongst other desserts. But, being the self-proclaimed cupcake snob that I am, I settled on a regular size red velvet cupcake for $3.

I was delighted when I took the first bite and it was very moist and the cream cheese frosting was pretty darn good. It wasn't too sweet and to top it all off, there was also cream cheese frosting on the inside, which I didn't expect. But, awesomely good nonetheless.

Nice and friendly customer service. Cute and clean shop. I'd come back to try the other cupcake flavors and the other baked goods as well.
author: Fallon P.

description: I happened to be in the neighborhood early yesterday when I noticed Susie Cakes. The cakes in the window looked amazing, and although it was a bit early for cake, I decided to pop in and take a look at their creations. A lovely woman came out from the back, in the middle of frosting a cupcake, and greeted me. She informed me that they were still closed (oops!) but continued to tell me about their cakes. I apologized and made to leave. On my way out she offered me the delicious red velvet cupcake she had been frosting. I'll definitely make my way back here as a paying customer to try their other cakes (I'm looking at you, coconut cake). Thank you so much for your hospitality!
author: Joe R.

description: Thank you susie cakes for the amazing birthday cake that you made for my nephew's first birthday!red velvet for the win!hahah..loved the mini cupcakes and the guests loved them too thank You!I will definitely come back and try your other sweet goodies
author: Emily V.

description: They provided an amazing wedding cake on short notice! It was amazing! We got carrot sheet cake and chocolate three tier! Yum yum!
author: Rebecca F.

description:
Vanilla Celebration Cake!!!!!

The end.
author: Suany W.

description:
I've ordered two custom cakes from them so far and they are definitely my go to bakery from now on.
The decorations were exactly as I imagined and requested and their flavors are not too sweet for buttercream frosting. Love their red velvet and the triple chocolate was oh so decadent.
Can't go wrong with the awesome service to the first and last bite.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Two minis and one regular... Over $7.00
Also placed in a small bag, when I got them home they had become one big mish mash... I carried the bag a few blocks! For over $7 U should be using better packaging!
Last visit, done
author: Carolyn C.

description:
Ever since Christina L. gave me a slice of red velvet cake, I've fallen in love.  Red velvet is my all time favorite, and I haven't found anyone that makes it better than SusieCakes!  The cake itself is super moist and the cream cheese frosting is to die for.  I like how they even inject the frosting into the middle of their cupcakes.  They also have a variety of other great cupcakes, but I keep coming back for my favorite.  

You can place your order online on their website, which makes things very convenient.  But parking can be a pain in the Marina.  I recommend having two people venture out for the pickup, so one person can jump out of the car.
author: Patra I.

description: My husband and I entered just before closing. Torii greeted us with a warm smile and a friendly hello. After perusing the bakery, we decided to get two large cookies: one chocolate chip and one snickerdoodle. The cookies were good; however, they seemed a little dry. I am assuming they were dry because it was the end of the day and they had been sitting out in the open case. Next time, I will get there earlier in the day so the cookies will be fresher and moister. Great customer service!
author: Stella K.

description:
We ordered a customized 3 tiered layer Red Velvet cake for the SFSU Counseling Dept's graduation ceremony March 25, 13.  

It was so moist and wonderful.  The frosting was not toooo sweet, it was just right.  Thanks for the great tasting cake.
author: Vanilla C.

description:
Oh Susie, why must your cakes me so damn delicious? I am a lover of anything sweet & typically enjoy any sweet treat but Susie's Cakes hands down is THE best cake around!! In a matter of 1.5 months, I have tried these cakes:
-Celebration Cake: Adult funfetti? Omg yes! I enjoyed it but do have to say the cake wasn't as moist as the carrot & chocolate but nonetheless it was good & fun to eat!
-Carrot Cake: the flavors are perfectly blended together & the cream cheese frosting isn't super sweet. One of the best carrot cakes I have ever had & that's saying a lot. I am a pretty tough critic. 
-Classic Chocolate with an added twist...peanut butter buttercream on the outer layer of the cake. My friend wanted a cake with peanut butter frosting. I thought it sounded strange but it turned out to be my most delicious combination ever! It was so delicious that I had to beg her to take it to work & get it out of my face because it was getting embarrassing. There was a Miranda cake moment  for those of you who watched Sex & the City...you know what I'm talking about.
author: kristina m.

description: I like this place, but they take way too long; to get to a customer. They package up your delightful sweets beautiful. Take way to long, for packaging Items. You guys are losing profit; because you guys take way to long to packaging items.
author: Mike J.

description: SusieCakes is Practically perfect in every way: sizes to accommodate all hunger levels (mini cupcakes to pieces of cake), perfect frosting to cake ratio, great selection of flavors, amazing buttercream that is not excessively sweet, other treats like banana pudding if you have a weird husband who doesn't like cupcakes-- and the red velvet is ON POINT. We live in the Central Valley now which is seriously lacking in good food places, so we make it a point to hit up SusieCakes every time we are in SF and want a cupcake fix. They say the cakes shouldn't be refrigerated but we always get extra and take them home, and I've both frozen and refrigerated them and had no issues. (Desperate times call for desperate measures!) Please start a mail-order business and we will be your biggest customers :)
author: Kate R.

description:
SusieCakes makes an amazing red velvet, that's definitely one of my favorites. The strawberry cupcake is quite tasty as well, though the frosting was rather sweet. The filling is just additional frosting, which isn't necessary given the amount on top. I also tried the fresh berry cream cake -- the cake slices here are HUGE! It could have used more berries, but I really enjoyed it. The cake portion of the cupcakes and cakes here are far better than their cupcake counterparts -- it's really moist, very rich, and dense. Unlike Sprinkles, SusieCakes tastes good the day after too. I was told to keep the items at room temperature, but I totally put the berry cream cake in the fridge.

The flavors here are more traditional versus creative, and I appreciated the pricing. A standard cupcake is $3, and a cake slice around $5.50 (other places charge more!). The service was friendly and a bag with handles is provided if requested. The store is bright, but a little tight and there are two tables outside with a few chairs.

Definitely worth a visit if in the area.
author: Jan P.

description:
Not sure why people would go anywhere else, but SusieCakes is my favorite bakery.  I used to live near the one in Calabasas, so I feel really lucky that there's one near me now that I live in San Francisco.

The cupcakes are moist & delicious & best of all, not too sweet (I'm looking at you, Magnolia). I'm a total cupcake whore, so I've tried them all: Magnolia Bakery in NYC, Sprinkles in LA, Crumbs in LA, Kara's Cupcakes in Ghiradelli's Square, Kako all around SF, Teacake Bakeshop in Emeryville, Love at First Bite in Berkeley, etc.  I've been to them all! And Susie Cakes is my favorite.

They are always friendly and helpful and don't judge you if you go twice in one day :D
author: Grace C.

description:
My sister in law ordered a cake and some cookies for my baby shower from SusieCakes. The cake was red velvet - my fave! It was super delicious, moist and perfect! Our guests loved it too. The sugar cookies were ultra cute - shaped as bottle and onesies, and so delish!

Will come back for more of that red velvet deliciousness, fosho!
author: Ragini M.

description:
I have become a loyal SusieCakes customer for every occasion that calls for a sweet treat. From office birthday cakes, to friends birthday cakes, to large-scale orders for events, and random cupcake cravings, the consistently high-quality and helpful, friendly service keeps bringing me back. 

For our most recent Halloween Event I worked with a couple ladies, but with Molly the most - shewas incredibly helpful and didn't bat an eye when I had to almost double my order. Everything arrived exactly on time, as promised. The attendees raved about the cookies and mini cupcakes.

I didn't realize for the longest time that they have a San Francisco location, but knew of the company from Southern California (in fact, my best friend had her wedding cake and bridal shower cake done by the Newport Beach location), and haven't looked back since I found them.
My personal favorite is a tie between the Classic Marble and Vanilla Celebration (funfetti) but I'm pretty sure I couldn't say no to anything from SusieCakes.
author: Jenna R.

description:
I indulged in an awesome blueberry frosting filled cupcake. Unfortunately, they said it was the last day for it. Sad panda. But getting one is better than none.

I also tasted my wife's chocolate chocolate frosting filled cupcake, which was also amazing. Both were not overly sweet and had great flavor.

We will be back to try more of those tasty treats.
author: Kevin H.

description:
I love vanilla sweets. Go here & absolutely get the vanilla celebration cake. Sure it might have some strange green food dye coloring on top, but the huge tasty slice they give you is more than enough to satisfy sweet tooth cravings & give you instant fat kid regret.

The other cake slices are also decent like their coconut cake. However, their take on cupcakes don't quite stand out against the hundreds of other cupcake exclusive bakeries. I'd recommend a pass on those. 

Really friendly service here. Grab a slice after lunch & head off to Crissy Field or Fort Mason to enjoy it.
author: Steven C.

description: Ordered the red velvet cupcake. Delicious! While it wasn't the best red velvet I've ever had, it was darn good. The cream cheese frosting was very good. The cake itself was moist, buttery, and oh so good. Staff was very cheery and friendly as well. Heck, I would be too, if I worked here.
author: Jenny B.

description: Always passed by this place but never stopped by. And then one day I happened to try their cupcake - Red Velvet, and oh lord my life changed. Now I always make an excuse to go by there only to stop by and grab another cup cake. I *wish* I hadn't checked em out.
author: Bennet M.

description:
This is a cute little shop to stop into for a quick treat. I tried the vanilla cupcake and was pleasantly surprised! Usually when I buy cupcakes they are dry and the the frosting has a weird texture, so naturally I am not a fan of specialty cupcake places. I decide to give this one a shot because we stopped in after dinner with friends. 

Surprise! The cupcake was delicious! The cupcake itself tasted fresh, like it was just made.  The frosting was soft and actually tasted like frosting, not just powdered sugar like other places I have tried. The best part. There was frosting in the middle of the cupcake.

I will leave you with that. Frosting.
author: Kristin F.

description:
Suzie's Cakes is done up really well. The glass counter is immaculately decorated with their enormous and utterly yummy looking cakes shielded in glass casings.
The people behind the counter are also super friendly and they serve you with a smile (I feel like that's a must especially at a sweet shop, no ? :))
The only set back is that I didn't quite enjoy their red velvet that everyone raved about.
Did I go on the wrong day or what?
The cake was not soft, the frosting too sugary and not velvety...hmm.
Maybe I'll have to give it another try.
As for now though, Kara's is still my fave!
author: Kinjal N.

description:
Probably one of the best places ever! I was looking for a place where I could order a cake for around 70 people but still had fair prices and when I looked into Susie Cakes and emailed the specialist we were able to figure something out.  A week later a beautiful cake arrived at the door and when we cut the cake at the party, people kept asking me if it was a homemade cake and to give them the recipe. I was so happy I found a place where they #1 delivered the day of #2 tasted homemade  #3 made beautiful cakes. I gave everyone the name of the place i had ordered the cake from and they said they would order from Susie on their next event. 

 The staff are amazing and welcoming, the place is cute! Definitely check them out.
author: Yoselin M.

description: We used Susie Cakes for our wedding (9/16) and SO happy that we did, they are professional and deliver a delicious and amazing product. We had a great time at our tasting to start with, they are very helpful, and helped us to customize our wedding needs. We went with a two tier smaller cake for our cutting, which was delicious and beautiful, and we went with a few hundred cupcakes for the reception. They were a hit! Any time I've ever been at a party and susie cakes is dessert, it's always gone! So yummy! Thanks Susie Cakes!!
author: Anne C.

description:
Have you ever walked into a place, that smelled so good? You wanted to eat the ground you walked on? I often think the only people who may know that feeling, 
Is "Hansel" and "Gretel" of "Grimm storybook fame"

"Susie Cakes" is the ideal celebration of pure American cooking,
the ladies who work there look like "Rosie the Riveter"
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:We_Can_Do_It!.jpg

Susi cakes seems to use fresh ingredients at I've gotten
some of my favorite cakes classic desserts cakes, cookies, cupcakes, pies, and puddings. 

I personally had the "Confetti cake" It has little sprinkles in them and sort of pop
in your mouth, with a Vanilla moist delicious texture.

The Whoopie pies are awesome. Nothing more nothing less.
I am a little iffy on the banana pudding, but I didn't order it, 
I had a spoonful but I can tell it was not packaged made.

But I bought a bunch of "Mini-cupcakes" the butter cream frosting is amazing!
I almost lost my manhood, because I was hyper and giddy like a school girl.

Hey, I said almost ;)

P.s. - Try out the cupcakes with filling in them, please let me know how they are!
author: Michael R.

description: Best cupcakes EVER!! Susie Cakes has turned into an addiction of sorts for me. What really sealed the deal was the custom cake that I had made for my dear friend's baby shower. Amazing. They even called and checked up on how the shower went. Just perfect! If you order a doll cake, keep in mind that they are HUGE! They feed about 25 people.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Dear Rangers, 

Eat THIS!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MKjhQLLVP0udUB6P-rv_Aw?select=Sx-hQ6gXH66t4HBpgSqv6w

Sincerely, 
Amy C. and SusieCakes
author: Amy C.

description: Holy moly. The biggest slice of cake ever. Me and my friend got the vanilla celebration flavor. Pretty yummy! The girls working were super nice and friendly. Glad I stumbled on this place!
author: Francesca D.

description: They have great customer service don't get me wrong.  I'm just not a fan of their cupcakes nor their cookies.  The cupcakes don't have much flavor, the cake could be moister and there is just too much messy frosting on them.  But their carrot cake is awesome!  Even one of my old coworkers who I forced to try it, who thinks carrot cake is gross, said it wasn't bad.  The cake is super moist with real chunks of carrots.  And the cream cheese frosting is so luscious and not too sweet!  3 stars for the carrot cake!
author: Cat C.

description:
Everything is just delicious! 

My first experience was just a post-dinner treat of sharing a slice of their Lemon Cake and a sugar cookie. Both were fantastic and provided such a high note for the end of our evening. If you are dinning or just strolling on Chestnut, it's a must stop. 

This past weekend we had friends come into town to celebrate and I knew this was the perfect place to order a cake. Online ordering was extremely easy. Bonus, during a busy Pre-Valentine's day rush I was able to walk straight up to the register and pick up my beautiful cake. My cake decoration and message was confirmed and quickly after was gift wrapped.

The cake (Vanilla Celebration) was a hit and as the weekend with friends had come to and end, I received a phone call from Susie's cakes. Calling to thank me and confirming that my cake and experience was up to my standards. This experience is what drove me to write this review. The follow through shows excellence. In every aspect of a business, customer service, quality, ease of purchase, and damn delicious cakes (Cookies, too), I give Susie's Cakes on Chestnut Five very deserved stars.
author: Trina V.

description: Cupcakes looked better than they tasted. I got a chocolate cupcake and a vanilla cupcake. The vanilla cupcake was very dry and tasted like it came from a boxed mix. The chocolate one was a little bit better but these cupcakes were not anything special.
author: Tanya Y.

description:
Do you know why the Marina socialites and social-dudes live in Lululemon pants and workout all the live long day? To impress the opposite sex, and look right and tight and sexy, right???

Nope!!!

It's so they can feed their bellies and tushies full of Susiecakes, duh! 

I kid you not, every single person that walked in here had stretchy pants or a dry-fit shirt on. One could speculate and infer that oh, they worked out today and now they're rightfully treating themselves! No, I think the true ideology is that they can't stop feeding their Susiecakes addiction and feel a little less guilty when they're parading around in their spandex. I obviously missed that memo and, like a fool, had jeans on. Yeah, that's right. Don't judge me.  

Susie's buttercream is smooth, creamy and luscious. One taste and you'll be sucking the wrapper clean.

Let me elaborate, I was actually wearing jeggings so I kind of fit in. And, they had that much needed extra stretchy fit to handle the aftermath of major cupcake consumption. Thank God for jeggings and buttercream! A match made in cupcake heaven!
author: Angela W.

description: I'm going to come back to try their signature cakes and pies next time. Sadly, I won't be getting a cupcake here again. Not sure if something went wrong with our cupcakes but the ones we got but were way too sweet. It was so sweet to the point that even my hunger and what I thought was my sweet tooth could barely finish the cupcake. My friend was having the same issue with hers. $3.25 for a cupcake is a little too expensive in my opinion. However, the people who work here were extremely nice and the store itself is charming. On that note, there really should be some sort of ticketing system (like Lucca's Delicatessen) to call on who's next. It's very small inside and people tend to conglomerate to take a look at the options. This led to a couple people behind me going before me for their order, which was pretty frustrating.
author: Hana K.

description:
3 years later, I actually did find myself a man. And I kept my promise to Susiecakes. We served our 200 guests a duet of Red Velvet cake + Celebration confetti cake for dessert. Everyone loved it. Molly was extremely helpful by email and our cakes were delivered to our venue on time with no problems.

I'll also add that we did their cake tasting (only to confirm that red velvet is still our favorite), and when I forgot to eat my piece of celebration cake, I went back a few days later and they packed me a new slice for free. Can't beat their cakes and service!
author: Amy D.

description:
4.5* Because of our cravings for Susie Cakes, we go out of our way to come to Marina---and even manage to find parking on crazy Chestnut Street.

*Marble cake: rich, soft, and delicious. A perfect treat when I have a sweet tooth. Wash it down with either a cup of hot Earl Grey or a glass of milk.
*Red velvet mini cupcakes: I never get their regular cupcakes because I like to try different ones. The bite-size cupcake serves that purpose. Susie has some of the best velvet cupcakes. Their cupcakes are frosting filled!
*Chocolate chocolate cupcake: tasty but I have to give that one to Kara because I like the frosting there better. Susie's frosting can be overly sweet.
*Snickerdoodles: nice balance of cinnamon, sugar, and buttery flavor
*Peanut butter sandwich cookies: heaven!

So there you have it. This is our go-to bakery in town for old-fashion cakes. The staff is very friendly and always acknowledge the customers when they walk through the store even if they are busy helping others.
author: Matt Y.

description:
"Delicious". "Just how I like my cake". "Beautiful". "Decadent". Just some of the comments my wedding guests had about my 3 tier wedding cake from SusieCakes. Their flavors are diverse and fantastic.

Coordinating with SusieCakes was streamlined and simple. Shelley and her team were quick to respond to emails and had a large digital and physical portfolio of all the work they've created in the past. 

The tasting was SO much fun and the team really let you enjoy the moment from afar. We weren't pressured at all, the cake made our decision for us. Their pricing is very reasonable.

The day of the wedding, I didn't hear from SusieCakes--a bride's dream! They delivered right on time, made the order correctly, and designed it exactly how we had agreed. 

Thank you, SusieCakes for a wedding cake my guests and I will always remember!
author: Alyssa O.

description:
Wow.  Yelp usually doesn't lead me astray, but today it happened.  Read all about this cupcakery that was supposed to outdo Sprinkles.  Really?!  Wow. That's something!

So my wife, daughter and myself excitedly charge into the store to get our sugar fix, but what a letdown.  We ordered red velvet, peanut butter, mocha and a slice of "Celebration" cake.

What can I tell you except that these were all very ordinary cupcakes.  I've tasted these same cupcakes at least a hundred times over.  Not moist, not flavorful, just a cupcake that you'd get at a birthday party somewhere.  Not trying to be mean, just trying to be real. I don't get what anyone likes about the cupcakes.  The frosting is WAY too sweet and too much butter, leaves a film on my tongue.  Can't handle that kind of frosting.  And even worse, SusieCakes puts extra frosting IN the cupcake. Horror of horrors!  :)  Not good for me at all.

We all took bites and tossed them.  I know that sounds bad, but we were all very full from lunch and the thought of ingesting all these calories when the cupcakes weren't even good, was a big turnoff for all of us.

Maybe we should have opted for the sllices of the large cakes instead of the cupcakes?  I feel like the coconut cake and the carrot cake might have been good--judging just from the looks. I don't think cupcakes are Susie's strongpoint.  We did have a slice of the Celebration cake, but I think that was the wrong slice to have ordered.  I wish I went for the carrot or coconut, then maybe I would have at least one positive thing to say.

I'm definitely the minority here.  I don't see too many 2 star reviews like mine.
What does that mean?  I think that means there's a lot of people in SF that don't know a good cupcake from a bad cupcake.
author: Darien R.

description: Holy carrot cake!  My husband and I are visiting from Virginia and my SIL bought me a birthday cake from Suzies.  It was so good!  I haven't had anything else from Suzies but if you like carrot cake, this will probably be the best you'll ever have!
author: Andrea J.

description:
As my hubby & I walked past this cute bakery and spied the delicious treats, it was a pretty easy decision to stop in and try something. There were almost too many yummy choices! 

We finally settled on cookies- a snicker doodle for me, an iced molasses for my hubby, and a flourless peanut butter for us to split. They cookies were large, so I thought the $2 price tag wasn't too bad. As our goodies were being bagged, an employee informed us that the iced molasses had broken (which was the last one), so he offered us a cookie on him (we picked chocolate chip). 

My snicker doodle was a tad undercooked for my tastes (which my hubby actually loved), and he thought his cookie had too many chocolate chips (I love chocolate, but I also thought it was a bit rich). The peanut butter was a tad bit dry, but had a very nice flavor. 

After reading the Yelp reviews, it's obvious that we should have tried a slice of the vanilla celebration cake (my hubby's mouth literally dropped open when we saw it). It's because of the rave reviews that we will return to try a slice (or two!). And I will definitely be trying a whoopie pie. And maybe a cupcake too. :)
author: Megan M.

description: Wow, Their Carrot Cake is so good. After my son's event my friends and I headed to this place to check out and also my daughter requested a Carrot Cake. I'm glad I went to see this place.
author: Marelisa J.

description:
How can you say no to cupcakes?! Unless you have diabetes :/
I tried their strawberry, lemon, mint chocolate, vanilla cupcakes! SO YUMMY! I'm a vanilla and strawberry person, so those were my favorites. The cakes were moist and had some filling in the middle, which I LOVE! You can also order cakes by the slice here. I tried a sample of their carrot cake and was tempted to get a slice, but I knew I would easily get a cavity by the time I finished the cupcakes.
author: Mia S.

description:
If I'd only tried their red velvet cupcake I would give this Bakery only 3 stars but the seasonal cupcake -- peanut butter & jelly -- was amazing! I probably won't have time to get another fix because they change their seasonal monthly...which you know...is a bit counter-intuitive...let's call it a monthly cupcake?

Anyhow, the cake is special...maybe it's a dollop of jelly inside or maybe they also put peanut butter in the batter? The icing seems to be mixed with PB & J. It's just freaking heavenly!

The red velvet? Not so much. The cake didn't grab me...no cocoa taste. The icing didn't sing "cream cheese" to me either. 

I will return to check out other cupcakes...and maybe...even a multi-layer cake which looks so decadent.
author: Leslie K.

description:
They make great cakes but they charge $1.50 for the pretty red ribbon. I think their prices should include the ribbon because it s annoying to pay a surplus to an already highly priced cake.
Claire
author: Claire T.

description:
I stayed in a hotel near here while visiting SF for a little vacay! While exploring the neighborhood I found SusieCakes - I have a HUGE sweet-tooth!! It was so very cupcake-shoppy! Super cute and colorful with a fresh bakery smell that you consider biting the display case! The people were nice and friendly!
I ordered a mini red velvet cupcake. Oh. My. God. The icing was so good, not too sweet, perfectly creamy but not too heavy. And the cake was fluffy and good! They together make a awesome-eye-rolling-cupcake goodness! Run, don't walk, to SusieCakes!
author: Shawnta W.

description: I've had various products. Hands down vanilla celebration cake is perfect. Lots of others are hit and miss. The strawberry is much too sweet for my liking. Yet lemon is well balanced. Sometimes the cake can be really dense and a bit dry. I find their customized cake pricing is pricey however they do all their designs by hand so sometimes I convince myself it's worth it. The pirate cake and princess celestia designs came out perfectly. I always get vanilla celebration. I wish their pricing for customizing small cakes and cupcakes was a bit more reasonable but then again I just wish I could get a break for being a return customer :) . Still beautiful and delicious though!
author: Margaret S.

description:
We had gone back and forth on having an actual wedding cake, but decided we would go for it!  I honestly didn't do a ton of research but had gotten cakes at SusieCakes before, so knew that their cakes were delicious. I emailed with Molly as we were planning our wedding from Europe and she was prompt in responding and helpful in going through all of our options.  We set up a tasting when we were back in SF for a week and got to try literally all of their combinations of cakes.  SO SO GOOD!!!  The hubby wasn't able to come to the tasting (so a lucky friend got to come!) but Molly sent me home with FULL slices of the ones that I liked so he could try everything.  

Ultimately, we decided on a red velvet, three-tiered cake with cream cheese frosting (along with a sheet cake to cover the rest of our guests).  Basically to die for!  I wasn't super picky about what I wanted the outside of the cake to look like and was surprised by all of our options with the cream cheese frosting (who knew they could make cream cheese frosting look like fondant!).  We didn't want any crazy design, just something that looked classy and simple.  I had looked at some pictures when we went in for the tasting and Molly sent more afterwards of ones.  The whole process from start to finish was easy.  I didn't even research any other bakeries as there was no need.  Their prices were much less than I expected for a wedding cake and the cake was absolutely delish!  They also delivered the cake to our venue in San Francisco.  

We have the top tier in the freezer, which I CANNOT wait to have!  Fantastic service and a fantastic cake!!  I would definitely recommend SusieCakes!!
author: Amy G.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday June 20, 2010 @ 6pm & Tuesday June 22, 2010 @ 3pm
Companions:  Cindy, Colette and Jonathon
Scene:  Marina Girls in Little Sundresses
Vibe:  Bright & Cheery
Decor:  Sweet & Nostalgic.  ChalkBoard Menu & "Eat Cake" Stenciled on The Wall.  Pastel Green & Yellow Color Palette.  Precision Stainless Steel Stools
Service:  Polite Ladies in Pastel Green Bandanas 50's Style & Brown & Green Susie Cakes Tee's
Devour:  Pastel Colored Vanilla, Strawberry & Coconut Cupcakes
Total:  $12
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Doesn't live up to the hype. Tasted like your standard bakery just around the corner. Don't understand why this places gets such rave reviews.
author: Jude N.

description:
My friend lives within walking distance of SusieCakes Bakery so I've been here twice on various visits. Both times I was enchanted by the cupcakes. I'm kind of over the whole gourmet cupcake trend, but we were on vacation so we decided we needed them. 

I've had chocolate & red velvet and both were high in quality and taste. I don't really know what else there is to say other than I'm happy I don't live as close to SusieCakes as my friend because i'd probably be way too tempted on a daily basis.
author: Alexandra K.

description:
YUM!! 

I just had their cupcakes... literally, five seconds ago!!

S E A S O N A L  C U P C A K E ($3)
- vanilla cake with strawberries inside!! Filled with a white chocolate frosting!!! Yum!!!!! I LOVE!!!!

This cupcake is not like your typical Sprinkles or Karas. It's not too sweet or dense! The frosting reminds me of Magnolia's!! The shop is super cute!! :D

Grand opening celebration is tomorrow, Saturday, June 26th from 2pm-5pm!!! :D
author: CeCe C.

description:
This was our final stop on my SF Food Crawl I hosted a couple weekends ago. Yes, I'm a sweet treat whore! Cuz even after having complimentary dessert at the restaurant we were having dinner at right before hitting up SusieCakes, I was already on my phone Yelping for a dessert place nearby to get my real sugar rush going.

It's a standard, small cupcake shop. They offer other sweets here besides cupcakes of course.

I got myself a mini Red Velvet cupcake and their last regular sized White Chocolate Strawberry cupcake (this one is a seasonal one).

I thought the Red Velvet was pretty basic. The cake could have been a bit more moist in my opinion. But the cream cheese frosting is definitely a winner.

The White Chocolate Strawberry on the other hand was a winner all-around! I loved the fact that their were pieces of ripe strawberries inside of the yellow cake. And the frosting was actually a creamy white chocolate buttery frosting! Mmmmm mmmm BOMB!

I definitely wanna try some of their cookie sandwiches here too. Until next time I guess. :)
author: Michelle V.

description: OK the baked goods are very good. But you will wait 15 minutes in line to buy a cookie. The past 5 times its the same. 3 servers behind the counter, 2 of them busy with "paperwork," entering many many lines of text, checking boxes, counting cupcakes and then entering that count on "forms." One poor person helping the ever expanding line of customers. The phone rings and its that server who turns away to answer and now no one is helping the line out the door! Have these people received any customer service training! The whole vibe to customers who walk into the place is "go away!."  They seem to only really want the phone orders.
author: Dave G.

description:
I was actually really surprised I liked this place so much! 

I walked in with my sister and mom after eating at the sushi place down the street, and was sooooo happy to find samples of little red velvet cupcake thingies on the side. Anyplace that gives cupcakes samples gets +1 star. :) 

I ordered a strawberry cupcake, and my sister got the orange creamsicle.

THEY WERE BOTH SOOOOO GOOD. Wow. I love cornbread, and the texture of the cupcake is kind of corn-bready. It's very crumbly, and not too cakey, and very moist, and the frosting is perfect. It's not too sweet or thick like Sprinkles. 

They're $3 each, which is about what I'd expect to pay for cupcakes nowadaysssssssss. :)
author: Jeanette S.

description: Ordered their mini red velvet and chocolate cupcakes, and OH-EM-GEE taste like heaven! Definitely need to go back and try their other stuff. Also loving the fun and friendly atmosphere here! :)
author: Mia O.

description:
We have always been a fan of Susie Cakes, so when it came to choosing our dessert vendor for our wedding, we knew that Susie Cakes was the way to go. We went with a mini two tiered red velvet (on one tier) and peanut butter funfetti (on a separate tier) as our cake and opted for their mini dessert bar selections.

We made an appointment with Molly and she was so patient with our questions and helped us calculate how much we needed to order. We tasted pretty much everything and I was in heaven! I never once felt overwhelmed or pressured and we put in an order that day! Throughout the wedding process, I kept in contact with Molly and she always answered my emails and questions in a timely manner. 

The day of our wedding, they delivered everything on time and all of our guests were raving about how this was the best dessert they have had at a wedding. The brownies, 7 layer bars, cookies, whoopie pies, and lemon bars were major hits and definitely did not disappoint! 

Susie Cakes knows what they're doing. Not only do they have really great desserts, but they also believe in customer service. We will definitely be going back!
author: Victoria B.

description:
Having been to a number of weddings with a giant beautiful fondant covered cake that tasted like dry nothingness, I knew instantly after I became engaged that I wanted nothing to do with those big, boring, standard wedding cakes.  

I had this vision of a giant cake bar with several different flavors of cakes.  I was less concerned with how the cakes looked, and more concerned with how they tasted, since so many wedding cakes just don't measure up in the taste department.  Having loved SusieCakes for their delicious cupcakes and other goodies, I could not wait to do my cake tasting with them!

At our tasting, Megan was extremely helpful and excited about our cake bar idea.  She took down our order of 13 different cakes and all of our information for delivery.  The big day came and all my guests could talk about was the beautiful cake bar which was at the center of our reception (see photo).  When it came time to cut the cakes, everyone was circled around the cake bar ready to jump in and try all the different varieties.  It was a huge hit - and I cannot thank SusieCakes enough for making our vision a reality and for providing our guests with so much variety on our special day!
author: Dana H.

description:
$5 for their exclusive whoopie pie was a bit on the pricey side, but I must say...it was one heck of a whoopie pie!  Definitely did not disappoint...the buttercream filling was a tad too sweet for my taste, but OMG, the chocolate cookies itself were both decadent and chewy, with a brownie like texture... divine!  

I've tried several of their cupcakes before from their Brentwood location in the past, but I couldn't help myself from caving into their 3 for $5 mini cupcakes special.  A perfect way to satisfy my cupcake craving without over indulging.  Everyone knows just how much I love red velvet cupcakes and it was no surprise that I bit into that cupcake first.  Sadly, I cannot say SusieCakes' rv was my fav.  Their cream cheese frosting was delicious indeed, tasty and not too sweet, but the cake itself was a bit disappointing.  Although it was very moist, it lacked the cocoa flavor I was looking for and the cake was bright red.  I hate to say this, but it almost tasted like a vanilla cake dyed with red food coloring, just with a cream cheese frosting instead.

Not a bad place to stop by if I'm in the Marina area, but I think I'll opt for the cookies + bars vs. the cupcakes option next time.
author: Janetto L.

description: Their flourless chocolate cupcake is straight up the best cupcake I've ever had in my life.... hoooly moly. Better than anything famous is whatever giant city (I've tried alootta cupcakes).
author: Emma Y.

description:
arrived 4 minutes before the official opening time. door was unlocked and it was misty outside. thought I'd stand inside and look at the selection ...but the staff informed that the team was preparing deliveries and I should wait outside 
once the doors officially opened there were a dozen people on staff, I was the only purchasing customer and had to wait another 5 minutes for them to be ready. Then as I was selecting .... they took 2 other customers ahead of me.

Definitely won't go back to Chestnut - the Greenbrae location has nicer staff.
author: Moxie A.

description:
Anyone who gives this place 1 star is an idiot. Well, that's mean. I don't know those people so I guess what I mean to say giving this place 1 star is idiotic. Do you know what warrants a 1 star? A terrible experience. I get it, we're all different. We all can't have the same favorites. But even if this wasn't your favorite cake, cookie, or customer service, it's still not your worst. If you think this was terrible food, then your palate sucks and your reviews should be suspect. I can see not loving it, I can't see hating it. 

One of the good things about YELP is that anyone can leave a review. The worst thing about YELP is that anyone can leave a review. Some people (most people) do not know how to properly discern what constitutes good and bad when it comes to reviewing. That's why its an actual job to review for some people. 

If you think the cake/cupcake is dry then you're high. Your palate sucks. I have been here more times than you and had most of their cakes and they have a consistent product. Its not dry. You suck.

I can understand the complaint of it being too sweet. That's legitimate. I'd prefer it a little less sweet but its not 'too' sweet for me.

Its not my favorite cake but its very good. And I appreciate the quality of cake it is. I once bought a mini-cake and had them write a personalized message on it. Understandably expensive but an easy process. In and out in less than 10 minutes. 

I love their seasonal cupcake. They had a blueberry pancake one once that was outstanding. 

Chocolate chip cookie is also great. I was wary because its thinner than I'd like but it still had a great moist texture. 

Customer service has always been pleasant. 

If I wanted cake this would be the place in SF I'd go.
author: Dash_Rendar _.

description: Was having a sweets craving after dinner and around the corner was Susiecakes! Cute interior (no seating though) with a retro vibe. The actual sweets, however, were super underwhelming. Got a slice of their supposedly signature red velvet cake, since you cant argue with the "signature," right? It was unfortunately dry and pretty flavorless. Even the frosting tasted blah--like too much powdered sugar and not enough cream cheese. It was just all wrong. Maybe their other stuff is better, but how can you not do your original dessert justice? Oh and it was $6.50 to boot. I'll have to find another place to satisfy my sweet tooth in the marina.
author: Cara R.

description:
SusieCakes has the most moist cake ever in comparison to any other cupcakes/cakes I have tried in the past. This, I feel, is the one deciding factor in how good a cake is. Frosting will always be frosting.. it'll always be sweet and sugary, but nothing can mask dry, flaky cake. This is not to say that SusieCakes' frosting isn't any good; actually, I could say they have perfected how frosting should taste like! 
I would recommend getting their red velvet.. as a matter of fact, it's the best I've tried all around. I would definitely recommend dropping by SusieCakes if you're in the mood for outstanding baked goods.
author: Monica M.

description:
I wanted to try this place as they're listed in one of the Foodspotting guides.  We tried a peanut butter, mocha, and March seasonal cupcake which was a Guinness chocolate stout cake with Bailey's Irish Cream frosting.

The cakes were moist but the icing looked mediocre - as if is were iced myself and not by a professional.  The cupcakes were kinda average - good but not great.

We also tried a 7-layer bar.  I couldn't tell you what each layer is but despite my dislike of coconut, the bar was pretty good.  They have other treats such as lemon squares and brownies that I wouldn't mind trying...
author: Rose A.

description: I came here on a Saturday and ordered two vanilla cupcakes to-go. I ate one as soon I left the shop, and immediately returned to buy another. The service is great, which is needed because so many people come in. Highly recommend this excellent sugar experience. Easily the best cupcakes I've had in San Francisco. I'm such a fiend that I plan on Postmating some today. Can't wait to try a slice of their cake!
author: Sara H.

description: This review is way overdue .. Been coming here for nearly 3 yrs. Never been a fan of cupcakes until I tried this place. Absolutely amazing! I love their cakes too.. Marble cake is my favorite. Staff is wonderful too. Once I forgot my wallet, the lady (forgot name) gave me the cake anyway and I called from home with my cc info (talk about trust and customer service).. About to order from them now!
author: Aziz S.

description: I was here recently to get cupcakes for a friends birthday and the cupcakes were stale! We got several varieties and all were dry. Not worth it.
author: Therese M.

description: Quality bakery. I tried a few of their items and they are all stars. Very well made and th ey put alot of thought in each recipe. My favorite is the banana cream pie,  it feels light and airy, mildly sweet and super good! The red velvet cupcakes has a distinct flavor, tasted fresh. Whoopie pies are the best in the city, they are not sickeningly sweet, the cookies ar emoist and chewy and the buttercream gave it it's richness. I love their simple decor as well and array display of cakes!
author: Diana T.

description:
Sorry SusieCakes, you're kind of the same wherever I go!

I feel the exact same way about this SusieCakes as I do for the Brentwood location in Los Angeles.

Decent cupcakes, a little bit on the dry side for my personal taste, but AMAZING FROSTING. I would buy the cupcakes just to eat the frosting. Red velvet was average, but the seasonal special (gingerbread?) tasted more like an inconsistent pumpkin pie.

The only differing factor here is that service, though perfectly fine on the rainy day that I entered, was not as cheery as the one in LA. I guess that doesn't really matter unless you need a cupful of happiness with your purchase.

Why oh why were the cake samples on the side so much tastier than the cupcakes themselves?!
author: Colleen M.

description:
extremely moist and yummy cupcakes. the frosting can be a bit on the sweet side, but if you are sharing with someone its not too bad. 

i tried the red velvet, the lemon and chocolate cupcakes. the cake is so moist and tasty! the frosting is light , fluffy and a bit too sweet for me. but overall, these are pretty good cupcakes and i would come back for more!
author: Stella J.

description:
Oh, SusieCakes how I usually love you, but tonight you gave me no choice but to post this review. 

After having dinner with a friend a Chubby Noodle we walked over craving a Red Velvet cupcake which I have an unusual weak spot for. When we arrived to your Marina location tonight at 8:02 your door was locked... However, instead of the woman smiling and apologizing for being closed, she glanced up and gave me a sour face and then rattled something to the other female employee working. Is this the definition of superior customer service? I thought the unusual $5 per cupcake cake secured superior customer service?

I'm usually a loyal customer, but I have to say that treating loyal customers like myself like an inconvenience tempts me never to return since I'm such a bother. 

Again, I'm not asking for you to open your doors past the hours posted on your door. However, show a smile and say you're closed rather than looking at me like I'm the idiot. 

I'm not sure I'll return because of this. I'll miss your cupcakes, but not your rude employee tonight.
author: Justin P.

description: Came here yesterday to pick up a slice of the celebration cake for my homie's birthday, so of course I got a cupcake for myself too. I was super bummed when I got there and was told the banana chocolate chip had run out, my back up was the peanut butter chocolate. The cupcake was overly sweet but otherwise solid. I definitely like other flavors I've had here like carrot and red velvet.
author: Allison D.

description: SusieCakes is easily my favorite place to get cake in the city. The Celebration cake is a-MAZ-ing, and each slice is gigantic (enough for two to share easily)! Yum!!!
author: Clay P.

description:
We were given three Susie Cakes I've the weekend. A carrot and fun-fetti from a destination wedding here (being the locals we got the left overs) and a friend brought a 5layered chocolate cake for dinner. 

All three of the cakes have been fabulous. We don't like them cold from the frig, but at room temperature they are still as wonderful as the day they were made. 

I can't speak to the service or pricing but the  quality is exceptional.
author: Lauren N.

description: Just happened upon Susie cakes in the marina. Marble cake was delicious and the frosting simply outstanding. Staff was very welcoming and efficient. Loved the experience!
author: Karen S.

description:
I went in here to indulge on a day I needed to destress. The girl that helped me was a sweetheart and could sense that I was having a rough day so she gave me an extra cupcake. SO thoughtful! 
Just too sweet for my liking. The cupcakes are dense, sweet and delicious. I could only have two bites of each and was done (until a few hours later..). 
On a separate visit I had a chocolate chip cookie and it was alright. It was big, think and a bit crispy. I prefer my ccc to be doughy and chewy in the middle so this wasn't my jam. 
I'll be back because the cupcakes, albeit just a few bites, hit the spot! 

I live down the street and this place is always busy!
author: Jaclyn K.

description:
Dropped by for dessert and picked up a red velvet cupcake, one of my favorite flavors.  It was ever so slightly on the dry side, but had good flavor.  The cream cheese frosting was spot on - not overly sweet and just the right amount for the size of the cupcake.  It was the perfect texture too.

The decor is a throwback to the era of "Happy Days", as are the items on the menu - cakes, cupcakes, cookies, bars inspired by that time in history.  There are plenty of folks working here that were busy as bees.  They are really cheerful, bordering on being a bit too Disney-esque at times.  Helium anyone?  However, I will say they were really nice and was able to help everyone fairly quickly.

I would love to try some of their cakes, especially the coconut cake, which looked really good.
author: Melissa L.

description: Walked by this place after eating at Pacific Catch. Had to stop by after eyeing their amazing display. But I had to walk off my lunch so after a two mile walk around the quaint neighborhood, we walked back for some cake. The mini red velvet was delicious. We also bought a slice of lemon cake to devour after more miles of walking. Can't wait to come back tomorrow.
author: Wener V.

description: The cupcakes were very good and my daughter and I ate them all before we even got back to our car.  We wish that the store was a little bit bigger so that people could sit and eat their treats.  Overall, the prices were okay, but we're on the higher side of the cupcake places that we have seen in the past.  Don't buy too many because you will eat them all in one go.  We highly suggest this cupcake place by the bay.
author: Q K.

description:
From the moment I laid eyes on the german chocolate cake, I new it was a match made in heaven.  One of the best!  

I'm a little picky when it comes to baked desserts, since I've been baking from scratch since I was a kid.  Traditional german chocolate cake is made with a specific baking chocolate, butter, and buttermilk.  Their cake is made with quality ingredients and the texture is perfect as if it were homemade from scratch by your grandma.  Quality of chocolate seems really good.  Does not taste processed or commercial.  I thought the frosting (chocolate and the pecan/coconut spread) was perfect (not too sweet, but I do have a sweet tooth).  They have great american-style desserts made traditionally.   Keep in mind, traditional american cakes are 1) rich/fattening and 2) sweet. I think it's a cultural thing ;-).  Service is very good.
author: Angelique B.

description:
I sent an order of red velvet cupcakes to a client with whom I'd missed a meeting and to whom I wanted to apologize. Not only did the staff at SusieCakes follow up with me personally to find out about my delivery, they also followed up with my client on my behalf to see how the cupcakes were received. 

I was greeted by a card from the client the following week thanking me for my thoughtfulness and telling me how much the entire office loved the cupcakes.

It's rare to get that level of personal attention and customer care these days and I was knocked out by the staff at SusieCakes and their dedication. The cupcakes were great, but the service was something truly extraordinary.
author: Brandon C.

description:
I've seen this cupcake shop many times as I've passed it whenever I've been in the Marina recently. I finally was able to stop in and get some mini cupcakes. Chocolate and red velvet. I didn't realize how much my friend enjoyed red velvet, but it was delicious and pretty well priced. 

I'll have to try some other flavors sometime I go back.
author: Nina Y.

description:
absolutely love susiecakes!

everyone who works here is attentive, sweet (no pun intended) and peppy. the vanilla celebration cake with classic retro blue icing is what birthday cake dreams are made of - i mean, gourmet funfetti?! yes, please.
author: Mandy A.

description:
Are you in your 20's and feeling lost? Did you know stressed spelled backwards is desserts? Susie can help. She can help get you fat, yet happy. Damn, I thought I gained the Twitter15, but no, it's Susie!  She has succeeded in making all these marina chicks fat and having to wear Lululemon sweat pants. Me? No no no, I'm a cool Russian Hill chick, I wear jeans. 

I have to say this bakery is way better than Kara's. The ladies who work here are all very sweet and friendly, and not to mention they do a superb job. Kara's is always empty, Susie's is always full. Susie (brunette) totally kicked Kara's (blonde) butt and took all her business. Not only is there more options, everything is just so good! I still think That Takes the Cake has better cupcakes, but the cakes here, OMG!  You must try a slice of the Red Velvet Cake, German Chocolate, or the Coconut Joy. Also the Whoopie Pie or a Snickerdoodle Cookie.. So scrumptious!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Stopped here as part of a cupcake tour through the Marina/Cow Hollow district and this was by far my favorite stop!!! Our tour guide told us that this bakery uses European butter and chocolate. Omg the chocolate cupcakes....I generally prefer vanilla, but sampled chocolate and absolutely loved it! Bought two minis to take home with me! This was a pretty kid friendly stop and I noticed the little girls around us were admiring the "Frozen" decorated cakes, which were very cute. 

Highly recommend this spot!
author: Amanda B.

description: The blueberry is the best.Vanilla is ok too.Dont get the lemon.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
If you don't moan after your first bite of a Susiecakes vanilla celebration cake, you're seriously repressed. However, if you actually finish the whole thing, you should get checked for diabetes. Susiecakes' baked goods are like the chorus to your favorite song: if you listen to it once in a while it's incredible, but if you listen to it over and over, you will eventually ruin it for yourself. This is why I only come to Susie's about once per month, and whatever I get I cut in two and immediately dispose of one of the pieces. Because the first half of a cake slice or snickerdoodle is sure to leave me feeling high - but the other half is just as sure to leave me feeling faint. 

While it may seem that I am offering a criticism of Susiecakes in some way, I don't mean to. Every bite is simply too much of a good thing. And it only adds to the experience that the ladies behind the counter are just as sweet in disposition as the baked goods they proffer.  

Susiecakes, keep being you.
author: Evan B.

description: Love love love Susie's! The confetti cake is dense but with the most balanced icing. Not too sweet and a lovely shade of blue! I've had this cake on multiple occasions and it never disappoints! Everyone who works here is super helpful also.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: Crowded in this location but love it none the less. They gave me a free slice for my bday. I brought it back (by plane). It was so moist that security ran my backpack three times. Third time they asked me to open the box. Told them it's just cake!!
author: Karina H.

description:
Ummmmmmm...... Guinness cupcake with Bailey's icing? Sign me up!

Moist, delicious, had a creamy center. 

This review is starting to sound dirty. 

I want more.
author: Karen C.

description:
We passed by this place while walking around the neighborhood a few weeks ago. I had heard good things about it, so we decided to stop in and get something to share for dessert that evening.

We ended up with a piece of their celebration cake, (it's funfetti, but I'm guessing they can't use the name.) It was moist, but a little too sweet for me. 

The staff we really nice, even though they were slammed.

If i was craving dessert, and in the neighborhood, I'd stop by and try something else.
author: Amanda G.

description: Susie Cakes is amazing! Never had a bad flavor! Favorites are Red Velvet and Funfetti cake slices! I tend to get slices over the cupcakes as I think its better value for size, although the cupcakes in a box look great as a gift! The slices are worth two servings, so easily can be shared between 2 people and are around $6-7, and cupcakes are $3-4. Highly recommend!!
author: Catherine C.

description:
To date, my only real experience with this place is based on a single cookie.  This lone chocolate chip cookie was however quite a monumental cookie since I ranked it in my top 5 best cookies that I've ever devoured.  Perfect blend of crispiness & chewiness...cookie nirvana achieved.

Mark my gluttonous words, I will definitely be back to sample EVERYTHING!
author: Justin L.

description: Best cupcakes in San Francisco, and trust me, I've tried a lot of cupcakes in SF. Most places either get the frosting right and the cake wrong or vice versa, but SusieCakes gets both oh-so-right. The cake is moist and delicious, and the frosting--whether buttercream, cream cheese or otherwise--is the perfect amount of sweet and creamy. I won't be going to any other cupcakes shops if I can help it. I've found the best!
author: Laura B.

description:
I waited a little too long to order a cake for my partner's birthday, when I came across Susie Cakes and ordered a cake online.
