When I went to pick up the cake (a 6 layer, 9" chocolate frosted chocolate cake with writing on top), it was ready when they said, and I don't think I've ever encountered nicer people working at a bakery... which, honestly, was extremely surprising for a bakery in the marina.  Everyone in the store was super nice and friendly... and when I realized that I paid for gift wrapping (on the box), but didn't need it since the cake was being served at a restaurant, they were more than happy to hook me up with a couple cupcakes in place of the price of the gift wrapping.  Then, when I realized that I should get a few more cupcakes (for friends waiting for me in the park), they were totally happy to tell me about the different flavors they have.  

The cake was a HUGE hit at dinner... one of my friends even said "I don't even like chocolate, but I want to eat this whole effing cake!"  Yeah... and I LOVE chocolate, and I wanted to eat the cake, order another, and eat that whole cake.  It was beyond perfect!  It may or may not have been my breakfast the day after, as well... hah!

It feels weird for me, someone who avoids the marina at all costs, to recommend any business in the marina, but I'll most definitely be ordering my cakes from Suzie Cakes again and again in the future.  They're SO, SO, SO good, and they have got to be the friendliest staff I've ever encountered.  Order from this place NOW :D
author: Marquis K.

description:
The HOLY grail of cakes! Seriously, if someone asked me what my last dessert would be, it would be a slice of cake from this place. My friends visited from the UK and we sat in my car and just mmm'd and ahhh'd about our different slices. Carrot cake - WOW. Birthday cake - uhhhmazing and red velvet - just as you expect but BETTER..

I told my friend about it and she ordered a big cake for her sisters baby shower - just the best! 

Yay for Susie cakes!
author: Cassie L.

description:
I just want to share my sweet tooth adventures in the city. The place that I find myself stuck and always stuck at this little nook at the Marina District  area 
RED VELVET CAKE: Aside for being my most fave cake of all time- Susie Cake bakes the Best Red Velvet. Moist,  slightly tangy, and I recognized the underlying flavor. The cream cheese frosting,  have a good balance of classic sweetness but not so much that your teeth feel like they're about to stage a revolt. Super moist & Not hard to Love.
RED VELVET CAKE: Aside for being my most fave cake of all time- Susie Cake bakes the Best Red Velvet. Moist,  slightly tangy, and I recognized the underlying flavor. The cream cheese frosting,  have a good balance of classic sweetness but not so much that your teeth feel like they're about to stage a revolt. Super moist & Not hard to Love.
OLD FASHIONED 6-LAYER CHOCOLATE CAKE: Rich dark chocolate buttercream frosting, a tower cake. Another MUST TRY and its gonna get your head spinning! Try and you'll know what I'm talking about.
author: Spice Of Leia R.

description:
Amazing cakes, period. Delicious, moist, large slices of cake to share with someone else or just indulge all by yourself. The cupcakes are very good, and the pie has tasty filling (not overly sugary stuff other people make) and a nice crust, but the cakes are the star here. I tried 4 different kinds and they were all very very good. I recommend the carrot cake and the spot-on chocolate cake. My least favorite was the lemon cake.

Oh, and service was always awesome, lots of sincere smiles (rare these days) and very attentive.

Awesome experience, being there more than once, and will go back again for sure.
author: André S.

description:
Oh Susiecakes, where have you been all my life?

I was lucky enough to first experience these little pieces of heaven when I went cake tasting with my sister (the bride), her fiancé, and my mom.  The lovely lady who was helping us provided each of us with a sample of ALL of their frostings, six cupcakes to share, and four slices of cake to share.  As we started off with the frosting, I couldn't believe how delicious each one was!  The frosting choices are just the right amount of sweet and are whipped to such a great texture, not too runny and not too hard.  The cupcakes and cakes were just as yummy!  The cake had a great texture, was just the right amount of dense, and didn't crumble.  The cake flavors, marble, coconut/pineapple, and the celebration cakes were so good as well!  After the tasting, they boxed up the remaining pieces of cake and cupcakes (since there was so much!) so we could enjoy them at home.  

Soon after the cake tasting, I brought the lady there to try some cupcakes since I raved to her about how good they were.  She completely agrees and enjoys the lemon cupcake which is so tasty and refreshing.

I think the lady and I have probably been back to Susiecakes more then 10 times since my first endeavor.  Each time we've purchased something, whether it was a birthday cake, cupcakes for our cheat days, or most recently, a 7 layer bar (which are to die for!) we have never been disappointed!

Thankfully my sister and her fiancé picked Susiecakes to host their wedding cake bar!  Can't wait to enjoy them on her special day!
author: Jasmine S.

description: We go here all the time, and we cannot stop. It's just so good. Red Velvet, Celebration...the cakes are the best part, but the cupcakes are pretty good too. My favorite is the Red White and Blue and the Strawberry shortcake, but they are seasonal only.
author: Captain B.

description:
The counter staff was superb. They let you take your time and to have samples of whatever you fancy. They were especially kind to us and determined the best cake that would survive being locked in a warm car for a few hours while we went to a movie.

For an added bonus they even gave us some free mini cupcakes to devour on the 30 second walk to the Marina Theater.
author: Kyle K.

description:
Pretty sure the happiest people in the world work at Susie Cakes. Never have I seen a more cheerful team of blissed out bakers. They must be sugar high; every time I go in they welcome me with wide eyes, a free sample, and a smile. 

Wedding season was my first introduction to the taste of Susie Cakes and since then they have become a tried and true favorite. I love their Celebration Cake (who doesn't?), sugar cookies, and mini-cupcake treats. I have found every sweet produced by the bakery to be "rant and rave" fabulous . Even though the french macaron will always be my #1 go to treat.... Susiecakes makes for a delicious runner-up sugar fix. HANDS DOWN the best part about the business is their customer service. Warm, welcoming, and instantly charming, the Susie Cakes attitude makes the bakery a "Dessert Disneyland" for visitors.  Its a smart business strategy for when your smiling, sweets taste much sweeter leave you wanting more. In the end it works out well for us all! 

Feeling like a kid again isn't a bad thing.... "its a small world after all". Treat yourself with a visit to the "Happiest Bakery On Earth". Savor life and I can guarantee you'll live "Happily ever after" :)
author: Caroline J.

description: I needed a special cake for a baby shower for two 1st time daddies.  A friend had just raved about SusieCakes the week before so I didn't hesitate to call them. I didn't know exactly what I wanted as one dad is having a boy the other a girl. They told me they could do a onesie and put blue and pink polka dots on it.  I said sold! It sounded very cute to me.  We had the confetti layer cake with vanilla butter cream frosting... OMG, is was delicious.  I don't know what I expected but there must have been 6 layers on this cake, 4 or so inches high. The staff is great, so polite and fun on the phone.  I can't wait to try the other flavors.  We will order from SusieCakes again... hopefully soon!
author: Brenda G.

description: I've had Susie's Cakes before for a friend's birthday cake- the funfetti cake was to die for! I knew I had to have them make me a Barbie funfetti cake for my 30th Birthday! Well, they made the cake and I put the Barbie and cake toppers on :) The cake was delicious and so cute!! Exactly what I wanted- a fun confetti party cake. A big shout-out to Molly.. she was a pleasure to work with and made sure I was happy with the results! Because my birthday was the 2 days after Christmas, they were closed for Christmas break, so I had to pick up my cake Christmas Eve and it was still so good and moist! The entire staff at the Chestnut location was so friendly and professional when I went to pick up my cake. Mmmm writing this review makes me want some now!
author: Stephanie Z.

description: EVERYTHING! Don't even waste your time at other places. They say it's filled but it's not bad as I'm not an icing person.
author: Brandon B.

description: I really wish my stomach can expand to 3x its size so I can try everything in this store. Everything looked appetizing and it was really difficult picking just 1 thing, but I went with a slice of the banana chocolate chip cake. For $5.50 you get a HUGE slice! It took my boyfriend and I two tries to finish just one slice. The frosting wasn't overbearingly sweet, but we still scraped off some of it to feel better about ourselves. I'm adding this place as another reason why I want to move to SF!
author: Helen D.

description:
From the yelp reviews, it seemed like the red velvet cupcake was the thing to try so I got one and I was satisfied. The cupcake was moist and the cream cheese frosting was really creamy!

We also got a cookie and it was too sweet because of the glaze on top. It melted in my mouth but I like my cookies chewier or crunchier so it was different. 

There's no prices on the boards or anywhere. You have to pick up the blue menus to see the prices so look out for those.

$3 per cupcake or $5 for 3 miniatures. 

I got the miniatures because I like my sweets in small portions so the miniature cupcakes were perfect! They also sell their cakes by the slice if you prefer that. You can also get free samples of whatever they have out on the first tray you see when you walk in. We got to try the German chocolate cake. Delicious!
author: Connie Y.

description:
The great part about frosting injected cupcakes is that I can wipe off the top and still have the perfect amount of frosting to eat with my cake :)

I enjoyed the flavors of mocha, lemon, and upside down pineapple.

The red velvet and the chocolate chocolate were both a smidge dry.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
6" German Chocolate  
24 full size cupcakes

You do the math.  Its pricey but the quality is definitely there.

My adorable niece was turning 3 and I'm not a big fan of the cakes from Shen Kee bakery.  I dont know why my family like their cakes.  All natural is the way to go.  Sure, their cakes are pretty but it has a certain "plastic" taste to it.  Who knows how long its been sitting in the display case.  I wanted to try something different and I was never impressed with Kara's cupcakes so I gave Susie cakes a shot.

My only gripe? The frosting on top is enough but injecting the cupcake with more frosting is just overkill.  I'm sure others folks love it but I can do without it.  Parking in the Marina is horrible so take public transit if you can or come with a friend so they can circle the block while you're inside handling your bidness =P

Cupcakes were an assortment of pastel vanilla, lemon, red velvet, mocha, coconut, strawberry.

The German chocolate cake was super rich.  I was a bit skeptical when they suggested 6-10 servings but its rich and I was able to get 8 servings out of it.  The coconut added texture and complimented the layers of chocolate in the cake.

My niece really enjoyed the strawberry cupcake.  She loves cake but the frosting really won her over.

pictures for your viewing pleasure.
author: Sun T.

description: I do love to indulge in a cupcake from time to time, especially a sweet moist one. SusieCakes was pretty good.  I will come back again if I'm in the area (which I usually am). I liked that they sell cookies and slices of various cakes. The staff is friendly and oh so trendy in their red bandanas.
author: Court S.

description:
We were walking along chestnut st enjoying the vibes when we saw a line at the SusieCakes so we decided to try a slice. When we reached the counter, couldn't help but smile because everything looks so inviting. 
We thought try the cupcake for a first sample but the nice friendly guy behind the counter managed to convince us to choose the slice. I am sorry that i forgot to get his name because he was so knowledgable and helpful that we were glad we went back with a slice of vanilla celebration cake and german chocolate cake.  
German choc cake was super moist, excellent rich chocolate and more importantly not overly sweet. It tastes like rich quality ingredients. 
Same to be said about the vanilla, rich dense yet super moist.. Great choices

Overall, i know where to go for my birthday cake in may... No other cake will do now..
author: Nelle L.

description:
Best Cake I have ever had in my life and it isn't even close. 

Please carry the Cinnamon Roll Cake year round!
author: Raymond A.

description: Eighty-five dollars later buying one Celebration cake and a dozen cupcakes later, I thought that was a bit too much for sweets. My twins who celebrated their bday loved the Celebration cake (it looks lime green); however, I thought the frosting was a bit overpowering to the delicious cake itself. I noticed that our guests ate the cake but left quite a bit of frosting on the plate. The cupcakes were delicious (note it's $1 extra to get the Happy Birthday inscription on the cupcake and $3 extra to get the Happy Birthday inscription on the cake) and noticed when cutting it in half, a bit of the frosting is infused in the middle of the cupcake. Delicious cupcakes sans the abundance of frosting which may seem to overpower the overall cupcake bite. The employees were delightful and friendly none the less.
author: Joy E.

description:
Still 5 stars, but I have to sadly say that their carrot cake has significantly gone down hill since I first allowed its luscious, buttery goodness to roll around on my tongue -- we buy it at least 2-3 times a month, and the last few pieces we've gotten have tasted WEIRD -- someone accidentally upped the number of golden raisins in there by a factor of 40000, b/c now that flavor just blows the delicate carrot out of the picture -- I even e-mailed them I was so distraught abt this (I take being a fat kid very seriously / I only work part time....in a hospital....yay slashing the obesity crisis) -- and they replied (rudely) that there have always been golden raisins in there...but I am suspicious...my carrot cake memory never fails me...

Regardless, what IS still awesome:

- Marble cake (chocolate chips, a HUGE amount of frosting, which is the only reason to eat cake, clearly)

- Whoopie pie (2 chocolate chip cookies, 1/4 cup of vanilla butter cream, 2394823 calories = ambrosia)

- Seasonal banana cupcake (tender, moist), pumpkin cupcake (omg, I want all of these in my body right now)

- Seasonal apple cake (toffee-ish frosting, chunks of fresh apple in the cake, awesome)

I like most of their cupcakes, but find that they are too top heavy -- b/c they are frosting filled, they kind of collapse when you take a bite.  I think Sprinkles has the edge here, to be honest -- oh the new peanut butter cookie sandwich at SC isn't worth buying -- the peanut butter frosting doesn't taste like anything -- I've had it a few times, and from multiple locations, always such a tease that doesn't put out.

BUT -- if you have some dollars to spend and want to make a significant dent in "weight gain 2011", then go to Susie Cakes right now.  I will sorely miss it when I leave this state.  Wow, this got longer than I intended, and yes, I am abt to go to the gym. 

Oh, full cakes are around $40, slices are around $5, and cupcakes are abt $2-3.
author: Rachel N.

description: Tried two different flavors, the cake was dense in a homemade way, good cupcakes, but not the best I've ever had, and not worth driving out of the way for.
author: Ana G.

description:
Delicious cupcakes and fun seasonal flavors. What I love about SusieCakes is that it's not just a cupcakery, they also have whoopie pies, cakes, cake pops, cookies and all sorts of treats.

I love their seasonal holiday flavors to their old stand-bys.  Their mini-cupcakes are great for parties and they travel well.  Every time I've brought their cupcakes to a party, there are none left and the red-velvet cupcakes are the first to go.
author: Amy L.

description: Today I went by to pick up some cupcakes for an event at my store. I am totally happy I made the long drive across the bridge to get the cupcakes. They were delicious. The custard at the top was very rich and creamy. The flavors were very basic but basic turned delicious.
author: Ford W.

description: They have done it again.....Loved our wedding cake that Susie's made for our small intimate wedding on 11/7/2014.  We worked with Molly and the outcome was perfect.  My brother who is not a big cake person said "that's the best F-ing cake ever" and he had like 3 pieces LOL!  We had a Vanilla Buttercream/ Vanilla cake, so simple yet so delicious.  We saved a slice and put it in the freezer to have at our 1 year anniversary...I doubt it will last that long but we will try.  Thank you again Molly for everything, you guys are the best!
author: Theresa A.

description: Damn what can I say bad about this place! Absolutely NOTHING!!!! If you are on a diet and in clean eating mode, this is NOT the spot for you.I came here after having dinner one evening in the Marina as i have bookmarked on bookmarks for a place to try. Boy We were not disappointed. My friend had the redvelvet cake it was seriously on point and I decided to get their seasonal cupcake which was the Blueberry pancake cupcake.The cake was perfectly made and overall this had to of been one of the best cupcakes I've ever tasted!!! Susie cakes is the real deal and much props to the gal who hooked us up with a complimentary whoopie pie was also very delish. I am a fan for life!!!
author: Richard G.

description:
When I got engaged, I knew that I wanted SusieCakes for my wedding...and not because my name is Susan. I didn't want a flashy wedding cake. What mattered to me was the taste. 

Instead of a traditional, decorated wedding cake, we ordered five plain quarter sheet cakes (for a 115-person wedding) in different flavors and had them pre-cut by the wedding venue staff. We arranged them all out on the table and labeled it our cake bar. In the end, there wasn't any cake leftover! We had numerous guests confess that they ate every single flavor of cake. People were raving about it, and everyone had their favorites. Our flavors were: Peanut Butter Chocolate, Vanilla Confetti, Coconut Pineapple, Carrot and Red Velvet.

If you're in the camp of milder cakes, then SusieCakes is not for you. If you want a sugary, moist, flavor bomb in your mouth, then this is your place.
author: Susan P.

description:
Delicious! 

The cake here is really amazing. I'm not usually a frosting girl, but this stuff couldn't be any better - especially the red velvet - it's amazing!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Cupcake: 3.5 stars
Location: 3 stars
Service: 5 stars! Super nice staff.

This is why it is average 4 stars for me. To be honest, had much better cupcakes before (sprinkles!) but it was a sweet little shop with friendly workers so i couldnt give it below a 4 star review. check it out! banana nut was the best!
author: Thach N.

description: I love this place. I ordered the vanilla, strawberry, and red velvet cupcakes. It was delicious. The red velvet was not overly sweet which was nice. The vanilla was just the right amount of sweetness. The strawberry was a bit too sweet for me. I remember having their cakes and it is extremely sweet. I would recommend cupcakes over a whole cake.
author: Kelly O.

description:
Birthday cake is a big deal to me.  Really, you only get to pick the one you want once per year.  I was explicit about SusieCakes for my golden 30th birthday.

My first experience with SusieCakes was last year for my husband's birthday.  I worked in the Marina and always walked by.  He said he wanted chocolate chocolate cake, so I thought, why not?

For those folks complaining about the heavy richness, or the sugarbomb overdose, you clearly were not attending to the marketing.  SusieCakes is very clear- both at the shop and online- that they create good old fashioned, all-American baked goods with the highest quality ingredients.  If you are looking for some new-fangled, lightly sugared and delicately balanced confection, this is not the place.  Susie cakes creates that insanely rich, butter-based, Ghiradelli-chocolate-infused, why...please....WHY can't I STOP stuffing my face kind of cake.  

Talking 'bout this cake was sitting on the kitchen counter the day before my birthday, and I refused to resist the throwback urge to claw at the tape keeping the box closed, attack that mofo with my greedy claw and pound that puppy into my eager mouth.  The smell was intoxicating and the frosting was immaculate.

Talking 'bout this cake took a slam at a just-too-late red light and went from the seat to the floor of the car slingshot style.  Not only did it survive, but the frosting that got on the inside of the thick box top had leeched its buttery footprint onto the top of the thick box top within a matter of hours.  Thassome REAL buttercream frosting.

Talking 'bout they CALL you the day after you get the cake to ask you how you enjoyed it and if there is anything they can do to make your cakey experience more pleaasurable.

There is a reason why SusieCakes locations are found only in places like Menlo Park, the Marina, and Beverly Hills.  Rich folks wanna get they cake  on, and they're willing to pay the price for some classic, simple, high-quality delectability.  So if you wanna taste of the rich life, mosey on over to SusieCakes.
author: Elaine B.

description:
When 50 Cent says, "I love you like a fat kid loves cake," he might have been talking about the love I have for SusieCakes. They make my favorite layered chocolate cake here. The cake is moist but not too dense, the frosting is rich and creamy, it's unpretentious at what it is. A classic chocolate cake. Also, when you buy a slice, it's huge! I'm always on the lookout for a good cake bakery, and have often come away disappointed. But SusieCakes was one of the first in recent memory that made me take a step back and think, "whoa." They also sell a pretty wide assortment of cupcakes, but since I still can't get on board with the cupcakes, I'll just say they're pretty good. The lemon cupcake is all lemon, all the time. I have yet to try their whoopie pies or other cookie sandwiches, but I plan to. 

The people here were pretty friendly, the shop is not huge, but it is well stocked with all kinds of cakes and other goodies. Love it.
author: Saunders C.

description: This review is for the red velvet cupcake only. But I'm sure the rest taste just as good. The red velvet was moist and the icing wasn't too sweet. It was absolutely amazing and left me wanting more! Highly recommend them!
author: Carmen P.

description: I love all of their mini cupcakes . We ordered their vanilla celebration cake for our sons birthday party and till now our guests talk about how tasty that cake was. Everybody at susies is very humble and helpful.
author: Abhishek G.

description:
I was walking from Crissy Fields back to my car when my co-worker reminded me that SusieCakes was in the neighborhood. I had been wanting to try the red velvet since so many friends of mine had been raving about it. Of course I had to stop by! 

Fairly tiny shop on Chestnut St, metered parking can be hard to find depending on the time of day. There are no tables inside but a few small ones out on the sidewalk that are typically filled.

My Order:
2 Red Velvet Cupcakes
1 Lemon Cupcake

My co-worker (who is a huge fan of tart flavors) said she actually enjoyed the red velvet more than the lemon flavored cupcake. That was surprising in itself as she thinks red velvet is way overrated. The red velvet's icing is the cream cheese icing that is on the sweet side. Since I was craving something sweet, it definitely hit the spot. I can see how many would feel that it's too sweet though. Even the next day, the cupcake was still moist.

Very standard and safe flavors (i.e. chocolate, vanilla, strawberry, coconut, mocha, chocolate mint, lemon,pb&j, etc), it would be great if they had more exotic or unique flavor combos. Was disappointed they didn't have the key lime flavor they had featured for the month as that's my co-worker's favorite flavor as well =(

Would come back to try the marble and the German cake as they looked delicious!
author: Kitty K.

description:
~*~ Excellent selection, delicious cakes, great service~*~

The SF store is pretty small with a grand total of one seating spot...which may double as the customer service desk.  

Ordered:
One Slice of Vanilla Celebration cake (I'm talking five layers of vanilla and butter frosting)
$5.25

Festive cakes and cup cakes for all occasions.

Recommend unless you're on a diet.
author: Rimi K.

description:
I've tried a few of their cakes since my office is kind enough to order a cake to celebrate everyone's birthday. Lately there have been lots of birthdays so my semi-sweet tooth is in overload. 

I understand that quite a few that we've had are custom creations all of which have beautiful presentation and balanced in flavor. The carrot cake was particularly memorable!
author: Amy Z.

description: These may well be the best cupcakes I've ever had.  If you are a follower of the fou-fou, less-sweet, less-icing philosophy of cupcake, this may not be the treat for you, but if you want a contemporary version of beautifully made, old-school cupcakes with both delicious icing *and* really moist, tasty cake, this is the bakery for you.  SusieCakes cakes are perfect.  Yum!!
author: D D.

description: Ordered a birthday party cake just today and the cake is not good at all. Too sweet and too hard
author: Helina F.

description:
I've been meaning to write them a review but after consuming their cakes... its so hard not to be on a sugar high and just forget... but the time has come!

After eating lunch... sis dragged me to check out their goods... we ended up getting one chocolate cupcake for the nephew... chocolate chip cookie for her and a mini red velvet cupcake for me... 

Since it was mini... I ended up just popping the whole thing in my mouth... it was moist... light... and fluffy... and the frosting was delicious. 

We also had their marble cake (we weren't a big fan b/c it was really dense...) but their red velvet cake was delicious! 

I think this will be our go-to cupcake spot ... definitely not good for the diet but just work out harder the next day!
author: Cath M.

description:
Seriously guys, what is the hype about?

I visited this little bakery when in town and was extremely disappointed. After all the talk and raves, I was hoping for some decadent, moist cake that almost melts in my mouth, except it was the total opposite. Maybe because we came near closing hour but the slice of red velvet was somewhat dry and the frosting wasn't very whipped as well. After taking one bite, and one bite only, I was not a happy camper. Seriously, I didn't know that anyone can make a red velvet worse than Sprinkles, but yes, SusieCakes did exactly that. 

If there is one thing I had to compliment about though, the coffee was good. Other than that, I will not be coming back again. It is a true waste of my calories.
author: Luby H.

description:
Wayy too sweet for me. Not sure what all the fuss is about with Susie cakes. Tried the vanilla with chocolate chips and chocolate frosting slice, the red velvet, chocolate and vanilla cupcakes. I found them all cloyingly sweet and so did the husband.

Looks like my search for the best cakes is SF is still on.
author: Sandhya C.

description:
I know I'm the one in the minority, but I feel like I've really tried to like Susie Cakes. The reviews are great, but I've gone three times and every time I was very disappointed. My first time, I was with my mom and got a cupcake. It had the possibility of being good, but it was just very dry. I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt and go again. Maybe I just got the one bad one. It happens, try again. Second time, second cupcake, same thing. Third time, I really wanted some pie, but there isn't anywhere else in the Marina to get pie. So I tried the banana cream (one of my favorite pies!). The filling was good, but there was barely any in the pie. It was all crust and whip cream.

I just can't give SusieCakes any more chances. Three strikes and you are definitely out in my book. Kara's is MUCH better and just down the street.
author: Alicia L.

description:
AMAZING
the red velvet cupcake is the best red velvet cupcake I've ever had 
It's not too sweet , but super creamy (frosting) whoopie pie is also good 
A must go cupcake shop, they have cute cakes too .
author: Farin B.

description:
First time came here last year when strawberries were still in season and I had their strawberry shortcake ( it was fantastic!) a lot of their cakes, especially the ones that have fruits are seasonal. 

Since i had their strawberry shortcake last year, I dreamed of having it everyday, just haven't had the opportunity to go all the way to the Marina. Finally got to go there 3 months ago but was told that strawberry shortcakes were not available yet because strawberries were not yet in season :( totally disappointed! The staff I spoke to saw how disappointed I was and offered I try their strawberry cupcake on the house but it just wasn't the same :( 

So far I've also had their red velvet cupcake and celebration cake ( all delicious! )

I have to come back for that special strawberry shortcake!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
First things first: SusieCakes has the best mint chocolate cupcake anywhere. Not just in San Francisco (and LA, where they're based). Anywhere. It is, in my humble-but-widely-schooled-in-cupcakes opinion, the only one worth having. And it is well worth having.

Now that we've gotten that out of the way: SusieCakes is a delightful stopping point midway down the yuppie paradise that is Chestnut St., in the heart of the Marina. In addition to cupcakes, it is a full bakery, featuring cakes, cookies, etc. Their chocolate chip cookies are large, flat and dense with chocolate chips, not too raw or doughy. Their cakes, like their cupcakes, are delicious and extremely moist. And their cake decorating is pretty impressive too! Photos of some of their designs have made their way on to my Facebook page, because they're just that cool.

The cupcakes are a highlight for me, though. They have about six flavors, along with seasonal specials, which are always fun. I prefer Kara's versions of chocolate with peanut butter frosting and chocolate with coffee frosting; they're a little lighter, somehow, but SusieCakes is no slouch. 

Their cupcakes are LARGE, with plenty of frosting, and pretty sweet. Definitely recommended.
author: Kathryn M.

description: My friends have spoken nonstop about how amazing Susie Cakes is.. and they were right. We came into the marina location on Sunday and there was no line at all. We were greeted by the staff and helped right away. They even waited for me as I snap chatted the case, ha! We ordered a slice of the red velvet, marble, and vanilla celebration cake. I kid you not, my favorite cake in the entire world is yellow with chocolate frosting. Susie Cakes has the best marble cake, EVER. It's so yummy, moist, and not too sweet. The frosting isn't overpowering and is the right texture. I'm glad I only got 1 slice, because I probably could eat a whole cake by myself. Definitely my new favorite bakery in the city!
author: Diana P.

description:
SusieCakes does not ever disappoint!  I love this bakery and when I lived over seas in Asia, would seek out the nearest SusieBakery when i traveled back to California.  I was able to have the deliver to my hotel in Santa Monica from their Brentwood Bakery.    I have recently moved back to the bay area and visit the Menlo Park or SF location once a week.  I have a SC addiction and would probably visit more if I could.  

Here are some of my favorites :

1. A slice of the  Chocolate cake...Chocolate Heaven is the best description.  OMG, its super moist and the right deep chocolate taste.

2. A slice of the Celebration Cake..never too old for this sweet cake that makes me feel 16 again.

3. Peanut Butter Nutter...Peanut Butter sandwich cookie between a heap of pb buttercream frosting.  Get in my Belly !

4.  Mini chocolate cupcake and Mini vanilla cupcakes...Never too guilty to eat more then one since they are the perfect "cupcake decision maker"...I eat them to decide on what dessert I will eat next!

5.   Seven  Layer Bar - Nice with a cup of coffee.  Great the next day even or forgotten in the fridge for a couple days...When you reunite with this 7 layer bar, happiness is all over your smile.

6.  Good 'ol Chocolate chip cookie - the perfect marriage of chewy brown sugar texture and yummy brown buttered gooooodness.  The perfect companion as you drive home.  Hits the right spot and oh so soft and yummy.

7. Banana pudding with nilla wafers. - Better then mom ever made.

8.  Lemon Squares - the lemon curd is a knock our success .  Great for the pucker up!

9.  Pumpkin Pie - All the right spices and nothing short.

My go-to's are the mini chic cup cake and vanilla mini cupcakes, nutter butters and chocolate chip cookies.  I promise you will want to go back to try more then what you take home on your visit.
author: Sandra L.

description:
Ridiculously good.  I've been meaning to stop in for quite some time now, and finally came around to making it in today.  I ordered a vanilla and red velvet cupcake.  Both are really delicious.  Just the right amount of sweetness (maybe bordering on a little too much, but hey, these are cupcakes).

On some cupcakes, the icing and the cake aren't really a complementary affair, they just seem to be arbitrarily matched together.  These cupcakes really tasted like the whole cupcake just made sense/went together.

Definitely a top-notch place to get cupcakes in the city.
author: Mel G.

description: I'm writing this review knowing I'd give this place another shot. The cupcake I tried just didn't jive with me - i wasn't a fan of the dense buttercream and filled center. I would definitely prefer Kara's cupcake around the corner if I were craving cupcakes. However, I would be willing to try their cakes and other assortment of baked goods because they looked and smelled delicious. Although rare for me, I'm willing to give this place a second chance.
author: Asmita J.

description:
My goodness - SusieCakes wins the award for the most buttery cupcake frosting ever. I LOVE IT.

What makes a great cupcake is the mastery of both the cake as well as the icing. I love some bakeries for their icing and some for their cake. However, SusieCakes has perfected both - the cake part is moist, fluffy and soft while the icing part is creamy, buttery and sweet without being overbearing.

I highly recommend the notorious red velvet and the slightly less-publicized vanilla cream cupcake. They also have them in cake form in both small and large sizes. I've bought some for mother's day and birthdays before and they have served as a unanimous, surefire hit!

So definitely stop by SusieCakes in the Marina to quench your cupcake lust or satiate several guests' cravings with some delicious cake. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
I am a fan of SusieCakes no matter what. I was having a craving for some of their sweet treats and since I wasn't in So Cal, thought I would give them a call to place an order over the phone. I talked to Erin and she was extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. I was able to order a Vanilla Celebration cake and Chocolate Marble Cake a few cookies for pick up later in the day. I prepaid to make sure the items were put away and waiting for me. 

When I arrived, everything was ready to go and boxed perfectly. I even had to make a quick change to my order and it was handled flawlessly and with a smile. The staff here offers impeccably friendly service and is the next best thing to their delicious treats.
author: Brandon C.

description:
The only reason I had any desire to come into SusieCakes is because my mothers' name is Suzy (close enough to Susie), and since I was away from her visiting friends, I thought it would be a cute photo opp.
I sure was glad we decided to stop in, though, but it was too hard to choose only a few goodies-everything looked simply scrumptious!
After a few minutes of tough decision-making, we finally purchased a Fluffy Coconut Cupcake (my friends' choice) and the chocolate cookie Whoopie Pie (my choice). 
I would have never chose the coconut cupcake, as there were so many other yummy looking cupcakes and I'm really not on fond of coconut, but this cupcake was delicious! The only place you really taste the coconut is the coconut flakes on top of the icing, and maybe a hint in the icing. The base of the cupcake was a yummy vanilla cake...I really enjoyed the little bit that my friend let me try!
My choice, the Whoopie Pie, was GREAT; It was a good size cookie Whoopie pie too, so I was generous enough to share a little bit. The Whoopie Pie was a signature item, so that helped me to make my choice. It was basically two big chocolate cookies, and delicious ones at that, and sandwiched between was a layer of a white buttercream frosting that wasn't overly sweet, but will definitely satisfy your sweet tooth. 
While I highly recommend the two treats that we ordered, there are TONS of other cupcakes, cookies, etc. to choose from-everyone will definitely find something yummy here!
author: Brianna B.

description:
I ordered 20 cupcakes online (on my iPhone) yesterday morning for pick up this morning, and it was so easy!  I got an immediate emailed confirmation, and when I sent an email back asking if I could pick them up earlier than designated, I got an immediate response back that it was no problem.

Most importantly the cupcakes were an absolute hit!  I chose five flavors- lemon, chocolate mint, chocolate vanilla, strawberry and red velvet- and within 10 minutes after opening the boxes there was not one left.  

I've already decided that we'll be ordering from them for our upcoming wedding after how easy the process was, and how popular they were.
author: Tracy M.

description:
I dream of SusieCakes!!!!

I know that SusieCakes serves cookies and cupcakes, but I can only comment on the quality of their cakes and they are tremendous! Over the past two years we have ordered one of their cakes for every birthday/cake-related party and we have NEVER been disappointed. The yellow cake with chocolate frosting, the celebration cake, the red velvet are all soooooo yummy! I can't wait for the next family birthday party!
author: lura m.

description:
SO HAPPY there's a SusieCakes in NorCal!  I used to get it allllll the time in LA.  My favorite cupcake flavors: red velvet and strawberry.  Love their cream cheese frosting.

However, the cupcakes at this location seemed a bit off.  Maybe it was just today but the red velvet was TOO bright red.. a bit unappealing although it was still moist & tasted good. The cream cheese frosting was a little too soft, had a melted texture.  I still love SusieCakes and will try this location again, hopefully on a good batch day!
author: A C.

description:
$16 got us one pastry, one slice of cake and one Whoopee pie. That is pretty pricey if you ask me....but hey, this bakeshop is in the Marina so expensive prices are expected. For the price we paid, I think we have had better (and more) baked goods from other shops.

The Whoopee pie is really sweet but I like theirs better than Teacakes Bakery. I like how the cookie is crunchy in the outside but soft in the middle. I have tried whoopee pies where the cookies are stiff like Oreos which is why I like theirs the best. The cream filling is smooth and it helps tone down the strong chocolate flavor of the cookie.

The sweet tart (heart shaped turnover) was not fluffy and was kind of chalky.  I would have liked it better if there was more of the fruit filling. I liked the browned crust with the sugar sprinkled all over the top.  It gives it that sugary crunch which I like in desserts.

The almond joy cake (my favorite out of the three items we bought) is super moist and tastes exactly like the candy. The chocolate icing has a really smooth texture and I really like the almond bits. The cake had just the right amount of sweetness and I like the frosting embedded in the middle of the cake.

The ladies at the counter were very friendly and were helpful in making recommendations.  Next time, I want to try their Red Velvet...it looks like it's a Sheeple approved item and maybe they're right.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
I got a small size cake from here (marble with chocolate butter cream frosting) plus 2 cupcakes for the hosts for a birthday get together for three family members who are just days apart. They wrote Happy Birthday w/ all three names I needed on the cake and Happy Birthday on the cupcakes...so cute! I had a slice and it was soo yummy. It was a hit with everyone! Even my "I'm not a sweet tooth" dad cleaned his plate.  

The customer service is absolutely amazing everyone was really nice and helpful. Although I live in San Jose, I will def be back to visit the next time I'm in the neighborhood to get a slice of another cake or two I had my eye on.
author: Nique A.

description: Delicious mini-cupcakes for our wedding. Their cake tasting was ridiculously awesome. They let you try everything in the store, even the brownies. The mini-cupcakes ended up being half the price of a normal wedding cake, which was one of the few places where we got a good deal on our wedding necessities.
author: Kate S.

description: Cute little shop. Bought the red velvet cupcake, guinness cupcake and a mini vanilla cupcake. My favorite was the red velvet. It was moist. Frosting was delicious, could have eaten a bucketful of it! Nice service. Go try the red velvet cupcake!
author: Nina G.

description:
I had a nice day walking up and down Chestnut Street and popped in here for a treat. The shop is small and very cute. There were tons of things in the case that were appealing, but I had to remind myself that I was a few hours away from heading home.

The lady working behind the counter was fabulous and agreed that the banana pudding I was tempted to buy for my husband wouldn't hold up without refrigeration (note to self for next time). I ended up getting a banana cupcake, a molasses cookie and a snicker doodle. The cupcake and doodle were taken home to the family and I nibbled on the molasses cookie while strolling down the street. 

I have to give this place great credit for a fabulous molasses cookie. It was soft where it should have been and crisp in the right places. The flavor was spot on and the drizzle of frosting was perfect. I truly appreciated the cookie being called the right thing as well as I am tired of molasses cookies being labeled as "ginger cookies" elsewhere. Truly a great cookie and I think I smiled a little more with every bite. 

To be honest, I wish I hadn't gotten the cupcake or that I had eaten it soon after purchasing as the frosting got shifted and a little too warm by the time I got home. We all agreed it had more texture of a muffin than a cupcake but the flavor was good. Husband really enjoyed his snicker doodle and I would get another one of these for him should I be in the neighborhood again. 

Yay for good bakeries and this one is a winner!
author: Tam F.

description:
We ordered our wedding cake at SusieCakes and were so happy.  Five stars  for service and price oh and the cake was really good.   SusieCakes is one of the few bakeries that does not price their wedding cakes by the slice.  We ordered their red velvet  and a half sheet of the vanilla cake with coconut filling.

We worked with Megan, SusieCakes celebration specialist.  She was very accommodating during the tasting (which we were 30 minutes late because of traffic).  She gave decent portions for tasting and gave us some treats to go.  We gave Megan a specific design for the decoration and it was well executed.  While I was not there for the delivery of the cake, I heard no complaints from my wedding coordinator so it's safe to say they delivered within the requested time frame.

I recommend SusieCakes any day of the week  I just love how friendly everyone is at SusieCakes.  I stopped by there a few months after my wedding to pick up an order  and was greeted very warmly by Megan and her team.  She even introduced me to the baker who worked on our wedding cake.
author: Johannah P.

description: Make a bee line here EVERY time I am in SF. Whoopie pie and coconut cake are faves. Everyone working here is SO lovely and helps me get through my indecision. Too many delicious things to choose from!! Also great for special events cakes. Highly recommended.
author: Clare G.

description:
I ordered a red velvet cake for Christmas Eve, and it was delicious! Unfortunately I think I ate WAY more of it than anyone else - loved every bite, waistline has really expanded. Oy. 

The most impressive thing was the call I got several days later, asking if I had liked the cake and hoping I had enjoyed it and the holiday. Ok, you have got a customer for life Susie Baby.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
The red velvet and chocolate mini cupcakes are amazing! They stay super moist and the frosting doesn't crystalize. Make sure to enjoy right away! If not, store outside not in the refrigerator. 

Delicious little delights!
author: Kiran J.

description:
Amazing cupcakes. They are taking spot #2 on my cupcakery list. (Sift and their Samoa will be forever #1). 
I also tried their chocolate cake...yum. 
Even though I personally prefer their Lafayette location, the cupcakes are solid! Try the peanut butter one!
author: Conny F.

description:
LOVED their chocolate chip banana cupcakes. Super moist with the perfect amount of chocolate bits. Frosting was not too sweet which can always kill it. 

Also tried their peanut butter cookies with peanut butter cream in between but it was a lil dense and dry. 

Not too much variety with flavors, pretty basic stuff.
author: Rosalynn D.

description:
Came here to order a custom birthday cake for my wife's birthday dinner. The whole process was quick, painless, and easy. My wife is a big chocolate lover, so I had to go with the "classic chocolate" cake. Toward the back of the store is a desk and computer where someone can help you personalize and customize your own cake. I forget the name of the person who helped me but I have found everyone here to be extremely helpful and courteous. 

After some short discussion, I opted for the classic chocolate cake covered in pink icing with white, brown, and black polka dots and a big ribbon in front. Fearing that I would damage the cake in transport, I asked them to have it delivered to the restaurant where we were having my wife's dinner party. Initially, I was fearful that they would forget the date, the cake wouldn't come out quite the way I envisioned, or that it would be damaged during delivery. All of those concerns ended up being in vain because everything was perfect! The cake looked gorgeous and tasted even better...and I don't even like chocolate anything! It was the hit of the dinner party and most importantly....my wife loved it! 

I won't lie...the custom cake was a lil pricey but I'm willing to pay more for a quality product and exemplary service.
author: Derrek O.

description: The sweets place to go, I love this place. Great service, excellent cakes, yet I must stay away. My inner chubby kid is hopelessly addicted.
author: Dawud H.

description: As an avid baker, I am usually disappointed with bakery-made cupcakes but Susie Cakes is the best! Plus, their old fashioned chocolate on chocolate cake is a birthday wish come true :)
author: Rachel C.

description:
The red velvet cupcake was delicious. Moist & a right proportion of cream cheese & sugar in their frosting.

The strawberry cupcake was just OK. Personally, the frosting on top would have sufficed but there was an added shot of frosting in the middle... so it was slightly overload for my taste. I would have preferred a strawberry preserve filling or something other than the frosting.

The decorations on the cupcakes weren't that fancy but still looked cohesive.

The store doesn't have any seating options but it's a great pick up and go location.

They even gave me a cute little Susiecakes magnet!

Bakers here are very friendly and the service was fast.
author: Mary Y.

description: The carrot cake is the bomb! The best tasting carrot cake that I've ever had. Service is sweet and fast. This place could be seriously addicting.
author: Happy C.

description:
I don't care what the yuppie set says, SusieCakes is the real deal and blows Kara's Cupcakes out of the water by a landslide of cake batter.

SusieCakes is exactly what cake and cupcakes should be like: decadent, sugary sweet, sinful and mouthwatering. I cannot get enough of her confetti cake, sweetheart cookies (sugar cookies smooshed together with some kind of frosting) and strawberry and lemon frosted vanilla cupcakes. 

If you're going to waste calories on such sinful stuff, do it right and do it at SusieCakes when roaming Chestnut. And kudos to the two tables outside when you can't wait to dig in.

I don't have babies or a husband, but SusieCakes is already booked for all my showers and celebrations.
author: Meredith R.

description: Amazing carrot cake!! I hope they make the 'seasonal' carrot cake cupcake into a regular!
author: Tony G.

description: Stopped in here on a weekday after a run on the Golden Gate for my birthday. 2 slices of cake were purchased: red velvet and chocolate marble. I also saw a lemon bar that I couldn't live without. Now, I have had many lemon bars in my life, as they are my favorite, but this one definitely "took the cake." Amazing. Perfectly sweetened, and not too sweet. Best by far. The chocolate marble cake was moist and bursting with flavor, super sweet. Yum! I didn't eat the red velvet cake, but was told it was heavenly, frosting was amazing and not gritty at all. Dense cake with a light flavor. I'll definitely be back here for their lemon bars!
author: Marina T.

description:
Amazing cakes with wholesome natural ingredients. 

We had mini cupcake (vanilla and chocolate), carrot cake and cookies. 
Frosting was real butter and was not too sweet. Chocolate cupcake was especially good and carrot cake was as moist as it should be. 

Cake slices are generous.

My birthday cake is going to be ordered here. Love it even though its expensive.
author: Rutuja K.

description:
The best cake I've ever eaten...and I've eaten lots of cake!! 
They whipped up a gorgeous two-tiered wedding cake on two day's notice. It was beautiful and delivered on time to the reception site. The cake was white with a strawberry middle and white frosting. Sounds so simple but was literally the best cake ever. I drool at the thought of eating there again!!!!
author: Alzira C.

description: I love love this bakery. The vanilla cake is king. The whoopee pie is a bit heavy but delicious. I cannot walk near this store without getting something. My entire family is hooked.
author: Randy S.

description:
We got these cupcakes delivered to work. The decoration was very amateur. It looked homemade with glops of frosting and some simple lettering that spelled out congratulations. As for the flavors, I tried red velvet, chocolate, and white chocolate raspberry. They were okay but nothing special and the frosting was overly sweet 

I wouldn't mind trying the other products at this bakery like pie, pudding, etc but I will never order their cupcakes.
author: Alice J.

description: Their chocolate cupcakes are THE BeST! Always go out of my way to stop here when I'm in the marina. I've had their cakes and the chocolate was amaaazing, funfetti no good though. Solid iced sugar cookies. I really wanna try their whoopie pies!
author: Carly M.

description:
Ordered the old fashioned 6 layer chocolate cake for a birthday celebration the day before the event as I ran out of time to bake which I love to do. So moist and the perfect blend of rich chocolate. Super decadent as each bite melts in your mouth. I will surely order again for a special occasion! Loved the gold numbered sparklers in substitution of candles. They were a big hit with the kids and adults at the party. 

Also the homemade look of the cake with blue writing and multi jewel colored dot sprinkles all together gave the cake a retro look. What a great find as all my guests raved and some couldn't resist and went in for seconds. 


Highly recommend  this bakery!
author: Julia T.

description:
Space is cute, if small. There isn't much in the way of space to sit if you're planning on just eating your purchase(s) on the spot.

But the people behind the counter were super nice and friendly, even though I came in at the end of the day, so props for that.

The cupcake I got wasn't particularly outstanding though. I'd put it on the better side of good, but not great.
author: Amanda S.

description:
I only go into SuzieCakes once in a blue moon. If I went in often you'd have to roll me out. Absolutely delicious... The red velvet cupcakes are delicious and the cookies are great. I have never had a cake from here so my review is based on cupcakes and cookies. 

The staff is very friendly, and helpful if you have any questions. I was there earlier today and Riley helped me pick out some delicious treats. She was super friendly and very helpful. :) I definitely will go back soon, and then for a run.
author: Adyson S.

description: Incredibly friendly staff. Cake slices and cookies are good. I couldn't get certain types of cakes for questionable reasons. Once I was told there was an egg shortage. Another time I was told the cake is seasonal. Still would go eat here any day.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Frosting is the big win at SusieCakes...tried the lemon, chocolate mint, vanilla and red velvet cupcakes on Friday night, and the frosting both on top and inside the cupcake was magic.  The cake in "cupcake" at Susiecakes has been done better in many other places, like my favorites, Georgetown Cupcake in DC.  And there's no discount for buying a dozen of these, which is always a negative in my book.  But otherwise, a happy surprise, thanks to other Yelpers for pointing me in the right direction!
author: Justin B.

description:
Finally! My first review!! After much consideration of who was going to be my first, I decided on SusieCakes. Now let me tell you why....

SusieCakes is amazing. Amazing doesn't do it it justice. It's more amazing plus phenomenal plus decadent with a hint of OMG. I have yet to have something I didn't like there and I have tried many things.  SusieCakes is my weakness. I can't walk by and not stop in. And it's impossible to only get one thing. The hardest part is limiting to get only two things. 

The Cupcakes:
For me, it's all about the icing. And their icing is perfect. It's fluffy but not so fluffy that it's like eating air. And there's a good scoop of icing but not too much that's it's all you taste. But in my opinion the best part is the tiny bit of icing that's piped into the cupcake itself so no matter what angle you bite into, you get a perfect mixture of cake and icing.  The red velvet isn't too decadent that you have a stomach after. The chocolate is relish but my personal favorite and go-to cupcake is the vanilla. And I'm not a vanilla kinda girl but it's so good I can't not get it. 

The whoopie pies. Now I've never had a whoopie pie elsewhere but all future whoopie pies will be judged open this masterpiece. The cookie is so soft and moist and the cream is so perfectly fluffy and not too sweet. The best part, when you take a bite, the cream stays in place. Nothing irks me more than taking a bite and then all of the insides spewing out of the cookie.  It's stays nice and even while eating the whole thing.  

I can go on and on talking about all the different things I've tried there but one last thing.  The mini pies. I've had one of their berry crumbles which was perfect. I heated it up in the oven and oh my gawd. Wow. The crumble crust. No words can describe how good it is. And then the key lime pie. The crust. The meringue. I'm drooling just thinking about it. 

All and all, if you're walking by SusieCakes and are debating whether or not to go in, do you and your stomach a favor. Don't question. Just go in. Good luck trying to decide what to get, but don't worry, no matter what you get, you'll be happy.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
Strawberry Frosting Filled Cupcake
- very sweet and frosting tasted like the strawberry cream in the yan-yans or on top of the pocky.   wished it was a little less sweet and a little more cream cheesy
- cupcake - no where near as moist at Kara's cupcakes.  the top portion of my cupcake was clearly dry and over cooked
- overall an above average quality cupcake - same price as Kara's but certainly not better than Kara's

i just wanted to take it to-go on a napkin, but they had no napkins, so they just handed the cupcake to me on a thick paper plate.  i considered that a complete waste of resources.  

even in my hypoglycemic sugar craving state - i still did not enjoy this cupcake much.  maybe i should have ordered red-velvet.  perhaps thats what i will try next time, if there is one
author: Tina A.

description:
Friendly staff, great location, plenty of options.

I had the coconut cupcake, red velvet, and chocolate. Each one was sublime. The staff was friendly and it's nice that it stays open until 8pm.
author: Tomas P.

description:
What the hell. Marble cake dry. Carrot cake didn't taste like carrots. Frosting slathered cakes that are left to dry out on top of a counter under a cake glass that gets removed every second from the slew of people who don't mind paying top dollar for dried cakes and a stale $5 rice Krispy treat. My boyfriend and I had a better experience from a vending machine earlier that day...thank you Kellogs. 

So many people were excited in line so we also got a cheese cake that tasted like plain pudding filled with air. My boyfriend just kept saying why. If you want delicious pastries go to b.pastierre. Over paying here is a waste. Two slices of cake, a mini sour cream cheesecake and a stale Krispy treat will set you back $21. Your better off with a carafe of sake from chotto
author: Zaviera R.

description:
Susie Cakes is my absolute favorite cupcake/I really deserve this/this is why I'm fat/totally worth it cookie store in San Francisco.  They are amazing.

My favorites at the moment:  WHOOPIE PIE!  - delicious chocolate brownie cookie with white frosting-puff cream in the center - tastes like straight heaven.  Tied for first with the whoopie pie is their NUTTER BUTTER sandwich - damn, that's final i'm going to grab one of those bad boys after work today.

Ladies who work here are the sweetest, super cool and also recommend/will do your picking when you're torn between a few.

I've had their marble cake too - flipping delicious.  Need to try:  birthday cake and seasonal items - they have pumpkin banana bread pudding - oh yum.
author: Jana S.

description:
I usually don't like to mention other places in reviews, but I think the best way to describe the cupcakes here is: a little denser than Kara's, a little lighter than That Takes the Cake. Some people like cupcakes light while some likes it thick and rich; this is an inbetweeny.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Great place, great eats, and great service! I almost wanted to give 4 stars because:

The only thing that sucks is the parking-- but it's not their fault, so 5 stars it is.

They have cupcakes, mini's, and cake slices. Standard classic flavors that are delish.

It is a bit of a drive and parking sucks but they are sooo good!


Nom nom nom nom nom ^___^
author: Tammy H.

description:
This is an update to a review I posted about 6-months age.
My daughter celebrated her 23rd birthday this weekend and asked that we get her birthday cake at Susies.
I called to place the order and the young lady who assisted me provided clear and detailed information about the cake options available.  She also gave great suggestions for decorations.
When I picked up the cake, I could not have been more pleased with the tasteful birthday decorations .
When the cake was served, we all agreed that it was one of the best cakes we had ever eaten.
Brava, Susie!
Bravo
author: Kevin W.

description: Amazingly fresh cupcakes, cookies, and pies.  The cream cheese frosting on the red velvet cake was perfectly cream cheesey.
author: Michelle R.

description: BEST CUPCAKES EVER! I order them for every birthday in the office simply because I want them myself. The peanut butter and chocolate ones make me want to jump up and down with joy.
author: Brad W.

description:
The presentation of the cupcakes with their trademark frosting didn't excite me as cute or pretty like some of the other cupcakes establishments in the city.  

But, I still ventured to try two of their cupcakes.  The coconut and red velvet.  The frosting was much too sweet for me, and I found the cupcake itself a bit dry.  I was quite disappointed.
author: stephanie c.

description: Cake is soooo good here. I tried the carrot cake and a vanilla cupcake and the icing is so amazing.  The vanilla icing was the best.
author: Lauren P.

description: My fiancé and I absolutely loved all the wedding cake options!! The cakes are absolutely delicious and prices are very reasonable! We worked with Gentry Woodward, the Celebration Specialist in the Menlo Park location, and he was extremely helpful and accommodating and gave us so many great ideas. Highly recommend Susie Cakes in general and the amazing wedding cakes!
author: Jasmine T.

description:
To me? NWTC - Not Worth The Calories

I wasn't blown away by the variety of flavors here or the red velvet cupcake. The frosting was very good but the cake itself was too dense. It reminded me of something that had sat out a few days and just wasn't THAT tasty.
author: Nate S.

description:
The red velvet cake was so bombbb! Okay I have to admit, before going here I looked at the yelp pictures for their red velvet cupcakes and definitely underestimated their taste. I honestly did not expect their red velvet to be that great. Every bite kept me wanting to eat more and more of the cake! I am so tempted to go back soon to get another slice! 
I yelped this place because I needed a cupcake bakery that opened on a Monday (since most of them are closed) and I needed cupcakes for my housemate's birthday. 
I REALLLY REALLY like this place! I have the biggest sweet tooth and this place definitely satisfied my cake craving. I bought chocolate cupcakes and red velvet cupcakes and she liked them just as much as I did!
author: Katrina T.

description: I had a piece of their lemon cake today. It was the best lemon cake that I have ever had. I have a serious sweet tooth and anything lemon I love, but this was fantastic. It was that perfect combination of tart from the lemon and sweet from the icing. I will definitely go back.
author: Mark W.

description: By far the best cupcakes in San Francisco! My friend bought me some for my birthday and when I took a bite out of it I died and went to cupcake heaven. I love how the cupcakes are filled with frosting too. My favorite cupcakes are the red velvet and chocolate.
author: Ali C.

description: Best cake in the city. I always get cakes from here for birthday parties and decided to try them out again for a co-workers last day. I got the red velvet and was able to get the cake 10 minutes before they closed the night before I needed it. Which was awesome. The cake was super dense and was an absolute hit. Everyone at the office said it was the best cake they have ever had.
author: Lisa W.

description: A cupcake is a great way to end the evening.  We went in here right before they closed tonight and I got a mint chocolate cupcake.  The cake was super moist and tasty. The icing was sweet and minty.  Overall a great cupcake and a place I would stop in to again if I were staying another night.
author: Nicole B.

description:
2.5 Stars: This bakery is pretty ordinary.  I had passed by here, heard good things (had several friends order cakes/cupcakes for birthdays) and stopped in once for a red velvet cupcake, which was good (not dry like many cupcake places, but rich).  So I decided to order a cake for my boyfriend's birthday.  I decided on the 6" classic marble cake since he isn't a fan of red velvet/cream cheese frosting (what a freak!).  I ordered over the phone as I hadn't seen the order form online.  I asked a few questions about the cake which I had not found on their menu.  The woman I spoke with was very nice and helpful.  I was slightly disappointed to find that the "Happy Birthday" was written on the side of the cake. This is not something it says on their menu (only on the online order form) and I was not informed of this over the phone.

Being a baker myself, I really wasn't impressed by the cake.  The buttercream frosting was good but overly sweet and the cake was overly rich/dense.  I understand that SusieCakes is going for that homemade look/taste but I was pretty disappointed with the way the cake looked.  You can still do the homemade thing and make it more professional.  The frosting looked good/average but the marbling was very messy looking (YES I understand it is a marbeled cake but the layers looked sloppy).  Very average cake decor, I would expect much better for a bakery that specializes in cakes/cupcakes.

Overall for $36 for a 6" cake, I found it pretty overpriced/average quality.  I was told a 6" cake (as the menu doesn't say how many layers) would feed 4-6.  For 4 people, that's $9/slice which seems pretty outrageous to me when it was a basic cake I could have made at home.  Now this would be 4 VERY large slices but even if you consider a 6" cake feeds 6 people, this still seemed overpriced to me.  Susiecakes appears to be a good bakery to order custom cakes (the pictures online are impressive) but for your average birthday cake, you won't find anything spectacular/unique about this place.  I would go elsewhere.
author: Devin W.

description:
Tried their flourless chocolate cupcake. Nope, didn't do it for me. Not dense enough, not chocolatey enough. 

That's all I have to say :( oh. And no where to sit too. Only like 4 chairs outside.
author: Kayla O.

description:
I consider myself a cupcake connoisseur, so I tend to be quite picky with my cupcakes. The best cupcakes ever, in my mind, will be Crumbs Cupcakes. That being said, I think that the cupcakes from SusieCakes Bakery offer a nice cupcake if you want a simple and traditional cupcake. 

These remind me of the cupcakes at Kara's Cupcakes. However, they are $0.25 cheaper. I chose my standard choice for cupcake tasting: a vanilla cupcake with vanilla frosting. I bought the one with Tiffany Blue icing. SusieCakes, you get points for dying the frosting to be my favorite color.

Although these cupcakes are a traditional size, something that IS innovative about this cupcake is the fact that they add a little dollop of frosting IN the cupcake. It's not a "frosting filled" cupcake-- as how they advertise it but, instead, it offers a little creamy frosting on the inside so the cake doesn't become too monotonous.

The cake, at first bite, was pretty moist. However, I found it to be a little dry as I started to eat more of the cupcake. I believe the top was more moist because of the frosting. The frosting was not overly sweet and it did have a nice texture. My favorite part was the frosting (and the color)!

SusieCakes Bakery is very cute, but it's small! Be prepared to be jostled a bit while ordering your cupcake by other customers who are trying to sneak a peak at all the cupcakes.
author: Gabriela K.

description:
It's taken a few years for them to make it up here, but Susie Cakes of LA has finally opened up shop in the Marina!

As most people know, I'm a sucker for red velvet cupcakes, and Susie Cakes does them right. Perfect frosting to cake ratio, moist cake and yummy cream cheese frosting. Plus, you can get them as mini cuppies or a large cake. Now that's what I'm talking about!

I can never go on a diet as long as they're located next to Blue Barn. Even after getting a salad, I can't resist sneaking over here to get a box of minis.
author: Connie C.

description:
i've had their cupcakes and i think they are great, 
but this review is for their BIRTHDAY CAKE only, which was AWFUL!!!

1. they chose the color, a nice seafoam green color, but then chose SOLID RED frosting to write a plain "happy birthday". no frills, no sprinkles, like i see in other posted pictures.  this cake was an eyesore from the beginning.

2. the cake was thinly layered, 6 layers to be exact, but why were the layers of frosting were thicker than the ones of cake?? (see picture). it tasted like we were eating a slice of birthday frosting. was there supposed to be light spongy cake somewhere?

3. the worst part was the OVERWHELMINGLY sweet butter frosting. i love sprinkles cupcakes so theres nothing wrong with sweet frosting. but this was just way too much of it, everywhere. i dont know that anyone in the office finished their slice. had the frosting been light or milder in flavor, maybe the cake would have worked even with 6 layers. definitely not the case here.

4. lastly, it was a funfetti cake, which was delicious. but since the cake was sliced down so much to near nothingness, the green frosting mixed with all of the funfetti spots and the whole inside of the cake was a slightly odd, ugly color of mush.

:( 

i hope no one has to have a 'cake' like this again. i did not order this cake but i suggest against it, or specify less layers/lighter on the frosting.
author: bonnie y.

description:
The best cake I've tasted in a long time! 
A popular item for get a special together.
author: Erika N.

description:
Every year my Mom asks me, "What kind of cake would you like for your birthday?" and rather than asking her for chocolate cake with vanilla frosting, I answered with "cupcakes!".

Susiecakes makes some verrrrrry delicious cupcakes. My Mom ordered a few cupcakes so that there would be enough for the whole family. She ordered red velvet (my favorite!), chocolate with vanilla frosting, and chocolate with mint frosting. I only tried the first two and they were nothing short of amazing. Susiecakes makes their frosting with butter and none of that fake buttercream crap thats made out of lard that you get at Safeway....eek! 

I haven't gone to visit Susiecakes but I will definitely make a stop there next time I'm in the Marina. The presentation was so cute and the cakes were so delicious that I can only imagine what else is in that bakery.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I tried the mint chocolate and red velvet cupcakes. Both were very good even after a few days and comparable to Sprinkles. The frosting to cake ratio was perfect.
author: Kien M.

description:
THE CONFETTI CAKE IS THE BEST!!!  Admittedly, I've tried German Chocolate Cake, coconut cake, and a couple pies, and I've never been disappointed.  BUT the confetti cake is my go-to.  I've bought it for birthdays, graduations, etc.  I will say, for some reason it tastes better as a round cake than a sheet cake, but even the sheet cake rocks my world.

They have a very friendly staff and a cute storefront.  I've never had a bad experience.  I recently moved, and I'm sad I'm no longer within walking distance of this delicious bakery.

Note:  They are a family business, so they will not write derogatory language on cakes, but if you want that sort of thing, you can always figure that out on your own.
author: Brit M.

description:
I admit it. I'mma dessert snob. My latest obsession has been my cupcake adventures, which consist of snagging an over-priced, but iresistable cupcake at each new cupcake store I happen to pass by.

My latest victim: SusieCakes. 

A cute little storefront with an even cuter interior, and 4-star reviews on Yelp? I definitely HAD to try this!

Unfortunately, I wasn't to impressed with the actual product. While I thought the frosting-filled approach was a neat touch, the overly sweet frosting topping the cupcake was more than enough. The interior frosting just resulted in frosting overload. Very few cupcake bakeries manage to perfect the fine art of a light, fluffy, and not overly sweet frosting. SusieCakes needs another lesson in the frosting department. The actual cake portion of the cupcake failed, as well. I hate to say it, but it felt like a boxed cupcake. I know, I said it. =/

On the bright side, the bakery was super cute with a bunch of cupcake-related knickknacks being sold in the front, and the bakery in the rear portion of the store. Bonus points for that!

I'd still choose to take my cupcake urges elsewhere..
author: Mansi A.

description:
Martha Stewart recommended (see the sign: http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/8L1XAZ1UY4v8ffLxjaURQQ/l).  She picked the strawberry cupcake as "one of her favorites in the whole country."  

Once you step inside, it smells like...sugar, lots of sugar.  They bake on site and everything's made from scratch.

The cases are filled with layer cakes, cookies, pudding, cheesecake, bars, whoopie pies and brownies.  It looks like an old fashioned, retro bake shop (reminds me of Magnolia Bakery).  Their frosting filled cupcakes have a homestyle look.  They had about 12 kinds of full size cupcakes (coconut, strawberry, peanut butter, lemon, vanilla, chocolate, chocolate mint, etc.), no minis, $3 each.  They also have cute letterpress greeting cards.  

* Strawberry cupcake ($3): the vanilla cake is tender, dense, heavier than usual, it goes well with their thick, smooth frosting.  The pretty pink frosting was very sweet but also tart - it smelled just like a strawberry lollipop (I kept the bag just to sniff, I would wear that scent).  I wish they put it in a box instead of a bag.  I think there's too much frosting.  The cupcake (frosting and cake) is very heavy, rich and dense.

* Molasses cookie with vanilla frosting drizzle ($2): Big, thick soft cookie, with plenty of cloves, cinnamon, molasses.  It was good, cake like, not that special though.

What I really like about this place is that you can get cake slices ($5.50).  

Saturday (June 26) they'll have their grand opening/sock hop celebration from 2 - 5 PM with 50's music, activities for the kids, prizes and tasty free treats.
author: Lolia S.

description: One of the best red velvet cupcakes I've ever had. Love it. They have locations in souther and Northern California!
author: Nancy H.

description:
The cake is a bit dense for my and my husband's taste (close to muffin-like sometimes).
The frosting decor looks like you could have made it yourself at home sometimes...
Just ok for me.
author: Nam D.

description: The coconut cake was amazing.  It was moist and buttery. Very large slices. Definitely made to share. Around  $6 a slice, but worth it. My husband had the carrot cake. Delicious as well. Kids love the vanilla cupcakes.
author: Gina V.

description:
Great cupcakes. 

Superb carrot cake. 

Awesome German chocolate cake. 

I even hired SusieCakes to do my wedding cake... and it was perfect. Delivered on time, exactly as discussed with their baker, and tasted fantastic. 

If I could give a bonus star I would.
author: Peter C.

description:
I was actually very excited to try Susie Cakes but it turned out to be a big disappointment.  With cupcakes, it's either make it or break it for me and unfortunately, Susie Cakes broke it...

Bought a red velvet to share with a friend. After cutting into the cupcake we noticed was that their red velvet had an intensely bright red color. Very odd for a red velvet. Being a baker, my friend thinks there is little to no cocoa powder in the cake batter. 

I will admit though, their cream cheese frosting is awesome! So rich and creamy that I couldn't get a good taste of the cake. My friend then took a bite and pointed out that the cake itself does not taste like a red velvet cake. I gave the cake a second try. She was right! It does not taste like a red velvet but more like a pound cake -only it's not spongy but crumbly.

Yes Susie, I'm very sorry too...
author: Jenny K.

description:
Um... Yum!

I needed a last minute custom cake for a friend's birthday.  I called and talked to Susie about what I wanted (something with a golf theme) and sent her a couple of pictures about things I thought were cute and voila!  A great looking (and freaking delicious) cake was ready and waiting for me!

I did not get a chance to sample any of their ready made yummies but I think I'll go back to see what I may have missed.  :)
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
Wow wow wow. 

Cute bakery with a great selection of cupcakes, cakes and cookies!! 

Martha Stewart gave her stamp of approval for the strawberry cupcake. I had to try. I did. I was blown away. Moist and tasty. Great sweet flavor of strawberry but not overly sweet. It had just the right amount of frosting. Light and airy. Yummy! My favorite was the chocolate cupcake. I love love love chocolate and this satisfied my chocolate sweet tooth. It was super moist and the chocolate frosting was un-be-lievable!! So chocolaty and light! Everything about it screamed homemade. Reminded me of those cupcake sales at school but on a grander scale. I felt like a little school girl again. 

If you don't feel like a cupcake, they have cake slices readily available. Red velvet cake slices, anyone??? 

Snickerdoodle caught my eyes but I have to save that for later. 

SusieCakes is now one of my favorite sweet spots in the city!
author: Molly T.

description:
3.5 stars.

I stopped by after lunch after walking around the area with a friend. We had been looking for a dessert place for a while, and when I spotted SusieCakes', I practically drooled with excitement, especially when I saw several people sitting in front with huge cake boxes. The two small tables in the front are a good place to sit and enjoy your treats, as well as the weather, which was nice that day (7-25-11).

The selection for treats and cupcakes wasn't as large as I expected, but it wasn't bad, either. I noticed immediately the Blueberry Pancake cupcakes, which surprised me, the chocolate chip cookies, and the Sweetie Pies and Sweetheart cookies, which all looked yummy. The cakes on display had me wishing that it was my birthday so that I could have an excuse to buy one; they looked lovely and delicious.

After pondering for a few minutes about what to get, my friend decided on the Neopolitan cookie and I grabbed a Whoopie Pie and Red Velvet cupcake to go (I was saving them to share with my family).
