My first bite of the cupcake had me reeling with delight. Instant 4 stars - it was fluffy, moist, and not too sweet, which is an issue I've had with many a cupcake. The frosting was a bit sugary but it was a lovely accent to its red, cakey counterpart. The batter wasn't too red as well; I find the rich, deep red of usual Red Velvet's disconcerting, as they hint of a bit too much food coloring, so I was very pleased with this cake's shade :)

I would go back for the cupcakes, but I'm not sure if I could say the same about the Whoopie Pies. I found it much too sweet and rich, and though I'm glad they don't skimp on the vanilla buttercream, it overwhelmed the taste of the chocolate cookies sandwiching it, which I think I might have enjoyed more on their own. It's definitely too much richness to eat alone, or maybe even to split, without suffering from a dessert coma, but eating a small portion is fine.

I am a big fan of good service, and this place was definitely friendly, though perhaps a bit too much? My friend and I were asked three times if we would like to order in the span of the few minutes we were in there, and I felt a little embarrassed for taking so long. Perusing the options in peace would've been nice, especially since there was no line waiting, but I did appreciate that the staff was attentive.

I would still recommend SuzieCakes' Red Velvet cupcakes, which is one of their most popular  treats, but the rest I'll have to recommend if/when I return!
author: Tina Y.

description: The cakes here are really really good. You can buy a single slice, which is huge, and it is super moist.
author: Carmen T.

description:
thank goodness for iphones...the trio in my backseat each searched on yelp for a bakery in the city which served slices of red velvet cake...after a few phone calls, we ended up at SusieCakes.  yum!  

the 2 girls behind the counter were awesome...they tolerated our group's madness quite well...(we can get pretty loud at times...haha).  one slice of celebration cake and one slice of red velvet cake please!  add 2 hot coffees and 2 iced coffees...which they brew fresh to order.  awesome!

both slices of cakes were delish and moist...the red velvet was the definite winner!  apparently, martha stewart loves their strawberry cupcakes!  that'll be on the list for our next visit.  oh, and they also sell whoopie pies!

great service, fresh coffee, and moist cakes.  can't go wrong here!  oh, and pick up a free cool magnet!
author: Jen W.

description: SusieCakes did the most amazing job on our wedding cake!!!  Our guests are still talking about how amazing it was.  Molly, their celebration specialist, was a joy to work with.  Their pricing was reasonable and the cakes showed up looking even more perfect than we could have imagined.  The tasting was also free and they loaded us down with cake to take home.  SusieCakes is the way to go for any wedding or event.
author: Megan F.

description:
I think great cupcakes are just the right amount of sweet and decadent. I had heard great things about SusieCakes, but I just don't think we can ever really get each other. Their cupcakes are so sweet and that really isn't a good thing. The filling inside and on top.. it's just really overkill. To my disappointment, their cookies were nothing special either. Would I go back and pay $$$ for their baked goods. No. 

Food aside, their service was horrendous. The lady I interacted was rude. There was nothing Susie about her!
author: Rosa L.

description:
Moved into a new apartment down the street and had to the chance to try a cupcake as well as the cheesecake. 

Cupcake: Disappointing. I was really hoping for something that stood out from the crowd, but this definitely wasn't it. WAY too much frosting and the cake wasn't very moist and decadent. It also looks like something I can make at home, and for 3 bucks a cupcake it should look a little nicer. 

Cheesecake: Great! It was sour cream topping which really balanced the sweetness of the cheesecake with the tartness of the sour cream. I will be coming back just for this.
author: Zara H.

description:
I think this shop competed on the Food Networks Cupcake Wars and I don't remember if they won or not but  I had to judge for myself... after all, I am a sweets connoisseur ;)

The shop is small and cutesy, the selection of flavors is divine and although I didn't try them all, the two I ate were SCRUMPTIOUS. One Chocolate and one Red Velvet- super moist, not too sweet, cooked perfectly and the frosting was HEAVEN. Honestly, I cant remember eating a yummier cupcake... Wish I had one now  :)
author: MsMichele P.

description: We went later in the day, and weren't too excited by the cup cakes. We felt they were a little dry, and way too sweet. The people were incredibly nice so 5-stars to them!
author: Veeral S.

description:
I've been here alot over the past five days and that's saying alot this place.
Taking over my beloved Moonstruck Chocolates and my not so exciting Miette's space, I was a-bit apprehensive. Well, the votes, eh... visits (and still going...) are in!

Nice and friendly staff!
Good coffee and teas though the coffee tends to cools pretty quickly for a sipper like me.
Cupcakes better than Kara's, "tasty and very moist" she remarked. Being a border-line diabetic myself, I gotta watch my sugar somewhat and the rich buttercream is aliitle much for me.
My favorites are their snickerdoodle and chocolate chip cookies.
We also very much enjoyed their Lemon Squares.

For the time being, Susan (aka Susie) and husband are there for a little longer to assure the launch is a success. I think they'll have nothing to worry about. Product and staff seem A-1 to me!

Check 'em out!
author: Ed L.

description:
Goood lord. Amazing.

Best cupcake iv ever had. Really do I need to say more? I do? Fine! The cake was perfectly mosit and just melted in your mouth and the frosting was perfect mix of creamy, sweet, and rich in a way that each helped the other perfectly. Perfect flavor synergy.
author: Tom O.

description: Working with the team at Susie Cakes was a dream. Assigned with ordering a custom cake for our corporate event, Molly was attentive to our needs, responded quickly to all inquiries and requests, and even gave us a drawn proof of what the cake would look like for our approval process. Plus, it was delicious and everyone devoured it.
author: Desiree P.

description: Went in for dessert with a group of friends. The cookies were delicious. Ordered the molasses cookie but got the chocolate chip instead. Had to go back to exchange. My friend had the vanilla celebration cake and we all shared it. It was delicious and moist.
author: Shelly P.

description:
Every time I'm in the Marina, I feel guilty if I don't pop over here for at least a cookie or cupcake! It's just that I'm not gonna get this kinda quality elsewhere! :-) 

Favorites: Cheesecake, Pumpkin Cheesecake, Molasses Cookies!
author: Jessica H.

description:
I think this is my new favorite bakery.   I have yet to get something i don't like, which is rare because I feel like most bakeries have a standout item and everything else is just mediocre.

cupcakes: I usually get their mini cupcakes and have tried the vanilla, chocolate and red velvet. all are yummy, but i like the red velvet the most. they aren't too sweet and it's a perfect amount of frosting.  they are moist and a perfect texture.

cakes: i've had the celebration cake and it really reminds me of a gourmet version of a betty crocker cake. i know it doesn't do the cake justice at all, but it really tastes a lot like betty crocker type of cake but 100 times better! it's really pretty (many layers, beautiful pale green frosting with confetti in the cake) and fun to look at too!  i've also had the strawberry shortcake which is amazing - the perfect mix of cake, fruit and cream.  the chiffon cake is so light and moist and the cream isn't overly heavy. such a yummy combination.

pie: i just had the key lime pie and it was soooo delicious. i love pie crusts and this graham pie crust is to die for (I think it's either graham or cookie crust).  The filling is a perfect tartness and creaminess and combined with the crust just makes every bite heavenly (I got the mini-pie so there was lots of crust)

Walking into the bakery just makes me happy. it's a modern retro decor and everything just looks so good. i can't wait to try more of their treats!

Overall, I think this is your all-american bakery rather than a french patisserie.  It can get a bit pricey though, but if it was more affordable, i might buy even more which would not be good for my diet =)
author: Eleanor C.

description: This place is going to be my wedding cake place some day. I am in love with the red velvet cupcakes. I think what my favorite thing about this place is that they are not overly sweet but still taste amazing. Just what I go for when I'm craving dessert! I've ordered specialty cupcakes for the superbowl and they were exactly what I expected. They also have a great selection of mini cupcakes in case you want to try a few :)
author: Amanda L.

description: While visiting San Fran I searched for the closest cupcake spot  to lighten my mood after a failed shopping excursion. It was shortly before they closed, so the selection was pretty sad. I got a chocolate cupcake w/ peanut butter icing & my husband got chocolate w/ choc icing. His was definitely better than mine, but neither blew us away. They were fresh & the icing was pretty tasty, but nothing to remember or come back for. The cake part of the cupcake was pretty bland. I was torn between 2 & 3 stars, but settled on 3 since I did come right before closing when the selection was bound to be low. But this cupcake snob will search for other options next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Ellen D.

description: Delicious cupcakes. I wish the filled cupcakes were filled with a flavored curd rather than the same frosting that's one it. It's  less cupcake and more cream.
author: Wildeflower M.

description: I have only tried the "Vanilla Celebration Cake". However, I have tried it on at least four separate occasions! It's delicious, sweet, and creamy. I like that it has rainbow colors of sugar confetti throughout the cake. Good for all occasions! Adult bdays, baby's first bday party, and just being in the neighborhood and wanting to celebrate life or whatever day you are having. $6 for a slice, but it's a big slice.
author: Laura F.

description:
Out with my girls and had some awesome soul food, now we needed some desert and a good conversation to catch up from our busy lives...after calling around and reading Yelp! reviews on Red Velvet Cakes we drove across town to SusieCakes Bakery.  Man-O-Man!

Red Velvet Cake Slice, Congrats (???) Cake slice, 2 iced coffees and 2 hot coffees=$18.00 Good deal!

2 huge slices satisfied 5 dessert cravers.  Mellow atmosphere and helpful staff.  Not too pushy in selling the delicatessens, for one thing, the name pretty much sells itself, so it's a definite plus to have a smiling face that's eager to help while servicing the guest at hand.  Seats right outside the store with the great atmosphere of Chestnut St in SF.  Awesome treat when you look through the window with all the creative Halloween decorated cakes and cupcakes with a sweet reward in every bite.  

Susiecakes you ARE the business.
author: Edrian D.

description:
items I got:

chocolate chip cookie. a-m-a-z-i-n-g. perfect hint of salt to balance the chips, excellent brewed coffee or latte complement

chocolate cake. SUPER RICH AND MOIST. yes, i said "moist". deal with it.  

peanut butter cookie sandwich. crumbly, extremely peanut buttery. light and fluffy peanut buttery whipped cream. 

EXCELLENT GIFT/HOUSEWARMING/PARTY GOODIES 

although i wouldn't be the happiest camper to get a muffin top from devouring these sweets myself, I certainly wouldn't regret it either. W O R T H I T.
author: Thankie S.

description: 4 stars? 4? If it were socially acceptable I would buy all the cakes and cupcakes in the store and make a bed out of them. And then eat the bed and start again. Cake is moist, frosting is the perfect amount of sweet and the cookies are...well they're frosted. Some are even 2 cookies with frosting holding them together. Take that Oreo. I would give them 6 stars if I could.
author: Mark D.

description:
The banana pudding with nilla wafers is not gluten-free, (offending nilla wafers can be removed, but cross-contamination makes it definitely NOT ok to eat for Celiac's.)

But REJOICE!  The butterscotch pudding is all gluten-free deliciousness, people!  And it's as rich and sinful as you remembered it from your childhood.  The baked goods are also pretty tasty and will overload your sweet tooth.

Overall, this is a cutesy little shop, overflowing with happy, smiley people and food.  Cultish cupcake goodness that fits right into the Marina vibe of Chestnut Street.
author: Kristina R.

description: The most delicious cupcakes in town! And the nicest people too. I ordered (many) dozen mini cupcakes for a retirement party at school. We couldn't have been more thrilled. All varieties were delicious - vanilla, chocolate, flourless, and red velvet. Look no further - this is THE place for cake!
author: Kath T.

description:
HEAVEN! I love this place! I had only been to the So Cal locations before. When I found out that there is one now in San Francisco (and soon one in the South Bay! We just need one in the Walnut Creek area) I was thrilled! Cakes, cookies and all kinds of treats. Just try it once and you will see.

The employees are extremely nice and helpful. I always see them making wedding cakes that look really cool. I'm sure they taste as good as they look.

Worth every star. : )
author: Steven P.

description:
I got a Susie Cupcake as a gift and what a nice yummy surprise it was! I think it was cranberry cupcake with vanilla frosting. Oh heaven. It was so yummy, I pretty much drunk the whole thing. Frosting has the perfect texture and cupcake is so moist. Not too big, not too small, just the way I like a cupcake to be. 

Now I see all the other Susie Cupcakes on the website and want to try different flavors. It make a wonderful treat for yourself after a long day at work, or a cute gift for your friends.
author: Tomomi S.

description: Hey, a cupcake place. That bite costs you about $3.50. Those 4 bites costs you about $6. But, for that price tag, you'll get tasty bites. You can pretty much close your eyes and point and get a nice mouthful of caky goodness. I like the chocolate mint personally.
author: Joe A.

description:
I work right around the corner from this place. My coworkers and I are huge fans of Susie Cakes. the price is bit lower than Karas and the frosting filled cakes are delicious. My favorite is the red velvet, the seasonal pumpkin, strawberry, and the lemon made with real lemon juice! The also have some pretty awesome chocolate chip cookies. 

When we have special birthdays or events for our coworkers we usually come by to get a box of susie cakes to share. a few times one of the lovely ladies at susie cakes have dropped off some of their cupcakes for us too! thank you so much susie cakes!!! xoxo
author: Natassia S.

description: My first time here and they did not disappoint. Their cakes are so moist and flavorful. I tried their strawberry cupcake and red velvet. Although their frosting can be a tad bit too sweet, it seems to balance well with their moist cakes. Their prices are pretty normal just like other places, but I think it's worth it.
author: Faye F.

description: Delicious cake and baked doggie goodness for my pup's birthday. What's not to love? Service was great. Convenient Chestnut St location. Highly recommended.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Susie Cakes...oh how I love thee!

So far, I haven't met any bakery that can make a Peanut Butter cupcake like the girls at SusieCakes! Not only is the Peanut Butter cupcake yummy (and my ultimate fave), everything else I've tried is delicious as well. The cake is so moist (which is very important), the frosting is better than any word I can come up with...it's just plain YUM!

My son and I find any reason to make a trip to the Marina for some yummy cupcakes.
Not only are the cupcakes good, but the girls are super nice and friendly. They make the entire experience worth it.
author: Tiffany F.

description:
Susie Cakes--woohoo! If you want moist cakes in traditional flavors, seasonal cupcakes, whoopie pies and sweetie pies then this place should satisfy your sweet tooth.

The +'s
+ Reception is friendly and prompt. Have your order ready or step aside for those who are ready.
+ Glass cases are replete with cupcakes in mini and regular ($3) sizes. Consider strawberry, chocolate mint, mocha and the seasonal ones such as blueberry pancake batter cupcakes which are divine! They taste like raw batter but it's safe and fun to eat. Packed with blueberries!
+ Buttercream frosting is really good but can be slathered on a bit thick for my taste. No biggie. Just scrape it off to your liking.
+ Cakes are moist and fresh. Personal favorite is the marble cake which is a mixture of chocolate and vanilla--accented with chocolate chip morsels! Others include red velvet, carrot and tropical coconut. 6" and 9" rounds go for $33 and $46 respectively.
+ Can't eat the whole thing then get a slice ($5.50) which is quite a generous slab.
+ Sweetie pies are heart shaped mini pies filled with seasonal fruit. They run $5.50 and are a great alternative to those who are not the cake types.
+ Custom cake orders are welcomed. Check their work in the glass cases and the photo gallery online. I had a marble cake frosted in pink and white. Came out beautifully!

The -'s:
- Seasonal cupcake flavors don't last. Sigh. 
- Wish they had coffee from Blue Bottle to pair with my sweet cravings
- No seating area to enjoy your sugar high.

The TIPS *:
* If you are into the seasonal cupcake beware that the flavor will change monthly and end a few days before the first of the next month.
* Get on the email list and you will get a free cupcake on your birthday!
* Consider having your cake decorated with fondant designs at etsy.com. I had Susie Cakes provide the cake and minimal decorations at a decent price
* Call ahead of time with your order if you don't want to hunt for parking. They offer curbside service! Sweet.
author: Yiven C.

description:
Cute little shop with the wonderful sweet aroma of baked goods.

Service-very patient, friendly, and quick.

We ordered:

chocolate mint, lemon, red velvet, and something else.  Out of the four I only had the chance to try the lemon cupcake.  I loved the frosting because it had the right balance of lemon and sweetness.  The cake itself was good, but not as moist as Love At First Bite in Berkeley.

I also tried their coconut cake.  That was very moist and fluffy, but the frosting on that one was a little on the sweeter side than I'd like.

I'd definitely come back if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Michelle S.

description:
I really like SusieCakes!  I think their baked goods are delicious, and I love that they are made from scratch with natural ingredients!  That is extremely important to me.  I tried a molasses cookie today that was amazing!

The women that work there have always been lovely to me.  They are super friendly and kind.  Only one time did I have someone serve me that wasn't as nice.  SusieCakes always offers little tasters which is generous & a great way to find what you like.

I really respect that they are very open to feedback.  Apparently they are always tweaking their recipes which shows that they are committed to making their cakes as yummy as possible.

My only suggestion is to change the frosting on the Tropical Coconut Cake.  I think it's way too sweet and overpowers the coconut & pineapple.  This cake is so beautifully made and has such wonderful ingredients and moistness, but I couldn't taste the coconut or pineapple nearly enough and would rather have those flavors dominate the cake.  The frosting should only complement the cake and not be overpowering so it needs to be much more subtle in my opinion.  Maybe they could try a pineapple cream cheese frosting : )

Anyway, SusieCakes is wonderful to have in the neighborhood!
author: Paula M.

description: Absolutely love Susie Cakes! Their cupcakes, cookies, and cake slices are absolutely delish and they offer excellent customer service. I've ordered from here in advance (for bday parties and baby showers) and have picked up last minute on my walk-home from dinner. It never disappoints in flavor and in taste. Susie Cakes- your cake aint gonna eat itself, please open a location in Denver!! :) :)
author: Ashley S.

description:
3.5 stars for me..

I had lunch a few stores down and saw SusieCakes! Because I was too full, I just bought two cupcakes ($3 each) boxed to go. The price of the cupcakes were nowhere to be found so I only bought two... wish I bought more! I was scared they were going to cost $4+ each.

First of all, I wonder why Martha Stewart thought SusieCake's strawberry cupcake is the best in the country? That thing was WAY TOO SWEET and had a really sour aftertaste. Yuck... I couldn't even finish a quarter of it and kept eating morsels of it throughout the day.  Otherwise, I loved the fluffy and not too dense consistency of the cake part. The frosting really overpowered the cake part. 

The second one I bought was the mint chocolate cupcake. This one was goooood! Sadly, the next day, I opened the box and found that both my parents ate 95% of the cupcake. Three pathetic bites for me :( But I can see why... they couldn't resist eating more! (and me wishing I could have a few more bites!) I liked this one a lot better because it wasn't too sweet, just right. I savored each bite, a bit angry at myself for not hiding my precious treasure.

Next time I'm around, I'm sticking with chocolate and the simple sounding ones... I wish I bought more to give to my parents, too... Lesson learned.
author: Janet H.

description: We got a visit from Susie herself and dropped off some goodies for! Great desserts, service and simply good people! Red velvet with 49er logo on the cupcake ready for Super Bowl.
author: T L.

description:
BEST CAKE EVER!  I got the vanilla celebration cake (i.e. confetti cake) and it was WAY better than any cake I've ever tasted. Full of flavor, heavy, moist and beautiful. Everyone at the party was raving about the cake and the mini cupcakes.

QUICK
I called four days before a birthday party and they were able to make me a 9" cake and mini cupcakes. 

EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE
I called 3 hours before picking up the cake and asked to add 12 more mini cupcakes and they easily did. Had them ready for me when I picked up and even offered to help walk me to my car since it was just me with three boxes.

NOT EXPENSIVE
A lot of other places were charging me much higher prices for what I think would be less quality. I got a 9" plus 24 mini cupcakes, enough for about 35-40 people (they say the cake is 12-18 but it's two layers so thin slices will serve more peole) realistically, and it was only $90.

I will come back here over and over and over again. I even want to go now and get my own whole cake just for myself. Ummmmmm
author: Cassy R.

description: The celebration cake I brought for a boys bday was the biggest hit! Super cute AND yummy. You can buy by the slice as well.  Coconut cake is a fav also, cake and pineapple filling not heavy or too sweet, although the frosting will satisfy any sugar addicts sweet tooth.
author: Poppy C.

description:
Boyfriend and I came here after a trip to Tacolicious. We ordered two cupcakes to go since our hotel was {unfortunately} in the Tenderloin area. 

Boyfriend went to change clothes and by the time he came back, I had devoured my Red Velvet cupcake. 

Yum. 

The cake was moist, but not too heavy. The frosting sweet, but not overly so like some  {Spinkles....ahem...} others. 

Definitely recommend.
author: Anne W.

description: Heaven!  The best cupcakes ever!  Vanilla and red velvet are my top favorites.  You cannot go wrong here.  The cupcakes are delicious and customer service is impeccable.  They also have easy online ordering.  Thank you SusieCakes!
author: Elena H.

description: Hands down my favorite slice or cake in the city. Nothing holds a candle to a giant piece of their yummy moist celebration cake :p I always like to pop in to see what their seasonal cakes and cupcakes are which can vary from a pineapple upside down cake, to a moist white cake with fresh berries inside yummy! Just get here early to make sure nothings sold out.
author: brianna t.

description: I happened upon this place walking down Chestnut the other day and decided to give it a try. I bought one each of vanilla, red velvet, strawberry and lemon cupcakes (the first two were mini's). When I got home I ate the first two which weren't all that bad, though the frosting tasted store-bought and the cake was a little dry. The lemon and strawberry cupcakes were completely indelible. I took a swipe of frosting from each one and they both tasted like cough syrup or powdered drink mix. I threw out the cupcakes (and almost literally my money). I realize that this review will probably het flagged but i wanted to share my feelings, anyway. Sorry SusieCakes, but that was pretty much unacceptable!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Obviously there is no Sprinkles Cupcakes in SF or SusieCakes Bakery WOULD NOT have 4 stars.  

I had the CHOCOLATE MARBLE CAKE and it was okay.  It was really big and pretty pricey.

Won't be coming to SusieCakes again--not worth it!
author: Yvette O.

description:
AAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHH my teeth are screaming due to a sugar overload!

I came here to sample a couple of cupcakes for a birthday treat since I love cupcakes and SusieCakes came highly recommended.  I got three cupcakes; a coconut, red velvet  and peanut butter jam cupcake to split with a friend.  The cupcakes were light, fluffy, and moist, but the frosting was just overbearingly sweet and I ended up wiping off most of the frosting just to finish the cupcakes.  I really enjoyed the coconut cupcake the best since it had the most delicate flavor.  I could not really taste the chocolate of the red velvet and the peanut butter jam was too...jammy?  I am glad I tried the latter however, because I have never run into a cupcake that tried to emulate a PB and J sandwich!

Everyone has a different tolerance level for the amount of sugar or sweetness they can enjoy (take!), but for those of you who, like me, do not like my sweets THAT sweet, I'd either ditch the frosting or bring a big glass of milk along!
author: Pb J.

description: SusieCakes was exactly what I was looking for! After attempting to try a cupcake from Kara's Cupcakes, (they had FLIES in their cupcake display so I backed out) I found SusieCakes. Even though they were less than 5min to closing, they were still very friendly. I tried their Red Velvet and Mint Chocolate cupcakes and both were very delicious. The Red Velvet here has now become my favorite. The cake was moist and the icing had just the right amount of sweetness. I will be coming back here next time I visit SF. :)
author: Roey M.

description: I was craving cake and decided to stop in for a few cake slices. I decided on the Confetti and the Marble. I also wanted to splurge and went ahead and got a ginger molasses cookie. The cakes were amazing. The frosting was not too sweet and the cake was not heavy. The cakes kept for about a day and didn't last after being refrigerated. My parents also tried the slices and they both loved it (my mom is also a baker and she could not stop raving about it). The cookie was what excited me the most. It was so good. And I loved that it kept soft for more than 2 days before getting hard. Highly recommend indulging yourself in their delectable sweets!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Susiecakes didn't do it for me. It was only okay and no WOW fact to me.  I went in last night just before dinner and picked up four cupcakes at $3.00 each.  The prices are on par and a little cheaper than most places but I find the cake too dry for my taste.  I personally prefer my cake moist and not so crumbly.  I had the red velvet and it wasn't very good... let's just say I can make a better one at home.  My friend had the seasonal chocolate chip banana and that wasn't very good either.  

I think it comes down to personal preferences, but this place is a miss for me...
author: Amy L.

description:
I am SO disappointed to learn that Susie Cakes will no longer carry the German Chocolate Cake year round. You had the BEST one in the city!!! What were you thinking?!!! The Lemon Curd one is way too sweet! Every time I go in there (and I've tried every flavor including the seasonal ones), there are more Celebration, Coconut, and Marble Cakes left over. This one star is for the Lemon Curd Cake that beat out the German Chocolate. Unbelievable...
And, yes, I agree with everyone else that the staff is friendly and nice. I appreciate the welcoming smiles and terrific service.
author: A L.

description: Try the special eggnog cupcake they have this time of year. Its freaking fantastic. I want to go back for more. The red velvet is moist and the frosting is the perfect amount of sugar and sweetness.
author: Chera T.

description: Good service and good cupcakes. I came in for my wedding cake tasting and found out that they don't do fondant, don't do square cakes, don't make cakes more than 3 tier, don't provide layer spacers, don't do cake setup (only delivery) and don't do floral arrangements on cakes (or coordinate them). In other words, you only get the basics, which is why I'll look elsewhere, BUT they have the best red velvet I've ever had.
author: Lina M.

description: I live in Los Angeles and had to plan a party for my Uncle's 90th birthday in San Francisco.  I called Susie Cakes and talked to Molly and she couldn't have been more helpful.  They designed a special Mardi Gras themed cake. At the last minute I had to add on some other items and they were more than happy to help. They delivered my items on the day of the party and the best part.... the cake was delicious.  Their sugar cookies are delicious and their pies look fantastic. I know they have a Susie cakes here in Los Angeles and I can't wait to support that location.
author: Valerie R.

description:
Got the red velvet. Very moist and so good. Tried the vanilla, which was not bad, but I didn't like the frosting as much.

The decorations of the cupcakes looks more home made, which is unique since most of the other cupcake shops are more well put together. 

I like that this place doesn't just sell cupcakes, but other goodies too!
author: Mandy D.

description:
Oh, SusieCakes --  I want SO much to like you and your baked goods.  The decor in the shop is adorable, the bakers wear the cutest outfits, and the treats you bake are seasonally specialized. 

However, I have never been anything but disappointed after purchasing and consuming one of these treats.

I thought maybe it could be a fluke, so I've given you multiple chances over the past couple of years and tried an assortment of items:

The cupcakes - Pretty to look at, but dry to the taste. One exception is the fun-fetti cake. That, I enjoyed.

The whoopie pie - frosting was way too sweet and cookie was bland. 

Sugar cookie - Blah. Not terrible, but nothing special. Definitely not worth the price.

Choc chip cookie - Same as above.

Apple-filled pie - filling was minimal and crust was dry and tasteless. 

Sadly, given these various (and EXPENSIVE) attempts and the fact that they've only lead to disappointment, I don't think we're a good match.
author: Tracy K.

description:
Went here to get my sugar fix on a few days ago, and was less than impressed. 

Vanilla cupcake with chocolate frosting: on the dry side, must have been sitting in the case longer than it maybe should have. Frosting was a but grainy, would def not return for this. Presentation left much to be desired. 

Coconut cupcake: Again, grainy frosting and on the dry side. I just don't think this place has a fast enough turnover with their cupcakes so it's maybe hit or miss to get a fresh one. It's super obvious when it's been sitting in the case cause the frosting gets that hardness on the top. Meh. 

Snickerdoodle: This was actually pretty good, though  microwaved it for lie ten seconds when I got home so it was soft and warm.

Chocolate brownies: Good flavor, but overall a bit dry, like they had been sitting there a few days.

Molasses Spice cookie: I just didn't enjoy this, not that there was anything wrong with it, just didn't do it for me. 

Basically a good place to get a snickerdoodle cookie and their packaging is super cute. In my opinion they should stock less daily so their stuff is fresher. We walked down to Karas cupcakes after and got a few cupcakes that were definitely SO much fresher (their chocolate coconut is to die for).
author: Oly O.

description: Amazing whoopie pies! Great icing filling and moist cookies. We also had miny cupcakes. Sparklers are expensive.
author: Grandy J.

description:
I absolutely LOVE the vanilla celebration cake! However i always feel sick after eating 1 slice because its overdosed on frosting, Im definitely a fan but if there was a little less frosting i would go ALL the time..... I feel like with the vanilla celebration cake there is more frosting than actual cake. 
But it does taste amazing
author: L V.

description:
Got Dayum...  SuzieCakes is MoFo tasty.. It seriously is singularly responsible for at least 10lbs.

Lucky for you, I'm a weirdo, I need to taste everything on the menu usually if I dig a place.

1.) The best is the celebration cake, a close second is the coconut/pineapple.  The flavor of the month isn't usally special - and Red Velvet is something many places in the bay have *mastered* so you won't be blown away as much.  The chocolate mainline stuff is great...but 3rd place here.

2.) The side snacks are bomb diggity.. 7 layer bar, peanut butter cookie whoopie.. might be the best Suzie got.

Cons - blue barn next door has better coffee imo, and Suzie cakes is weird not to list a price anywhere in the store... I have a thing where I like to know my bill before the register.  I think $5.50/slice and maybe $3 for side item is what it works out to.
author: Matt C.

description:
Came to get my cupcake fix after lunch on a Sunday. I've heard a lot about SusieCakes as people from LA love it. We opted for minis so we could try different flavors. I got the red velvet (of course, my benchmark for any new cupcakerie I try), the peanut butter, and the chocolate.

Red velvet - wayyy too much food coloring, dried out the cake. Definitely not up to par with a Sprinkles* cupcake.

Peanut butter - I really like peanut butter but this was over the top with the chocolate cake. Didn't like at all

Chocolate - the chocolate was pretty mediocre, nothing to write home about.

Bottom line, SusieCakes was a disappointment and clearly does not live up to all of the hype! 

_______________________
* = Sprinkles: http://www.yelp.com/biz/sprinkles-cupcakes-palo-alto
author: H T.

description: Quantity of cake slice more impressive than quality. Cakes look great and taste good but not great. Cute shop. Good service by kids who work there just not stellar gourmet quality. Cupcakes are a disappointment at 3.50 ea. - they should be twice that size kinda anemic looking.
author: M M.

description: OMG that frosting is AMAZING.. a little pricey but defiantly worth it.
author: Diyana I.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to come here after we've had lunch at Tacolicious. Originally, we had planned to go to Straw for some funnel cake, but since I wanted to satisfy my sweet tooth STAT (and since we didn't feel like spending another gosh dang 30 minutes driving and looking for parking-especially, since there's fucking meters all over the place), we decided to come here. The employees were very nice and welcoming, and the presentation of their cakes, cookies, and cupcakes were very appealing to the eye. Although, I was craving sweets, I didn't have enough room in my tummy to eat a full-sized cupcake hehe, so my bf and I decided to get a half dozen of the mini cupcakes (vanilla,red velvet, and chocolate--for ten bux....blahh...) to take home. 

-Red velvet: Cake was moist and flavorful; cream cheese frosting wasn't too sweet
-Vanilla: dissappointing...cake was dry...frosting tasted like the frosting out of a Betty Crocker container
-Chocolate:moist; chocolate cake and frosting were good...but nothing special...tasted store bought

This was my first time coming here, so my 3 stars are just based on those 3 cupcakes I bought...and the price..haha...

I wouldn't mind coming back here again...If I do, I'd like to try the mint chocolate cupcake and peanut butter cupcake...
author: Zerrilyn P.

description:
Perfect in every way. Seriously. The cakes are amazing. The service is amazing. They're just delightful. And totally reasonable for the quality you get. 

After three wedding cake tastings had me enraged at the prospect of paying NINE EFFING BUCKS per slice for wedding cake, we realized we didn't really care about big and fancy but we did care about delicious. AHA! SusieCakes! $300 total for a layered cake for show/cutting, and sheet cakes to serve our guests. People still rave that we had the best tasting wedding cake in history. 

So good I went back last weekend for my husband's 40th birthday cake. Ordered on Friday. Picked up on Sunday. 

And then got the sweetest voice mail in history today. SusieCakes just calling to check that everything "went well with Daniel's 40th birthday party and checking that the cake was up to par!" 

Love you forever, ladies.
author: Emily E.

description: Had an excellent piece of carrot cake. Very moist with great flavor. Can't wait to go back and try more. My friend had the mini cupcakes and said they were delicious! Cute shop!
author: Heather B.

description:
The cake is adequately good however the service and customer service here ruins any well-meaning thoughts I may have had. 
When you walk into the bakery it is clearly posted that if a student brings in a paper with the grade of an A or 100% you will receive a free cookie. Unfortunately, the staff was reluctant to follow the clearly posted instructions and made up fictional reasons to not give a cookie that was clearly earned. The staff said that in order to qualify you must be in grades K-8 and that high school or above does not matter. This is not stated anywhere in the store. It was clearly a fabricated lie in order for the staff to not give a free cookie. 
Also, I am not sure if Susie Cakes is only supposed to serve freshly baked cupcakes; if they are they are going against their word, and if they are not then they are serving day old cupcakes to paying customers. Either way, I am extremely disappointed with the San Francisco Susie Cakes. Additionally, the staff took some of the cupcakes from the display and proceeded to eat them, without paying, in front of the store window. They were clearly munching on multiple cupcakes with paying customers watching. 
I am very disappointed in my experience at Susie Cakes and I would suggest to go down the street to the multiple other cupcake places if you wish to be treated well.
author: Tara B.

description: I loved the peanut butter cupcake here. It was difficult just to eat one cupcake. Bit pricey but worth every penny. Frosting was good. It was moist and so delicious! Staff was extremely kind and friendly.
author: Noel K.

description: Had a peanut butter cupcake and it was REALLY good. It was hard to choose what to get because they have many different cupcakes and other baked dessert goods to choose from. Also, they have party supplies available if needed (plates, napkins, etc.). They have whoopie pies and they are probably good, but please note they are not like a real whoopie pies. They look more like a big cookie sandwich. Nice little seating area outside.
author: Christopher C.

description: There is a reason why Susie Cakes is so popular. The cakes are to die for! We went for cupcakes, polished them off and went for a walk to burn the calories :) But lo and behold, on our way back something pulled us back in and we ended up buying the fruit cake and coconut cake (pretty huge portions for one slice) and then left the area for fear of a third visit. Love!
author: Shruti D.

description:
I really love that they do classic birthday cakes. Good, delicious cakes that everyone loves and that don't have 25 ingredients and come in a cone or a triangle or cube. 

I have been getting all my family's birthday cakes at Susie Cakes for a couple of years now.  The one time we had a mistake in our order, their customer service was excellent!
author: shannan R.

description:
I thought that when I moved away from Chicago and my favorite cupcake store (Sweet Mandy B's!) that I would never find a replacement...but I did.

Yum.

I love Susie Cakes.

I love them so much when we were having a post wedding party I ordered our cake from them.  The only hitch...I was letting my brand new 8 year old step daughter design the cake (we picked the wedding cake, she picked this one).  So, I go into Susie Cakes and meet with Megan and tell her I need a cake for a party.  And it needs to be green.  And pink.  With stars.  I don't know how many people can make a green and pink star covered cake pretty but she did.  And it was delicious.  

I also really appreciate their flexibility and patience.  It was 2 tier, then 1 tier, At first my stepdaughter wanted it yellow, then green, then lots of starts, then no stars and Megan just rolled with the punches.  The cake ended up being more expensive than I had planned but it was worth it.  Megan also called me the next week and left me a voice mail saying she hoped the cake worked out well.  So nice!
author: Kimberly W.

description:
I"m am in love with Susie's Cakes Bakery's cupcakes. O M G. They are to DIE FOR. No, SERIOUSLY. Every time I take a bite of their cupcakes I feel like there is an oral orgasm happening in my mouth. :) 

I stopped by once out of curiosity and got their seasonal Strawberry white chocolate cupcakes; after that, i just kept walking to the store for one. Their cupcakes are different from CAKO or CUPCAKES because they use real fruits and have an extra bit of frosting in the middle of the cupcake. Their red velvet is also an awesome choice with a rich and creamy, cheesy frosting. The cake is soft and moist. While, Cako's cupcakes are mildly sweet, soft, and dully frosted. Cupkcakes's cupcakes are very good too but they serve a limited selection, however, Susie's cupcakes' menu selection changes seasonally. During berry season, their specialty is Blueberry breakfast cupcake. HMMMMMM!!!! Each bite is packed with yum, yum, and more yum.
author: Lily K.

description: The delicious cupcakes were a huge hit in our office. As a bonus, they had incredibly decorated one of them with our company logo. We were tickled pink!
author: Esther W.

description: Stopped in here for the red velvet. Sweet, moist cupcake with cream cheese frosting...what more could you want? It's a nice snack in between a day of shopping.
author: Madeline S.

description: Hands down the BEST bakery and dessert ever. I used Susie's for my wedding cake and assorted dessert station and everyone raved how amazing the mini cupcakes, lemon bars, whoopie pies, cookies and coconut cake was! My favorite Susie's treats are the coconut cake and lemon bars!
author: Kelsey G.

description:
Someone brought a chocolate cake and cookies from SusieCakes. The chocolate layer cake was ridiculously moist, rich, and indulgent. One of those cakes worthy of a cold glass of milk. Cutting a thin piece is not such a bad idea. My stomach was gurgling, "Have mercy on me young sire."

The sugar sprinkled mini cookies were in a shape of a cute ice cream cone. Just by looking at it you can tell it's packed with butter because of its golden sheen. They're good but they're rich like the cake.

____

Very, very rich but SusieCakes will surely satisfy your sweet tooth cravings.
author: Michael H.

description:
Red velvet is my coworker's "angry" food.  Because really, it's sort of just chocolate cake with red food coloring and cream cheese frosting.

I don't mind it; in fact, I like the cream cheese frosting a lot.  However, I'm not a fan when a) the actual cake part is bright red (and I mean BRIGHT red), and b) the whole thing only tastes faintly of red velvet.  The frosting was a tad dry, and although the cake was moist, it was way too crumbly and soft.  I tasted not one hint of chocolate/red velvet in the cake, and the cream cheese frosting felt like it was half vanilla frosting, half cream cheese, not an amazingly pure frosting.

As someone who's already not really a fan of cupcakes, I'd have to say that this one didn't really take the cake at all.
author: Tori S.

description:
When I got engaged, I had a very specific vision for my cake.

I wanted NO fruit, NO disgusting weird fillings. I wanted chocolate and sugar and butter--and that is the Susie Cakes specialty. There's nothing subtle about the sugar in these here desserts--and I LOVE 'EM.

We called and had no problem setting up a tasting. They easily accommodated the four of us and set out six cupcakes and samples of all of their frosting choices, along with the marble cake. The woman showed us dozens of beautiful cake options and explained clearly the pricing. We couldn't make a decision then and there, and I felt absolutely zero pressure to do so. I ended up calling about a week later to place the the order. We ordered 5 dozen mini cupcakes and a two tiered decorated wedding cake. Including decorations on the cupcakes and delivery, it was less than $400 and every bite was worth double that. The cake was moist, the delivery was prompt, the decorations beautiful. I will be visiting them again for all birthday and anniversary cakes.  Thank you Susie Cakes for making our wedding as sweet as it was beautiful!
author: Melissa S.

description: love love love the cupcakes here.  everytime i stop by, there is a new flavour that i haven't tried.  last time, i tried the blueberry pancake cupcake, which was a vanilla (or buttermilk) base cake with fresh blueberries baked in the batter, topped with a maple buttercream frosting.  it was delish....there was no need to make breakfast that day, this cupcake did the trick.  my hubby likes their strawberry cupcake with strawberry frosting, moist cake with lots of creamy frosting on top.  i also like their red velvet & coconut cupcakes.
author: Ellen L.

description: I ended up getting four cupcakes because SusieCakes had a Birthday special. When you buy one cupcake they give you one for free. We had the following cupcakes: chocolate flourless, peanut butter, mint chocolate, and regular chocolate. All were delicious but we LOVED the peanut butter cupcake the best! Moist, real ingredient tasting, and lots of frosting! SusieCakes is my new favorite cupcake shop in the city :)
author: Josie C.

description:
I am partial to Susie cakes because I first ate there in LA. I think Susie Cakes is better than Kara's: 1) Their cupcakes are softer 2) Their decor is way cuter 3) They make other full size cakes like the Celebration Cake which is ridiculously good. Also try a whoopie pie (if you are ok with being in a diabetic coma after) :) 

I have also done custom orders from this location and in LA - super professional and turns our perfect each time. Everyone loves Susie Cakes at a party!
author: Tina U.

description: Wow, this place is good.  The German chocolate cake is amazing and I would definitely recommend it, especially if you like coconut!  It was $5.50 for a HUGE slice.  The slice was probably at least 3 times the size of a normally slice of cake.  I also tried their strawberry cupcake which was also amazing.  I don't normally care for frosting but I have to say that I would eat spoonfuls of that strawberry frosting on the cupcake. Both the cupcake and the slice of cake were not too sweet, which made them even more delicious.  Also, the staff is very friendly!
author: Juliana K.

description: Quick update.  Today my sister received a call from SusieCakes General Manager apologizing for the cake and asking for her address to send a gift card.  I am truly impressed by their customer service as is my sister.  Thanks SusieCakes!
author: Katherine C.

description:
After a long day this place hit my sweet tooth spot! We wandered in after dinner and I was pleasantly surprised to find a large selections of deliciousness (much more selection than just cupcakes!) and very happy with my two choices...a mini chocolate and a full sized red velvet cupcake. Otherwise known as perfection!

The cake was moist, but not crumbly, and the frosting was divine. 

If we lived here this place would become very, very dangerous.
author: Margaret M.

description: Maybe I went on the wrong day? I had the vanilla cupcake and the frosting was alright, it tasted like a lighter and butterier version of boxed frosting, the cake wasn't impressive either. It was dry! Very dense, but lack the moistness. If you are familiar with Cako's cupcakes, Susie's has the same exact density of Cako's but lack of moistness. I read so many good reviews about this place, I am saddened that this isn't my top 3 cupcake store. I'll try again some other time, maybe in the AM and not when it is closing. Fingers crossed!
author: Nina H.

description:
I went there for the first time and bought a chocolate and peanut butter cupcakes to go. The customer service was average. The staffs were mildly friendly. When I went back to the car I was having trouble opening the box since it was nicely taped : ) and I didn't want to ruin the box nor the cupcakes. I was kind of exciting before I take the first bit but then I was disappointed because the texture of cupcakes is very loose and all I can really taste is a chuck n chuck of sugar in my mouth. So sweet I had to drink alot of water to flush it out though I wish I had milk on hand.
I properly won't go back again not only is far away from where I live but wasn't totally satisify. : (
author: Irene L.

description:
So I ordered a 6" Red Velvet cake.  I must say it was moist and oh so delicious.  One of the best I've had in quite a while.  

  A few days after consuming the cake with friends for a birthday, I received a phone call wondering about my experience.  Now frankly I've never received a phone call from a bakery asking about how I enjoyed their product before, so let me just say that they really do care.

  I've been here a few times when they first opened on Chestnut and they have gotten much better.  After being shaky at first I think it's solid now.  I plan to go a few more times before the 5 star bump up.     

Decor: 5
Food: 4
Service: 5

Would I go back? You bet your Pastrami I would!
author: Kelson H.

description:
Sometimes I wonder why I look like an albino panda. And then I remember it's places like susiecakes that love to nurture food babies. 

Things that I enjoy about susiecakes, The girls in the front are super sweet, and keep things moving well when its busy. And I like the little samples they put out for tasting. :)

Actual cake! Not cupcake, but yeknow, the seemed to be forgotten love... ACTUAL LAYER CAKE. 
German Chocolate is good, delicious even. Very moist, and susceptible to disappearances.
Old fashioned Chocolate is  MASSIVE BEAST!!! Oh my lord, its huge. But its good, you need like 3 people just to eat one slice.
Luscious Lemon, MY FAVORITE!!! The buttercream? outside is sweet and textured with sugar granules. The cake itself is moist and soft and lemony, but my most favorite part is the tart tangy custardy(?) filling between the layers.  . Holy Moly I need to eat that cake every day. 


I love the strawberry cupcakes. 
I love the plain vanilla cupcakes also.
I also think the sugar cookies are like picket fence perfection in edible form. 

American Delights.
author: nicole r.

description: Wow!  I have not been to the location in person but one of the girls at work brought in the red velvet cake for a birthday celebration today.  I am now a susiecakes fan!  The cake was moist and the frosting was spot on - not too sweet and the right consistency.  it had multiple layers of cake and frosting - all red velvelt goodness.  I now want to try other flavors.
author: Bebe W.

description: We were in the area shopping so stopped in for cupcakes.  When you go to a bakery to buy a cupcake, you sort of expect something special, or at least that looks better than I could do at home being an absolute baking novice.  The top of the cupcake was flat as if it didn't rise all the way and then the colors on top ran (bled) as if they had been sitting around for a very long time.  I wasn't impressed and we'd never go back.  The price would have been just fine had it been a decent cupcake.  But given what we were served, the price seemed to high.
author: Lisa P.

description: Sweet Sweet Sweet! They have the best service and cakes! Make sure you try a slice of their Celebration Cake, it's a gourmet version of everyone's guilty pleasure, Pillsbury Funfetti! Yes, the prices are bit high but you really do get what you pay for as their cakes are six layers deep. CAKE, CAKE, CAKE, CAKE, CAKE! Tip: Can't decide? Grab a few mini cupcakes, that way you enjoy more for less! ;)
author: Cindy G.

description:
Cake Nazi.
I felt something that the people who works here are very proud what do they make.
It is all old recipes means an old school kind.
I like an old school, Nazi kind of people when it comes to food.

Cup-Cake Nazi
Sushi Nazi
Ramen Nazi
Pizza Nazi
Jiveassroll Nazi
Bibimbup Nazi
Burger Nazi
Cappuccino Nazi
Curry Nazi
Dimsum Nazi
Vietnamese Sandwich Nazi
Pho Nazi
Taco Nazi
Tonkatsu Nazi
Izakaya Nazi
Shanghi Dumpling Nazi
Fried Chicken Nazi

You name it.
Food is very serious business.
You can not to be Yo-Yo about it.

I don't know you'll like to be called "Nazi" but it is true.
There is something you have to be 'Nazi" about it.

May be the Susie is such a nice person.
May be the Susie is such a sweet woman.
May be the Susie has such a great personality.
May be the Susie is hot lookin'.
May be the Susie has a hot-temper.
May be the Susie is bitch.
May be the Susie is asshole.
May be the Susie is always bitching about her assistants in the kitchen.
I don't know.
I don't know anything about the Susie at all.
I am not even guessing.
And basically, I don't care what she is.
But I see it clearly that she cares about what she does.

The best German Chocolate Cake I've ever had.
author: Nobu K.

description:
SusieCakes Bakery has the best cupcakes in San Francisco, hands-down. I have never had a bad cupcake, and I have tried almost all of their flavors. I love the fact that they are very creative with their cupcakes, but also have other baked goods that are equally impressive. To top it off (pun absolutely intended), their staff consists of the friendliest ladies! All of them are down to earth and genuinely love their work and final product. Beware if you walk down the southside of Chestnut St. because the smell will force you to investigate their baked goods. 

A few items to point out:
* Although you might think the cupcakes are expensive, they are comparable to all the other high-end cupcakes/bakeries in the San Francisco area, so don't leave without buying at least 1 cupcake. 
* THEY DELIVER! A lot of cupcake places or bakeries do not offer delivery, but SusieCakes does for a nominal fee.
author: Kevin C.

description:
The red velvet was pretty good, but the mint chocolate chip one tasted like mouth wash. I couldn't even finish my first bite.

I think I need to go back and try something new... Any recommendations?
author: Sara D.

description: They just know how to do cake.. It's amazing. But my top two would have to be the red velvet and carrot cake! And if you're ever in the mood for a bombass snickerdoodle you GOTTA go to susie cakes, you just gotta.
author: Jasmine J.

description: This bakery is just way too cute. Workers are very friendly. Right when you walk in, they all greet you! The only thing I've ever had are their lemon bars, I mean squares. And I am a fiend for lemon bars! Their lemon squares are soooo gooood!! It is the BEST lemon pastry I have ever had. The crust is the right texture, and the filling has the perfect tangy-ness. I've gotten their red velvet and pb&j cupcakes for my bf and his family, and he said they are the best he's had before, so I'm pretty sure everything else at the bakery is just as delicious! This place is a hassle to get to because I live on the other side of the city, but those lemon squares are just so worth it!!
author: Marilyn W.

description:
This bakery is adorable, and the staff was really happy and nice to us when we went in.  We each got a slice of cake (the German Chocolate), and the slices are HUGE!  I got cupcakes for a birthday party the following day.  I love how they give you a post-it with suggestions on how to store each type of item they sell.

The cake was delicious! Super decadent, moist, and a huge portion, enough to share for sure.  It was even great the next day! 

The cupcakes, well, there's just too much icing! I think filling them is a little overboard.  I also found it to be super sweet, and more fluffy than creamy.  I prefer a smoother denser buttercream, this is a bit more pasty than what I am used to.  The kids liked the cupcakes though, so it was fine.  I think I'd stick with a slice of cake though, it's easier to scrape off a bit of the frosting if it gets too much.
author: Miss C.

description:
As a person who usually prefers a second dinner rather than any kind of dessert, I feel compelled to give SusieCakes my praises. This place makes me actually LIKE cupcakes. Places like Sprinkles, Kara's and all the other trendy cupcake joints make cupcakes that taste too sweet and too fake. SusieCakes cupcakes taste homemade but 10x better than anything that would aaactually be homemade (sorry, Mom).

I really can't emphasize how NOT a dessert person I am but I would gladly chow down on a SusieCake treat any day. SusieCakes is also in a great location along Chestnut with a bunch of great restaurants to get lunch or dinner at before ending up here.
author: Sarah S.

description:
DOUBLE REVIEW - Originally from 1/2011 - Transferred from my old profile

I love sweets and SusieCakes takes my breath away!!! Yay! 

Although I live in San Francisco, trucking it way across town for a cupcake may seem excessive. So, I limit my indulgences to my days off when I don't have a child in tow... 

I prefer their slices of cake rather than the cupcakes but the Whoopee Pie???? Yummmmmmy!!! It takes me a week to eat one. A bite a day keeps the gastric bypass away! 

Pricey but worth it!  Their customer service is also great!  I'm a stickler for guest satisfaction and they meet the expectation!  Great job ladies and thank you for taming my sweet addiction!!!
author: Candy R.

description:
We have been going to SusieCakes since it opened in San Francisco, and simply love the cakes and cookies, and especially the people that work there. I think that they do a good job of finding the balance between keeping the favorites always available, and rotating in seasonal specialties monthly. I love the marble cake, and the puddings are a welcome surprise. My kids like the chocolate chip cookies and the red velvet cake. Yum.

But the real secret to the place is doing cakes for birthdays. Most recently, it was my son's birthday, and he is a huge Lakers fan. He got a Lakers themed chocolate cake that was fantastic. 

Megan is great, and who we turn to for events, and Riley, who runs it, is super warm and keeps the place consistent and high-touch. Highly recommended.
author: Mark S.

description: Sadly I was unimpressed with the cakes from here. I got all excited to try out Susie cakes but was dissatisfied. The cakes were dry and tasteless. Really the only sweet thing was the icing on the cake. I had the carrot cake and my girlfriend had the chocolate cake, we also got a rice crispy. The lady that worked there said the rice crispy was the best treat in the shop but it was sour and stale I honestly recommend the Kellogg rice krispie and Dunken Hines over Susie cakes any day.
author: michael h.

description:
After my first cake experience with SusieCake's original chocolate cake, I couldn't wait to get my pearly whites into another slice of the yummy goodness.  Fortunately for me, my coworker was persistent on my hosting a gathering at my place.  I thought "Perfect!" I hadn't stopped ranting and raving about how great it tastes.  I decide to buy a small cake in lieu of a few slices of the larger version.  Absolutely ecstatic, I bring the cake home and wait for dinner to be over to bring it out.  To my slight dismay, it didn't have the same orgasmic impact as the first time I had it.  However, needless to say, every one that it was amazing.  After analyzing it a bit, I realized that the cake to frosting ratio was different in the two sizes.  The smaller version has a bit too much frosting for my taste.  It overpowers the lusciousness of the cake.  This cake is still #1 in my book!  

Side note: I tried a mini red velvet.  In my honest opinion, it is a little flavorless; it is akin to edible playdoh.  Will not purchase again.
author: Rachel B.

description: We ordered a beautiful celebration cake (vanilla confetti cake with buttercream frosting) over the weekend. Customer service over the phone, and in person at pickup, was on exceptional, and the cake was deliciously fresh, albeit slightly on the sweet side for our tastes. That said, it's cake, so we shouldn't really complain about sweetness.
author: Deane M.

description: One of the best red velvet cupcakes I've ever had and the frosting was sooo yummy! Only wish they had some seating.
author: S M.

description:
You might call me a cupcake expert. I scour bakeries, cafés and restaurants for those perfect little cake 'n icing bundles. I like dense cake, sweet but not too sweet icing, unique flavour combinations and imaginative toppings. Yes, I know my cupcakes.

Imagine my surprise (and delight!) when I stumbled upon the best tasting red velvet cupcake ever at Susie Cakes. The perfect combination of moist cake and cream cheese icing. The icing is really creamy and smooth- I could have eaten it on its own!

The people at Susie Cakes were pretty great too. They were patient when little kids (ahem... and me) were indecisive about what treat to choose and offered advice on their favourite picks. I wanted to eat everything in there.
author: Seema M.

description:
I've never ever been much of a fan of butter cream frosting, but the magic that SusieCakes creates to make theirs so delicate and tasty is amazing!  I highly recommend popping in from time to time to scope their flavor of the week!  (I think it's "of the week" and not day or month?)  Anyway, so far I've had two unique amazing cupcakes that I still think about often.  

Blueberry Pancake Cupcake

Guinness cake and Irish Cream frosted Cupcake

I think the names speak for themselves, as well as everything else on their menu!  

SusieCakes has perfected the yumminess of the unusual!  (Their basic cupcakes are pretty darn good too, hehe!)  SusieCakes is superior to Kara's and just ahead of Mission Mini's on my SF cupcake list.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I had been here once before and the cake was good so I came back to treat my self and the cake was terrible! I ordered the birthday cake slice and it was hard on the outside like it had been left sitting out over night. I attempted to warm it up a little to make it a little softer and that just made it worse! It was still hard, but now it tasted like old butter. There was no "flavor", it tasted like all of the ingredients not blended well and I could taste each one (yuck). I was also skipped in line when I was ordering. They got 2 stars because the banana pudding was great!! It was fresh, the cookies weren't too soft and the pudding had a great taste. It was the perfect size too!
author: Dominique J.

description:
I came here after eating at blue barn one day. I had the red velvet cupcake and I have to say not bad.  A little too sweet for my taste.  I still enjoy Sprinkles red velvet more.  I will need to come back here again to try the other cupcakes.  I love that these cupcakes don't look super fancy.  I really appreciate that they put less icing on the cupcake and really focus on the flavor of the cake part and not the icing. 
This bakery also has other pastries: cakes,cookies, whoopie pies and cookie sandwiches!!

Parking is a little annoying.  But that's Marina in general.
author: Ying F.

description: Ohhh Susie Cakes! We had a good run, but this last visit was just unsatisfactory! We arrived at the bakery around 11am on a Saturday. First, the ladies working were extremely unorganized and we waited 10 minutes to be helped when there was only one other person in the store. Second, they didn't have ANY of their seasonal cupcakes out AND they said that if we wanted a piece of chocolate peppermint cake, we would have to let it sit out 2 hours before eating it. I drove an hour to the city specifically for these items, which you would expect would be available since they are in high demand. As for the peppermint cake, which we obviously couldn't wait two hours to try, it was good, but not my favorite layer cake. The cake to frosting to ganache ratio was off and there was way too much cake. Maybe it was an off day and I usually have a really good experience whenever I visit, but I think it will be a while before I return.
author: Hayley H.

description:
I've gotta say..this was the best red velvet cupcake i've ever had. 

Bright red cake, soft white frosting with a sprinkle of red sugar. 

Small shop, nice service. Not a lot of places to sit beside 4 chairs outide. You can't make cupcakes like these. 

My recomendation: take em to go! Sweet treat after dinner or lunch! Huge $40 choco cakes too!
author: Heather H.

description:
Red Velvet= Good, not great. Not CupKates. Really really good frosting, cake seemed a little less moist though. 

Snickerdoodle= Good, not great. Good consistency, but kind of lacked flavor.

Over all it seems like one more trendy "sweets" spot thats just missing the "sweet spot". I wanted to love it, I'm afraid I only liked it.
author: Jarred D.

description: You'll notice that my original review spoke to the near perfect German Chocolate cake that has been my No.1 go-to favorite for several years. Since I have learned this was dropped from the menu due to a lack of popularity I am more than a little disappointed in such a poor choice - especially since that overly sweet lemon curd came in as the favorite!?!? Sorry, Susie . . . you blew it not even keeping it on the menu. See my review from 3 years back. Soooooo disappointed and I now gotta go elsewhere.
author: Tristan C.

description: I ordered a half sheet red velvet cake for my sister's birthday and couldn't have been more pleased with the beautiful and scrumptious cake we had.  Our guests loved the cake and my sister was delighted with the decoration.  SusieCakes did an awesome job with the decorating despite my vague description of what I wanted.  I just told them my sister had recently moved from Hawaii back to SF and wanted something that evoked that but what they did really exceeded my expectations.  Thanks to your cake specialists for a wonderful job!
author: tina l.

description: Really quite good ^_^ very happy I stopped to grab some cupcakes on the way out of the city. So far chocolate mint and mocha have been delicious. Quite sweet but hey, they are cupcakes after all. Saving the red velvet but I have a feeling it will be just as delicious as the rest. Thanks Susie cakes!!
author: Katie T.

description: Wonderful service! I called the morning I wanted to get some cupcakes delivered to my brother's workplace. First off, amazing that they offer delivery! Secondly, the lady I spoke with on the phone was extraordinarily pleasant and helpful. I know that SusieCakes are just about the best from going to their LA location, and this SF spot did not disappoint. The cupcakes arrived right within the window they gave me, and they turned out beautifully (and delicious). Thanks, SusieCakes!
author: Amy B.

description:
Came here last night because I was craving a slice of Funfetti... totally hit the spot! I love love love Susie Cakes slices. I definitely need to try the Sweetheard cookies soon as well, but I can't resist a slice of heaven when I walk by.

Definitely try the funfetti, 6 layer chocolate slice, carrot, red velvet... they are all amazing!
author: Sarah A.

description:
We were walking around wasting time waiting for our dinner reservation and noticed this tiny place. I'm a big fan of cupcakes, so I had to go in and get cupcakes for us to eat after dinner. 

The store was bright and clean. The girls were uniformed in white shirts and had on red bandanas on their hair. They were friendly and worked fast to keep the line moving. 

 I got my favorite, the red velvet with creamcheese frosting. I enjoyed their cupcakes very much, very moist and yummmy.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Some friends and I went to the San Francisco Crab Feed this weekend, and were left in need of some dessert therapy. I am so glad we found this place.

My friend got a piece of the Tropical Coconut Cake. Holy hell that is amazing. THE best coconut cake I have ever had. Amazingly moist (not soggy) cake, great coconut flavor... It was perfect. I even had to break it to my mom that I found a coconut cake better than her's. She is now intrigued.

Me... I bought, well, I dropped about $40. Something to know about me, I'm a bit excessive when it comes to food. I purchased one of each type of full-sized cupcake they had (chocolate-chocolate, vanilla-vanilla, mocha, vanilla-raspberry, chocolate peanut butter, chocolate-mint, red velvet, lemon, coconut, chocolate vanilla), a piece of the vanilla celebration cake and two Snickerdoodles

MUST GETS:
- slice of Tropical Coconut Cake
- slice of Vanilla Celebration Cake
- vanilla-vanilla cupcake (imo, the BEST way to judge a cupcake establishment)

DELICIOUS:
- Every single cupcake (both vanilla and chocolate cakes were perfect consistency, moistness and flavor, and all frostings were impeccable in taste and consistency).
- Snickerdoodles (massive, flavorful and soft, just as they should be).

STORE OPPORTUNITIES:
- Cupcake boxes, please! By the time I got them home (I'm southbay) they were all huddled together, with a few sleeping on their sides.
- Two workers talking about a customer and her dirty looks.
- Be closer to meeeeeeee!

I can't wait for my next time there to get more Celebration Cake, Tropical Coconut cake and try a few more things. :)
author: Amber H.

description: I was lucky enough to taste the mini cupcakes, red velvet at work today. It was the absolute most delicious cupcake ever!! It was fresh, moist and just perfect. I'm so happy to know that this is located near my home because I will most definitely be going on my own to purchase more. I'm hooked!!!
author: becki n.

description: We have got several cakes from here over the years. The last one is for our one-year-old's birthday and it came out amazing. My only complaint is that it is quite expensive but if you are willing to pay it is worth the quality and taste and design
author: Suzanne Y.

description:
This place is like my own personal hell, but in the best way possible.  Having the world's biggest sweet-tooth and just being diagnosed with having a gluten allergy, I am screwed.  I've tried all of the cupcake places that have come and gone (as there have been many), bakeries, candy stores--and this is by far the best in SF.  It's a throw-back that serves old time sweets--from snicker doodle cookies, to 7 layer bars, 7 layer fun-fetti cake, and icing-filled cupcakes.  Whatever they put in their frosting (either pure lard or crack) is so unbelievably good and addictive that it makes my teeth tingle.  The white on white is my personal favorite.  

Store is clean and light in decor, with really friendly staff.  They sell bday cards and candles too, which is an added bonus if you're in need.  Also makes for great client gifts for any fun occasion.
author: Monica C.

description:
I have ate MANY cupcakes in my lifetime and have a hard time passing up any cupcakes even if I know they aren't awesome. However we were strolling down the Marina and I saw this shop (didn't Yelp it or anything before walking in). 

Ordered a mini vanilla cupcake and a sugar cookie. The cookie was just about perfect but pretty standard/expected for a high-end sweet treat. However the cupcake was just perfect!! Sweet but not too sweet icing. Good texture icing, it was soft but not so soft that it would fall right off the cupcake. the cake itself was moist but not that super moist soggy taste. I always try vanilla cupcakes anywhere new I go I think it's the perfect test for the rest of the shop since it's a fairly standard flavor where chocolate can be a much wider range of flavors (milk, dark, coco, etc...)

I super DUPER wish there were one here where I live!
author: Jenny D.

description: I needed dessert for about 30 people and ordered their Old Fashioned Chocolate Cake, strawberry cupcakes, vanilla cupcakes, and red velvet cupcakes, plus a butterscotch pudding for my glutten-allergic friend.  Everything was delicious -even a couple days later as we had leftovers.  (we followed the do not refridgerate instructions) I also appreciated their follow up call to see if we were happy with their products and services.   Not sure what the negative feedback is about.  Everything tasted great and our guests were also really happy.  Yes, they charge $3 to personalize a cake.  Sort of lame - but I like their cake/cupcakes enough to overlook this.
author: Madhuri K.

description: well, it's nice that the cupcakes are good. but if you can't take care of customers who call in or order online cause you are too busy, then maybe that should not be a part of your business.  unfortunate, but there are plenty of good cakes out there.
author: Food Is L.

description: Expensive but delicious. My wife gave her 7 later bar a 4/5. My daughter have her chocolate cupcake a 4/5. My carrot cake slice was a 5. Best carrot cake I've ever had.
author: William M.

description: Susie's cupcakes were dry and dense, but I particularly did not care for the frosting on their red velvet, strawberry, and seasonal banana chocolate chip cupcakes. Though the frosting had a wonderful, smooth and creamy texture, it was also too tart! Their strawberry cupcake was just flat-out disgusting. Of the four I tried, red velvet and vanilla were the most decent.
author: Sophia B.

description:
I recently got married and I'm still coming off the high. The day was perfect in every way, and the sweetest part was definitely provided by the wonderful bakers at SusieCakes. It's true what they say about not eating on your wedding day - you spend so much time running around, saying hi to everyone, taking pics, etc, that its hard to really enjoy the food you spent so much on.

Both my husband and I didn't even touch our meals (not that they weren't yummy...I know they were), but I was absolutely determined to get at least two cupcakes into me before the dancing began. In came SusieCakes. We got a cupcake tower with a wide variety of their best flavors, including strawberry and red velvet. They were sooooo good, and everyone kept complimenting us on our choice of deserts.

In a city where there are a number of really fantastic cupcake bakeries, it's hard to stand out from the pack, but i really think that SusieCakes is head and shoulders above the rest!
author: Danielle J.

description:
These cakes are to die for!  For breakfast, I sit blissfully eating a slice of Susie's Famous Carrot Cake.  I just couldn't wait til lunch- no way.

For special occasions at work, SusieCakes is our go-to bakery, next to Delessio.  So far, we've fallen head over heels in love with their Old Fashioned 6-Layer Chocolate Cake, Southern Red Velvet and Susie's Famous Carrot Cake.  

Obviously, the chocolate cake is my favorite because it's just so crazy-yummy!  And moist.  And dark.  And has 6 layers!  BEST CAKE EVERRR.

I have to tell the whole world that SusieCakes are incredibly moist!  Red velvet is so hot right now and for some reason, everyone thinks they can make it- WRONG.  SusieCakes's Southern Red Velvet is a winner, I promise.  Also, the carrot cake has so much good stuff in it such as golden raisons, walnuts, and tons of shredded carrots, but not so much that you're thinking there's too much going on.  SusieCakes  is just pure quality.  

SusieCakes is my favorite cakery of all time, no doubt.
author: Teena O.

description:
I know my baked goods, and let me tell you, this place never disappoints! I bake as a hobby so I am no expert but I just love this place. The whoopie pies are wonderful, the cookies are *delicious*, and the cakes are sweet, moist, and rich. And every time I go here everything is fresh, no matter what time of day.

In fact, this place is so good that when I am done with the cookie/cake I am actually SAD. Yes, I just admitted that...but that should just show you how much I love their stuff :)
author: Shirin M.

description: This review is way overdue, but better late than never. My husband and I took a trip up to SF for my 30th birthday and he knew one of my only requests was to have an awesome little birthday cake made to my liking. Enter...SusieCakes! We both had a little bit of an idea of what we wanted in my cake as far as size, shape, flavors, etc. but nothing drastic or over the top. To my husband's dismay, after calling just about every bakery/dessert shop around the city, not one bakery wanted to oblige to our simple request of a semi-custom birthday cake. They stated they only did cakes "their way"...alrighty then. Guess we'll take our money elsewhere! When my husband contacted Susie Cakes, they immediately welcomed our request with open arms. The staff (especially "Park") was extremely patient and helpful while my husband tried to get the cake and frosting flavors just right for my celebration. They were accommodating in every aspect. They delivered the cake straight to our hotel (as he was keeping the end result a surprise), they made the cake exactly as promised (came out beautifully), it tasted great, and of course from the very first phone call, to the last bite of cake, they made our experience delicious and stress-free. You can tell the people working here are genuinely helpful and excited to earn your business. We'll definitely stop by when we're in SF again and Thank you Susie Cakes for making my birthday that much more special!
author: Danielle S.

description:
O-M-Geezy. I don't even like German chocolate cake, and I freaking fell head over heels in love with theirs 

Today It had to be someones birthday @ work, so there had to be another cake, and I JUST HAD to have a piece.

 The cake itself is dense, moist,  and tasted like chocolate ice cream, maybe that sounds odd, but there is a certain taste/smell inherent to ice cream, and that richness made itself present in this cake. The chocolate buttercream? reeediculous, it's a homemade old fashioned cake on steroids!
