Cupcakes are on point, and now I'm desperate to try the marble and celebration cakes!
author: Bonnie K.

description: Nope, not impressed... they're greasy.
author: Layla L.

description: I will try something else small next time. I made the mistake of ordering a confetti cake for my daughters birthday. Was too sweet for me. made my teeth hurt. Sorry. Other stuff looks good. Will just have to wait and see.
author: C U.

description: Susie Cakes are the best. My family bought me a red velvet Tiffany Blue birthday cake and it was wonderful. The flavors are amazing and the cake was perfectly soft! Will be purchasing more birthday cakes from them for friends!
author: Summer M.

description:
Holy Diabetes Heaven!

I could breathe the air in there forever. The Celebration funfetti cake is all I really want out of life.
author: Greg J.

description:
Meh.  These cupcakes didn't do it for me.  I went with my fam the other day and we ordered the mocha, mint chocolate, and strawberry one.  ($3 each)  

Mocha: didn't even taste like mocha!  It tasted like chocolate.
Strawberry: It tasted like it was infused with strawberry..SYRUP.  yuck!  I was not a fan of this one
Mint Chocolate: this was the best one out of the ones we ordered, but it still didn't cut it for me. 

My Suggestion: go to that takes the cake!  by far the best cupcakes in SF so far!
author: Kristen T.

description: These cupcakes were a complete rip off! Mini cupcakes should never cost $2! The cupcakes were dry. The red velvet had no taste. The frosting was good, but the final product was not worth the price.
author: D ..

description:
Came in today and had a great experience.

Food: Ordered cupcakes and a slice of red velvet cake. It was really good, probably best RV cake I've had -- Moist, but the frosting was a tad too sweet for me..However, great with a cup of coffee!

Service: Awesome! The worker there was very welcoming and helped us decide on what we wanted. Last minute, we decided to switch to another cupcake, and she decided to just throw it in for free! There's no way I wouldn't leave a tip + a nice review after that kind gesture.

Price: A tad pricey, but I don't eat cupcakes/cakes that often...So a little trek to SusieCakes once in a while is perfectly fine.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
For all of you cupcake fans, this is the place! I tried SusieCakes for the first time a couple of weeks ago, and I'm hooked!  They have the "grandma baked them from scratch" nostalgia paired with a flavor sure to fire up your taste buds.  My favorites so far - strawberry buttercream (best strawberry cupcake I have ever tried, and that's a serious compliment), the marble cake (layers of vanilla, fudge, and it even has some chocolate chips!) and of course their chocolate chip cookie.  
You really have to try this place.

enjoy!
author: Pooja S.

description:
I HATE SUSIECAKES.  Because I LOVE SusieCakes.  

And they are making me fat with their enormous, delicious slices of 6-layer chocolate cake which barely fit in a box.  I now get a slice every time I end up in the Marina, and I can polish it off within 24-48 hours.  I am ashamed.  And elated.  

Luckily I live far away...
author: Daniel S.

description: Saw it and had to go in just to browse.  Browsing turned into purchases which included whoopie pie and also a strawberry cupcake.  Both are delicious.  I would definitely get both again.  Although the whoopie pie could be a tad sweet, the taste is great!  Actually I do suggest they make it slightly less sweet.  If they do, it would be the perfect desert.  The strawberry cupcake is also a tad sweet, but the flavors were good.  Would definitely come back here again sometimes.
author: Andrew N.

description:
Mother of mercy!  I had the most divine peanut butter cookie here today.  It was peanut butter cream sandwiched between two super soft peanut butter cookies.  

Heaven.
author: Robert M.

description:
Am I the only one who notices the change in the cupcake size here? 
I walked in with another formerly-SusieCakes-loyal friend sometime in mid September, I noticed the lemon bars were smaller and she noticed the allegedly full size cupcakes were ALSO smaller. 
The 3 stars are for the the staff who is superb as always.  Can someone tell me I am wrong?
author: Brock L.

description: Super delicious cupcakes. Plenty of choices and even seasonal options. I love peanut butter cupcake and banana pudding . Wish one would open also on east coast or they shipped. Def a must try for dessert.
author: Joe W.

description: Vanilla celebration cake! Super delicious and I loved that I could try a small sample before I bought a slice! It's gigantic and definitely one slice is meant for sharing. I would recommend eating this cake the same day that you get it! I tried to eat my slice the day after I bought it and the creme does harden quite a bit. I'd love to come back and eat an entire slice though! :) Location is great, could be a little difficult to find parking at night though.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Not all that impressed w/ their cupcakes.  Pretty good but not all that.   I like that they're a bit different from the typical boutique cupcake in that they've got a homemade feel.  Look like they were frosted by a kid w/ a butterknife.  Not cheap tho.

But, looove the peanut butter cookie sandwich w/ buttercream!  So friggin good, if you like peanut.  Hence, the 4 stars.
author: Miss K.

description:
I love susiecakes! I give it almost 5 stars,but I'm rounding up. I will not call this the best location for susiecakes, but if I need my fix for flourless cupcake, I will come to this location in a heart beat, given that this is the closest one to us ;) bonus, that I can drive/walk up the hill to the park at the peak of Steiner street, and can look out at the pretty view of the marina sitting on one of the benches enjoying my cupcake.

So much love for susiecakes and this town :)
author: S W.

description:
Molly Butler, Susie Cake's celebration specialist, is amazing to work with.  Susie Cakes made my wedding cake.  I had a two-tiered lemon cake custom designed with a simple inscription with my fiance's and my initials in an airstream font to match the cake topper I made which included an airstream (camping theme).  Molly was responsive, patient and willing to exchange multiple iterations of the decoration drawing a couple of times to ensure that the design was just right.  She was a pleasure to work with.  Also, from what I hear, the cake was amazing - all the pieces were devoured before I could have a slice.  I had to go to the store the next day for a piece :)

Also, for a simple custom design, Susie Cake's prices are very reasonable.  

Thanks, Molly and the Susie Cakes crew!!
author: Danielle Q.

description:
Wow! How am I just hearing about Susie Cakes?! A buddy and I popped in last weekend after a splure of lunch followed by coffee which led us to needing something sweet. We were on our way to Kara's when we noticed susiecakes. There were two girls sitting out front sharing a huge piece of red velvet both couldn't stop smiling. We were sold. 
We each stood dumbfounded in front of the display. I was in total vapor lock as to what to get, there were at least 5 things I felt like i couldnt live without. I ended up going with the peanut butter whoopie pie. seriously to die for. And I also got a coconut cupcake, also scrumptous. They advise you to keep things at room temp which was a great tip because everything stayed super soft and moist. 
I can't wait till next time I'm on chestnut to sneak in here again!
author: Audrey V.

description:
I'm not a big cupcake person but this place is very good. Cute location right on Chestnut Street and next door to Blue Barn which is one of my go to lunch places and the Apple Store. 

It's a small shop but perfect to just go in, grab a cupcake or other dessert and head out.

They do have a few chairs and tables if you want to sit and enjoy your cupcake. 

They have a wonderful Lemon Cupcake, Coconut Cupcake and yummy peanut butter cupcake besides many many more. They even do special holiday Cupcakes. During St Patrick's day they made an awesome Guinness Cupcake-yum!

They cupcakes are expensive($3) but they are very rich so you could easily split one with someone or save half for later. They also have mini cupcakes which are a great option.

Besides cupcakes, they make regular cakes, wedding cakes, cookies and an assortment of bars from seven layer to lemon.

great place to indulge your sweet tooth!
author: Whitney S.

description: A slice of the german chocolate cake can feed 3 people.
author: Iche S.

description: Susie cakes stole my heart:') I have been here a few times, each time trying something new. I have not been disappointed. Today I had the chocolate vanilla with red and green sprinkles, I didn't mean to eat the whole thing but before I knew it, it was gone! Soooooo good! Thank you suzie cakes! Oh, the staff is helpful, happy, an was patient with undecisiveness:)
author: Monique Q.

description: I had intended to post a photo of my strawberry cupcake, but the only thing to make it home was the little wrapper. A bit smallish, but that was fine because it was super sweet. Perfect topper to my Izzy's steak dinner.
author: Robert M.

description: I love this place! I've been here a number of times =). Always friendly service even when you get there close to closing time. Delicious cupackes. Scrumptious flavors (my favorite: red velvet). The cupcakes are soft, fluffy, and full of flavor. Their icings are tastey and not dominating over the cupcake. I've tried a lot of other places in SF and this place is definately up there!!
author: Monica M.

description: Great cupcakes. I go there at least twice a week. Best thing, they have treats for my dog outside in a cute bowl.
author: K C.

description:
I'm sad to say after going to That Takes the Cake this place is simply sub-par.

I was too disappointed with their Red Velvet, it tasted like a garbage box recipe, not to say it was terrible, it's just when you're exposed to a better variation isn't it more often than not, harder to go back? 

The other flavor I tried, Coconut, wasn't too impressive either but it was way better than the Red Velvet.

I had to fake a smile of amusement and fake nostalgia for my best friend who just kept looking at me smiling and saying "OMG ISN'T THIS THE BEST, ISN'T THIS THE BEST CUPCAKE EVER?"

No. I am willing to bet Cako on Powell tastes better and for all the fans of this place, I strongly urge you to try other cupcake eateries because this one was just beyond mediocre, I couldn't believe I paid so much for safeway remniscent cupcakes. 

Obviously, my review is most unfair as I only tried their cupcakes once and only tried those 2 flavors. But, I wasn't going to come back if my two favorite cupcakes tasted like shit, it just meant that I wasn't gonna have luck with the other ones.
author: Myrtle M.

description: Can't go wrong with a good ol' fashioned chocolate chip cookie! YUM!
author: Krista R.

description: After reading the great Yelp reviews I decided to call in an order. Whom ever I spoke to was friendly and cheerful over the phone. I ordered a dozen assorted cupcakes and they were able to accommodate same day delivery!  This will be a nice birthday surprise.  I'm looking forward to giving SusieCakes more business!
author: Doyle M.

description: Awesome coconut cake, personalized for a birthday on the spot (extra $3), and friendly counter service.
author: Robert B.

description: One of the best Snicker-doddle cookies I've ever had, its huge man.
author: Taylor G.

description:
Dear Ms. Cakes,

Thank you so much for the delicious birthday cupcake last week.  I enjoyed visiting your shop, and singing along to Barry White with your employees.  For my complimentary birthday cupcake, I chose the peanut butter, which is my favorite (second to the coconut).  The cake is a rich chocolate and the hat, as I like to call it, was a tasty peanut butter cream that complimented it perfectly.  

You scored the double play last week.  On Friday, it was also my wife's birthday.  We hosted a soiree at our place, and went full tilt with the 9" Red Velvet.  In our E-vite, we billed this as "the best cake in town," and feared that perhaps one guest might dissent.  However, when the oversized 3 and 0 candles were blown out, we found smiles all around the room.  The moist red chocolatey cake combined with sinful cream cheese frosting was beyond reproach.  If I had one complaint, it would be that we all slipped into food coma after I got a little too generous with the portions.  

And then we had cake for breakfast the next day.  Still good.  Suzie, my wife loves you and I can't argue with her.  

Thank you again,

Chad
author: Chad K.

description: The best red velvet cake I've had in a long time! Very moist and great flavor!!! Definetly a must if you come to San Francisco.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I am very fond of Susie. Very fond. She does a lot for me.  For example, her mini vanilla cupcake with the pale green frosting brings a crooked grin to my face each time I visit her after my haircut appointment for breakfast. She makes me grin like no other cupcake-atier in SF.  Susie, you see, has mastered the art of cake to frosting (and not to sweet) ratio. 
She has also done a splendid job of whipping-up delightful sandwich cookies.  I am especially fond of the fancified nuttter-butter cookie sandwich that graces her glass case. I find it to be the perfect lunch time sandwich. 
Oh, and then there's the pudding for dinner.  My goodness. The banana pudding. Very pudding-y. Great mouthfeel - like a smooth refined wine.  
Thank you, Susie. I'll see you after my next hair-do appointment, 
Oh, and your staff are super fun and nice!
author: Carson R.

description:
Long-time Cupcake Lover, First-time Engaged.
A friend suggested we try SusieCakes for the cupcakes and cake we wanted at our wedding and if the big day goes as smoothly (and tasty!) as the tasting did, I'll be soo happy. Megan, the Celebration Specialist we met with was so helpful and sweet--I highly recommend working with her. We CANNOT wait for the wedding--if not just to be able to share SusieCakes with our family and friends. :)
author: Monica M.

description:
My sister is brilliant. Makes all the right decisions when it comes to food (French toast holla!), travel (she introduced me to Airbnb), style (many favorite items in my closet came with her recommendation) and of course city (no one loves this one more than her...except maybe me). But Jen, proving we all are fallible, you got SusieCakes wrong.

She texted me that my choice of a slice of Marble cake over a cookie was a suspect one. Both her and her friend were not impressed with the former, loved the latter. Ack. How could you not get cake when cake is in the name of the place? Should I get off this 22 home and get on a 22 back to the Marina to try and exchange? Would I have to go back for a second round? I hate regret. Especially dessert regret.

But there would be none. One bite of my slice of (Marble) heaven was all it took to know it was the right decision. This heaven doesn't come cheap, but with the investment you get sweet service, a sweet retro store design and plenty to share with a few lucky friends. Or maybe not.

Still love you Jen. You'll always be five stars in my book.
author: Jason B.

description:
Holy Mother of God- I just ate the best cupcake I've had in my life.

We get A LOT of cupcake deliveries at my work, as it always seems to be someone's birthday. They're from some sort of trendy bakery each time and I'm never that impressed. I mean, except for SusieCakes. These are dense and joyful cupcakes.

They did a lovely arrangement with the cupcakes, spelling out the birthday girl's name, and included a wide variety of cupcakes, from red velvet to chocolate peanut butter. The vanilla cupcake with buttercream frosting and shaved coconut I tried was a divine and spiritual experience. The buttercream is so completely perfect and the cupcake itself is just... better. Better than any cupcake you will ever have, I swear to you.

Don't buy into the cupcake hype unless you're buying into it at SusieCakes.

SusieCakes is basically the mother of all cupcakes.
author: K M.

description:
The BEST CARROT CAKE I've ever had and I've been told by many that I make the best carrot cake.  Susie's carrot cake is full of flavor with juicy raisins and tons of carrots to keep it very moist.

This is our second time ordering for an office birthday.  I would give five stars for the carrot cake but our last order of chocolate cake was just ok.  My advice is to go with the good stuff!

I love that the box comes with a custom printed post-it of how to store the leftovers.  It's so cute and thoughtful.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I'm not big on desserts and baked goods but if I were ever craving a cupcake, this would be my number one choice. I had the strawberry one and I was in love. As in love as I can be with a little cupcake but I digress. Moist cake, fabulous frosting and my favourite part is the frosting on the inside.

I've gone on random cupcake treks with friends since people are still into cupcakes these days and this one takes the cupcake. What a horrid ending. I'm sure someone's used that one. But oh well. 

I want a cupcake now.
author: Deanna L.

description:
I always make it a point to stop by Susie's when paying the Marina a visit. I'm a big fan of the Tropical cake! However Susie, I'm reading some of your most recent reviews and becoming somewhat concerned about the freshness of your delicacies.

I just hope that I show up on the right day to make sure I get the freshest product, because I do not want to pay a premium price for something substandard.

Keep up the great work because you are always the highlight of my trips to the city.

Your biggest fan!
author: Robb M.

description:
Ooh, so delicious! My friend and I were just walking by and I couldn't resist not going in. Since we were headed to dinner and had already had a couple of beers, we decided to just split a mini red velvet cupcake and it was really delicious! Everything in the case looked wonderful, the ladies behind the counter were really lovely and nice, and we decided after dinner to head back in for more!

All I know is that when I go back, I will have to try the carrot cake. Oh, and I got a free magnet, which I think is awesome, too!
author: Caroline L.

description:
I trekked from Nob Hill to the Marina today JUST to get the Red Velvet Cupcake...which is...hands down the BEST RED VELVET CUPCAKE I have ever eaten. (I got a taste of SusieCakes creations at a wedding I catered a few weeks ago...and knew at that moment that I had to find this place again!) 

For just about $3, you get a fairly large uber moist, tender..supple delicious cupcake batter...topped with a very generous serving of light fluffy cream cheese frosting. And get this...there's even a lil extra cream cheese surprise in the middle of the cupcake!!!

Fingerlickin...PURE GENIUS!
author: Gail N.

description: Pretty cake. Way too sweet. I had a multi layer cake but it was all frosting and too much sugar!
author: Yodosi Y.

description:
Came in here to order a cake for 14 people. Megan (the manager) was super sweet and very helpful. 

I think the cake itself was about  4 stars, but her friendliness, and the fact that she even called me to follow up a few days after I placed my order just put them over the top! 

Their cupcakes however, are worth 5 stars!
author: Irina S.

description:
not as good as Love at First Bite in Berkeley.. but definitely a fan! 
I tried the banana pudding which was delicious. Tried the red velvet and their special cupcake of the day. Both were really good and if I'm ever in the area, will stop by again.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Dear prudie little Susie Cakes,
  I'm super annoyed that you refused to write my friend's name on his birthday cake.  Yes, it can have a slightly naughty connotation, but it is still his name.  He's a gay minority and doesn't need any more discrimination from you.  

P.S. - Doesn't it reflect on your staff that they even know that reference?

But your cakes are delicious.
author: Liz V.

description: YUMMY ! Went in Monday afternoon around 3 and there were a line of people inside.  Anytime I see a line in the middle of the afternoon in a non touristy area I know the place has to be good. I was right I ordered a red velvet cupcake $3. The cupcake had an amazing cream cheese frosting. The cupcake itself was very moist and not very ca-key. Great cupcake, also very good quality ingredients.
author: Alissa W.

description:
No question about it--they have the best cake and cupcakes in town. I recommend the red velvet, though all the flavors are good. 

The store decor and service are also both excellent.
author: Sabrina H.

description: There weren't many choices to choose from. But, then, again, I prefer korean bakeries, because there's less sugar.
author: Eric J.

description: Red velvet cakes here are AMAZING! But the reason they get 5 stars is for their customer service. My friend and I are very indecisive when it comes to cupcakes so we ask a lot of questions. Last min she changed her mind from red velvet to vanilla and the girl had already put 2 red velvets in the box for us. They were nice about it and got her the vanilla one and said we could have one of the red velvets for free! I thought that was really nice of them... So they def met all my requirements for being a "5 star" business
author: Mariya P.

description:
Pretty good for their cakes/cupcakes but I was not impressed with their cookies.  I had to try them 2 times just to make sure I didn't like them....and yep, I still don't.  They are just not the chewy soft cookies I like and prefer but more of a harder and more crunchy cookie.  The cakes however, are very rich in flavor and are complemented by good flavored creams that are not overly sweet.  

The color of red they use for the red velvet is so bright that I KNOW they use a ton of food coloring.  It kind of creeps me out how brightly red they are so I avoid them even though they are my favorite cake.
author: judy l.

description:
Yummy, I love the cupcakes here!
I split one of their famous red velvet cupcakes with my niece and we loved it so much!  The frosting was creamy not too sweet, and the cupcake was nice and moist.

We also split a peanut butter cupcake oh my! Heaven!  I loved the frosting so good, it had the peanut butter taste but not overkill.  It was my favorite over the red velvet, however both were extremely yummy.  

Just had one yesterday and now I am craving one again today, oh my!
author: Lydia S.

description:
I am not that big on cupcakes. I generally think they are trendy and not that satisfying, and usually, when cupcakes are busted out as the party dessert, I think, "Oh, great. You did not want to buy a real cake."

Susie Cakes totally slaps my wrist with that thinking. These delights are so tasty - the frosting is creamy and not too sharply sweet; the cake is moist (I hate that word, but it's accurate here); and the additional frosting inside the cake is a hidden joy. I enjoyed them so much at a party I went to, I decided to order them for my baby's birthday party. I got various chocolate/vanilla combos and the luscious red velvet - wish I had tried the seasonal pumpkin, but I wasn't aware of it at the time. The price was very fair and partygoers were very satisfied (almost too much so - there were only two left, and I thought I was ordering plenty of extra!). 

As some others have noted, the service is excellent. They took my order over the phone in about 5 minutes, called me after the event to follow up on how everything tasted, and were generally just very professional and friendly. When I returned the stand I rented, I picked up a banana pudding and a butterscotch toffee pudding. That was a good idea. Especially the butterscotch toffee...YUM.
author: Kiesha R.

description:
This place is amazing.  Better than Sprinkles.  

Loved their chocolate, coconut and vanilla cupcakes.  Also, the only place I have ever liked a red velvet cupcake. 

So moist and not too rich.

The shop is cute and the staff is friendly.  The area surrounding the shop is nice too!
author: Jenna S.

description:
Shut the front door!!!   Where have you been all my life you delicious red velvet bites of sweetness??  5 stars on their red velvet cupcakes alone.    

The other flavors are just ok, but the red velvet is their superstar.   The cake is the perfect balance of moist and light,  the icing is oh so ah-mazing!   The hubby got me a red velvet cake as well as a few dozen cupcakes to share at my birthday dinner.  And that is part of the reason why I love my man, he knows what I like!   Not to mention, he drove around for almost an hour with the three kids in the car on a weekend trying to find parking in the Marina to pick up the order.   So yes, he obviously loves me because he knows I obviously LOVE these cupcakes!!!  

I might just have to go and get some now....

P.S.  This was stop #6 on my self-created SF Food Tour.
author: Christina L.

description:
SusieCakes is neck-in-neck with the better know Kara's in the hyper-competitive cupcake wars in the Pacific Heights/Cow Hollow/Marina section of the city. There are a few others left in their dust who I no longer even bother visiting since SusieCakes opened.  There are certain thing I like about both Kara's and SusieCakes, and I still patronize both- however I find myself at SusieCakes just a bit more these days when I am in the mood for something sweet.  Here is my analysis-

Both places are great, both are in the same price range, and both give me cavities and make me fat.  The cupcakes at each place are always fresh, moist and outstanding, and really the preference comes down to what you as an individual prefer.  If you like vanilla- then Kara's is the place for you- I have never had a better vanilla than their 'sweet vanilla'.  Kara's also has a great meyer lemon cupcake as well.  If you like red velvet (one of my personal favorites)- then SusieCakes wins- their red velvet is the best of show amongst the local competitors, and beyond that I do not believe Kara's even makes one?  Other delicious varieties I have enjoyed at SusieCakes include a white-chocolate strawberry, a peanut-butter and jelly, and a blueberry variation.  I enjoy their creamier frosting a bit more than Kara's as well.  Both places have 'mini' cupcakes as well to suffice that market need....

Beyond all of this, I have grown to really appreciate and consistently order some of their non-cupcake items- they feature a variety of cookies and cakes and other goodies as well- and unless I am mistaken Kara's only features cupcakes (and coffee...).  My favorite non-cupcake item is the 'Susie's Nutty' sandwich cookie which features two peanut-butter cookies with a peanut butter cream in the middle- excellent.  Maybe my favorite thing at their store? Aside from this location, I have also visited a Marin location of theirs ironically just after visiting my dentist in Greenbrae- and everything is basically the same if not identical to the Chestnut Street spot.

In summary, while I am not exclusively loyal to SusieCakes, I am definitely a big fan and I will surely be a consistent future patron of theirs until my teeth rot out and my cholesterol level reaches critical mass :-)
author: Andy S.

description:
Great service, great cakes!! 

I accidentally ordered the wrong cake, and despite the fact that it had the "Happy Birthday" written out, the ladies at Susie's were kind enough to make a switch (at no cost). 

I'm here pretty frequently to grab a mini cupcake, and I can never decide between chocolate, red velvet, or vanilla. They're chocolate chip cookies are also phenomenal: really, really chocolatey and perfectly chewy in the center, yet with a bite towards the outside.
author: Sandra H.

description: Phenomenal cupcake I had today. The happy birthday chocolate cupcake with vanilla buttercream frosting and confetti. Super moist cake and rich decadent frosting. I don't care if the decorations are subpar. Just keep it tasting that wonderful! Anyway the decoration was nicer than what I do and it was still festive and fun to eat. I also had a red velvet mini cupcake which was good but not the best red velvet I've had. Good enough, I would say. Would buy again
author: Lenore F.

description:
Their red velvet is a thing of beauty - literally and figuratively. Be it in cupcake or traditional cake form... mmmm good. 

Why three stars you ask? Well, the other things I've had haven't been so good. The one I tried this evening was a flavor of the day or something - well, it tasted not so current. Vanilla cake with red funfetti (really?) and a chocolate cinnamon frosting. The frosting was good but could have been creamier. The cake part was kind of offensive though - so dry, blech flavor. 

Thankfully I had saved the red velvet for last, so this evening was redeemed. 

I'll continue to try them out, hopefully be able to award some more stars...
author: Liz K.

description:
My friend and I strolled Chestnut St. after our eyebrow appointment at Benefit and she suggested that we stop by SusieCakes. It was my first time here but she raved about how delicious so I had to try!

We both got two red velvet cupcakes, found a seat outside and dove right in. The red velvet cupcakes were very creamy and tasty. The cream cheese frosting did not taste as sour as some of the other cupcake places. Although their cupcakes are smaller than Sprinkle's in size, it's a perfect amount to satisfy your sweet tooth while browsing some shops in the Marina.
author: Vikki K.

description:
Now this is what I call a bakery! Susie Cakes--welcome to San Francisco!

I'd bookmarked this month-old Marina spot when I noticed it being reviewed by several of my Yelp homies. Today, after finishing our "make your own salads" at Blue Barn, I told the BFF to keep his eyes peeled for Susie Cakes (the road to hell really is paved with good intentions; I go to the Marina for a semi-healthy lunch & end up at yet another bakery *sigh*) We didn't have to look very long or very far--it's located right next door! (I am not-so-secretly happy that Miette has been replaced.)

The counter is busy with glass cake holders; red velvet, coconut, german chocolate--all with slices missing, exposing gorgeous filling & perfect cake layers. Behind the display case, well stocked rows of pastel frosted homemade cupcakes share space with cookies & whoopie pies. 

Their seasonal cupcake is Orange Creamsicle (available til the end of July, I was told) but I went straight for the Strawberry ($3). I was disappointed to find no real strawberries. The frosting, though more tart than I expected, was creamy & delicious. The little extra frosting that they pipe inside was a nice surprise. It is absolutely necessary that I try every cupcakery's vanilla on vanilla, so I ordered a mini ($1.95.) Loved the frosting--so sugary sweet! The vanilla cake in both varieties I tried were a little dense. I prefer a more light & fluffy texture. I'm hoping this is just a kink they can work out in time for my second visit.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
YUM!!!! Excellent selection of cupcakes, nearly every flavor you can think of, plus lots of other yummy treats! Came here on a rainy evening in search of dessert with my boyfriend and we were certainly not disappointed. 

Sooo....
we got a lemon bar - delicious, seriously, if you don't get this you're missing out.

Whoopie! - pretty good, however I prefer my Whoopie's to be more cakey and this was more like a cookie, but never-the-less the flavor was there. These were massive.

Snickerdoodle cookie - these things were as big as my face! (That's not saying much, but I digress...)

Brownie - yum! Super good, pretty moist. 

They also have a nice selection if candles for cakes, the really long kind that are typically difficult to find. We also purchased a "Happy Birthday" tiara here for our friend which we will be presenting to her shortly! We will be back!
Some stuff was a bit pricey, but the staff was extremely friendly and helpful!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
The chocolate cake I bought here got amazing reviews at my husbands birthday party! They all said it was moist, was very rich and it was pretty to boot. I got the smaller 6" Old Fashioned 6 layer Chocolate Cake ($33) and it served 8 people plus had a little left afterwards. 

*Warning if you go pickup on the weekend either go early before Chestnut is crowded or have someone in the car. It took me almost 30 minutes to just find a spot for my car so I could run in. Once inside they were fast, so nice and the cake was ready to go, but picking it up on a Saturday ended up being a nightmare!
author: Natalie N.

description:
I was at a birthday party the other night, and the birthday girl's sister bought the cake from here.  OH...MY...GOD...this cake is AMAZING!!!  It was a chocolate layer cake with vanilla buttercream frosting, with some confetti.  The cake itself probably weighed about fifteen pounds, and you could feel the weight when eating a slice.  As much as I hate the word moist, it really is the perfect word to describe the texture of the cake.  Perfect ratio of cake to frosting.  Next time I need to buy a cake, I'm getting it from here!

There was only one problem: I was so stuffed from dinner that I couldn't finish my slice!
author: Lindsay B.

description:
I was excited that another cupcake spot sprouted in San Francisco but I was rather turned off to find out that it's a chain. But I left all my inhibitions at the door and decided to try SusieCakes for their cupcakes. 

This review is about their cupcakes only. That's the only thing I've tried so far but their cakes look delicious! I'm going to have to pick up a slice of carrot cake for pops on his birthday. 

Their cupcakes are filled with frosting but it's not too much. Probably just a little dallop. I picked up a regular sized mocha cupcake for $3 and three mini cupcakes for $5 total: red velvet, chocolate, and vanilla. 

MOCHA - Um, it tasted exactly like the chocolate cupcake. What happened to a slight hint of coffee?? No where to be found :(

RED VELVET - Probably the best red velvet I tried in the city!

VANILLA - Standard. Nothing to rave about.

CHOCOLATE - Standard. Nothing to rave about.

One thing that bothers me is that they don't have boxes for one cupcake. So if you buy 1 cupcake, you're stuck with it in a paper bag. Classy? I think not. Aside from asethetics, the cake is pretty moist and their cupcakes have a homemade feel to it. 

I'll give SusieCakes another try in the near future because I still want to try their lemon cupcake as well as their carrot cake. Rather disappointed with their "mocha" cupcake.
author: Heidi C.

description:
I have become a serious fan of Susie Cakes over the last few weeks.  I've found that anytime I'm remotely anywhere near the vicinity, I somehow find myself walking through the door excited to taste another bit of deliciousness!  

The thing that I love best is that you can get a few mini cupcakes (3 for $5) if you want just a little something sweet or you can splurge and get a regular-sized cupcake.  We've often picked up a dozen for dinner gatherings because it gives everyone the chance to try something different (instead of our having to eat the same type of cake).  

I usually don't even want to try red velvet cupcakes at bake shops because they are always underwhelming but the ones at Susie Cakes are THE BEST!!!!  The secret is absolutely in the icing.  The ladies in the shop are so cheery and fantastic!  I love this place and the minute you bite into one of these cupcakes (or cakes or pies or brownies), you will too!
author: Ashley C.

description: I stopped by during my visit last week and got one chocolate mint cupcake. I've had a lot of cupcakes from different places through out my travels so I have a lot to compare this with. The cake itself was normal like everywhere else but the frosting was good! Mint is not a usual flavor anywhere and it was just different to have. Plus it paired up with chocolate so well!!!
author: Cat N.

description:
SusieCakes is the whole package - cute shop, nice staff, mouthwatering cakes and the red velvet cupcake is DELICIOUS to boot! It's fluffy, moist and just the right amount of sweetness. 

I didn't want to leave the shop because I was just so happy standing there and staring at all the cute and yummy goodness.

UPDATE: We ordered our wedding cake from Susiecakes! A warm shoutout to Megan who was so sweet and helpful. If you're looking for a simple 3-tiered buttercream cake, look no further than Susiecakes. I can't wait to have our red velvet cake - will definitely update again after the wedding!
author: Nancie T.

description:
there are so many cupcake places popping up everywhere i was really suprised to see susiecake in marina when walking around one day.  i didnt bother trying it the first time i saw it.  they do have doggie biscuits and water outside though =]

their cupcakes are very good!  i saw many people ordering cake slices and wondered if those were even better?  the cake is very moist and a bit dense but i think thats why its so moist?  i had the red velvet.  and i didnt think there was too much frosting.  i thought there was just the right amount.

we bought one togo for my cousins toddler and when we opened the bag in the car, the whole car smelled of strawberry!  

they even have whoppie pies
author: claudia y.

description: Delicious cakes! I love the german chocolate cake and carrot cake. And the people who work here are super friendly.
author: Jamon B.

description: They have the best red velvet cake I have ever eaten and the cream cheese frosting is worth every single calorie. Luckily I live in SOMA and don't venture to the Marina that often because if I lived nearby, I'd get a slice of red gooey goodness on a weekly basis. I ordered 12 dozen mini-cupcakes for my partner's birthday party. The service was top notch from making the tasting appointment, tasting the different types of cakes and frosting, making and updating the order, and the delivery of the cupcakes. The chocolate cupcake with coconut frosting was runner up to the red velvet! I will definitely order from them again.
author: Kevin C.

description:
The icing tastes like the one on top of the cupcakes we had in the early 80s in elementary school...before we knew how bad butter was for you.

I went there 2 times in the last week after making this discovery.

I had 2 vanilla cupcakes and the coconut cupcake and 3 cookies....in one sitting and then went back for dessert! Just kidding!

The cupcakes are soft and moist and much better than Kara's, American Cupcake and Crave. These places all taste the same to me. 

THe place closes at 8pm. Everyone hustles to get in right at 7:50 pm. It should close at 9 or 10 on the weekends.
author: Gitanjali K.

description:
I love these cupcakes!!  

Sadly, I am ending a three year love affair with Kara's cupcakes because of Susie.  Oh, Susie!  You just destroyed the best relationship I have had in years.  Kara never disappointed me!  She was always there for me and she never judged when I finished eating that cupcake before I even left the store.   

But I can no longer just cheat on Kara with you.  I must break the ties and commit myself to Susie's sugary sweets.  Oh, how I love Susie's strawberry filled cupcakes. Love! 

But unfortunately, I must write my dear john letter...

Dear, Kara.  It's over between us.  It was a good run.  I have had a lot of great times with your vanilla cupcakes.  But I have become bored by you.  Your frosting is too sweet, too buttery.   Delicious, yes.  

But all good things must come to an end.  This is no way for me to live.  I can't live like this!  I can't!  I won't.  I can't afford to buy two different cupcakes from two different establishments.  I must choose.  Susie cupcakes are cheaper.

Hey, don't be sad.  I'll miss you.  I will.  honest.  I just dont' have the time or the money in my life to give you anything.  It's not you.  It's me.  

Susie is number one in my life.  Her cupcakes are served on a little plate.  She has samples for me to eat while I wait in line to order.  Plus, she has cookies.  You've never given me a cookie.  Not once!  Some days I like a cookie...

We can still be friends.  I hope. 

Take care.  All the best.  Have a great summer!
author: Iggy R.

description:
Delicious!  

Took their cake decorating class today with 2 other friends and we had such a fun time.  They showed us how to properly cut, stack and frost the cakes. Then how to mix colours into the butter cream and make pipettes to decorate our cakes.

While our cakes didn't look nearly as nice as our instructors, I can confidently say everyone enjoyed the class and brought home some good tips to practice at home.

And finally, when I got home and showed my masterpiece to my husband he must've been feeling kind because he said it looked kinda cute... but when he actually tried that cake his eyes popped and said it was damn good, super moist and just the right balance.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
ive had their cupcakes and i ate an insane amount of frosting when wedding cake tasting. their standard flavors are fine and frankly, run of the mill. the only times i have been pleasantly surprised were when i tried the monthly special cupcake or cake. seriously good each time. 

but dont try to order THOSE as your wedding cake. the baker states is absolutely impossible to make a cake with their salted caramel frosting any time outside of september. seriously, they wont budge. it can ONLY be done that month. like..really? and dont ask if that insane guinness cupcake with irish cream frosting can be made into a cake, cuz uh, the answer is no. firm, no. its almost mind boggling that you even ask. absurd.

susiecakes loses points on customer service and absolute inflexibility. 
if you go, check out the monthly specials and for heaven's sake, dont you dare stray from the menu.
author: Dama J.

description:
SUMMARY.
Does the marina really need another cupcakerie? No, but this place is different.  This place sells various childhood baked goodies that are oldies but goodies from simpler times.  No fancy fondant, crazy piping, or herby flavors or futuristic decor.  Reminds me of magnolia on bleeker.  Cupcakes here are $3 each, generally dense/heavy (not my favorite texture), but flavorful.  Some flavors  need work. I'll be back to check up on them.  Nice, welcoming service.

DISPLAY:
Like old school places, stuff is on baking sheets/trays. Like they just took em out of the oven.  It feels like a bakery, not a "boutique" cupcakerie.

CUPCAKES:
In general, cupcakes w/a vanilla cake were super dense, but not dry.  They were heavy and not "springy".   I guess this is a dense cupcake done right, whereas American Cupcake is a dense cupcake done wrong.  So, if you like light fluffy cakes, you might not like these.  Personal preference. Also, they "fill" all their cupcakes with a tiny bit of frosting.  I personally didn't like this. But to each his own.

The 4 cupcakes I tried:
1. Vanilla (vanilla cake w/vanilla buttercream frosting)- cake had good vanilla flavor. A bit dense for my preference.  Frosting: reminded me of magnolia, from the pale pastel colors to the simple spatula-spread frosting (no fancy piping of frosting or strange, round domes a a la kara's). Sometimes, simple is good.  

2. "Seasonal"  (vanilla cake w/strawberries baked into it; white chocolate frosting).   This is like a strawberry muffin, with nice pieces of strawberries.  If you let this one sit too long before eating, I can see how the moisture from the strawberries would make the cupcake too soggy.  Cupcake had good flavor, not too sweet.  White chocolate buttercream frosting was delicious.  Not a frosting I see at other palaces.  I think cream cheese would have been good too. Or a strawberry buttercream.  Just suggesting...

3. "Lemon" (vanilla cake w/lemon frosting).  This was just ok--needs more work to elevate the lemon flavor.   The lemon frosting tasted like a cross between lemon curd and the jelly in a lemon donut. It didn't stand out like I'd imagine lemony flavored things to do so.  The texture of the frosting could be revamped too--it was also a mix of a buttercream /jelly in jelly donut.  I really wish the cake itself was lemon!  Right now, the frosting must carry the weight of the lemon flavor and it's just not there yet.  How about adding lemon zest to the frosting or cake? 

4. "Peanut Butter" (Chocolate cake w/PB butercream frosting).  Cake: after plowing through 3 dense vanilla cakes, i expected the same of the chocolate cupcake.  Yet, this cupcake was light and spongy, it actually tasted kind of like it came out of a box.  The frosting was delicious!

They also have cookies, cake slices. Other cupcake flavors: mint, red velvet (can't believe i didn't get this!!!), chocolate, mocha, coconut.

If I'm in the hood, I might be back. Density-wise, I like Kara's better.

RANDOM:
Anybody else think the name of this place sounds like it's the sequal to Boogie Nights?
author: Caroline I.

description: The. Best. Cupcakes. Ever. Make an excuse to get them. Birthday party? Obviously. Friends visiting? Definitely. Housewarming? Of course. Pre-gym snack? Why not!
author: Cassie S.

description: You've got to get the vanilla celebration cake!!!!! OMG!!!!!!  Loved this place in this adorable neighborhood
author: Erin M.

description:
Yeah, I dunno. I read about 40 of these reviews. I agree with most all of them. I agree with the 5 star reviews, and with the 2 star reviews. That's weird, but it's a reflection of how awesome Yelpsters are here in the city. We're accurate! We like what we like! I like green monkeys - 5 stars! I hate green monkeys, because the killed my penguins, but I respect their quality - 2 stars!

SusieCakes is an offshoot of the LA SusieCakes. Know it!

Everyone is comparing it to Kara's. I tried a big old slice of chocolate fudge cake. I thought they'd cut it thin, so that it would have about the same mass as a cupcake. (I go by mass.) It was a big old honkin' slab o' cake, though, and it went for 6 bucks. Basically 3 cupcakes worth. I thought it was really good. My wife scorned me for buying a huge slab o' cake. I washed the scorn down with 1000 calories of chocolate cake.

My wife, however, had different ideas. She's a consummate cupcake idealist. An amazing baker, she's the type to dismiss some of the best cupcakes the world has ever seen, dumping them in the trash, frowning, and mumbling, "something is lacking," while a host of shocked little kids hold each other, rocking, mouths agape and eyes wrapped in misery. 

The dryness of the vanilla cupcakes, which other yelpsters called "cornbread-like," didn't do it for her. I recommended eating some of the frosting in the same bite as the cake. She called that idea, "a crutch for the unimaginative." She then blithely tossed it at my ear. I was driving down Bush, dodging texting cabbies and peripatetic buses. I was thinking about chocolate cake. 

Kara's isn't going to like the competition, but they are still better. Of course, the lack of red velvet is an issue, but they are a whole step above this cute little shop. Perhaps it is unnecessary. Perhaps it will keep Kara from resting on her laurels. It seems that she rarely rests anyway, though.
author: micah f.

description:
I really tried to like SusieCakes.  There are very few cakes I will turn down, I love cake.  Perhaps it's because I'm not a big chocolate lover, perhaps they do chocolate better than my favorite cake (vanilla with a buttercream frosting).  The first time I went there it was close to closing and a grabbed a slice of the confetti cake.  It was good for one bite.  Then you notice the cake is really greasy and the frosting is ridiculously sweet.  

The second time I went, thinking I perhaps had a bad batch, I tried a cupcake.  The cake was dry and stale and the frosting still crazy sweet.  My friend got the peanut butter chocolate and it was just terrible.  The peanut flavor was really artificial and just not very good.  She ended up throwing it away.

I don't think I'll be going back.
author: Sasha R.

description:
I was so excited to try this place out. The store is cute, their items looked yummy so I ordered a couple cupcakes.

Red Velvet - DRY cake but the frosting was very good.
Strawberry - Again, DRY cake but the frosting was awesome.

I loved their frosting but need to love their cake also! Wouldn't go back & wouldn't recommend them.
author: Asian G.

description: OMG!  Best 7 layer bar  I've ever tasted.  Just like my grandma used to make. Very friendly staff that makes the line move quickly.  Banana creme pie was tasty too
author: Jannine N.

description: Susie Cakes baked my wedding cake and it turned out so beautiful! I brought in a few pictures with a design that I liked and they executed it perfectly! It was three tiers with chocolate, vanilla, and red velvet. Unfortunately I didn't even get a chance to eat a piece, but I heard it was delicious! Susie Cakes was very reasonable compared to other bakeries I looked at, too. Thanks Molly and Susie Cakes staff!
author: Katie P.

description:
Stopped by this place after eating Barney's Gourmet Burgers off of Steiner St. I must say we were taken in by the smell of this place.  Walked in and little halos and a white light shined on the cupcakes..haha!!  So with that said I decided to try them.

Here's what I finally decided on:

(1) Stawberry cupcake (very strong strawberry taste..my least fav of all that I tried.)
(2) Red Velvet cupcakes (very moist, and the red color was sooo bright...LOVED this!)
(2) Blueberry pancake cupcakes.  This is a seasonal flavor and one of the BEST cupcakes I have ever had! 

I paid $15 for 5 cupcakes..pretty expensive but hey good desserts are def not cheap!! They also have chocolate, vanilla, and red velvet mini cupcakes for 3 for $5.  My friend and her kids LOVED them =)
author: Charlene D.

description:
I will ONLY buy Red Velvet Cake from SusieCakes Bakery!  It is a true Red Velvet Cake!  So moist and delicious!  It is obvious that SusieCakes uses only the finest ingredients.  For Valentine's Day, I bought my boyfriend a heart-shaped Red Velvet Cake with MINE written on it.  He absolutely loved it!  It made our Valentine's Day very special.  

Believe it or not, today I got a call from SusieCakes Bakery asking me if my boyfriend enjoyed his Red Velvet Valentine's Day cake.  That's right... they called me!  Their customer service is tremendous and makes me feel like a valued customer!  

If you're looking for a special treat, look no further than SusieCakes!  Everything is yummy and fresh, plus the people who work there are warm, friendly and helpful!  

Thanks SusieCakes!  See ya soon!
author: kristan l.

description:
I love SusieCakes!  I've had it several times the last year and it is always really good.  We all know there are a number of cupcakeries in the Bay Area and SusieCakes is definitely tops.  

Their red velvet is yummy.  But I like how all their flavors are good.  My faves are the strawberry cupcake and lemon cupcake.  Its also cool that they have other items you can buy including cake, pies, cookies, etc.  Their prices are pretty average so no issues there.

The store and presentation of their sweets are really cute too.  :-)  I am a fan!
author: Anna C.

description: Great little cake shop in the Marina District.  We have a friend who lives in the neighborhood who brought us to check it out.  We weren't disappointed.   Very Yummy and worth a visit.
author: Joe G.

description:
I've been a SusieCakes fan ever since I tried my first SusieCake cupcake in Calabasas. I'm SO glad they made it up here!

We tried their seasonal cupcake, red velvet cupcake, coconut cupcake, free samples of their whoopie pies, chocolate chip cookie, 7-layer bar, & Butterscotch Toffee & Chocolate pudding. 

Seasonal cupcake - the best! It was the strawberry seasonal cupcake this month. MMMMmmm...very good. I think this is my favorite! It was perfect...not overloaded too much with the strawberry flavor. It had just the right amount of strawberry touches that I like. The frosting was very sweet, but oh so good. For some reason, this cupcake tastes like strawberry ice cream to me. Anyone else? It was creamy, sweet, dense, & delicious.

Red velvet cupcake - I always order red velvet cupcakes wherever I go. Red velvet is always good. My question, how do they make their cupcakes SO red??? hmmm.. 

Coconut cupcake - surprisingly great! I'm not the biggest fan on coconut cupcake, but this cupcake has sure changed my mind. Some may think it's too sweet, but I have a sweet tooth so I loved it. Just the right amount of coconut to top it off- YUM! 

Pudding - Oh my! Verrrry sweet. I could only take a few bites. I think it would go well in a cream puff or a doughnut. It was okay to me but I needed a glass of water after 2 bites.

7-layer bar, whoopie pies, & chocolate chip cookie - all were just okay for me. Nothing too rave too much about. The chocolate chip cookie was huge, but not the greatest thing. 

I would stick to their cupcakes all the way! Nothing beats SusieCakes cupcakes in my book. Martha Stewart was right! I was sad that I didn't get to try their Strawberry cupcake bc they were all sold out. Oh well, there's always next time. And there definitely will be a next time. Thanks for moving up here, SusieCakes! I LOVE YOU!
author: Annette Y.

description: Just got a 6" red velvet 4-layer cake for my sons 2nd birthday...AMAZING. The icing is super delicious and the cake is really moist but not at all dense. We tasted some others when we were in the shop which were also good but red velvet is their signature for a reason!!
author: Amanda S.

description: Really adorable bakeshop that makes delicious (and very pretty) cakes.  I love that they do their cakes by the slice, which is great when you just want to drop by for dessert.  My S.O. had the vanilla celebration cake (it's basically fancy funfetti with really great mint-colored buttercream), and I had the flourless chocolate cupcake.  The slices of cake are HUGE-- like 2-3 normal slices of cake-- and more than enough for two to share.  It was about $6 for a slice, which given the size and quality, wasn't bad.  The flourless chocolate cupcake was also great-- dense and rich and not at all dry.  The staff seemed a bit overwhelmed, but it was their anniversary and they were running a lot of promotions and were very busy, so that might have been why.
author: Courtney C.

description:
This is a cute bakery on Chestnut Street.  We had just been to Kara's and picked up a few cupcakes (shhhhhhh) and on the way back, Hubby wanted to try a Susie's cupcake.  I stood outside with my Kara's bag (too embarrassed to go in) while he went in and purchased a red velvet and mocha.  He wanted a cupcake throwdown (oh..... Bobby Flay, where are you??) 

The red velvet is good, moist with a very melty, soft cream cheese frosting, $3. It was a bright red cupcake.  Overall, I prefer the red velvet cupcakes at Noe Valley Bakery.  You can't have a red velvet cupcake throwdown against Kara's because they don't use artificial coloring, which is what's needed in red velvet, lot's of red food coloring.
The mocha cupcake was also moist but I thought it was too sweet.
Should've ordered the strawberry one which Lolia S. says was delish.

Their cupcakes come in mini - 3 for $5.  And they serve pies ($8.95 - $25), cheesecakes $32, puddings ($5-$25), cookies/bars ($3-$5), specialty cakes:  coconut, German Choc, carrot, marble, choc ($33-$46), sheet and tiered cakes ($33-$225), and wedding cakes.  I like that they use quality ingredients such as European-style butter, Scharffen Berger cocoa, Ghirardelli and Guittard chocolate (local products).

They have 6 stores in California and all but 2 are located in So. Cal:  Brentwood, Calabasas, Manhattan Beach & Newport Beach.  You can find a store in Marin-Greenbrae if you live north of SF. All calorie havens.
author: Ry T.

description:
Cute, unpretentious, great service!
has the johnny rocket's feel of an era gone by
guess it is like Magnolia's of NY but I prefer Kara's cupcakes.
kara's has more refined ingredients (local and fancy stuff)
and Kara's frosting is worth eating alone

you do NOT want to eat the frosting at SusieCakes alone. it needs the cake.

the chocolate cake: nice, light, airy
the vanilla cake: dense as others have noted - feels like Magnolia's of NY  (I like Kara's better, kara's is light and vanilla-y)

price is standard $3 (less than Miette but more than Noe Valley)

so given this is in parking place hell and is ok. I will stay a Kara's fan.

though my friend did RAVE about their frosting on the red velvet! my friend was on a quest... so she knows her red velvet frosting!
author: Sophia Y.

description:
There are SOOO many cupcake joints in the marina..sometimes it feels that a new cupcake store opens every other week-I can't keep up! So, when I heard that Susiecakes opened up today, I figured, "I might as well try this place since I've gone to EVERY OTHER cupcake store in the Marina"  Thank goodness I did!! Let me tell you why:

1) Delicious treats!! Their cupcakes aren't too sweet and are very moist - YUM!  I love the ratio of cake to frosting - pure perfection. 
2) The variety of desserts - whoopie pies, 7 layer bars, slices of cake, cupcakes, whole cakes - the works! 
3) Friendly staff - everyone here is pretty helpful and sweet.

Overall, I will have to say that this place is by far my favorite place :)
author: Cherlyn M.

description:
Susie you blow Kara out of the water! The RED VELVET is amazing! I was grabbing lunch a few Sundays ago and noticed that Susie Cakes was open- a soft opening they said- but I stopped in to pick up a Red Velvet cupcake for my roommate and I to share. It was soooo hard not to- I mean my roommate and I keep telling ourselves that we are on a diet since it is bathing suit season- buttt then again it is summer in San Francisco and when do we wear bathing suits? Soooo might as well get the cupcake! 

$3.00 for a cupcake aka $0.25 cheaper than Kara's- sign me up! 

They also have cakes, cookies and many other desserts. I got my birthday cake from Kara's this past February along with mini cupcakes. The mini cupcakes were good- but the cake not so much. The cakes at Susie's look fabulous! 

SusieCakes = amazing and very fresh tasting! Just like coming from mom's oven!
author: Kimberly M.

description:
Did a royal sampling of goodies to take home and devour.

Depending on you preference of liking dense dense cakes verses light and airy, you'll be very happy if it's for the heavy cakes.
I bought 2 cupcakes lemon and a seasonal, which is strawberry filled with white chocolate butter cream frosting. Not much strawberry
I give way thumbs up for the frosting, sweet yes, but so nice and thick, and come on, it's a cupcake =) The LEMON cupcake ROCKS!!!
The frosting gets a tad filled into the cakes, an as I was saying before, the cake is really dense, so it's filling and satisfying...but didn't stop up!
Also bought a slice of the marble cake, again, very sweet, very thick rich milk chocolate ganache frosting and dense dense cake.

Whoopie Pie...hmmm, confused.... it's more like a brownie sandwich with buttercream frosting in the middle. This is NOT a "whoopie pie", this is heavy duty stuff...again, didn't stop us...

oh the BANANA PUDDING!!!! Super yummy! with nilla wafers and  whipped cream.....That won my heart! More pudding PLEASE!!!

all those goodies came to bout $21...I suppose reasonable....welcome to the hood =)
author: ERICA E.

description:
Watch out, Kara, these cupcakes (and cakes) will blow you away. 

I like how Susie Cakes has daily samples of one of their yummy treats. They also offer cookies, cheesecakes and lemon bars in addition to their great variety of cupcakes and cakes. 

Their chocolate cake and red velvet cake are amazing and their chocolate chip cookie is super chocolately and delicious! They use mini chocolate chips in their cookie so you're sure to get chocolate in each bite :)

So happy a new bakery has joined us in the Marina. Yum!
author: Joy A.

description:
This place is dangerously addictive.

THE BEST vanilla cupcake I ever had the pleasure to Nom Nom Nom-- It tastes like cake batter!! And the red velvet is fabulous!! 

I also love that this place stays open until 8pm with a great selection still available.

Thank you Susie for rockin my world!!
author: Stef I.

description:
SusieCakes is in a great location because its on Chestnut in the Marina where there are tons of shopping and food.  You always need a froyo and dessert place to wash down your lunch/dinner. 

Went to SusieCakes right after a pretty salty yummy meal at Pacific Catch down the street.  All the parking around here is based on expensive meters.  A quarter per 15 minutes? jeez. 

I bought the mini cupcakes which had about 4 different flavors- I got red velvet and chocolate there was also vanilla and something else too.   I kind of wish there were different options for the mini cupcakes because  I didn't want to get a regular size one.   I wanted to try the mint chocolate flavor. 

The cupcakes were moist and the frosting was light and yummy.
author: Anya R.

description: YUM!! I love to find dessert spots! The staff was really friendly. I had the marble cake..bf had the PB whoopie cookie. The cake slice was huge!!
author: Madelon C.

description:
I tried their red velvet cupcake.  It was good but it didn't blow me away.  I thought the frosting was a little grainy and the cake flavor was ok.  In my opinion, That Takes the Cake has a much better cupcake because it has more flavor, the cake is moister, and the frosting melts in your mouth.  Kara's are marginally better too.

But, the girls behind the counter were really nice and kept giving me new samples to try.  I tried a couple of their cake samples, they were delicous and moist.  Next time, I'll get a slice of the chocolate marble cake.
author: Shelly W.

description:
As I walked by SusieCakes, this is what was going through my head:

Too bad Miette closed

Another cupcake place in the Marina?

Mmmmmm, cupcakes

Wow those look delicious

I shouldn't

Ok fine, I can bring them to the picnic

*note* - it doesn't take much to convince me to try a cupcake (or actually any dessert)

The cupcakes look perfect, which always makes me a little skeptical, but these cupcakes tasted as good as they looked. I got 9 mini cupcakes (3/$5) 4 red velvets, 2 chocolate and 2 vanilla (no I did not eat them all, I took them to a picnic). The red velvet was fabulous as was the vanilla, the chocolate was not as good, but was still delicious. The frosting was thick, creamy and sugary tasting perfect for a cupcake and the cake part was moist and not to fluffy.

I will definitely be going back to SusieCakes, they sell a large variety of desserts, not only cupcakes. Great addition to Chestnut street!
author: Elaine S.

description:
This is my new favorite cupcake shop in the bay area.

Sprinkles is my second favorite, but I find the cake to be lacking.  At SusieCakes the cake is actually dense, moist, and delicious.  It doesn't just hold the frosting-- it can stand alone.  Sprinkles has a very corporate mass produced taste these days, whereas SusieCakes has a very homemade look and taste.

My favorite is the vanilla.
author: Poker B.

description:
Although I am no cup cake fan, I couldn't resist the candy-colored shop and wanted to buy something to try.  I got something seasonal: a pumpkin bread pudding, for $5.  The packaging is cute, but boy, $5 is a lot of money for the size of it.  I could have gotten something twice as big for $3 at Tart to Tart, or $3.75 for a small bowl at Tartine.  

But this pumpkin bread pudding was quite special!  I brought it home to share with my husband and the first thing he said was, you went to SusieCakes?  I thought, why would you know a girly cake place in the Marina?  Turns out, Brian Wilson likes this place, supposedly.  Wow, you must be super secure with your masculinity to endorse a shop full of pink cupcakes!  

Anyway, the bread pudding was delicious.  The whipped cream was especially good, with its fluffy and airy texture and slightly spicy taste.  

I almost think it's the worth the price.
author: Candice B.

description:
I'm a huge Red Velvet Cupcake lover and yesterday my coworker surprised me with one of these.  It was so GOOD, I scarfed it down in about 30 seconds flat.  Amazing.  Tons of frosting that tasted just right, cake was moist and nommilicious.  I mean it's pretty hard to screw up red velvet cupcakes but SusieCakes did it just perfectly.  

I cannot wait until I have a chance to head over here to buy more.
author: Sonya T.

description: I love their seasonal sweetie pies (sugar cookie with a pie like filling inside) It's amazing! I always hear it calling my name whenever I'm in the area. I also really like their lemon bars. Haven't tried their cupcakes yet, but I am definitely willing to get one next time I'm in the area!
author: Maggie T.

description:
I was looking for Kara's Cupcakes but since parking was too horrible and I was getting tired walking around the area for a Kara's when I can easily get one near home: Santana Row, I started to walk back to Pataxi since we ordered pizza and the wait was 40 minutes.  I turned around and saw Susie Cakes.  

Inside was a cute bakery w/ many pink and girly colors.. it was packed!  Cakes, cookies, cupcakes, and whoopie pies!  I got the mocha cupcake, peanut butter cupcake, chocolate cupcake, and a whoopie pie.  The whoopie pie was huge and so sweet but not too overpowering.  The cupcakes were moist and not too sweet as well which was very impressive to me!  

I can't believe I forgot to check-in though but nevertheless I will come back for more!!!
author: Tram N.

description:
Coconut cupcake was one of the best I've ever had.  And I will fantasize about the buttercream sandwich cookie until I visit again.  The staff was super nice and helpful while I made my decisions. 

We tried Susie's, Kara's and That Takes the Cake on the same day and Susie's won hands-down.
author: Katie P.

description:
Really yummy cream cheese icing cupcakes. Tasty! I literally just ate one a minute ago and then signed on to Yelp.

But......... you REALLY have to have a sweet tooth to eat the whole cupcake. I have a sweet tooth normally -- but this was just a tad tooooooo sweet and heavy for me. Coming from a girl who eats sweets by the pound, you have to understand, the cupcakes are VERY sweet and VERY heavy. They are good, just a bit too good. Maybe the petite cupcakes would be better than the regular sized cupcakes.

It's good as a treat once in a while. Then hit the gym because you'll need it. 

So maybe I'll eat another Susie cupcake in March ... or April... next year!
author: Marie F.

description:
With Kara's being my favorite, any other cupcakery is hard pressed to excite me.  However, I stumbled upon Susie Cakes today and spontaneously bought one of their seasonal special cupcakes, and I have to say it was DELECTABLE!

I found the cupcake to taste very homemade, which is a nice change from most of the other cupcakes around.  It was very reminicent of birthday cupcakes I'd bring to school during my childhood.  Great, flavorful and soft frosting...and chunks of strawberry in the moist bread.  Oh, and their cupcakes are frosting filled!!!!!!  How have we not thought of this before?!?!?!

Definitely give it a try if you're into cupcakes.  And if you're not into cupcakes, well then you can just go be pensive and bitter someplace else! Just kidding....kind of.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
Walked by & had to stop in -- picked up 6 cupcakes -- Seasonal: orange creamsicle; strawberry; red velvet; mocha; coconut; and chocolate mint.  Had the red velvet while sitting outside -- too delicious -- the cream cheese frosting was deliciously sweet, yet enough tartness to make it sure it wasn't cloyingly sweet.  The red velvet cake was moist and light -- not heavy, dry or overly crumbly.  Orange creamsicle was good -- but not as good as the red velvet -- the icing had an orange flavor (extract, not zest), and the cake, though moist, was more dense.

Hours later -- will update as we eat the various flavors.  So far, so good!  
One note -- for all of the cupcakes, there is a nice balance btwn the icing and the cake -- they (so far) all work well together, but you need both of them to get the complete picture, as you should have to.  Neither the icing nor the cake dominates the flavor and texture -- they work and play well with the other.  If you're looking for 2"+ of icing on top of your cake, this is not your place.

Day Two:  Just had the chocolate mint cupcake & it is the best so far -- the mint icing is minty & sweet but very well balanced -- not too sweet or too minty, with just a hint of crust on the icing.  The chocolate cupcake is the best yet -- very moist and crumbly, yet not dry or dense at all (even on day two).  There was a slight indentation in the cupcake with the icing piped into the hole -- created the perfect ratio of cake to icing in each bite.

Coconut cupcake was also delicious -- the coconut and butter in the icing were quite pronounced which gave it a rich flavor in combination.  The cake was a bit denser, more like the Orange Dreamsicle cake -- very moist, but denser.  Good coconut flavor in the cake made for a nice combination of the icing and the cake.

Two left for afternoon snack . . .
author: Star M.

description: Red velvet cupcake was great. Loved the cream cheese icing and I am very picky about red velvet, anything, after tasting the best red velvet cake I had ever eaten back in Louisiana. There are a couple tables and chairs outside and they have a water bowl for your pup as well as a jar of dog treats. When I'm in the area craving a sweet, I won't hesitate to go get my red velvet fix at SusieCakes Bakery.
author: Kelsey K.

description: Really? $17 for four cupcakes and I ask for a birthday candle and it's $.50 plus tax? Have you never heard of "gift with purchase"? Cupcakes, however, were delicious.
author: Pat W.

description:
I really like this area, and on a warm sunny day...what better way than to enjoy some sweet baked goods!

They have probably 8-10 different cupcake flavors, a variety of cookies, and small cakes. We got the seasonal special which was pineapple upside down cake, red velvet, chocolate mint, and coconut.

Most were decent, and the frosting was a bit more like sugar icing than your typical cupcake bakery frosting. All of them also had a filling inside, except the red velvet. The red velvet was the favorite of the batch, mainly because the cake was nice and moist but was not oily like most red velvets.

Cupcakes are $3, and the woopie pie I believe was like $5.50? The decor is pretty cute, kind of retro, 50s American diner feeling. Cute colorful cakes and lively ambiance.
author: Stine H.

description:
The staff gets five stars. Always very nice and friendly. 
My picks are the Whoopie pies and the slices of cake. 
The cupcakes are pretty but dry. Frosting is out of this world.
author: lin b.

description: What can I say....SusieCakes is AMAZING! The tropical coconut cake is the only thing I ever get...Honestly, if it ever got discontinued I would most likely want to die. I get SusieCakes for literally ever occasion I can, and sometimes just for because in the Marina area!
author: Sheryl P.

description: They made order and delivery of my daughter's birthday cupcakes so easy!!! This busy mom needed that. Plus, the cupcakes are so yummy-just like my grandma's frosting and hers was the best. Thank you susiecakes.
author: Lala C.

description:
I just had 2 cupcakes but I was underwhelmed. Overall, I would much rather used those calories eating cupcakes from Sweetiecups. 

I had a red velvet and a vanilla cake with strawberry butter cream frosting. Both were good, but I felt that ll of the frosting had way too much sugar that it overpowered the taste of everything else. The cake was OK, although could have been a bit more moist. I was eyeing the 7 layer bar in the case and didn't get one. I think if I were to be in here again I would skip the cakes and cupcakes and maybe go for that. 

All in all, good spot, just not amazing.
author: Lindsay A.

description: I tried the red velvet and mint chocolate chip cupcakes - delicious!!! And the other day, they were handing out free mocha and chocolate cupcakes!!!
author: Natalie S.

description:
It was my roommate's B day and he had one request for me." I knew you will buy me a surprise Birthday Cake any way, So.... Please buy it from Susie Cakes" He requested. 
"What is Susie Cake?, I never heard of it" 
I replied. 
" Google it,it's on Chestnut st." He replied and smiled. 
So I managed to Google and found this place and got a big Birthday Cake.
    And now I know why my roommate requested for Susie Cakes for his B Day. I know now that they famous for Velvet Cake but I kept going back and tried their other cakes - Coconut Cake, Neapolitan Cake, Carrot Cake and all kind of Cup Cakes. And they are all wonderful. 
     I work in the wedding business so I went to the wedding every weekends and have tested so many expensive wedding cakes but Susie Cake still stands out in my mind when you talk about delicious Cake - I am not even sure if they do wedding cake.
author: Dom G.

description: Yum! First time trying Susie Cakes and loved it. Their snicker doodles are amazing. Also LOVED the lemon cupcakes and the chocolate mint cupcakes.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
After having sushi at the best sushi place in SF (Zushi Puzzle) we wandered on Chestnut and found SusieCakes Bakery. I noted that I wished we wouldn't have gone to Kara's (because they didn't have Red Velvet cupcakes. ) The nice lady behind the counter (without hesitation) grabbed a red velvet cupcake off the shelf and handed it to me "on the house". It made me love the cupcake even more (although the cream cheese frosting and cake would have won me over alone)
I'll be back to try more. Thanks SusieCakes!
author: Heather E.

description:
Tried the red velvet, mint chocolate, and vanilla cupcakes, which were both flavorful with the cake part rather dense (not bad, but I tend to prefer the lighter and fluffier fares) and the frosting not too leave-a-film-in-your-mouth rich or teeth-hurting sweet (yay!!).  

The whoopie pie seemed no different than merely two chocolate cookies held together with creamy filling; rather different from the New England original that I had when first introduced to such delights.

Take-Away: with cupcake-eries popping up faster than I can spell c-u-p-c-a-k-e, I found this place to have a draw factor and the jury still out about its repeat factor.
author: Carol K.

description: We tried other cupcakes in the Cow Hollow area but none compared with Susie Cakes. The coconut was the best but all we tasted were worth the calories. There was usually a line and I understand why. But it moves fast and well worth the wait.
author: Robin M.

description: SusieCakes is not a bad option, but also not going to blow you away. I wouldn't choose SusieCakes over any other bakery in the city, but might be worth a visit if you're nearby. Friendly staff, nice presentation, but ultimately, I'm just here for the food
author: Taylor C.

description: REAL from SCRATCH kinda goodies at this deelish bakery!  LOVE the Celebration Cake...so retro, rich ans dense with oodles of layers.  Cupcakes, cookies, lemon bars, brownies, etc........  You can't go wrong with anything you order.  Great service and occasionally you might just run into Susie herself...an adorable Chicago native!  Worth the drive across The City Bridge or Bay...be patient if there's a line!  Need a birthday cake for any age...pre-order or just show-up they will have something to fit the bill.  Love YOU Susiecakes !  xx
author: Nene H.

description:
Brown Butter Oatmeal cake w/ Irish Whiskey and Coffee Buttercream frosting and green sprinkles. 

The slice was generous; the cake was delicious. A very lovely weekend treat!
author: Andrea L.

description: I can't remember exactly how much my slice of chocolate cake was, but at first I thought it was expensive until I saw it was the size of my head. It was so good it would have been worth the price if it was just a tiny sliver. When you take into account the size, I think the place is amazing and a good value.
author: Erik B.

description:
Susie could be the most anticipated girl to move into the Marina since Marilyn Monroe!  Definitely happy to have her here.

The place looks great, and even just two days in business, the staff was knowledgeable and efficient.  I tried the fudge cake which was quite tasty, though I can't say it was the best ever.  I'm a big eater but couldn't get through half of it in one sitting, so my initial $5.50 sticker shock has abated a bit.  Look forward to trying the marble cake next.

Bought my kids a sugar cookie which cost an astounding $3.  Was a fine cookie, but certainly not remarkable enough to justify the price.

I thought the cupcakes looked rather pedestrian but ever other reviewer is telling me otherwise.  Look forward to giving them a go.

Welcome to the neighborhood, Susie.  I think you'll be sticking around for a while!
author: Mitchel H.

description:
I don't know if one slice of cake is worth 5.50. Really wanted a late afternoon / pre-dinner snack and the last slice of carrot cake was just sitting there tempting me in its solitude.

For someone who strongly dislikes raisins, pineapples, and nuts in cake, I found little to complain about with the taste of the carrot cake. I loved how moist it was without being greasy. I even found myself indulging in the cream cheese frosting. It's a hefty slice that can easily be shared with 2 others so I guess you wouldn't have to think "did I really just pay 5.50 for a slice of cake? I could bake two entire cakes with that money." 

There are two little tables outside at which you can eat your sweets and people watch on Chestnut. Cute. 

Also the workers ought to pay better attention to who is next in line because I totally got skipped over and I felt offended.
author: Lydia W.

description:
It's very hard to find a good chocolate cake but Susie's is so moist and so yummy!!!

I don't particularly like German Chocolate cake but when I tasted theirs - oh, wow!

Luv it, luv it...
author: JHOANNE G.

description:
Best cupcakes in the city by far. I keep coming back to this bakery thinking it can't be this good, but it really is. The cake is moist and tasty and the icing is sweet but not overly sweet. I have tried cupcakes all over the city, and this is the only place that doesn't  let me down. 

Highly recommended.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Oh Whoopie Pies.....why must you haunt me so? Why must you be so mind-bogglingly delicious to the point where I want to rub you all over my face in ways that might earn me a triple-X rating? 

I swear that the Whoopie Pies MUST have some sort of crack in them. Or something highly addictive- because I can probably eat a dozen of them and still want more. And then have to buy new pants or something to fit my fat ass into.
