Not only are their Whoopie Pies totally a different texture than most, they are in a totally different league of deliciousness than most. If you don't get one when you go there, then you should be ashamed of yourself. 

Ashamed that you're missing out on trippin' on Whoopie Pies.
author: James B.

description: Best cupcakes in San Francisco - we had red velvet, vanilla, mint chocolate and flourless chocolate and they were all amazing!
author: Lisa F.

description: My friend came here for cupcakes and highly recommended their strawberry flavored cupcake. A while back when I stayed in NYC, I went on a cupcake craze where I literally hunted down all of the cupcake shops in NYC. Having tasted one of the finest cupcakes, I think this place is pretty good. Not the best, but definitely won't disappoint you. I think what makes a good cupcake is the buttercream frosting and the moisture of the cake itself. I got the seasonal white chocolate strawberry frosting, so white chocolate frosting and strawberry chunks in the cupcake. I was going to go for the strawberry or red velvet, but decided against it. The frosting was buttery and very sweet. The cupcake itself was good, but a bit dry on the mouth. Overall, I think it's beautifully presented. My friend got their cookies & brownies, which were not their specialty and thus not that great.
author: Joyce B.

description:
This place gives out samples!  Yes.  If you want to try a taste of the red velvet before you commit to buying the whole cupcake (or layer cake), the shop girl will shave off a small sliver of red and white, pop it into a cupcake liner, and hand it to the thin, blond woman with the young, sagging face and the ancient eyes who gobbled up the morsel in front of the yearning look of her toddler.  

I still don't understand what "frosting filled" cupcakes means.  Does this mean they filled the cupcake with frosting?  And now it has even more frosting than normal cupcakes?  Or do they fill the frosting with something on the top where the spatula has made a swirled, decorative scoop?  Either way, I'm skeptical of places that uses quotations to describe items of consumables.  

Even though the brochure says "$20 for 2 dozen mini cupcakes," my friend paid $60 for 3 dozen special order cupcakes.  It wasn't even that special.  I mean, the ducks still lost.
author: Christina C.

description: Randomly saw this place and it was crowded. Thought "hey, why not?" and walked in. The sales clerks were very nice and on top of things. I got the banana cream pie. It was smaller than a personal pizza. It was about 8-9 dollars...not too bad. Ate it in the car and it was good. Not the best I had but good.
author: Samantha H.

description:
For the cheesecake alone I would give 5 stars. The lemon bars I would give 4 stars.

But for everything else...eh. I've had much better cupcakes elsewhere...some reviewers think these are "moist" but I feel the texture is better described as a wet sponge, and not a very flavorful one at that.

The pumpkin pie is decent, but I tend to like my pie crusts more baked and golden.

Also, the service here isn't very kind unless you know what you're ordering. An elderly lady in front of me had trouble deciding which cupcake to get (she had some allergies) and the girl behind the counter was incredibly impatient, almost rude. Definitely not an environment to linger in.

Get in, grab a mini cheesecake, then get out!
author: Jen K.

description:
I'm what you can call a cupcake snob. I love cupcakes...yes, they are just small cakes, but whatever, they are cute! 

I've heard great things abous Susie Cakes and the line out the door convinced me that waiting in line was going to be worth it. 

Their signs boasted that Martha Steward chose their Strawberry cupcake as one of her favorites....I was sold. The strawberry frosting was absolutely divine! Fluffy, not too sweet, not too thick, and perfectly strawberry-ish! The cake? Eh...have had better. It was a little dry and kind of reminded me of cornbread. The mint chocolate chip one also had the same cake consistency- the good thing is that they aren't overpoweringly sweet. 

It's a cute bakery, but I wasn't impressed enough to have the desire to come back. I'll walk a few extra blocks to have Kara's Smores cupcakes (the BEST!).
author: lauren j.

description:
Working down the street from here is dangerous!
So far everything I have tried rocks, their red velvet is my favorite. The peanut butter frosting/ chocolate cake cuppie, was the best I have had.
Moist cake, light frosting, how could you go wrong?
I've also had their apple crumble pie, brought it home to the boy as he loves pie. It only lasted a day or two.

The staff, or cupcake girls as I call them, are as sweet as the treats! Always smiling and friendly. I dig the green bandanas in SusieCakes green, I think it's better than Tiffany blue.

I need to try one of their whoopie pies... must have self control...
author: Emily P.

description:
I was so excited to see another cupcake shop in the Marina. The store had a simple display of all their cakes and cupcakes. I purchased the Strawberry (which is shown as Martha Stewart's favorite) and the Orange. With excitement, I quickly drove home to dive into the bakery goods to only be a bit disappointed. 

SusieCakes is really all about the frosting, and not too much about the cake. The cake was ordinary. Not flavorful and was a lil too cakey. The strawberry frosting was really good, and I think that was the only great thing about the cupcakes. The orange - eh, I can live without it. Nothing hyped about it. 

Prices were $3 a cupcake, $1.95 for a mini-cupcake, $45 and up for cakes. 

Sorry Susie, Kara's Cupcakes is my Marina favorite...

Will I come back again - Maybe if Kara's is close.
author: Dee T.

description:
SusieCakes has samples. 

There. I said it. Samples galore. 

I will often walk on THAT side of the street, purely and selfishly, so that I can pop my head in and grab a sample. A bite of pumpkin cupcake? sure. Snickerdoodle cookie piece? yes please. 

And yes, I do BUY actual whole products. Of those, I have enjoyed (thoroughly) their snickerdoodles and chocolate chip cookies. Keepin' it simple is sometimes the way to go, people. 

My friend bought a whoopie pie from there and while she nom nom nommed it all the way home, I wasn't necessarily impressed. Service at SusieCakes is welcoming and pleasant, and though I don't think they bake anything out of this world, I do enjoy treating myself to their homemade goods once or three times a day. I mean week.
author: Laura D.

description: All their cakes taste the same.  Lots of sugar and the base cake is the same across all of the selections.  And if you want to take advantage of their "seasonal specials" good luck.  For example, their strawberry shortcake is hit or miss at best.  And when I asked about availability I was told to call to ask if they have it that day, and I shouldn't expect they will have it within the next few days, even though it is listed on their chalk board as a special.  Hardly worth the effort.  Easier to just make it myself.
author: Mike B.

description: I've been going for awhile and always thought the cupcakes were delicious.  Just as equivalent to Kara's cupcakes.  But when you can compare something side-by-side sometimes it negates a standout.  But then I tried the carrot cake and found this was the best carrot cake Iv'e had.  So now it deems a necessary stand out from others and a consequent review.
author: around town e.

description: I got the coconut and pineapple cake and my roommate had the confetti cake. Both were super duper rich and heavy. I had to scrape off the icing because it was too sweet. Wasn't really my cup of tea.
author: Alice W.

description: I've only had the red velvet cake but its damn good - so moist and delicious with not over the top cream cheese topping in the correct proportion.
author: Wakako U.

description: Cute store front! many different flavors to select from. Red velvet was good!
author: Arlynn A.

description: My partner had the gluten free cupcake and her comment was "I've had better in DC". For me I had the very large chocolate chip cookie and yeah it was good, but not anything out of the ordinary.
author: Jocelyn M.

description:
I had just stepped out of Blue Barn next door with a mean 'n lean salad, ready to head home when I noticed out of the corner of my eye...cupcakes...

5 minutes later i stepped out of Susiecakes with 6 cupcakes...honestly I'm not sure what happened in the span of those few minutes.  I don't quite remember much.  Remember that scene in Old School where Will Ferrell's character Frank blacks out and knocks out James Carville and then re-awakens?  Yeah, that was me.

The cupcakes however were just so-so.  The frosting was just too much and way too sweet.  It overpowers any real flavor the cupcakes were supposed to have.  They were somewhat dry too, but varied by the flavor.
author: Tadd L.

description:
Ah, SusieCakes. If only every bakery could be as friendly and helpful!

I placed an order for a large one sheet cake with only two days advance notice, and Molly was helpful and enthusiastic the whole way through. Everything from the custom design to the delivery was taken care of. 

Bottom line is, if you need a custom cake done well along with the peace of mind of having it delivered, go with SusieCakes.
author: Daniel S.

description:
I SO wanted to love their cupcakes, but they are just a little denser than I like, with overly sweet frosting.  They are supposedly "frosting filled" but there is so much tooth aching sweet already, that tag is overkill.
They need to moisten the cake part, so it's not just a fat frosting vehicle.

Their strengths are...
CARROT CAKE - only giant slices, no cupcakes :( !
Could go toe to toe in a DELICIOUS DUEL with kara karrot, if only they made it in cupcake form (or at least a cheaper than $5 1/2 slice)
Strike that, if they did, I'd be here every day.

SNICKERDOODLES, CHEESECAKE, and PUDDING (vanilla and banana) are great, with real NILLA wafers - NO skimping!

If you like ultra sweet buttercream frosting and heavy cake, this place is for you.  Even the red velvet is good (that artificial red SF-ers seem to hanker for -  I prefer to get my daily food coloring in a bag o Cheetos) as is the Peanut Butter frosting w/ chocolate cupcake.

I'm thinking of changing my name to All-Things-Peanut-Buttery...
author: Bamboo T.

description: All I can say is YUM! A little piece of heaven. I had the lemon and my husband had the red velvet. The lemon had to be the best cupcake I have ever had. The cake was  was moist and not too sweet and the icing was the perfect blend tangy and sweet(tasted like fresh lemonade). I had a bite of my husbands red velvet and it was delicious as well. The cake was perfectly moist. Go there!!!
author: Helen D.

description: I love this place.  The customer service is great. I ordered a beautiful red velvet cake for a birthday on Easter weekend.  They had it ready with instructions.   The thing that really impressed me is that they followed up with a call to see how the cake was, if I had any problems and thank me for the business.  In an age where everyone is ordering things on apps etc this really impressed me.  I'm still young but having been in customer service for 10 years. I still believe great customer service creates brand loyalty that can't be measured.  I'm always going to order from them from now on because of this thoughtful gesture.
author: Malinda C.

description:
DELICIOUS! 

This little gem is one of a kind. Unlike the "other" cupcake stores Susie Cakes adds that little bit of extra love into their cupcakes and their service. 

My favorite is the red velvet and the peanut butter! The frosting is perfect and the cupcake is so moist it tastes like it just came out of the oven! 

Haven't had their cakes yet, but I do see them all in there EARLY everyday baking away so I am sure they are just as good as their cupcakes!

Great people and fantastically sweet treats!
author: Kelly B.

description: The store is decorated very nicely and the ladies behind the counter are very friendly, but nothing can salvage a dry cupcake - It's like taking a bite of a slightly mushy apple - you just can't get past it and have to throw it away. The frosting was super sweet (but not necessarily in a good way, unless you're a little kid) and the cupcake itself was so dry. I paid over $3 for one cupcake and was so disappointed, especially since it looked so beautiful.  I really wanted to like this place, but I'll have to take my $3 somewhere else for that occasional sweet tooth.
author: Jake B.

description:
We hate you.  My saggy ass, cottage cheesy thighs, droopy pooch, teacher arms, double or triple chin, and jiggly back hate you Susie.  We hate you and your decadent butter cream frosting made the way nature intended frosting to be- creamy, buttery (not lard), sugar bliss.  We hate your moist chocolate cake that dupes us into a second... make that a third piece.  And we hate that your cakes are big enough to have leftovers sitting in my kitchen right now pulling me like crack to a junkie upstairs at 10:30 in the morning for yet another piece of cake.
We hate you Susie.  We really hate you.

***  We're back from upstairs and we're going to sit on you Susie.  That will teach you.
author: Cort T.

description: I discovered Susie Cakes while on a Cupcake tour in the area. The bakery is very small, but how much space do you really need? Grab your treat and move on. They had slices of cake the size of my face that had me drooling the moment I walked in the door. Their red velvet cupcake, which they are famous for, was amazingly good. Super flavorful and rich, topped with a sweet and creamy cream cheese frosting. Their presentation was definitely lacking - it looks like they just plopped the frosting on top with minimal effort. Not exactly something I would want to display at a nice event or catering, but for the day to day sugar fix, who really cares how they look? Apparently, they use some type of special butter in their batter that gives their cake a dense, smooth consistency. It was different, but in a good way. I would definitely recommend this bakery if you are in the area and have a sweet tooth.
author: Jaimie A.

description:
I have ordered dozens of cupcakes for meetings and events from SusieCakes Bakery and have to say that their cupcakes are always a hit!  I tend to order the mini cupcakes as they allow people to sample various flavors with the Red Velvet and Strawberry cupcakes as two of the favorites.

My last order was a chocolate 9" round cake with butter cream frosting for a birthday party.  Everyone seemed to be in a state of bliss.  The cake was rich and moist but not dense like some gourmet cakes tend to be.  The butter cream frosting complimented the chocolate cake with just the right amount of sweetness.

I recently started using their delivery service and have to say that it takes the stress out of having to pick up the yummy baked goods!  They usually ask for a two hour delivery window so I typically request that the latest delivery time be an hour into the event if the treats are being served for dessert.
author: Myrick T.

description: Four stars for the whoopie pies, which are better than the cupcakes. Three stars for the cupcakes which I thought were a bit dry and lacking in flavor. Good service. Good coconut cream pie.
author: Ce Ce M.

description: Amazing cupcakes! Hands down the best red velvet cake.
author: Saprina A.

description:
I'm so glad hat I'm moving to San Francisco because Susie Cakes on Chestnut Sreet is a dream. Their frosting is wonderful, creamy and moist and they always have samples where you can taste new flavors.  Try it, you'll love it.
Barbara T.
author: Barbara T.

description:
My friends and I decided to stop by here after a day of kite flying and bubble blowing in Crissy Field!  It's such a cute shop and everything inside looks AMAZING and delicious!!! 
I got the season special, which was pumpkin spice with cream cheese frosting. It was really good; the only thing was the frosting. It was pretty good, but it's really sweet and there was a lot of it! 
The price seems a little expensive, but I guess it's on par with other bakeries that are similar.
I woud definitely go back though! Gotta try some of their cakes & cookies!!
author: Kei H.

description: Miniature Cupcakes are delish. $20 for the dozen, and so presentable in a customizable box. Cute ideas and very clean. *LIKE*
author: Monalisa M.

description: Tried their carrot cake and red velvet cupcake. They both were good!
author: Hien N.

description: The red velvet is all I've had, and it is all I will continue to have....until further notice. It's darn good. Highly recommend.
author: gabby m.

description:
SusieCakes is, hands down, the absolute best dessert place around! I've had my fair share (and maybe other people's share as well...) of cupcakes and none of them compete (Sprinkles, Kara's, Love's, Love at First Bite...and the list goes on). SusieCakes frosting is AMAZING. The cake is delicious. Their frosted cookies are also worth-trying!!

I even took a cupcake decorating class at Susie's! While the class was fun, it was a little expensive...$65 and you get to take home 12 cupcakes, but you don't get to pick the flavors (you get 6 vanilla and 6 chocolate with white icing, only) so that was a little disappointing.
author: Raminder H.

description:
I'm always on the lookout for gooooood cupcakes...so when I find a bakery worth talking about I will... :) 
SusieCakes is something to rave about. I'm a huge fan of cupcakes, cakes... all of the above, but I hate it when there's just waaay too much frosting because of the overbearing sweetness of it. SusieCakes however does not have that problem. With a great balance of sweet from the frosting with the flavors of the cake, their recipes have great balance. I mjust say the celebration cake caught my sweet tooth... a slice you must try. I look forward to trying more of the their flavors.
author: StaceyRose G.

description:
A and I were walking along Chestnut Street checking out some dinner options when we came across SusieCakes.  We'd never heard of it, but it looked appealing, so we went in.  They have so many cakes and cookies and cupcakes!  There were a lot of things in there that looked good, but we hadn't eaten dinner yet, so we asked when they closed (8PM) and said we'd come back.

And we actually almost didn't make it back.  At about 7:55PM, we were still sitting at Enoshima waiting for the waitress to have the time to bring us the check.  I finally told A to head over to SusieCakes while I took care of the bill so we wouldn't miss out.  So he went over and, would you believe it, he was back and done before I was even done with the check.

He ordered the Mocha and Chocolate Mint for himself and a Red Velvet for me.  He also got me one Susie's Nutty, which is two peanut butter cookies sandwiching peanut butter buttercream.  Super peanut butter-y.  If you don't like peanut butter, don't order this!  And, I think probably because it was closing time, they threw in another cupcake for free.  So we ended up with two Red Velvets!

I thought the cake was really light and fluffy and the frosting wasn't too sweet nor too hard. They really do pile on the frosting though.  The flavors really stand out and it's definitely good.  I might try this famous strawberry cupcake next time though.  I mean, if Martha Stewart likes it...
author: Kris L.

description: Wanna take a trip to outer space? Call this place. Spoke to a couple space cadets while trying to place a cake order, (FYI Susie Cakes: don't let people who don't know what they are doing try to answer questions about your cakes. It just frustrates potential customers). FYI: Cakes are so dense and heavy that carrying a large cake will break a mad sweat. So sweet we could barely finish a slice. Tasty, but will bring on a diabetic coma.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Susie Cakes is great on the taste buds...but not on the waist line! Ever since this little bakery has opened on Chestnut, I've been walking by salivating over their freshly baked cakes and cupcakes. You can purchase the cakes by the slice or as whole. And they are not skimpy with the slices either! One slice is easily sharable among several friends or can last a girl for days. So far my fave is the Coconut Cake! Best coconut cake I've had aside from my mom's of course :-) The chocolate cake is ok but not craveable. 

Next up on my to try list at Susie Cakes: Red Velvet Cake and then the Confetti Cake! With a few dozen trips to the gym in between.
author: Amanda W.

description:
It's a little hard to type this review because 1) my eyes are rolling into the back of my head in sugar coma from the amazingly delicious coconut cupcake i'm devouring and 2) the decadent frosting is all over my hands, cuz I can't stop eating the cupcake....

Ok, it's not like I haven't had Susie Cakes before - love the Newport location in Socal - but I had to try them here to make sure they were as good as they are 6 hours south. Mystery solved - YES they are!

Great...now I've got to run 10 more miles to work off the deliciousness...
author: Heidi M.

description: This ritzy little neighborhood is adorable to stroll around on a nice sunny day. The bakery is super clean and the staff is super friendly and helpful. I didnt go too crazy with the sugar overload so the staff recommended the 7 layer bar. Which was HEAVENLY!! i look food with a lot of texture and this HAD IT! The chocolate and nuts were delicious. I could had ate a whole plateful but i got some self control!!
author: Angela L.

description:
I didn't actually buy any cupcakes, but the selection of them, and of cakes, looked awesome. They were also giving out bite size samples of cupcakes. I got a taste of two different cupcakes, and they were delicious.

After my "diet", i will come back and buy one!

Super cute place, nice people behind the counter.
author: Carol L.

description:
Stumbled upon SusieCakes while walking around the marina one afternoon. Walked in for a cupcake because who couldn't use a cupcake once in a while? 

My boyfriend ordered the red velvet cupcake (which was insanely good), and I was lured by the pumpkin cheesecake (perfect fall dessert and also insanely good). We pretty much devoured each immediately - it was hard to hold back. 

Other spotted goodies included cookies and cakes, which I promised I'd return for. 

A few weeks later, my boyfriend surprised me with a 7 layer funfetti cake for my birthday. This was unbelievable. Not only was it delicious, it was so well crafted. A few days after purchasing it, my boyfriend received a call asking how it was and making sure we were satisfied. Now THAT is service. 

This place is the best bakery, by far, in SF.
author: Cristina P.

description:
I'm going to review the taste of their sample and the overall feel of this place.

After having lunch at Asqew grill, I had to stop in for a look at all the tasty desserts they have.  Lo and Behold they had some samples!  Yay!  I love samples!... Anyway- they had samples of their white chocolate raspberry cake, and I was so happy eating the sample.  I'm usually a regular chocolate girl or a red velvet girl, so I didn't expect to be blown away by this cake.  But, boy... it was so moist and tasty!  I had to go back in and get another one!

I really liked how once the sample tray was empty, they filled it right back again with more samples.  Yes, Please!

The cakes look amazing, and give that special home made feel.
author: Beth M.

description: great service, amazing cupcakes -- I'm going back for all special occasions!
author: Emily B.

description:
Honestly, I've eaten my share of cupcakes - small shops in the city, private chefs, caterers, you name it - and I have to say Susie's rank #1 in my book. The cakes are amazing and have replaced my "go to" of a bottle of wine when going to someone's house. The RED VELVET, COCONUT and CARROT CAKE are my all time favorites. Icing is the real deal - cream cheese, cake is moist through and through -- ugh, run, don't walk.

Thank you Susie for opening in the city. I will be recruiting the troops from far and wide, especially from your "neighbors."
author: Tavistock Restaurants LLC ..

description:
Great cupcakes and slices of cake.  Super friendly staff.  Adorable packaging.  

Just wish it stayed open later so we could grab a cupcake after dinner!
author: M. C.

description: Favorite cupcake place in SF.  Cupcakes easily 5 stars, but location is a pain in the ass...wish they would either move or open a second location someplace else in Richmond or the UCSF/Sunset area.
author: D S.

description: My name is Susie and approve of this bakery and it's Red Velvet Cake.  The most moist red velvet with just sweet enough cream cheese frosting.  Yum-my!  I am proud to have my name associated with this delectable sweet goodness.
author: Suz L.

description:
This place is adorable and tasty.

Red Velvet is a must have! Their original was so delicious and made it home on a crowded, hot, sticky muni ride. (ew)

Good places nearby for lunch and you can pop in for dessert. They don't just have cupcakes, either. Cake (whole and sliced) bars and squares, cookies and drinks. I wanna come back and try more :)
author: Courtney M.

description:
When I had decided to move from Los Angeles to San Francisco earlier this year, I was sad to think that I would have to say goodbye to Susiecakes. But they decided to make my life that much better by opening up a location up here! This location is a bit smaller than it's LA counterpart, but is just as delicious.

The "celebration" funfetti cake is one of my favorites. They do really cute decorations, too, when ordering them for a birthday. The bars, cookies, and cupcakes are all moist and flavorful, and never too sweet. They also offer a great selection of party napkins, sparklers, greeting cards, sparklers, and other things like party hats. Absolutely love their aesthetic.

So happy to have you up in the bay, SusieCakes!!!!
author: Geno B.

description: I have had a lot of red velvet cupcakes from other bakeries and they have been sub par. Not here at SusieCakes bakery. Their red velvet cake is sweet enough and moist too. Nothing worse than a dry cupcake. Good thing they have mini versions of their red velvet cupcake along with actual red velvet cake where you can get slices of. In any case, their red velvet rocks as well as their other flavors of cupcakes. Their seven layer bar wasn't really memorable thus the one less star. Other than that, good cakes!
author: Edna F.

description:
I used to live next to the SusieCakes in Los Angeles' Brentwood neighborhood. It was the best part of living in Brentwood. 
I moved home to SF, and was sad that i never found a cupcake as perfect as SusieCakes.' This all changed when SusieCakes opened a location in SF. 
Whenever I am having a bad day, or whenever I'm in the Marina, I always grab at least one cupcake. Their Strawberry Crush cupcake is to die for. And the Carrot Cake!!! Oh man, the Carrot Cake.  Simply divine.
author: megan s.

description:
I love sweets and SusieCakes takes my breath away!!! Yay! 

Although I live in San Francisco, trucking it way across town for a cupcake may seem excessive. So, I limit my indulgences to my days off when I don't have a child in tow... 

I prefer their slices of cake rather than the cupcakes but the Whoopee Pie???? Yummmmmmy!!! It takes me a week to eat one. A bite a day keeps the gastric bypass away! 

Pricey but worth it!  Their customer service is also great!  I'm a stickler for guest satisfaction and they meet the expectation!  Great job ladies and thank you for taming my sweet addiction!!!
author: Gin R.

description:
I'm not very big on cupcakes but I do like the treats at Susie Cakes. They must be loaded with butter and sugar because the cupcakes are super moist and very tasty. I usually don't even like butter cream frosting but theirs is pretty tasty. They've also got other tasty treats including whoopie pie, cakes, and more. 

If you're a sweets fan, it's worth a visit!
author: Enzo R.

description: Susie Cakes is the BEST bakery for cupcakes and cakes, hands down.  I haven't tried their cookies yet, so I can't comment on that, however I have driven to the Marina on several occasions JUST to pick up a slice of cake or a few cupcakes.  The cakes are SO FRESH: moist, tasty, melts in your mouth.  The frostings are always sweet and not hard like a lot of store bakeries.  I usually get the chocolate cupcakes with sprinkles but I have tried many different flavors and they have all been amazing.  I absolutely love this place and can't say enough good things about it!  There was another reviewer who criticized their cupcakes saying he thinks San Franciscans just don't know a good cupcake.  Riiiiiight - go back to San Jose and stay there.
author: Sofia G.

description:
I stopped in here for a cupcake to surprise my mom for her birthday.  I ordered the coconut cupcake.  It was very good, however a little too sweet for my taste (and I have a big sweet-tooth).

I think I'd be back when I need a super-sweet fix, other than that-- I might go back to Kara's or another cupcake shop.

I also must add the staff was friendly & courteous - good customer service!
author: Heidi B.

description: $3 for big cupcakes.  I loved the red velvet! The strawberry cupcake was okay.  Peanut butter was a little too rich for my taste buds.  I was hoping that there would be more fun/exotic flavor combination, but the cupcakes are pretty plain.  Though they are seemly big portions, I don't know if I will be returning here.
author: Jen P.

description: My all-time fav! My most definitely go-to spot for cupcakes! Just writing this review makes me salivate and want one or maybe a few! When I heard that Susie Cakes was coming to SF, I was in utter shock! Before SF, I wouldn't mind going to LA for them, aside from visiting friends. My fav is RED VELVET! IF you haven't had it... TRY IT! I go to Susie Cakes about a few times a month; otherwise, I have withdrawals!  It's extremely deelish. An extra plus if you have it with milk! =) Susie Cakes also have special cupcakes they make during the holidays and those are also worth trying if you're anticipating whether you should or not. It's something different than ones you may have been accustom to. They are all sooo... DEELISH and YUMMY!
author: Megan S.

description:
We stopped in here to try the red velvet cupcake (samples) and I thought it was a too fluffy and moist for my tastes.  

Otherwise..it's a bakery that sells cupcakes, cakes and some lemon bars, and cookies.  No seating inside the bakery but on a nice day, you can sit in the front of the store (4 chairs available).
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Ever since I was introduced to Magnolia Bakery in NYC a few years ago, I've been on an eternal search to find the perfect cupcake.  {FYI Magnolia is not all that SATC has made it out to be, hence my search}.  

With that said, I really LOVE SusieCakes on Chestnut.  Besides the fact that it is conveniently located only a few blocks from me {which is actually quite dangerous}, their scrumptious cupcakes and other desserts continue to impress me.  Their frosting is like sugary goodness and their cupcakes are very moist.  This homestyle bakery includes a variety of seasonal pies, specialty custom cakes, cookies, bars, & cupcakes.

What I LOVE even more is that their customer service is fabulous!  I've been to another nearby cupcakery (cough cough Kara's on Scott) several times and each occasion has included an unfriendly experience for my friends and I.  Not SusieCakes!  They are consistently friendly and very professional- both in the store and over the phone. They were running a special during Orange October and had fun SF Giants cupcakes available to order.  I placed an order the day before a world series party I was attending, ended up stopping by early the next day to pick them up, and sure enough they were ready!
author: Carla V.

description: The best cupcakes I've had is Magnolia NYC in Hummingbird flavor!!!! There's no other places that can duplicate that! 2nd is Georgetown cupcakes, google it. SF used to have nice cupcakes from Sibbys San Mateo. But I went back few months ago, they were ok. For Susie go for mocha flavor. Lemon is hard on the inside. The rest are ok nothing to rave about.
author: Clemencia S.

description: Review is a bit late but I wanted to Yelp them nonetheless.  I ordered the old fashioned chocolate and the tropical coconut cake for Christmas Eve dinner.  Both cakes were incredibly delicious!  Best cakes I've had in quite some time.  My family polished off both cakes leaving no crumbs.  And the customer service is amazing.  When I showed up to pick up the cakes, they sent out a staff person with me to help carry the cakes back to the car two blocks away.  They didn't want to just throw the cakes into the same bag for fear of them getting ruined.  These are people who believe in their baked goods.  And so do I.
author: Gordon A.

description: Oh Susie Cakes, I love you!  Best bakery on Chestnut!  Staff is friendly, knowledgable, and greets you the minute you walk in.  Delicious cakes and cupcakes.  Mmmmm, mmmmmm!
author: Nicole W.

description: Fantastic bakery with really delicious cupcakes and other baked treats. The employees, especially Riley, made it a fun and friendly experience. Pumpkin cupcakes for the holiday season were very tasty and the red velvet was one of the best I've ever had. The frosting isn't overly sweet, and the cake is really moist, so you continue to eat more than you should! Have yet to splurge and try one of their larger cakes.
author: Jeffrey Y.

description: Horrible customer service! I walked in today and stood around for about 3 minutes with no greeting or anything! There were about 4 women behind the counter and I made eye contact with two of them, still nothing! Then two white women walk in (yes, I am a black woman) and all of a sudden it's "Hi! Welcome to Susie Cakes!" WTF?!?! Seriously?!? Oh and thanks for throwing 4 mini cupcakes in a paper bag! Yall might as well have just frosted the bag.... I know now to take my money elsewhere, and if you're wise, you will too!
author: Dominique C.

description: Just found out about this place while at the Jazz and Wine Stroll in Rockridge.  They had mobile truck giving out free cupcakes so we went to the store on Chestnut the next day.  The cupcakes were incredible, the carrot cake was great, and the service matched the treats!
author: Jeff E.

description:
Was so disappointed with a cupcake I had at Kara's today that I walked into this place hoping to make my frown into a smile again. 

Glad I did! Had a red velvet cupcake and my faith in plunking down 3 bucks for a cupcake was restored. The red velvet cake was definitely moist and the cream cheese frosting was sweet but not so much that you end up gagging. Will definitely be back again to try the other desserts that I saw ....Move over Kara - Susie is the new gal in town and judging by the line (that was out the door as I was leaving) she's here to stay! 

Oh and by the way, Susie's cupcakes are cheaper than Kara's...=)
author: Cris H.

description: I had two cupcakes here, and while the cupcake itself was moist and delicious, I found that the frosting in both were way too sweet for my tastes.  I'm a huge dessert person and fancy myself to be a decent baker myself (Ok, admittedly, I almost opened my own bakery) but I haven't had a frosting in a long time that was this sweet where it made me wince a bit.  If only I could take the cupcake from this place and mix it with somewhere else's it'd be really fantastic...but alas, I don't think I'll get another cupcake from here because it was just too much.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: Ok - the reviews are extensive on this place, so I took advantage of ordering the Red Velvet cupcake and whoopie pie while in the area.  The Red Velvet cupcake lives up to its strong reputation.  Cake, cream cheese  frosting, and center surprise were all fantastic.  Thankfully I ordered 2 and had 1 for the next day as a special indulgence.  The whoopie pie was a freakin' disaster.  The frosting was a slightly fresher consistency of Oreo cookie filling and just as sweet.  Yuck.  I will avoid at all costs.  I would say, stick to the cakes and cupcakes, and if you like red velvet -- this place really 'takes the cake' with that offering!  :)
author: Leslie W.

description: Best cupcakes in SF!  The swoosh of untamed frosting makes them more appetizing than the perfect porcelain looking cupcakes at other bakeries.  Vanilla is my favorite, as well as the Irish Guinness cupcakes, and I love that they make SF Giants themed cc's on home game days.
author: Brooke N.

description: YUM! I am a self confessed cupcake snob who requires not only delicious frosting but a moist, flavorful cake. Wait, that shouldn't make me a snob, that is how every cupcake should be! SusieCakes cupcakes are just that--totally delicious! WAYYYY better than Kara's cupcakes which I find to be on the dry side.  I have tried various flavors here from coconut and chocolate to red velvet and chocolate mint--all of them were awesome!
author: Natalia K.

description: I am an extremely picky eater, ask any of my friends. I feel in love with Susie Cakes Bakery the first time I bit into one of their cupcakes. Their chocolate chip cookies are amazing and I just had their key lime pie which was fantastic. I would not go anywhere else for cupcakes or cakes!! :)
author: Lisi G.

description:
I have a love/hate relationship with this place.  I recently grabbed some Red Velvets and a Strawberry cupcake from this shop on a weekend trip to SF.  I usually get my cupcakes from their Manhattan Beach location.

During this day, I also grabbed some cupcakes from American Cupcake to do a comparison.

The cake in the Red Velvet is really red in color, very dense and moist. But with the frosting, you could really taste the grains of sugar on your tongue and it's consistency is really thick.  I was not happy with that.  (*If you want to know my American Cupcakes review - check out my separate review for that).  

I prefer Sprinkles or Cupcakes Couture, but sometimes I don't have the time to drive so far, so I will eat these up to satisfy my love of cupcakes.  I also noticed, when I eat more than one from Susies, I get a headache.  One time a friend and I asked a worker about the cupcake's nutritional information and she wouldn't disclose the calorie or sugar content of the cupcakes.  I guess if I really knew the truth about the sugar content of cupcakes, I would think twice about my dessert obsession... but then shortly forget about it once I start craving again!

I used to order cakes here for work events, but I would recommend to go the cupcake route instead.  The cakes are too sweet and they put multiple layers of frosting which overwhelms the cake.
author: Rye G.

description:
I am a cupcake snob...yes we exsist.  I had the vanilla cake with light green frosting and it was hands down the BEST cupcake I have ever had...EVER!!!!

my boyfriend had the red velvet and I was jealous I coudn't eat another one.  I will always order from them moving forward...
author: shannon h.

description:
The chocolate cupcake my girlfriend and I shared was so amazing!
They are the only thing she would ever leave me for! Lol!
author: Kirk M.

description: Couldn't pick up my (pre-paid) pumpkin pie the day before Thanksgiving. Jennifer promptly had a freshly made one set aside for me for Friday. Amber called days later to check that I enjoyed the (truly delicious) pie. You guys are the best:-).
author: Tonya M.

description:
We had some delivered to our friends at ROI DNA in San Francisco with our company logo on them and they were a hit!

Not only was the design amazing but we heard that the cupcakes were super yummy! Putting in our order and payment was extremely easy and the staff were very kind and friendly to work with. Thanks so much from everyone at Malwarebytes!
author: Lacey C.

description:
Whoopie Pie = 1 lb of cookie and the best icing you've ever had.
Mini Cupcakes = a perfect mouthful and leave you craving a box
Icing Shots = should be bigger......although I doubt a pint would be enough.

Try them. SusieCakes IS worth the hype!
author: Abra A.

description:
Wow, what a lovely bakery!  I thought Susie's was yet another cupcake place in the city (how many can we support?); but then I curiously walked inside to find beautiful cakes, pies, cookies and puddings along with their prerequisite baby cakes.

So first I tried the blueberry crumble pie--oh my oh my!  One of the best pies I've eaten!  Blue tinted thumbs up--way up!

Then I went in a week later and tried the old-fashioned 6 layer chocolate cake and carrot cake---Both fabulous with moist cake
and creamy dreamy frosting.  The carrot had great fruit and nuts
inside, and tasted healthy and decadent.  The chocolate was
pure luscious decadence.

I am looking forward to tasting the other cakes, cookies, pies, and even the cupcakes...

Way to go Susie!
author: Laurel T.

description: I stopped by to pick up desserts for a dinner party and couldn't decide! So, I picked out a slice of celebration cake and strawberry shortcake cake, peanut butter nutty's, strawberry shortcake cupcake,  and mocha chocolate cupcake. Everything was delicious! But, the strawberry shortcake cake was the best slice of cake I have ever had! The cake was light and fluffy and just so damn good. Definitely on the pricey side - $31 for the whole tab, but so worth it. Celebration cake is my second favorite. I would definitely go back again and try new items or get the same thing!!!!
author: Kelly P.

description: Horrible customer service. You work for a pastry shop, silly girls. Yes, I said girls.
author: Edith G.

description: Peanut butter cookie sandwich a tad too sweet.
author: Inigo M.

description:
My friend and I walked into every bakery and sweet store there was on Chestnut street (as well as the side streets). But Susie Cakes was the only place we actually bought an item. At first we walked out of the store because although the cupcakes and freaking 6 layered cakes were amazing, we didn't see anything unique.

Yikes, were we wrong. Outside, we looked at the display one more time when we saw two words, Martha, and Stewart on a poster above the displays. She recommended the Strawberry cupcake, the best in the land. We best trust Martha Stewart. 

We went in and tried the Strawberry cupcake like she said. !!!!!!!!!!! BEST KLSAEJRA CUPCAKE. I've never had a strawberry cupcake but this was perfect. The cupcake had a more cakey texture to it but it was still moist and chewable which melted in your mouth. The frosting was also really unique. It was a little bit more watery than usual but it was better than the more sugary and creamy texture. When it first touches your tongue it's good but as it combines with your saliva, it turns gooey which is even better! The taste was complementing. It had a slight sour taste but it was also tangy and sweet. 
I could not forget about this cupcake. A strawberry cupcake floating in front of a white background preoccupied my mind for hours. 
Oh, and if there are only women in a bakery, you know it is good.
author: Ella L.

description: We had SusieCakes provide an assortment of cupcakes and mini-cupcakes for our wedding a few weeks ago and they were fabulous to work with.  Meghan was very pro-active and the cupcakes were a big hit at the wedding.  We covered the basics with the Vanilla and chocolate, but also added the red velvet because they are awesome.  We would totally use them again, and if we are in the neighborhood will stop by for some sweet treats.
author: Jerome B.

description: Cakes are not hard to like unless too sweet or dry. Well Susie's doesn't have those 2 problems. The problems I have is what flavor to get or which cupcakes I want? This place is great when you want to get something sweet and get a full cake for a special occasion and its not that expensive. Plus its not just cakes they have cookies! I love they are here in sf!
author: Nadia N.

description: To Megan who helped my groom and I through it all- THANK YOU! The taste testing was fun, and delicious, tech friendly with using their ipad to pull up images I've seen online; with emailing responses throughout the planning- even being the one to contact me the week before my wedding to "check in"-loved it, one less thing for me to do! I heard the drop off of the wedding cake was magical, I mean mysterious, "ninja delivery" my husband says. They came, there was a box, and poof it was set up and they were gone-no problems! And the cake....was PERFECT! Looked just the way I wanted it to: 3 tiers, ivory frosting, black tree branches, green grass.  The taste-rich, moist, heavenly. Even days later we enjoyed the leftovers,sinfully but no more dieting for a dress. I've only eaten the chocolate filling with choc. cake-amazing. I can't wait for our 1 month (yes not year) to try the mocha filling with choc. cake. THANK YOU!
author: jennifer g.

description: We enjoyed their carrot cake during a wedding that we attended, and I must say it was absolutely the best carrot cake that I have ever had. It is so delicious with fresh plump golden raisins, lucious creamy frosting and the perfect balance of raisins and nuts. I'm very picky and I prefer cakes that are not too sweet and are all about flavor, and this cake had it all! I will definitely be visiting one of their local locations when I want to entertain  guests or just splurge.  :)
author: McKenzie L.

description: Great cakes! Pricy but by far the most delicious Marble Cake I've ever tasted! Love this place!
author: Smiley F.

description: Tried the red velvet cupcake today since it had a good review. It was good but was not moist. I still think That Takes The Cake  on Union St makes the BEST red velvet!
author: P C.

description:
Officially the Best Cake Shop in all of San Francisco. Besides the fact that her cakes are the moistest, most delectable, most sinful creations imaginable, Susie (who manages to stay a trim, dainty little lady depicted on her bags) should be applauded for:
1.) knowing that Icing Whores exist in the city, and the more delicious, frothy icing you put on your cakes and cupcakes the more those people will live in bliss
2.) putting icing IN their cupcakes as well, the happiest surprise in the world
3.) making their cake slices ABSOLUTELY MASSIVE, totally worth what otherwise may seem a steep price
4.) changing up their cake menu (besides the classic faves) so often that one of the highlights of my week is to check their Seasonal Offerings
5.) having hands down the nicest, prettiest, most helpful and cheerful servers in the city. 
Oh, Susie. I gave up dessert for Lent, but have vowed to make my first Easter Stop you store, to celebrate my horrific self discipline the best way I know how.
author: Ali M.

description: Best cheesecake in SF!  They have seasonal flavors.  Loved the cranberry orange one they had during Christmas time.  Texture is light, smooth, and creamy and it's not overly sweet.
author: Irene C.

description: Definitely the best chocolate cake ever!  Intensely chocolate, as good as it gets :)
author: Liz Y.

description: On vacation from Seattle, have stopped by Susie Cakes everyday this week because the cupcakes are DELICIOUS! However, the service is terrible! They never offer a friendly smile, make eye contact, and are constantly rolling their eyes as if the customer is a bother. Today, I extended my hand expecting my change to be handed to me and the cashier, looking away chatting to her coworker the whole time, threw it on the counter instead. Very rude. Will not be returning.
author: Angie D.

description: Best cupcakes in town. HANDS DOWN!
author: L H.

description: Wow, this place is awesome!  We order cakes for office birthdays and are tired of the same old places.  We were looking for apple pie or key lime pie.  We ordered the tropical coconut cake and the apple pie and both were OUTSTANDING!!! this will be our new favorite bakery!  After Diandas of course.  : D  Totally different style, but both are DELICIOUS!!!!
author: Brandi T.

description:
Yum! Best cupcakes in the Marina (and there are like 5 other cupcakeries!)

The best balance between moist cupcake and tasty, flavorful, but not-too-heavy frosting.
author: Lina L.

description: Great experience overall! A great alternative to a wedding cake (and WAY more flavorful). They delivered without any issues to a venue that was a bit off the grid. We got rave reviews of them. The one thing that made us a bit sad was they discontinued a flavor of icing that we loved. It made my husband a bit sad that they wouldn't bring it back for us, but what are you going to do. Would definitely recommend them to anyone.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Love the confetti cake slice from Susie's! This place is so good, great frosting, amazing cake, super cute! The staff is always extremely nice. I always enjoy Susie's on the weekend and think it's one of the better cupcake places in the city and in the Marina. (hair flip). The red velvet cupcake is also super good. I've recently also ordered a birthday cake from Susie's and have been super impressed so far. The cake was a major hit at the B-day party and everyone wanted to know where it was from. They decorated it super cute and it was a major success. They even called afte the Birthday to make sure everything went well and to see if we had any feedback. Now that is insanely great service. Keep up the good work Susie's! Good cupcakes make us all happy!
author: Brent T.

description: Cup cakes are alright ! Have tried couple of then.. Nothing super exciting that'd take me there again! Also, they are bit $$$
author: Avi S.

description: Went here earlier today after a trip to the city on a beautiful day! Cupcake was pretty good.. not too much icing which is nice. Also grabbed a sweetie pie. It looked cute, shaped like a heart and everything. The price i thought was a little too high and there didn't seem to be too much filling. I think i'll just stick to their cupcakes!
author: Mertani G.

description:
Its probably not a good idea to eat cupcakes less than 12 hours before a race but these were so damn good. 

We had the coconut and the mint chocolate. (Sorry I just dont get the obsession with Red Velvet). 

The coconut was incredible. The mint chocolate was divine. I hate cupcakes that have so much frosting that after I eat the cupcake, I look like a character in New Jack City that just did a line of coke. 

I want moderation, even in my cupcakes. And this place was--is--perfect for that. 

The coffee? Amazing. Drip coffee. I have been to coffee places where the coffee tastes like something from a gas station. 

I will def go again.
author: George J.

description:
This is exactly the bakery that I have been looking for in SF.  I like that the cupcakes are good, but they also offer slices of cake, whoopie pies, bars, and other desserts.  Basically, they have all the desserts I like.  I love buttercream frosting.  I do not like the whipped cream cakes that are so popular in SF.  So it all depends on your palette. 

The menu has a lot of classic items, some of which are executed creatively.  The girl at the counter could not have been nicer - she let me sample the coconut cake and the carrot cake - both were delicious. The carrot cake (I am a carrot cake fanatic) had praline filling instead of frosting.  Definitely interesting and worth a try.  The coconut cake had pineapple and was as delicious as it looked.

I ordered a strawberry cupcake and a whoopie pie.   I don't know how I have survived without having had a whoopie pie before - amazing (of course because I love their frosting).  If I had let myself, I could have easily eaten the whole thing - and it was massive.  I don't eat dessert every day, so when I do, it needs to be good!  SusieCakes did not disappoint.
author: C K.

description:
I used to be *obsessed* with susiecakes, and they're still VERY yummy but...
I don't know if it's me, but it seems their confections are getting a bit TOO sweet.  However, they still have the best frosting, and best cupcakes. I'm still a fan, but maybe I'll cool it for a bit...don't need any cavities!
author: Maritza P.

description:
Best cake ever. We just got a SusieCakes cake for our baby shower- confetti with chocolate filling and old fashioned frosting on the outside. HEAVEN.

Everyone was amazed by how good it was.  We got a half sheet, they say for about 30 people, but it feeds more like 60.

The staff were all amazingly helpful, and the cake decoration was adorable. I look forward to using them in the future.

I have had their cupcakes before, also delicious!
author: Vivian T.

description: If I could eat a whoppie Pie everyday the rest of my life from Susie cakes, I would be super fat and super proud of it. They are so delicious, full of flavor and YUMMY. Go get your self a whoppie pie and enjoy life!
author: Ashley M.

description: Sorry to be brutally honest, but these cupcakes were rather awful.  They didn't taste like any cupcake I've had before- gourmet or boxed.  They were rather crumbly and fall apart at the touch.  Sorry but definitely not my cup of tea!
author: Nicole G.

description: What a wonderful staff!  They were helpful and friendly.   We sampled several cakes and decided on the carrot cake and chocolate chip cookies.   Both were superb.
author: Ernie C.

description:
let me just start off by saying that i don't even like cupcakes. and i don't like red velvet. however, susiecakes must be doing something right because i really like their red velvet cupcakes. the reason i don't like red velvet is because most places just don't get it right. however, susiecakes bakery's red velvet cupcakes are moist with just the right amount of chocolate and sweetness (i actually scrape off most of the frosting). 

i used to frequent the susiecakes in newport beach when i lived there. im glad the quality wasn't lost with this location!
author: Erin M.

description: They should rename this place SusieCookies! Their cookies are great, but I find their cakes too sweet. The latest one I tried, the 6 tier chocolate, tasted more like sugar and less like chocolate... But the servers are nice, it's got a great atmosphere and their cookies are delish!
author: Maria Y.

description: What the heck! Had a craving for chocolate cake so went to SC. What a disappointment!  At least 2 layers of the cake were dry and hard. The frosting was kind of grainy and had some small lumps, not smooth. Disgusting and Not Good!  Couldn't eat it and ended up throwing it in the garbage. Save your money and don't support a business with over priced, sub par products.
author: A. L.

description:
Stumbled upon this place when walking around the Cow Hollow/Marina district. The inner kid in me saw a grand candy-like store and had to stop and look in. I was immediately greeted by wonderful, friendly and very smiley staff members. I sighed and told myself, I need to get something, these people are too nice. 

I ended up getting a red velvet cupcake and falling madly in love. I've tasted many red velvet cakes over my short lifespan and this is one of the better places to go.
author: K. E.

description: This update is long overdue.  The owners and management at SusieCakes were very quick to respond to my yelp comment with the hopes of making it up to me.  I decided to try them out again, this time with a smaller carrot cake (which was just as yummy as the first time) and some cupcakes for the BF's coworkers.  Though the staff was still not quite as friendly as other bakeries we frequent, our experience was much better, and I was happy to have a good reason to come back in and have another slice of that cake.  Once SusieCakes decides to open another outlet somewhere more convenient, I'd definitely come back just for the carrot cake.
author: Crispy P.

description: I don't think their cakes look that good.  I think their frosting swirl looks funny.  After I ate a cupcake, I just felt bad consuming calories I didn't need.  Definitely did not hit the spot.  I find kara's cupcakes are so much more moist with better frosting
author: Hannah W.

description: I'm pretty sure that the girls who work here recognize me by now. If everything here didn't taste so delicious, if they weren't the cutest housewarming gift, or the perfect treat for my little sister on our 2/monthly trip over there...maybe I'd be able to resist. It takes me 2 days to polish off a slice of the vanilla celebration cake, and way too few minutes to finish the final bites of my red velvet cupcake, but it is just so good! They really are worth the splurge. As long as I never find out how to make them myself or hear how many calories I'm consuming, I will keep coming back for that taste of heaven :)
author: Michelle N.

description: everything here is delicious, the staff is all so friendly, and the place smells divine. I love you, SusieCakes on Chestnut St.
author: Mrs. J.

description: Had high hopes for this bakery, since it came recommended.  Whoopies pie was quite good, more like a cookie sandwich than cake.  Chocolate mint cupcake was just okay.  A bit dry and lacking in flavor.  Staff was very friendly.  No place to sit, as one of the workers there was using the only table to do her paperwork.
author: Curt Y.

description: SusieCakes have the BEST cupcakes ever! While in San Francisco, we also sampled Kara's Cupcakes and Cako and SusieCakes was way better. They are even better than some of the larger chains (Sprinkles, Crumbs). The frosting is so creamy and delicious... mmm.... We had the pumpkin w/ cream cheese frosting and the peanut butter ones yesterday.
author: Kelly M.

description: damn damn damn....if there was a dentist next door, they would make a killing advertising to the patrons that come here.  The cake is so moist and the frosting is scrumptous....i have a love/hate relationship with this place....or my mouth loves it, my hips hate it....and Im a dude :)
author: Shel D.

description: Their slices of red velvet cake are TO DIE FOR! That is all I have to say. *nom nom nom nommmmm*
author: Candy C.

description: The most delicious cupcakes known to mankind. I'd gone to the Susiecakes in Brentwood a couple times in college, but for some reason, these cupcakes tasted different (better). Red velvet is a must (the cream cheese frosting isn't too heavy, and you can definitely taste the cheese, which surprisingly is hard to get right), and the vanilla is delicious too. My friend swears by the chocolate cupcake frosting, and although I'm not the hugest fan of frosting in general, I can handle Susiecakes.
author: Lillian K.

description: SusieCakes is a really cute bakeshop.  They sell the cutest little baking knick knacks, candles, party goodies, etc. for all you baking lovers.  I wanted to buy everything since everything looked so good!! The family and I decided on 6 mini cupcakes (1-vanilla, 2-chocolate chocolate & 3 red velvet) & 2 regular cupcakes (strawberry & blueberry pancake).  Our most favorite was surprisingly the blueberry pancake cupcake.  It was moist, delicious and to die for.  I never knew blueberry could taste so divine in a cupcake. Just delicious and a must try!  I think it may be a seasonal flavor.  Martha Stewart's favorite cupcake from here-the strawberry cupcake was a bit too tart for my taste.  Thought it was only me, but hubby thought the same thing also.  Maybe the batch it came from was made wrong that day...who knows.  I'd be more than willing to try it agin though.  The red velvet tasted pretty yummy too.  Sprinkles still has the #1 red velvet cupcakes to me.  The chocolate chocolate and vanilla were also tasty.
author: Sheila M.

description: Hands down best bakery in SF!  Giving this place anything less than 5 stars is a crime. Everything here is stellar. The atmosphere is also great and everyone's really friendly. Prices are very reasonable.
author: Joe S.

description:
I agree cupcakes are supposed to be sweet.  There should be a balance though, if the frosting is super sweet then the cake shouldn't be and vice versa.  I didn't have that problem with their product though so I don't even know why I'm addressing it lol.

Sooo I walked by this brightly lit bakery and was like aw cute.  Very retro, simple and to the point.  This is a bakery, this is our display, here are some samples, have a nice day!  Fantastic.  I ordered a slice of the celebration cake and the seasonal Irish cream cupcake.  The cupcake was good but odd...?  It was chocolate-y and moist but it fell apart when you took apart the wrapper. It was almost as if somebody smashed it a little bit to put the icing inside and just smushed the cupcake back together.  The chocolate cake with the not to sweet and irish cream frosting was good enough though that I was able to look past it. 

Now the cake.  Think gourmet Funfetti cake.  You're probably like oooh really, I love Funfetti!  Of course you do, everybody does and they did a pretty good version.  I have one concern though.  As I had the cupcake before I dug in on the cake, I was starting to hit cake overload and I made the fatal mistake of putting my cake in the fridge.  I say "fatal" because I'm pretty sure that everybody that has walked out of SuzieCakes left with the warning of "DO NOT REFRIGERATE!" still ringing in their ears.  Brainfart on my part.  I just assumed they were so adamant about it because they were using buttercream and it would get rock hard in the fridge.  (There was a bakery in Sac that told their guests the same exact thing for that reason)  So I left it out while I went to work for it to get back to room temp.  When I got back and checked out the cake after work it was still rock hard!  The frosting and the cake!  I was like what?  What is in this cake that keeps the frosting soft at room temp until it is put in the fridge and then keeps both the cake and frosting hard even after it returns to room tempurature??  It kinda reminds me of McDonalds french fries.  You know there's something up with them because they don't start to decompose like regular natural french fries.  But even though you know they've done something seriously unnatural with them, you'll still go back because they taste good.  And chances are I will go back.  Because fresh out of the display they're pretty good!  :)
author: Jammir G.

description: I have been a fan of SusieCakes since it opened. It is always a must stop when walking down chestnut. The cupcakes are always so moist and I love that the icing is not overwhelmingly sweet.  This past month I was looking into ordering a cake for a friend's gender reveal. I researched a few cake places and then remembered Susie's. They created the cutest cake with pink icing inside for the gender reveal. The price for the cake was also very reasonable compared to other places. Best off, they called the next week to follow up on the order. You will receive excellent customer service at SusieCakes.
author: e w.

description: A friend pre-ordered a bunch of chocolate whoopie pies and we stopped by to pick them up. I can't imagine ever eating a whole whoopee pie by myself, at least not in one sitting.  They're definitely two or three serving's worth! The cookies were quite sturdy, sandwiched between very thick and hearty frosting, which was a little too heavy and sweet for me.  I ended up picking at the cookie and leaving the frosting behind.
author: Lisa C.

description:
OH YUM! I SWEAR I DREAM ABOUT THIS PLACE IN MY SLEEP!

This place is OFF THE HOOOOOOOOK. Everything about it is great. You can get a slice of cake for $5.50 and it is GINORMOUS! It took me 2-3 days to finish 1 slice of cake! I've had their red velvet (my mom's fave and the frosting is amazinggggg), marble cake, and their celebration cake (I'm sucker for sprinkles and colorful things). All of their cakes are so moist and they definitely last for up to 5 days. They always warn customers never to put their cakes in the fridge because it'll dry out their cakes.

I still haven't tried their frosting filled cupcakes yet, but they look amazing as well. Actually, there is just so much I wanna try from here. It definitely isn't a trip to the Marina without a trip to SusieCakes!!
author: Fiona N.

description: SusieCakes has the best cake and Cup cakes. If you have a sweet tooth like me and crave sugar daily, your gonna want to try everything when entering the shop. The red velvet and chocolate marble cake are two of my faves, but you really can't go wrong with whatever you choose. If I could I'd eat here daily but I would definitely gain at least 50 pounds!!! Maybe in heaven there will be Susie cakes where I can eat to my hearts content and stay skinny!!!
author: S M.

description: So cute! Everything about this place is cute. The inside is so small though, and it has the faint smell of...cardboard box mixed with cream cheese frosting. Also, the desserts tend to be on the pricier side. But aside from that it's splendid. The desserts are so pretty and sugary. The workers are super efficient and friendly. Extra points: the bags are adorable! They're a light turquoise color and have the susiecakes design on them and are just precious, just like all the desserts.
author: Idk A.

description: Visually, this place is five stars. The cupcakes look succulent and gorgeous and fresh. I will say that I've yet to try a big cupcake, and have only had the tiny ones. The tiny ones were not good. I mainly speak of the red velvet baby cupcake. The cake was not moist, too sticky and tasted like nothing. The icing was way too sugary. Granted, red velvet is hard one to master, but I expected way more. Everything looks gorgeous, and I'll definitely give them another shot, but will be a tad wary.
author: Emily M.

description: The vanilla celebration cake (AKA the million layer funfetti cake) is the best.  Not for the faint hearted though...super dense, moist, and sweet.  They even call the next day to see if you liked the cake that was ordered.
author: Joe L.

description: This place is awesome!!!  I've had their cookies, cheesecake and now the whoopie pie.  The whoopie pie is to die for!  like I dream about it.  I so wish this place had been in existence when i had my 30th.  I would have loved a sheet cake from there.  I think the next thing I'll try is the pudding.  Solid bakery!
author: Kirsten M.

description: The 5in Key Lime Pie is Yummy Yummmy Good.  Had a bite of the cake but it couldn't compare to my pie.   Which I was able to savor but it didn't last long enough....
author: Tonya T.

description: We ordered desserts from SusieCakes for our wedding. We had the dessert selection which included 6 different desserts and mini cupcakes. It was all delicious and really easy to deal with, with a good variety offering something for everyone . You do need to like frosting for the cupcakes (which we do...) and I think it would have been nice to have something special offered with the wedding order which ended up being a pretty big order - like a decoration or some signs that would come with it saying what is offered.
author: Yfat B.

description: Mini-cupcakes are a great treat to bring to a party. I ordered 2 dozen for a Royal Wedding party and they were a big hit!  Everyone loved them - especially the coconut, lemon, Red Velvet and Strawberry.  I put British flags in them with pictures of William + Kate.  The cake was moist and the frosting rich and delicious.  The best thing about the mini-cupcakes is you can be satisfied by a couple of indulgent bites.
author: Karen L.

description: People in San Francisco love this place. My friend has been raving about it so I figured I'd check in out. I'd like to state a couple of things: (1) It's not just about the cupcake. Presentation and icing (shout out to butter-cream) are very important. (2) A sure sign that a cake is NOT a winner is if I only take a bite out of it or worse, don't touch it because I think it is sloppy (I know, I have issues) (3) while I haven't met a cake I dislike, there are a few that rank in the bottom pile (sorry German chocolate and key lime. Anyway, on to Susie Cakes. Not sure why people think their red velvet is something to write home about. It is way too red (I consider this an imbalance of food coloring:cocoa powder), I found the cream cheese icing lacking and the cupcake simply didn't present well. My friend, bless her heart, concluded I was a loon because everyone else seems to love it. I happen to like the red velvet cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory. The color is a deep red, the cake is moist and my opinion, better than Susie cakes. I will say that I did like the 7 layer granola/chocolate/coconut bar :-)
author: Sierra S.

description:
oh hello seasonal cupcakes!

a coworker had a box of these this week, and i (after already having eaten 3 cookies that day) hesitantly took a cupcake with little gingerbread man shaped sprinkles frosting.  uhhmm... BEST IDEA EVER?

cream cheese frosting was amazing and a GINGERBREAD CUPCAKE?! never have i heard of such a thing, but it was so delicious. i wish i had another one to eat right now.

i've never been to the actual store, but from my one experience, i would like to make a trip out there soon. :)
author: Linda T.

description:
Besides their fantastic cakes and their "Susie's Nutty", Susie Cakes service is fantastic!

    During our vacation in San Francisco we ate there every single night! The prices aren't cheap, but still VERY reasonable. Do not be fooled! One slice of cake could easily feed 2!

     Our last night we tried to enter the store but it looked closed.  A friendly women who works there came out.  "I'm sorry there's a bird here that we're trying to get out...we'll be back in about 10 minutes I'm so sorry!" she said.  

    We returned back later (we knew it would be well worth the wait:) and after ordering 3 desserts the lady told us one of the slices was on the house!

    Every single worker there was always so friendly and nice, our experience there was only positive!:)
author: Donna B.

description: A pretty solid red velvet.  Cupkates has my go-to red velvet cupcake, but this is a close second.  I like the shop.
author: Erika C.

description: The vanilla cupcake is SOOOOO good. Fabulous!
author: Brooke S.

description:
Thank you soooo much!

I've ordered several cakes before for birthdays so when it came time to order a cake for my daughters bridal shower there was no doubt where I would go.  It's hard to walk in the door without gaining weight just from the smell and visuals!  I sat down with one of the staff (I wish I remembered her name...such a sweetie) and explained I wanted the cake to look the one one from the invitation...of course I forgot it but she pulled up the website on their trusty IPad and we found it quickly.  I settled on a two layer cake, bottom layer was the coconut with coconut buttercream (it's a piece of heaven) and the top was red velvet with cream cheese frosting....both are our favorites and so moist and so amazing... I asked for a very pale pink frosting with just a simple scalloped edge....it looked exactly how I wanted....absolutely beautiful!!!

Thank you for baking such a beautiful memorable cake for a very special day!  You never fail !  The flavors are consistent, always moist and delisous......see you for our next event or perhaps just a cupcake or two to hold me over
author: Carol F.

description: Came in here after having dinner along Chestnut. Was craving a cupcake and didn't want to walk down to Kara's, plus I haven't been here yet. We walked in and saw a huge display of good looking cakes and desserts. After perusing the goods, we decided on a vanilla and red velvet cupcake. The service was quick and very friendly. The cupcakes...not so much. The cupcakes tasted stale, they didn't fresh taste at all! The frosting on the vanilla was a little crusty as well, definitely been sitting there for a long time.I didn't even finish it! (which is unheard of for me) The only saving grace was the frosting on the red velvet, that was tasty. Anyways, thanks for the $3 cupcakes, I won't be back.
author: D J.

description: YUP 5 Big ones!!  I can't stay away from this place - I love their cupcakes - we order cakes for work - I thought Red Velvet was my favorite but after having the marble cake - I have changed my mind.  SOOO  GOOD!  The SusieCake Employees are always smiling.  Great place - Great bakery!!!!
author: Jodi B.

description:
I was in the neighborhood the other day and couldn't resist stopping in to try a cupcake.  I guess I have been spoiled by my local joint that is owned and managed by a classically trained pastry chef because this was a huge disappointment.  Yes, cupcakes are supposed to be sweet, but there is such a thing as too sweet.  The frosting shouldn't be so concentrated with sugar that it practically burns your tongue.  

I tried a sample of lemon cupcake and it was disgustingly sweet.  It tasted like cake mix from a box.  I almost walked right out of the store but decided to try something else before rushing to judgment.  The cupcake I got was better, but still not great.  The chocolate cake was pretty good, but the frosting was still way too sweet.  I had a funny aftertaste in my mouth for a long time after eating my cupcake.  It was not pleasant.  I will definitely never go back.
author: Katie B.

description: So cute inside. Great options. And they donate at least weekly to local shelters.
author: Vicki L.

description: Don't you have a 10 star option?  Couldn't go a week without thinking of a reason to go to Susie Cakes. Every celebration calls for a Susie Cake -- nothing but raves, and there are never leftovers. Bring visitors from East Coast and Europe, and they all love it.  Their quality is fantastic, and their customer service is amazing. The designs are incredibly creative. For special occasion orders, they always call within a day or two to see if everyone liked the cake. Best pumpkin pies ever for Thanksgiving -- we had three and not a crumb was left. For those who love coconut cake -- it can't be beat. Cakes, cupcakes, cookies, pies -- all are fantastic.  Wonderful addition to the Marina neighborhood.
author: Mona H.

description: Atmosphere and service are good enough for 2 stars, but I wanted a good chocolate chip cookie and what I bought earned them no points whatsoever. The chocolate was not good tasting and the cookie on the whole had one of those healthy fruit juice sweetener oversugared tastes.
author: aaron f.

description: The best red velet cake in the world!!!! I have not had a cake better than this place ever.......
author: Gaven B.

description: Anyone who knows me knows my obsession for cupcakes runs deep. I have had more cupcakes than I can count and I must say out of all of them hands down Susiecakes are the best. They are so moist and not overly sweet. I am not a huge fan of chocolate but the chocolate cupcakes here are perfect. Thank you Susiecakes for making my taste buds smile.
author: Jeni Z.

description: I had their mint chocolate cupcake and a peanut butter chocolate cupcake...to DIE for! Delicious!
author: Linda L.

description:
I was visiting california from chicago and stopped into susie cakes and...wow! soft, luscious, scrumptuous...and the surprise filling- to die for!

hope they come to chicago soon...its hard to have to come to california for a great cupcake.
author: leon t.

description: They make a killer "European chocolate butter" frosting that is wonderful.  Also the red velvet was extremely flavorful.  I would have never tried the Red Velvet if it wasn't for their samplers.  Unfortunately, they are not open on Mondays (at least when I was there)...
author: Michael V.

description: WOW! My boyfriend and I were just strolling around the Marina when we noticed this cute bake shop.  They were giving samples of the Red Velvet Cake outside. OMG that was one of the best RV cakes I've ever had. We bought a slice of cake to bring home and I felt like hiding and not sharing the cake! My BF had to peel the box out out of my hands just to have a bite.  So my advice to everyone, buy your own slice. DON'T SHARE!!
author: Michelle A.

description: Suzies cakes blew my striped socks off as I sat there eating this wonderful cake. I got the chocolate marble cake, it looked so good. I didn't even care handing over my credit card for a $33 cake, it was well worth it, I would have paid a million bucks for this cake. I highly recommend EVERYTHING in the store to you!!!! Oh yeah.
author: Jake P.

description: Disgusting! Heavy, frosting was like a clump of butter. Cake was as heavy as a rock. Kara cupcakes down the street are way better.
author: v. m.

description: I was strolling down chestnut street after a fun day at crissy frields with my boyfriend and stumbled upon this cute little store.  I had a red velvet cupcake.  It was A-MAZING. one of the best red velvet i've ever tasted.
author: Mandy L.

description: $3 for a thin Christmas tree shaped sugar cookie smaller than my hand, seriously? I can't believe I didn't say nevermind when the girl rang me up. It wasn't even that good. Also tried the red velvet cupcake- it was dry & just meh. Their lemon bar is pretty good, but won't go back after that $3 cookie. Walk a few blocks to 'That takes the Cake' on Union & Steiner for something sweet.
author: Jenna R.

description: I'm a baker so I tolerate "store bought" cakes, but for the most part, I don't LIKE them so much. SusieCakes is a departure from that model! I LOVE the cake. Real butter, real cream, real elbow grease. Tastes like something that might come out of my kitchen! Dare I say...even better! And SOOO beautiful too. Perfect for both formal and informal events. Yum!
author: Katherine A.

description: We bought a peanut butter cookie sandwich. No prices posted anywhere though and when she told us it would be 4.25 I kind of choked a little.  But it was pretty dang good. Soft cookies with pb cream frosting, I can't complain too much.
author: Hana Z.

description: Walking in the Marina, I see a lady standing outside of SusieCakes with a tray of cupcakes.  Of course I'm all over a free cupcake!  It was a vanilla cupcake with light pink frosting and candy confetti on top, normally $3.  The frosting was a bit sweet for me, but the cake was super tasty and moist.  A yummy treat and great advertisement, because I would go back to try more the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Sandy K.

description: The red velvet?  OMG!  I can die now.  Sigh...
author: Bill S.

description: My boyfriend went on an adventure while I was at the dentist and walked to susiecakes. There he got me a snickerdoodle and a red velvet cupcake. I enjoyed the huge and delicious cookie but I can't say that about the cupcake. It was too dry and the cream cheese was strong, like cream cheese and salmon crackers strong. I feel so bad saying that because I really wanted to like this place because the employees are so nice and the bakery is so cute but the sweets here are just not up to par. I went here a second time and got a toffee butterscotch pudding and it was okay, not great. It made my throat feel weird after.
