Nothing all that special, kind of like the snack paks you would buy at the supermarket. So my rating for this place is still 3 stars, hopefully I can get something that will change my mind.
author: Jayne A.

description: I happened to be craving cupcakes when I was in the area, preferably mint chocolate, and they had it here.  Score!!  The frosting was perfect.  It was not too sweet...just the way I like it.  The cake could have been a little more moist though, but it was still good nonetheless.
author: Daisy L.

description: I travelled all the way from Virginia to taste SusieCakes' Red Velvet Cake - and it was worth it!  I used their online ordering service which was extremely easy to maneuver and convenient.  SusieCakes delivered the cake to my hotel on time and with great care.  The red velvet cake was absolutely delicious and the perfect size.  (I ordered the 6" size for 3 people, and it hardly lasted the weekend!)  SusieCakes is a superstar with delicious treats - I would definitely recommend this establishment and their attention to detail.  Thank you!
author: Alison K.

description: I am literally eating their Red Velvet cake as I write this review. This is my first time trying anything from SusieCakes and I'm already a fan! It's one of the best cakes that I have ever had. The cake itself is very light and moist and the cream cheese frosting tastes wonderful. I highly recommend this place to any cake-lovers out there.
author: Laura P.

description: Based on the rave reviews and the number of people standing in line, I expected this place to be amazing, but unfortunately it was just another mediocre cupcake shop.  I got the lemon, the strawberry, and the chocolate mint.  The frostings were all decadent and rich and yummy, but the cake part was sorely lacking moistness.  The consistency was a little hard and dense.  It wasnt awful, but it was not to die for either.
author: Mimi D.

description: The lemon cupcake was literally the best I've ever had! And the staff were lovely!
author: Julie E.

description: In comparison to other cupcakes I like it better then Kara's but Sprinkles cupcakes are still the best.  I had the coconut cupcake, which is my favorite cake.  The frosting was excellent but the cake I considered from "a box".  There are other things I want to try at this bakery so I will be going back.
author: Beth T.

description:
tried few things here.. nothing so impressive... yesterday i stopped by cause i craved something sweet and decided to try their strawberry/blueberry pie or cookie... whatever you call that... anyway... the thing was tiny, much smaller than their choc chip cookie and tasted meh... $5.50 for this little ok pastry/cookie? are you out of your mind people???

definitely not going back....
author: Anna S.

description: I found out that their red velvet cupcake recipe is from the owner's aunt. I decided to give their red velvet another try. Unfortunately it still isn't one that I like. The cake was too sweet and a bit dry. I enjoyed their coconut cupcake more.
author: Joyce L.

description: Hmmm. I really wanted to like this place. It's very cute, the baked goods look lovely, and most of all, I just love cake. I brought home two slices for my family to share (the slices are huge). I chose the marble cake and the vanilla confetti cake. We all agreed that the cake was very dry, very dense/heavy and way too sweet. We just couldn't eat more than two bites. I wrapped up both slices well and today, they are as dry as bones.  Maybe the cupcakes are better. I hope they are just getting their "cake-legs" and things will improve.
author: Ken W.

description: Strawberry cupcakes: too sweet and the frosting was bit too tangy for me.  Also, the cake was very dry.  Red velvet: bright ass red and yummy.  The cake was perfect and moist.  The frosting was damn good.  I ate every bit of it.  Cant wait to try the celebration cake.
author: Lauren S.

description: I was reluctant to try this place only because it seems like everywhere I turn, there's a new cupcakery opening on on every block.  Anyway, I went in an ordered a Red Velvet cupcake which is my absolute favorite and I'm very finicky when it comes to this flavor.  I gotta say, it was pretty good - everything from the taste of the frosting down to the cake to frosting ratio.  I also ordered a mini vanilla cupcake because I love those as well but I have to say the cake was a little on the dry side.  The frosting was just right, not too sweet, but again, the cake needed to be more moist in my opinon.  I found these cupcakes to be reasonably priced and very good!  I will definitely be back.
author: Danielle V.

description: I'm a cupcake lover but I like that they have cakes and other pastries too. I'm going to definitely keep this mind the next time I need to take a cake for a party! I really like their packaging too! Mouth-watering, moist coconut cupcake!
author: Sheena S.

description: this is my FAVORITE dessert place in the marina, if not in all of SF!!! i've had a few of their cupcakes, including the chocolate, red velvet, and coffee, and honestly i've had better, but their holy grail is the CELEBRATION CAKE!!!! it is seriously the most AMAZING dessert i've ever had, and i simply crave it all the time (seriously). imagine funfetti cake on steroids...then multiply that by 10! its the perfect blend of moist cake and frostingy goodness. i seriously dont know how they do it (i tried make my own "celebration cake" and did not come even close.) the slice is huge and big enough for 2 to share, or to eat half and take the other home (even I can't finish an entire one.) i cant wait for an occasion to buy an entire celebration cake!!!
author: lisa l.

description: Sometimes there's a back story to a trip to the bakery.  This is one of those stories.  About 3 years ago my sister got married.  I was a bridesmaid, of course, and as a bridesmaid I was to take care of certain wedding duties.  I had succeeded at each and every one of them despite my margarita infused breath that caused my slurred speech and stumble from here to there. I was so distracted that I did not even see my sister cut her wedding cake that she had slaved over ordering.  She is a cake FREAK.  She loves cake more than any other person I know.  By the end of the night she gave me my last duty.  My cake freak of a sister made sure to save her and her husband the top cake.  And guess who she put in charge? That's right, me.  I was more than capable of holding to a cake as long as I could find somewhere to sit in the middle of a picking-up tables and chairs chaos.  My baby nephew at the time decided it would be fun to jump and try to reach the cake I was told to hold with my dear life.  I made sure his little game did not cause a cake catastrophe.  Oh wait but I didn't.  It was one of those "OHHHHH SHITTTTTTT" moments as I saw the cake fall to the ground.  My sister hadn't tried her wedding cake that night and now I was to blame for her furious face.  Everyone of course thought I was still drunk, which I wasn't. I swear. Anyway, she made me swear to buy her a cake for her 1 year wedding anniversary.  Too bad for her I was broke a year later and too lazy the next.  It wasn't until this year that I decided to replace their cake with one that I purchased.  I looked into Susie's and they sounded delicious.  I ordered the marble cake and it was more than delicious. Shall I say scrumptious? My sister and her husband enjoyed the cake so much so that they kinda sorta forgave me for my (not my) mishap.  So thank you Susie, for erasing a guilt trip and satisfying a very happy couple :)
author: Brenda S.

description: I paid $175 for 3 dozen pink and blue cupcakes for a "birth announcement". I was disappointed that the color of the cupcakes were orange and spearmint green. The woman on the phone said they were blue and pink. Cupcakes tasted good, but not worth it!
author: Erica C.

description: Pineapple upside down cupcake. Yum. I've been trying to try various cupcake flavors besides the usual red velvet, and i have to say that this is definitely on the list of cupcakes to try!
author: Candace H.

description: These are my favorite cupcakes in the city! The vanilla/vanilla is my favorite, its reminds me of a classic perfect wedding cake. If they ever have the blueberry cupcakes on special it is a MUST, soooo freaking good! The red velvet is okay (not my favorite) but still good. I also love their cakes, marbled, carrot cake and german chocolate, you really can't go wrong. These are all very classic flavors done well so for me that is preferred over fancy flavors and when bringing them to parties they are a huge hit!
author: R T.

description: Not as good as Kara's Cupcake when you're comparing cupcake to cupcake but it's cheaper and I like how it doesn't look visually perfect. Some times things don't need to be perfectly shaped.
author: Lisa S.

description: Based solely on the cupcakes? 3 stars. I plan to return to sample some of their other baked goods (cookies, brownies, etc) which looked really promising. But the cupcakes are too darn dry! I much prefer Kara's for the moistness factor. The chocolate cake with PB frosting was the best SusieCakes had to offer (I sampled 4 kinds) simply because it wasn't as dry as the rest.
author: Beth T.

description: Very moist cupcake and delectable frosting!  I loved the red velvet, and if I'm craving a cupcake I'll probably go here since you can't buy just one from Sibby's Cupcakery.  It's better than Kara's down the street also.  The worker even threw in a full-sized pumpkin cupcake for me to try too because I had trouble deciding on flavor.  Thanks for being so generous!
author: Diane A.

description: I was excited to find a new bakery near me and couldn't wait to try them out.  We ended up getting the mini cupcakes to test out first.  They weren't bad.  Pretty moist but then again we did eat them that day.  I love sweets so they did satisfy me.  I can't wait to try their cakes next.
author: Cynthia L.

description: I want to like this place but after trying it here a couple of times after visiting their original store in Los Angeles, I'm just not that into their cupcakes.  Strawberry is supposed to be there signature but it was just ok.  Sprinkles is the gold standard, Kara's is pretty good, but SusieCakes while cute just isn't moist or flavorful enough for my family.
author: BW A.

description: This place just does everything right. We got our cup cakes here for our wedding, my husband bought my birthday cake here, everything has always been perfect. The red velvet is to die for! I've tried red velvet many other places but Susie takes it to another level. I've never had anything bad and would drive across town in traffic to have a red velvet cupcake. Thanks Susie Cakes!
author: Kristen N.

description: The tropical coconut cake is amazing! And if you order by the slice like I do, you will appreciate the huge portion. The cupcakes are good (especially the strawberry one) except for the extra shot of icing in the middle. I think the icing on top is plenty.
author: Judy C.

description: I work right across the street from Susie's cakes.  I catch myself staring across at the lovely shop dreaming of sweets all day...(don't tell my boss).  But Susie's cakes have THE most delicious cupcakes.  Red Velvet is one of my favorites, and don't forget to try the Lemon Bar.  Tangy, sweet, and coated with powdered sugar.  It is extremely delightful.  Be warned if you are addicted to sweets like me though, those lemon bars cause serious craving.
author: Nip Y.

description: I can't believe I'm just now getting around to writing a review for good ole Susie!! This place is the bombdotcom. My fiancee and I would come here just about every Sunday for a delicious little treat living only a block away for the last year. I used to think That Takes the Cake was the best but Susie blows TTTC outta the water. Everything is good but I highly recommend a slice of the red velvet cake (not the cupcake, the cake!) You'll probably need to share it unless you want a tummy ache for the next 7 days (their slices are no joke!) I'm so sad we just moved to NYC, the mouth is watering just thinking about it. Yum!!
author: Andrea Y.

description:
I ordered a birthday cake from Susie Cakes the day before Easter and on my way in, I overhead a guy out front telling his friend as they were passing by SC that this was the best place in SF to get a cake.... Nice to hear this as this was my first experience with Susie Cakes.
Let me cut to the chase. Ordered the Luscious Lemon Cake to be picked up the next day at 10am. I asked for a sample and in spite of the crazy busy-ness of all their staff members, the employee never made me feel rushed and was cheerful and helpful. 
The cake was ready on time when they said it would be and it. was. DELICIOUS!!! Not only that, but the next day, someone from Susie Cakes called to ask how the cake was and to thank me for my business! 
That is great customer service. They delivered a fabulous product with a smile and then followed up. Very few businesses do that these days.
Thanks Susie Cakes - the cake was very well received and since it was so delicious and MUCH better than anything I could have tried at home, I will be back- I am a very happy customer.
author: susan a.

description: I went to SusiCakes tonight. I have to say, I would give them 5 stars easy for the Passover treats. I had the drizzled matzo. It was AMAZING. My friend got a cupcake and wasn't too impressed, hence the three stars. I have to say, maybe they should rethink their baking if their passover treats are better than what they're known for.
author: Emily K.

description: Hands down, best cupcake place in CA, cupcakes are moist and yummy - love all of their stuff - go there, you won't be disappointed!
author: L D.

description: The traditional 6 layer chocolate cake is orgasmic.  Absolutely delicious.  Good free doggie treats too.
author: Karen C.

description: Classic cupcakes, serious frosting, generous samples...what's not to love?
author: Sara W.

description: Oh yeah---the chocolate and peanut butter cupcake---heavenly!
author: Danielle B.

description:
Cupcakes ARE sweet! I'm so sick of reading the reviews for SusieCakes (and other cupcake places) that say, "the frosting is too sweet"....hello! frosting is suppose to be sweet for heaven's sake! If you don't like sweet stuff (ie, frosting) then don't eat a freakin sweet treat. Ok, now that I've got that out....I like Susie Cakes; I'm a frequent at home baker, have a "sweet tooth," would consider myself a sweet snob and this place is good. I will go back. It is a bit pricey buy hey this is SF and in the Marina so that's the way it is. I've had their cupcakes and sugar cookies and thought they both tasted fresh; especially the cute shamrock cookie I tried Saturday had yummy frosting that was fresh and creamy.
I've not had the red velvet cup/cakes because like some of the other reviews the cake just looks too red; I prefer a deep, dark red color that is rich in cocoa...just like they make it in the south.
I've not had their whole cakes or ordered their treats in bulk so I don't how they are when ordering/eating more than just the single treats from the store...perhaps if I do and the experience is great I'll give them the all coveted 5 stars.
author: Erin S.

description: I recently had custom cookies created for a Bridal Shower and they were a huge hit. Beyond the cookies, I found SusieCakes to be exceptional when it comes to customer service. They were extremely responsive and professional - from start to finish. I will definitely plan on leveraging them for future events!
author: Ginnie H.

description: Just had my first cake from SusieCakes and it was DELICIOUS!  My dad wanted a straight up chocolate cake for his birthday (no fleur de sel, no ganache, no cocoa nibs, etc.), just like they used to make back in the day.  I had seen SusieCakes but had never been in, so I looked at their online menu and saw that they made an old fashioned 6-layer chocolate cake.  I decided to give it a try and I'm glad I did.  My dad said it was the best chocolate cake he had in years and I would have to agree.  Moist, chocolatey, buttery, sugary...  The ratio of cake to frosting was perfect.  If you like chocolate cake, you should try this!
author: Chris A.

description: For our wedding, my fiance (then) and I were looking for an alternative for a wedding cake. He happened to have a coupon for Susie Cakes so we decided to try their cupcakes and they were all yummy!! We ended up having tons of cupcakes for our big day!:)
author: Ella B.

description: We went here and got a dozen cupcakes. One of each flavor to try. The regular size cupcakes are $3ea. Really liked the red velvet, lemon, chocolate, strawberry, vanilla and mint ones. The peanut butter one was okay, something different to try. The icing is really sweet, kinda like Sprinkles sweet but the texture is softer and smoother. The cake itself is very moist and tasty. They also have regular cakes and other treats to nibble on.
author: Cupcake s.

description: Their red velvet cake is the most rich, tasty, satisfying cake I've ever eaten. I would recommend it to anyone.
author: Patrick M.

description:
To die for Red Velvet cupcake!!!!   Very, very good!!!  Fresh & yummy.  Just like the original red velvet recipe!!!   LOVE!  LOVE!!!

Thank you SusieCakes!!!
author: skipper a.

description: My work partner and I have stopped in twice for cupcakes. The first time we had the Tangerine and the second time the Strawberry. Both times we were dissapointed. The frosting was great but we felt the cake part was too sticky and dry.
author: Pearl R.

description: I usually get cupcake cravings and even though I live on the other side of the city, I would definitely drive 1/2 hour just to be satisfied. Their red velvet cupcake is not overly sweet which is great.. other places I'm dying to down it with milk.
author: Anita L.

description: I had the most delicious coconut cake of my life here. I'm a huge fan of coconut cake, but rarely see a good one. I've had more slices than I can count that look perfect, but taste flat. This place has a version with a beautifully moist cake layered with frosting (with bits of pineapple and coconut mixed in) and a superb top frosting covered in coconut. I rationed my huge slice over the next 4 days. Yes. I. Did. Had to make that sucker last! Only one minor complaint, which I hesitate to even bring up. I'm a sugar head, but the cake could have been slightly (very slightly) less sweet. Doesn't matter. I'll take it just as it is.
author: Eme L.

description: 10 stars for Susie Cakes. Lemon bars, perfect. That big azz chocolate cake, perfect. Chocolate chip cookie, awesome. I haven't tasted the cupcakes yet, but I'm sure they're good. This place is for those who really appreciate that down home flavor and a real hearty hunk of cake. None of that European fly away light as a feather cake here. I am so glad to be near this place, well, 50 miles away, but it's worth the trip.
author: Renee M.

description: I had an interview at SusieCakes and immediately fell in love with the decor and the cute treats they had available for dogs also. The manager Michelle is so nice that after our interview she offered me any treat on the house. I decided on the traditional red velvet and man did I make the right choice! It was extremely moist and the frosting was a delicious cream cheese one. A must go place!
author: Surge C.

description: This place in bangin'!!  Who could disagree?  I would like to die face down in one of their red velvet cakes.
author: Sin F.

description: My bestie bought cupcakes from here and I tried their pumpkin spice! Oh my god, sooo yummy. The cake wasn't too sweet or overwhelmingly spiced. It had the right amount of nutmeg and pumpkin flavor. The frosting was light and creamy. This won me over.
author: Mika D.

description: Simply to die for. The frosting was delicious!  I'm craving for more. Got the chocolate.
author: Sam S.

description:
Rockin Bakery..

I'm a regular at your Brentwood location ;]

BEST cupcakes I've ever had.

BEST red velvet cupcake, you get my vote.

Whoopie pies are amazing, the fresh buttercream is heavenly.

My personal favourite is the Berry Chiffon Cake, I feel like Marie Antionette when I eat it. The fresh whipped cream is out of this world, its such a sweet cake and the berries baked inside it are always ripe. Too bad its only seasonal. I (used to) treat myself to a sweet slice of heaven every week, I find my mouth watering for it. Hopefully they bring it back next year! I LOVE SusieCakes! 

BEST sweets I've come across so far in Los Angeles.

EVERYTHING IS AMAZING!
author: Nicole O.

description: I've never personally been here but a friend brought a dozen of these cupcakes to a party so I have gotten to try them. It was an assortment of all different type of cupcakes. We pretty much demolished them because we ended up cutting them in like quarters so everyone would be able to try multiple ones without getting too full. I have to recommend the ones with the darker batters as they had the moistest cakes. The vanilla and lemon were ok but again, not as moist as say the red velvet and chocolate. The peanut butter tasted very strong like you are just eating peanut butter straight from the jar. All the frostings were delicious - not too sweet and oh so creamy. My favorite would have to be the red velvet. $3 per cupcake is average but these were on the smaller side. I think they have mini ones for $1.50 but there might be a minimum order for them. Oh and I actually looked up their info on their website and they originated in the LA area which is a lot closer to me. So now I can have them whenever I desire.
author: Alison W.

description: I am so happy this place opened in San Francisco. I was a little apprehensive because I am a huge fan of Kara's down the street, but this place sells an entirely different kind of cupcake. For starters, the decor is old-school, almost like a soda fountain/bakery mix. The cakes look like they flew in from the '50s, and taste amazing. The cupcakes I have tried are the chocolate, vanilla, red velvet, and mocha. Out of these four, the red velvet is the best. Although the food dye is a little bright, the taste and texture of both the icing and cake is phenomenal. There isn't too much frosting, either. I didn't like the mocha one so much, but it might just be a personal preference: these had a boozy aftertaste. All in all, though, this place is a must-try in the Marina!
author: Victoria B.

description: Cupcakes are good. My favorite is their red velvet. Better than Kara's but not as good as That takes the cake or Moonbabycakes.
author: Isabella L.

description: Finally had a chance to try SusieCakes and it was just okay. The shop isn't as pulled together and modern as Kara's and the cupcakes looked really homemade - not special looking at all. It bothered me that they use paper bags instead of to-go boxes because some of the frosting comes off on the inside of the bag. I had the red velvet cupcake and it was good. I don't think I would go back unless Kara's was closed.
author: Gina C.

description: Tried the KeyLime pie yesterday for my husbands birthday.  The keylime had great flavor, but we both thought the pie had too much whip cream on the top.  My husband says keylime should have meringue not whip cream.  Probably would not order again.
author: Cheryl F.

description: Susiecakes is really good, it's a little pricey so go for the cake slices insteak of the cupcakes. Don't miss the chocolate or the red velvet. Cakes are really moist, but definitely do not refrigerate them or you'll be sorry. Parking kind of sucks in the marina, but if your close you can't but stop for some cake.
author: Anais T.

description: I was craving cup cakes that day so I decided to stop by Susie Cakes Bakery. I bought a couple of chocolate and vanilla cupcakes. Boy they were so good! I plan on visiting again to buy some red velvet ones since they looked so tasty last time I was there.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Went there today for the first time.  Bought a small blackberry crumble pie to share with my husband since it's Mother's Day and his mom was a great pie baker.  It was absolutely delicious!  And the other thing about Susie Cakes that I liked was the fast, friendly service.  When I arrived there around 5:45 p.m., there was a line out the door.  But it moved very quickly and everyone seemed very friendly and polite.  
definitely a go-to spot for a treat! I also noticed they have a class in cake decorting.  Sounds fun!  I might even go to that, though I am not much of a cake baker myself.  All in all, a really good find.
author: Joan O.

description: Best goddam cupcake i have EVER had.  buttercream frosting is light and airy, and the things are bloody sweet as well.  we even went there for a sheet cake for our daughter's birthday this last weekend and it was exquisite.
author: Rocky M.

description: i ordered my wedding cake from SusieCakes it was amazing!! my mum and i had an appointment with Molly to cake taste before we choose anything was great very attentive and she also followed up after we bought the Red Velvet Cake which was i can only describe as a piece of heaven!!! All the cakes we tried very amazing! you wont be disappointed.thanks molly.
author: Emma D.

description:
How cute is this place? 

I walked by this place on the way to go get my car after coming back from the Ghirardelli Chocolate Festival at North Point Street. As you can imagine, I had already had 45 or so helpings of all-things chocolate samples and is going into a sugar shock and eventually sugar coma. Yet when I walked By Susie Cakes, I just couldn't resist the temptation. The cupcakes were calling my name. Mind you, I had already had 2 mini cupcakes from Kara's Cupcakes at the fair. I walked in and saw that Susie has Sour Cream Cheesecake. Since my better half didn't go to the chocolate festival with me, I thought I reward him with a cheesecake for completing my honey to-do list at home. The individual size Sour Cream Cheesecake was just the start. I saw Lemon Square that is my all time favorite and was drooling over the display glass. One of those too please! Then moving down the line, the CUPCAKES!! OMG! Somebody stop me! 3 mini cupcakes (2 Red Velvet and 1 chocolate) and finally I am satisfied. $14 bucks later, I walked out of Susie's with a big smile on my face. 

The 2 of us shared the individual Sour Cream Cheesecake with graham cracker crust and sour cream topping. It was divine. The cream cheese filling was creamy, but very light and fluffy and it wasn't overly sweet at all. The graham cracker crust gave it a crunch that matched with the cream cheese filling so perfectly. We were already full with our pork chop dinner, but we ate the whole thing. The individual size cheesecake is perfect to share for 2 people. We will go back to get the 8" for dinner party. That will definitely be a hit. 

We still have the Lemon Square and the 3 mini cupcakes in the refrigerator. Those won't last long. They will be devourer tonight after dinner. 

This place really knows how to make their cakes. It's so tasty and everything so beautifully decorated is both alluring to the palette as well as to the eyes.
author: Gourmet Princessa L.

description: The 7 layer funfetti cake is AMAZING- the perfect birthday cake.  Also the service here is great; they even called afterward to make sure we were satisfied.
author: Jason T.

description:
i haven't tried all they have to offer-yet- but the lemon and red devil cupcakes are delightful.  great frosting to cake ratio, flavor, and cake texture.  too often the cake part is just mediocre.  this is not the case for susie.  try them and you'll understand.

as soon as i've tried more goodies i'll up the stars if necessary.  great customer service too.
author: lulu a.

description: In my opinion, the best red velvet cupcake in San Francisco (on par with Sprinkles and Sibby's for the Bay Area vote).  Moist and flavorful cake with that sweet frosting that you come to love.  I was not as much a fan of the cookies, but oh well.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Melinda C.

description: Hands down, the best brownies in San Francisco, perfect amount of crunchiness on the outside and fudge-like consistency on the inside, and not overly sweet...still licking my lips as I'm writing up this review.  I have also tried their red velvet cake as well as the coconut banana cake, both absolutely delicious.
author: May L.

description: Ordered a birthday cake from here and I would definitely do it again!   Easy to order, had it ready before the scheduled time, looked really cute, and it was super yummy!!!  It is pricey for a cake ($36 for 6" round with writing - that's why the 4 instead of 5 stars) but not outrageous for the city.  There are a ton of bakeries out there charging a ton more and aren't nearly as good.  Good customer service, yummy cakes and really reliable - I guess you get what you pay for!  They even called the next day to follow up and see what we thought.  Hope they stay in town!
author: Allie P.

description:
I finally came here after walking by several times.   My fiance and I had the Celebration (Confetti) cake slice for $5.  It was HUGE.  It would have been enough for 3 people.  I can't stop thinking about it.  It was so dense and moist and perfect.  The frosting is out of this world. Go get it!

Also, the woman told me wedding cakes are around $250-$300.  So cheap.  I wish I was getting married in CA.
author: Katie S.

description:
birthday celebration cake (aka pillsbury funfetti cake) is great! i love the aqua cream color and the pops of color in the cake. it was great but the frosting is REALLY sweet....almost a little too sweet for my preference.

service is great and they had samples of their pumpkin pie.
author: Melanie F.

description: Obviously there cupcakes are amazing but a delightful surprise were their pies. I got the pumpkin pie and apple crisp pie for Thanksgiving and they were delicious. And reasonably priced, around $20. It probably would have cost me more than $20 to make one pie, so I was impressed. Then to top it all off, the next day they called to see if I enjoyed the pies. That is spectacular customer service if you ask me! I would recommend this bakery to anyone.
author: Kim T.

description: SusieCakes are consistently good. I particularly enjoy the frosting on the cupcakes. Stopped by yesterday and grabbed a few mini cupcakes and  was delighted to see the variety of cakes. We usually order them at my job and I had never actually been in the store. I will be sure to stop back in when I'm in the Marina.
author: Stacy B.

description: Welcome to the Bay Area. Love you!
author: Mei G.

description:
not bad. i've only tried the cupcakes, but i wasn't that impressed. definitely prefer kara's cupcakes. i had the red velvet--not great. there was way too much frosting and i could practically taste the food coloring. i was afraid my teeth were going to be tinted red! a few days later, i tried the strawberry cupcake because martha stewart endorses it...also disappointed. dry, too much frosting again, blah. 

3 stars because the staff was nice and the place was clean. also haven't tried the other stuff so it doesn't seem fair to judge the place solely on their cupcakes.
author: Sara L.

description: SusieCakes has some of the richest, most delicious cakes around! The staff is very friendly and the cakes are to die for. And for those complaining about a lack of nutritional information, who cares, its cake! Enjoy it!
author: Matthew G.

description: A bit pricey, but if you are into cute little fancy cupcakes and other pastries, you won't mind paying $3 for a cupcake. My friend and I shared the Bannana Pudding. It had vanilla wafers, and real bannana slices, and whip cream. Heavenly! Then we went across teh street to Starbucks to buy soem coffee and ate it there. Perfect combination!
author: Ana S.

description: We had our wedding cake made at SusieCakes Bakery. They were polite and helpful on the phone and in person when we were making up out minds about how to decorate our cake. They listened to my ideas and did a great job guiding us to a beautiful cake that fit into our budget. When I first saw our cake it felt like the best kind of scene out of Cake Boss. I was so happy. It was delicious too as evidenced by how many of our guests helped themselves to seconds. I'm looking forward to having our second helping on our anniversary this Spring. If you've never been to their bakery it's worth checking out. We sampled a few of what they had to offer and I would not hesitate to buy their cupcakes and cookies if I was going to a party and didn't have time to bake something myself. In fact after sampling we considered just doing a dessert bar instead of having a cake but in the end I decided against it just because I really wanted us to have our cutting the cake moment and cutting a cupcake or cutting the ribbon to the dessert bar just didn't feel like it would be the same.
author: Mary R.

description: Susie's cupcakes are amazing! My ultimate favorite has to be the red velvet cupcake, the cake is baked to perfection and the frosting is just right! Yes, they are very sweet, just how i love my cupcakes. I can eat them everyday :)
author: Diana C.

description: Big fan of this place.  Only reason why I saw a 4 vs. a 5 is that the cake part could be slightly more fluffy but this is the best cupcake place I've had in the City.  Frosting - Yuuuuummm.  They make buttercream right which is really hard to do.  I think Kara's and American cupcake make it tasteless.  So does Magnolia in NY for that matter.  The frosting is super tasty and worth every calorie.  Plus, the frosting to cake ratio is awesome esp. when they put a dollop of that frosting right in the cake.  I had a chocolate on chocolate and a red velvet one and they were both awesome.  The frosting on both is amazing and the cake is pretty good.  All in all, my favorite of these chi-chi cupcake places.
author: Deal G.

description: Cupcakes are moist and full of flavor. We bought an assorted box of 9 cupcakes for a casual dinner party and everyone asked for seconds. Wish we bought more. A must try on Chestnut Street.
author: Kelle Y.

description: This place makes me happy. The staff is nice and smiley and if you're lookin' for some seriously-good-classic-type cake, go here! I'm usually a chocolate cake kinda person but I've found the vanilla cupcake here so simple and satisfying that it's become of of my favs! The carrot cake is rad too!
author: Erica B.

description: I stumbled into this place while trying to meet up with a friend in the Marina. I saw people walking around with bakery boxes that had an unfamiliar bakery logo, so I had to investigate. I found the place where there used to be a chocolate store. I tried the chocolate cupcake with vanilla frosting which was pretty good. Since I judge by frosting, I will tell you that it is a confectioners sugar based buttercream. I also tried the strawberry cupcake, which I, and apparently Martha Stewart would advise you try (judging by a sign with her :-). It was amazing because it has strawberries built into the cake!! Yummerz!!!
author: John W.

description: Tried to order a custom cake for our son's birthday party - what a nightmare!  Forget what it says on the website, custom orders are not taken via email or online.  Forget what it says on the menu, custom cakes are made according to what the baker says he/she can do.  Forget trying to order around a holiday, custom cakes take more than  two business days to prepare for pickup.  This outfit is a chain - and each location makes it's own rules.  The Marina location is a retail outlet - NOT a bakery.
author: Leake L.

description: I came here last night after a disappointing dinner at Country Sky (see my review) after just noticing it walking down bustling Chestnut.  Man, am I glad I did.  The service is very friendly with a bubbly staff and you just can't go wrong with anything.  The German chocolate cake is wonderful with rich chocolate, coconut, and nuts and not to mention moist.  You can't go there for the first time without getting a house whoopy pie which is two chocolate chip cookies that are equally moist and chocolatey with butter cream in the center; think of it as a refined Oreo.  $9.50, got us two large pastries; you get what you pay for here.  So, for excellent baked goods at reasonable prices with friendly service in a casual atmosphere, Susie Cakes cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.!
author: Brian S.

description: Wandered in here wanting to see how this new spot stacks up against the other local favorites (Kara's and Takes the Cake). The staff is very friendly and they have some really cute cake accessories for birthdays and that sort. I got the mint chocolate cupcake, good flavors, light cake not very dense and yummy frosting. However, I kept feeling like it was a cupcake I could have very easily made for myself at home. I also felt like the layout was more spacious with the last bakery here, it felt a little crammed inside. Overall, a yummy spot with cute baked goods but nothing I'd seek out in particular again.
author: Sandy G.

description: Whether it's a cupcapke or a pie, Susie's always come through. I always have the biggest smile on my face eating anything from this place. Their frosting on their cakes is a slice of heaven, or at least what heaven would taste like If you could serve it as a food item. Thank you for making my day every time I visit you,  SusieCakes! =)
author: Ruth R.

description:
Delish -- my favorite cupcake place in SF!  I'm a lazy bum when it comes to writing these reviews but loved this place so much.  I've tried Kara's, That Takes the Cake, Sweet Things, Noe Valley Bakery, Chestnut Bakery, etc...and this is by far my favorite because of the dense quality of the cake combined with the sweet yummy frosting to get the sugar rush taste. 

The dense cake is important too because I not only like the texture/taste but it signifies to me that the bakery actually takes care in making their cakes instead of relying on a cheap, light, commercial tasting box mix which I could do myself!   

I had the stawberry cupcake (dense vanilla cake w/ pink, stawberry flavored frosting) and the 3 of the mini (red velvet, vanilla/vanilla, chocolate, chocolate).  The strawberry was my absolute favorite and the others were good too.  I completey agree with Martha Stewart -- best strawberry cupcake!

If you want something special, come here!
author: M. J.

description: The caterer for our wedding recommended SusieCakes, however our wedding was in Livermore.  We tried several places and kept coming back to SusieCakes.  It was worth every dime of the delivery fee and after a week I am still hearing how wonderful the cupcakes were and I agree wholeheartedly.  Recommended: Red Velvet Cupcakes and Carrot Cake (best I ever had).
author: Monique L.

description: I LOVE Susie Cakes!!!  The frosting is to die for and the freshness of the items, cannot be compared to any bakery around this area!  In fact, they are my absolute favorite bakery and the key for me, is the freshness, flavor and texture.  Hands down the best!
author: Krista L.

description:
what a cute little shop! 

the cupcakes are so yummy and the staff is always super friendly! i feel like if i worked here, i would be so annoyed by people taking forever to make up their mind but the staff here is always so patient with their customers!
author: C. R.

description: Susie Cake's recently did my wedding cake. Megan, the baker, was wonderful to work with, and it was handled in a  completely efficient & professional manner. The tastings were great. I unfortunately, did not get to try the cake at the wedding, but no fewer than 20 of my guests told me it was the best wedding cake they had ever had. I was thrilled. I will also say my cake was substantially more affordable than other bakeries I had previously gotten quotes from.  My Bernese Mountain dog also loves  this place because of its awesome dog biscuits - it's a must do every time we are on Chestnut.
author: traci u.

description: Amazing cupcakes! By far the best in the area.  They also have cakes, cookies and even adorable dog treats.
author: Stephanie B.

description: These are such great cupcakes! I've come in to just get one cupcake when I'm shopping on Chestnut for a quick snack, and other times I've walked in needing big orders for dinner parties- they've always been SO accommodating and helpful, not to mention their cupcakes are DELISH! The service is great (everyone working there is always so happy, friendly, and ready to help) and they always have the best products. Their cupcakes are dense and the frosting is cream cheesy and fantastic. Their cookies and cakes are fantastic as well! Never had a bad experience here.
author: Emily P.

description: By far, my favorite cupcake place in San Francisco! All the cupcake flavors are so tasty . . .moist cake and just enough frosting.  I absolutely love the strawberry cupcake! Yumm. Martha Stewart even recommends it! The ladies behind the counter are also as sweet as the cupcakes and so helpful. This place is really such a little treat!
author: Brittney J.

description: I bought a slice of the celebration cake! It was the best piece of cake i ever had! It's really sweet, so it takes like 3 sitdowns to finish the whole slice, but still is soo good! I love this place!
author: ashley s.

description:
The San Francisco cupcake craze is in its fourth year, and after consuming at least 500 cupcakes (and spending countless hours at the gym burning them off), I have found my favorite -  Susie Cakes!  I love the red velvet and strawberry cupcakes here.  Better yet are the cakes -- the marble, carrot, and red velvet are super moist and have layers of frosting.  I have yet to try the other baked goods...  

The staff here is okay.  The nicest by far is Daphne who is fantastic!
author: M. J.

description:
I first discovered Susie Cakes when a friend of mine had a little get together at her house and provided us with Susie Cakes cupcakes for dessert.  I loved trying all the different flavors they had!  When I got engaged and we started looking around at different bakeries for wedding cakes, I hadn't even thought about Susie Cakes because I thought they only did cupcakes.  I was thrilled to discover that they do wedding cakes too! 
I got in contact with Megan O'Leary from Susie Cakes and she scheduled us for a tasting.  The tasting consisted of three cupcakes (since it's all the same cake in a wedding cake or a cupcake anyway) with little spoons of their many different frosting choices.  That way you could mix whatever frosting you wanted with either white cake, chocolate cake, or red velvet cake.  We thoroughly enjoyed tasting all the different combinations, but in the end we ended up going for the simple yet delicious white cake with vanilla frosting!  We were so surprised because we had thought we'd go for something more exotic, but the plain one was so good we just couldn't pass it up!
They don't do those huge layered cakes so if that's what you're looking for, look elsewhere.  They do a great little three layer cake and then the rest they can do in giant sheet cakes to serve the rest of your guests.  We weren't looking for anything huge so it worked out perfect for us!  AND, the best part was it was our favorite tasting cake and also the least expensive among all of the bakeries I had looked into!  When does that ever happen?  We were pretty excited.

Megan was great to work with.  She talked me through all of the choices we had for decoration, style, and colors. On the day of the wedding they delivered it to our venue for a small fee (which was great considering our venue was way up some windy hills).  The cake looked amazing and tasted even better!  Several guests went back for seconds.  We ended up with plenty of extra because the slices were cut pretty small, so we had plenty to take home and freeze.  That cake is almost as good frozen!  We have one chunk in the freezer that we've been eating away at slowly.  A slice of frozen cake goes great with a cup of coffee.   Thank you Susie Cakes!
author: Ashley A.

description: Yummy!! Best red velvet! So fluffy.  I ordered a dozen for a bachelorette party a couple of months ago and the service was wonderful.  They even called and followed up to make sure I was satisfied with the order.  So sweet!
author: D B.

description: Its like desert crack for sugar addicts.  Good cupcakes, amazing chocolate cake.  I try to stay away because its so wrong, but oh so good!
author: Dan W.

description: This place is so cute, I always wanted to try it. And I was looking for a customized cake / cupcakes for my baby shower. So we went in and tried a slice of the celebration cake, the one with the Susie signature pastel green buttercream and vanilla confetti cake, and one red velvet cupcake. YUCK!!! The cake was somewhat moist, because of the buttercream layers I guess, which made it much too sweet, and the fat layer of buttercream on top was so sugary, even I couldn't finish it. My husband had one bite and threw it away. The cupcake was DRY, that's all I have to say. NOTHING compared to Kara's cupcakes. Disappointed. That's really too bad because they have fun decorations, but the cakes and cupcakes don't taste good.
author: Laurene S.

description: Ok. People, I was so excited about trying a Susie Cakes cupcake, that I didn't think I could possibly be disappointed. Boy, was I wrong! As a longtime cupcake fan (e.g., someone who has on MULTIPLE occassions driven over an hour for a Sprinkles cupcake) I can't remember a time when I haven't finished a cupcake. That is, until I tried a SusieCakes vanilla cupcake. No joke, after one excited bite, and then another to confirm my suspicions that it was not good, my cupcake went right into the trash. If you are looking for a worse version of a processed, factory made version of a Pillsbury Funfetti cake (which I actually enjoy!), then this is for you. However, if you are like me, and want a fresh, smooth, buttery cupcake...look elsewhere. Sprinkles in Palo Alto or Kara's in the Marina are both significantly better options. Two stars remain- one for the environment and selection, and another because they put frosting on top AND in the middle of their cakes (although I just wish it had been edible...).
author: J L.

description: We decided on Susie Cakes for our wedding cake. We had an appointment to taste cake. Price was reasonable - I chose chocolate cake with mocha filling and white butter cream frosting and a custom design. They delivered the cake the morning of the wedding at the site for a very reasonable price. I was very happy with the design but most importantly it was the most delicious cake I have ever tasted. No joke! Everyone at the wedding was asking the name of the bakery I used and even my caterer asked for the name for referrals.
author: Sally S.

description: holy hell how did i let myself spend $18 on 6 cupcakes?? good cupcakes. nothing special, but still some solid cupcakes.
author: Regina C.

description: Right after the 2012 New Year I was in a bind as I had ordered cupcakes from a neighboring store for a friend's party.  Even though I ordered them almost 2 weeks out from when I needed them and from one of the owners of the store, I found out a day before that the store was closed until the second week of January!  I was appalled that it took me sleuthing around to finally get a contact number for one of the owners and when i explained my situation, she was less than understanding.  Enter Susie Cakes.  I knew that I coudn't not have cupcakes so I went into Susie Cakes and spoke with one of the lead cake designers, Meghan.  She was AMAZING and worked with me to get me exactly what I wanted and at the right time.  She also helped me out with the price since I had a coupon for the other store.  She gave me an unbelievable deal for more cupcakes than I would have gotten at the other store.  I would whole heartedly recommend Susie Cakes over any cupcake store in San Francisco...not only are their desserts fabulous but their customer service is above and beyond.  Thanks to Meghan, dessert for my friend's party was saved and was even better than I had planned!
author: Elisa G.

description: I was drawn into Susie's because of the great presentation, it all looked so tempting. I bought 3 cupcakes and a slice of the 6-layer cake only to be disappointed! Frosting is good, not to sweet. The actual cake I found no real flavor to any of the 4 items I purchased. Little chocolate flavor to my cake and cupcakes. So sad....
author: Marty G.

description: Susie Cakes is way better than Kara's. While Kara's has cute branding, their cupcakes just aren't anywhere as good as Susie Cakes. At Susie Cakes, the icing is creamy and not overpowering to the cake, and the cake itself is so moist. Love, love, love them! It's difficult to walk past their shop on my way home from work without buying a mini cupcake.
author: Marta H.

description: Susie Cakes provided the desserts for my wedding and I have to say, working with their team was one of the easiest (and most delicious!) parts of the wedding planning process! We worked very closely with Brooke and she was incredibly friendly and helpful. She always answered our questions in a timely manner and went the extra mile time and time again. We wanted a dessert table at our wedding so we opted for a few small cakes (two 6" and one 9" - red velvet, celebration, and chocolate) and a bunch of mini desserts like cookies, whoopie pies, 7 layer bars, etc. The guests LOVED the desserts and even told us that the red velvet was the best they had ever had! If you want to have delicious treats that your guests will love and an amazing customer service experience - I'd highly recommend working with Susie Cakes!
author: Amanda O.

description: I tried the cupcakes at a friends party, have walked in and grabbed the mini's with my son, and have bought him a cookie or two since this place opened....so when I needed 2 doz. cookies for a cookie exchange I figured they were the place but come on-----$72.00????? for sugar cookies??
author: jules c.

description:
After posting my message I received a concerned email from the owner of Susie Cakes. The owner was sincerely concerned on why the cupcakes I had yelped about had not been well received by my friends. He asked me about my opinion in regards to the flavor, texture and density in order to determine why exactly it was I was unsatisfied. He then offered me a gift card to give Susie Cakes another try. I rarely see or hear about a business especially the owner providing this kind of service. Later that same afternoon I received a call from the store manager. Now that's what you call amazing service. This is defiantly a business who cares about its customer and business. It's refreshing to experience such compassion towards a cupcake! Now it's totally understandable why there always seems to be a crowd excited to purchase a treat here.
I've also gone back and purchased a slice of each of their cakes for a dinner party...amazing.
author: Nora D.

description: I avoided getting anything from susiecakes for a long time because the cakes seemed dense and heavy and calorific. Until someone brought me a slice of their carrot cake this past month. It was wonderful. Possibly the most wonderful carrot cake I've had. You will not find light and sophisticated French baking here - no Italian meringue frosting or anything light and airy. What you will find is very old fashioned American cakes, very much alike magnolia bakery in New York. Their cakes are dense, layered in the old fashioned way. Their frostings are dense, sugary (so sugary that i can taste the grains of sugar some days), simple and unsophisticated. The thought that does go into their ingredients for each cake is commendable - pineapple with coconut, pecans/praline/raisins/carrots (just loaded with real fruit and nuts) in their carrot cake.  It does remind me of the baking of an old lady whose cakes I enjoy annually when I see her. I can tell her about the magic of meringues in cakes and frosting but there is some magic in just simple baking. It is wonderful if you set your expectations straight before going. The staff were really nice and it makes shopping there a pleasant experience - always.  For exquisite light and sophisticated cakes, head for the newly opened b passtiserie. And sophistication can get tiring after a while, simple can offer a nice nostalgic contrast.
author: tc h.

description: Tried the snickerdoodle - wasn't as soft or fresh as Hot Cookie, but satisfying nonetheless.  The staff was super friendly and enthusiastic.
author: Jeremy C.

description: Not cheap, but delish!  $6 for 2 cupcakes.  I scarfed down my vanilla on the sidewalk so that I could tend to my 3 yo and her chocolate/ chocolate.  Cruisin' down the sidewalk in her stroller on a cool and sunny day, diving into her cupcake, coming up covered in chocolate, giving everyone she passed a sh*t-eating grin - that alone was worth $6!
author: L T.

description: I have always have big issues with cakes and pastry.If you know your cakes well, you will agree that you want something that is fluffy and not too overly sweet and always have to be perfect frosting.Well I found this place because my husband is such a cakes addict.Now he got me hooked for this place.It's been an on going cakeaholic like every weeks since January .Always 2 cakes at a time and if you seen their cakes.One slice can feed 2 to 3 people.Note:You will not want to share their cakes with anyone cuz the results tend to be that you will never see the cake again.Also the staff are always nice and they understand my addiction. So....try it and see what I am talking about.
author: S F.

description: I stopped in here for cupcakes yesterday and have to say, I wan't impressed.  I had the chocolate mint cupcake, the lemon cupcake, and a taste of the BF's mocha cupcake.  The cake of both the mocha and chocolate mint cupcakes was very moist and pretty good.  The frostings on these cupcakes were just alright.  Nothing spectacular, and I felt the texture of the frosting was a little off.  The frosting on the lemon cupcake was quite tasty.  Unfortunately the cake was very dense and dry.  Not my favorite.  I've had much better cupcakes in the bay area.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Susie makes the most delicious cupcakes I've tasted in the city.  The employees are all very nice and helpful in choosing your cupcakes, and everyone seems to leave with a smile on the faces.  I highly recommend them!
author: L B.

description: De-licious. My friend and I split the coconut and red velvet cupcakes.  We are still reeling from how good these treats were.
author: K Z.

description: The cupcakes are ok, a bit on the sweet side, but not super sweet.  BUT the cake itself is a little too sweet for my taste bud; I guess that is the "all American" style.  I do appreciate the custom design they do.
author: Sasa L.

description: Best cupcakes I've ever tried. They are really moist and have lots of frosting. Ive been here lots of times, never disappointed. The carrot cake is also amazing
author: carla f.

description: I ordered a red velvet birthday cake for my girlfriend at Susie Cakes last week and it was AMAZING.  Honestly, some of the other reviews nit-picking about "cake was too moist.." are riduculous and downright laughable.  Susie Cakes is the real deal.  Fresh, sweet, and tasty.  You won't be dissapointed.  Yes, things are priced slightly higher than at the Safeway bakery counter.  BOO HOO...  Quit crying about it people and maybe you'll all be able to enjoy something simple in life like a REAL bakery.  Oh, one more thing...  The day after her birthday I got a follow-up call from someone at Susie Cakes (I think it was the manager).  She just wanted to know if we enjoyed the cake.  Nice to see a business that actually cares about their customers enough to make follow-up calls!  Awesome.  Gotta love the Susie Cakes!
author: Jason T.

description: Of all the cupcake places around- best quality, flavor, selection.  My favorite is red velvet but they sometimes have a mocha and a peanut butter that rock.  So yummy!  If only they were good for you.
author: Jen B.

description: The bf and I decided to try out this place since a few yelpers swore this place was better than Kara's.  We came on a Saturday afternoon and got lucky with street parking just around the corner from the shop.  The shop itself is pretty small and was fairly packed that day.  The service was pretty quick as we didn't have to wait long and the staff seemed super friendly.  Against the wall, opposite where the cakes and such were displayed was a small table for free samples, this day they were offering samples of their blueberry crumble (not  bad).  At first glance, I already awarded points to Kara's for having more options (cupcake wise).  Susie's just seemed so limited with their flavors offered.  However, I do like how Susie's has a variety of products overall.  In addition to cupcakes they have cookies, cakes, brownies, puddings, pies, etc.  They even have a pretty decent deal for their mini cupcakes: 3 for $5.  As far as the cupcakes we tried: mint chocolate, their seasonal orange creamsicle cupcake (*don't know if that's the actual name, but it's supposed to be like those orange cream popsicles), red velvet, and coconut.  They were all pretty good.  The cakes were moist, especially the red velvet and chocolate.  I get how some reviewers said the vanilla cupcakes are more on the dense side, but it wasn't so much that it was drier than the chocolate cakes.  The cream cheese frosting was really good, definitely had that nice cream cheese taste to it and not overwhelmingly sweet.  The mint chocolate chip was good.  It did remind me of mint chocolate chip ice cream--which happens to be my favorite ice cream flavor so I did enjoy that and the seasonal cake we tried was a vanilla cake with orange buttercream, again pretty good but the frostings on these two, were IMO, a bit too sweet.  Shocking for me since I could eat almost anything that's sweet.  You will definitely need a tall glass of milk (or water) after eating those cupcakes.  Another thing to note that their filled cupcakes are just cakes with some of the frosting piped into the cake.  They lose points for creativity in this area since Kara's offers more options for fillings for their filled cakes.  I guess Susie's is supposed to be considered a home style bakery so maybe simple is their thing.  We did also get a slice of their carrot cake, which btw is a HUGE serving! I swear that one slice could easily be 2-3 slices in one.  Go big or go home I guess!  This shop was pretty good, but since Kara's is in the same area, we'll more likely continue going there for our cupcake fix.
author: Tess E.

description:
Susiecakes is my favorite bakery. Besides the amazing treats, they have a sparkling clean interior and friendly, warm staff. The frosting couldn't be any better, and Susiecakes NEVER bakes from a mix- unlike almost all other cupcake bakeries. 
Their commitment to quality and customer service even as their business expands is truly inspiring to a young entrepreneur like myself. Interested to find out more about this awesomely branded company, I had the chance to talk with Susie one day. What she told me made me like the bakery (and their business) 10 times more. When Susie and her team think of new ways to serve cake and deserts, they don't really consider how much profit they will make. Their main concern is about celebration- will this desert make the customer's celebration more memorable and special?  Rough quote here sorry Susie- "These bakeries are about connecting people through celebration. When someone buys a cake from us, I feel good. Not because of the money, but because I know that their day will be more special. I hope that our deserts can bring families and friends closer. If these cakes accomplish that, even for a few minutes, I feel my bakeries are a success."
Susie is awesome. So are her cakes. Check it out!
author: Katherine A.

description: I've been a big fan of the SusieCakes in Calabasas for many years, but now that I live in SF, I figured I'd try the one here.  When I walked in, there were a bunch of ladies behind the counter chatting away.  I stood there for a few seconds.  They kept chatting.  I almost walked out because I was getting impatient, but then some other dude in front of me walked out, which got one lady's attention and I decided to stay.  I ordered a red velvet and a lemon cupcake.  Most of the time I order a seasonal as well, but the seasonal right now is pineapple upside down, and when I had that one last year, I wasn't really a fan.  Usually when I order two cupcakes, I give the red velvet to my mother and keep the other.  However, I walked around the Cherry Blossom Festival and deserved to eat both (sorry, mom).  The lemon one did not hit the spot at all and I don't know why because it's usually my go-to cupcake.  I'm glad I ate the red velvet one though because it was amazing.  I usually don't eat all the frosting because bakeries tend to overfrost cupcakes, but I couldn't stop eating it.  Five stars for the amazing red velvet, which turned me into a fan.  Minus one star for mysteriously bad service and the weird lemon one, which I will pretend doesn't exist from now on.  Hopefully the service was some fluke because I plan on going back.
author: k h.

description: My friend and I were exploring the shops on Chestnut Street and she raved about this place, so we went in to satisfy our sweet tooth. I had a huge slice of their Classic Marble cake and it was so yummy! A fluffy mix of chocolate and vanilla cake (with some chocolate chips thrown in), topped with creamy chocolate and vanilla buttercream frosting. I love that the frosting wasn't overly sweet and that it was just the right amount. I would definitely go back to try the other cake flavors; Red Velvet, Carrot, Coconut, German chocolate, pretty much all of the 7 types they make! I also bought a 7-layer bar, which I didn't really like because I thought there was too many butterscotch chips, but I gave the bar to someone else and they loved the taste. This location is pretty small and there's no place to sit inside but they had 2 small tables outside. I guess you don't really need to sit down to eat a cupcake/cookie/bar, but if you're getting the cake you'd probably want a place to sit.
author: Zehra S.

description: After trying the red velvet from Susie's at a friend's birthday dinner, I had to have more (if they add addictive chemicals to it, I don't care), so my darling husband stopped by the Marina location on his way home from work.  We tried the lemon, chocolate w/ vanilla frosting, chocolate w/ peanut butter frosting, and the red velvet.  I was worried that the red velvet was not going to be as heavenly as I had remembered since I had put it "on the pedestal" (40 Year Old Virgin anyone?), but my cravings were vindicated upon my second encounter with the velvety, almost creamy, richly flavored cake in symphony with the fantastic cheesecake frosting.  Different red velvet cakes from different places speak to different people--this one speaks to me and is probably the best red velvet I have tried, not something I would say lightly, btw.  The lemon was my second fav.  I would have liked to have had a bit more potent peanut butter flavor in the PB frosting, but that's typical for me.  Will be back for more red velvet....I have quite a few more flavors to try as well, life's hard sometimes.
author: Ana B.

description: We just happened to walk by this place when strolling through the Marina area on our visit to San Fran. The Red Velvet and Coconut cupcakes were SO moist and delicious. I've had Georgetown Cupcakes (aka" DC cupcakes") and SusieCakes were much more moist. I took the Coconut cupcake home and couldn't believe how fresh it tasted the next day.
author: Jennie J.

description: I'm a icing fan and this bakery has buttercream like mom (and the old fashioned American bakeries) used to make. The cakes are moist and consistently delicious. There are few all american bakeries in the City and this is my favorite.
author: mark m.

description: I've only been here once and I tried the Vanilla Celebration cake.  I felt like I was eating a delicious cake that I saw straight out of a cartoon!  That's the best way I can describe it.  I am definitely coming back.. I hope everything else is just as good!
author: K T.

description: yum. just like any other cupcake place. i like the small cupcakes!!
author: Cindy L.

description: We passed by Susie Cakes a couple of times and were tempted.... even browsed the display case but decided to pass.  We were on Chestnut grabbing a coffee before heading out of town and gave in at the last minute.  My daughter and I bought two cupcakes....coconut and vanilla. There were a lot of very tempting flavors but we decided on vanilla because is was decorated so cutely in a SF Giants theme.  SO DELICIOUS.  The frosting was just the right consistency and sweetness and the cupcake itself was very moist.  We shared 2 cupcakes between the 4 of us and we were ready to run back in and buy about a dozen more but we had already given up our parking spot.  Lots of tempting cupcake flavors but next time I think I might buy a whole cake.  The cakes were just beautiful and looked nice and moist as well.  The cupcakes were pricey but wonderful and we will definitely hit Susie Cakes the next time we're in the area.
author: Colleen W.
